Section.Label: A.01.001
Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Food and Drug Regulations.

Section.Label: A.01.002
Section.Text: These Regulations, where applicable, prescribe the standards of composition, strength, potency, purity, quality or other property of the article of food or drug to which the standards refer.

Section.Label: A.01.010
Section.Text: In these Regulations,

Definition.Text: acceptable method means a method of analysis or examination designated by the Minister as acceptable for use in the administration of the Act and these Regulations; (méthode acceptable)
Act means the Food and Drugs Act, except in Parts G and J; (Loi)
common-law partner has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Criminal Code; (conjoint de fait)
cubic centimetre and its abbreviation cc. shall be deemed to be interchangeable with the term millilitre and its abbreviation ml.; (centimètre cube)
inner label means the label on or affixed to an immediate container of a food or drug; (étiquette intérieure)
Lot number means any combination of letters, figures, or both, by which any food or drug can be traced in manufacture and identified in distribution; (numéro de lot)

manufacturer or distributor means a person, including an association or partnership, who under their own name, or under a trade-, design or word mark, trade name or other name, word or mark controlled by them, sells a food or drug; (fabricant or distributeur)
official method means a method of analysis or examination designated as such by Minister for use in the administration of the Act and these Regulations; (méthode officielle)
outer label means the label on or affixed to the outside of a package of a food or drug; (étiquette extérieure)
prescription drug means a drug that is set out in the Prescription Drug List, as amended from time to time, or a drug that is part of a class of drugs that is set out in it; (drogue sur ordonnance)
Prescription Drug List means the list established by the Minister under section 29.1 of the Act; (Liste des drogues sur ordonnance)
principal display panel has the same meaning as in the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations; (espace principal)
security package means a package having a security feature that provides reasonable assurance to consumers that the package has not been opened prior to purchase. (emballage de sécurité)

Section.Label: A.01.011
Section.Text: The Minister shall, upon request, furnish copies of official methods.

Section.Label: A.01.012
Section.Text: The Minister shall, upon request, indicate that a method is acceptable or otherwise upon its submission to him for a ruling.

Section.Label: A.01.013
Section.Text: Where a food, drug, vitamin or cosmetic has more than one name, whether proper or common, a reference in these Regulations to the food, drug, vitamin or cosmetic by any of its names is deemed to be a reference to the food, drug or vitamin by all of its names.

Section.Label: A.01.014
Section.Text: When a lot number is required by these Regulations to appear on any article, container, package or label it shall be preceded by one of the following designations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “Lot number”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “Lot No.”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “Lot”; or

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), any statement, information or declaration that is required by these Regulations to appear on the label of any drug shall be in either the French or the English language in addition to any other language.

The adequate directions for use required to be shown on the inner and outer labels of a drug under subparagraph C.01.004(1)(c)(iii) or paragraph C.04.009(2)(f) shall be in English and French if the drug is available for sale without prescription in an open self-selection area.

Section.Label: A.01.016
Section.Text: All information that is required by these Regulations to appear on a label of a food or a drug, other than a drug for human use in dosage form, shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: clearly and prominently displayed on the label; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: readily discernible to the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase and use.

Section.Label: A.01.017
Section.Text: Every label of a drug for human use in dosage form shall meet the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information that is required by these Regulations to appear on the label shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: prominently displayed on it,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: readily discernible to the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase and use, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: expressed in plain language; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the format of the label, including the manner in which its text and any graphics are displayed on it, shall not impede comprehension of the information referred to in paragraph (a).

Section.Label: A.01.022
Section.Text: An inspector shall perform the functions and duties and carry out the responsibilities in respect of foods and drugs prescribed by the Act, and these Regulations.

Section.Label: A.01.023
Section.Text: The authority of an inspector extends to and includes the whole of Canada.

Section.Label: A.01.024
Section.Text: The certificate of designation required pursuant to subsection 22(2) of the Act shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: certify that the person named therein is an inspector for the purpose of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister and the person named in the certificate, in the case of an inspector on the staff of the Department.

Section.Label: A.01.025
Section.Text: If authorized by a regulation made pursuant to the Broadcasting Act, inspectors shall act as representatives of the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission for the purpose of enforcing the provisions of regulations made by the Canadian Radio-Television and Telecommunications Commission concerning the advertising of any article to which the Food and Drugs Act applies, or concerning recommendations for the prevention, treatment or cure of a disease or ailment.

Section.Label: A.01.026
Section.Text: An inspector may, for the proper administration of the Act or these Regulations, take photographs of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any article that is referred to in subsection 23(2) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any place where, on reasonable grounds, he believes any article referred to in paragraph (a) is manufactured, prepared, preserved, packaged or stored; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: anything that, on reasonable grounds, he believes is used or capable of being used for the manufacture, preparation, preservation, packaging or storing of any article referred to in paragraph (a).

Section.Label: A.01.040
Section.Text: Subject to section A.01.044, no person shall import into Canada for sale a food or drug the sale of which in Canada would constitute a violation of the Act or these Regulations.

Section.Label: A.01.041
Section.Text: An inspector may examine and take samples of any food or drug sought to be imported into Canada.

Section.Label: A.01.042
Section.Text: If an inspector examines or takes a sample of a food or drug under section A.01.041, the inspector may submit it to an analyst for analysis or examination.

Section.Label: A.01.043
Section.Text: If an inspector, on examination of a sample of a food or drug or on receipt of a report of an analyst of the result of an analysis or examination of the sample, is of the opinion that the sale of the food or drug in Canada would constitute a violation of the Act or these Regulations, the inspector shall so notify in writing the collector of customs concerned and the importer.

Subsection.Text: Where a person seeks to import a food or drug into Canada for sale and the sale would constitute a violation of the Act or these Regulations, that person may, if the sale of the food or drug would be in conformity with the Act and these Regulations after its relabelling or modification, import it into Canada on condition that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person gives to an inspector notice of the proposed importation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the food or drug will be relabelled or modified as may be necessary to enable its sale to be lawful in Canada.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell a food or drug that has been imported into Canada under subsection (1) unless the food or drug has been relabelled or modified within three months after the importation or within such longer period as may be specified by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug, the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of food, the Minister or the President of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency.

Section.Label: A.01.045
Section.Text: A certificate referred to in section 37 of the Act shall be signed and issued by the exporter in the form set out in Appendix III.

Section.Label: A.01.046
Section.Text: An exporter that issues a certificate referred to in paragraph 37(1)(c) of the Act in respect of a drug shall retain a copy of the certificate for five years after the day on which the drug is exported.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 37(1)(d) of the Act, a drug that, by virtue of paragraph A.01.048(a), is required to be fabricated, packaged/labelled, tested, distributed or wholesaled in accordance with an establishment licence must be fabricated, packaged/labelled, tested, distributed or wholesaled by the holder of such a licence that has paid fees in connection with the licence in accordance with the Fees in Respect of Drugs and Medical Devices Order.
Words and expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in subsection C.01A.001(1).

Section.Label: A.01.048
Section.Text: For the purposes of subsection 37(1.2) of the Act, the following provisions are prescribed in relation to drugs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the provisions of Division 1A of Part C;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the provisions of Division 2 of Part C, except section C.02.003.2 and paragraphs C.02.009(5)(b), C.02.016(3)(b) and C.02.018(3)(c);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.03.001 to C.03.013; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.04.001 to C.04.006.

Section.Label: A.01.049
Section.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 38(c) of the Act, all drugs must be in bond.

Section.Label: A.01.050
Section.Text: When taking a sample of an article under paragraph 23(2)(i) of the Act, an inspector shall inform the owner of the article or the person from whom the sample is being obtained of the inspector’s intention to submit the sample or a part of it to an analyst for analysis or examination, and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where, in the opinion of the inspector, division of the procured quantity would not interfere with analysis or examination

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: divide the quantity into three parts,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: identify the three parts as the owner’s portion, the sample, and the duplicate sample and where only one part bears the label, that part shall be identified as the sample,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: seal each part in such a manner that it cannot be opened without breaking the seal, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: deliver the part identified as the owner’s portion to the owner or the person from whom the sample was obtained and forward the sample and the duplicate sample to an analyst for analysis or examination; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where, in the opinion of the inspector, division of the procured quantity would interfere with analysis or examination

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: identify the entire quantity as the sample,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: seal the sample in such a manner that it cannot be opened without breaking the seal, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: forward the sample to an analyst for analysis or examination.

Section.Label: A.01.051
Section.Text: Where the owner or the person from whom the sample was obtained objects to the procedure followed by an inspector under section A.01.050 at the time the sample was obtained, the inspector shall follow both procedures set out in that section if the owner or the person from whom the sample was obtained supplies him with a sufficient quantity of the article.

Section.Label: A.01.060
Section.Text: The cost of analysing a sample other than for the purpose of the Act, for a department of the Government of Canada for the purpose of legal action is $15.

Heading.TitleText: Labelling of Food and Drugs in Pressurized Containers

Section.Label: A.01.060.1
Section.Text: In sections A.01.061 and A.01.062,

Definition.Text: flame projection means the ability of the pressurized contents of an aerosol container to ignite and the length of that ignition, when tested in accordance with official method DO-30, Determination of Flame Projection, dated October 15, 1981; (projection de flamme)

flashback means that part of the flame projection that extends from its point of ignition back to the aerosol container when tested in accordance with official method DO-30, Determination of Flame Projection, dated October 15, 1981; (retour de flamme)

Subsection.Text: Subject to section A.01.063, in the case of a food or a drug packaged in a disposable metal container designed to release pressurized contents by use of a manually operated valve that forms an integral part of the container, the principal display panel of the inner and outer labels of the food or drug shall display, in accordance with sections 15 to 18 of the Consumer Chemicals and Containers Regulations, as they read on September 30, 2001, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the hazard symbol set out in Column II of item 10 of Schedule II to those Regulations, accompanied by the signal word “CAUTION / ATTENTION”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the primary hazard statement “CONTAINER MAY EXPLODE IF HEATED. / CE CONTENANT PEUT EXPLOSER S’IL EST CHAUFFÉ.”.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section A.01.063, one panel of the inner and outer labels of a food or drug referred to in subsection (1) shall display, in the size required by paragraph 19(1)(b) of the Consumer Chemicals and Containers Regulations, as they read on September 30, 2001, the following additional hazard statement:

Provision.Text: “Contents under pressure. Do not place in hot water or near radiators, stoves or other sources of heat. Do not puncture or incinerate container or store at temperatures over 50°C.

Contenu sous pression. Ne pas mettre dans l’eau chaude ni près des radiateurs, poêles ou autres sources de chaleur. Ne pas percer le contenant, ni le jeter au feu, ni le conserver à des températures dépassant 50 °C.”

Subsection.Text: The requirements of subsections (1) and (2) do not apply in relation to a drug or food if the Minister determines that the design of the container, the materials used in its construction or the incorporation of a safety device eliminate its potential hazard.

Subject to section A.01.063, if a food or drug is packaged in a container described in subsection A.01.061(1) and has a flame projection of a length set out in column I of any of items 1 to 3 of the table to this subsection or a flashback as set out in column I of item 4 of that table, as determined by official method DO-30, Determination of Flame Projection, dated October 15, 1981, the principal display panel of the inner and outer labels of the food or drug shall display, in accordance with sections 15 to 18 of the Consumer Chemicals and Containers Regulations, as they read on September 30, 2001, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the hazard symbol set out in Column II of the same item;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in both official languages, the signal word set out in Column III of the same item; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in both official languages, the primary hazard statement set out in Column IV of the same item.

Provision.Text: TABLE IS NOT DISPLAYED, SEE SOR/81-616, S. 2; SOR/92-15, S. 3

Subsection.Text: In addition to the requirements of subsection (1), one panel of the inner label and outer labels of a food or drug referred to in that subsection shall display, in the size required by paragraph 19(1)(b) of the Consumer Chemicals and Containers Regulations, as they read on September 30, 2001, the following additional hazard statement:

Provision.Text: “Do not use in presence of open flame or spark.
Ne pas utiliser en présence d’une flamme nue ou d’étincelles.”

Subsection.Text: Where the labelled net contents of a container of a food or drug described in subsection A.01.061(1) or A.01.062(1) does not exceed 60 millilitres or 60 grams, the inner label may show only the information described in paragraph A.01.061(1)(a) or paragraphs A.01.062(1)(a) and (b), as the case may be.

Where the labelled net contents of a container of a food or drug described in subsection A.01.061(1) or A.01.062(1) exceeds 60 millilitres or 60 grams but does not exceed 120 millilitres or 120 grams, the inner label may show only the information described in subsection A.01.061(1) or subsection A.01.062(1), as the case may be.

Where the labelled net quantity, in a container, of a food or drug referred to in subsection A.01.061(1) or A.01.062(1) is less than 30 mL or 30 g, the hazard symbol shall be of such size as to be capable of being circumscribed by a circle with a diameter of at least 6 mm.

Where a container of a food or drug, described in subsection (1) or (2) is sold in a package, the outer label may show only the information described in subsection A.01.061(2) and, where applicable, subsection A.01.062(2).
In this section, drug for human use means a drug that is intended for human use, whether the drug is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a mouthwash;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to be inhaled, ingested or inserted into the body; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for ophthalmic use.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), no person shall sell or import a drug for human use that is packaged and available to the general public in a self-service display, unless the drug is contained in a security package.
Subsection (2) does not apply to lozenges.
Subject to subsection (5), a statement or illustration that draws attention to the security feature of the security package referred to in subsection (2) shall be carried

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the inner label of the package; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the security feature is a part of the outer package, on the outer label.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (4) does not apply if the security feature of a security package is self-evident and is an integral part of the immediate product container.

Section.Label: A.01.066
Section.Text: Sections A.01.067 and A.01.068 do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug included in Schedule I, II, III, IV or V to the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a prescription drug.

Section.Label: A.01.067
Section.Text: A drug is exempt from subsection 3(1) of the Act with respect to its advertisement to the general public as a preventative, but not as a treatment or cure, for any of the diseases, disorders or abnormal physical states referred to in Schedule A.1 to the Act.

Section.Label: A.01.068
Section.Text: A drug is exempt from subsection 3(2) of the Act with respect to its sale by a person where the drug is represented by label or is advertised by that person to the general public as a preventative, but not as a treatment or cure, for any of the diseases, disorders or abnormal physical states referred to in Schedule A.1 to the Act.

Section.Label: A.01.069
Section.Text: These Regulations do not apply to a drug referred to in paragraph (b) or (c) of the definition biocide in subsection 1(1) of the Biocides Regulations.

Subsection.Text: In this Part,

Definition.Text: agricultural chemical means any substance that is used, or represented for use, in or on a food during its production, storage or transport, and whose use results, or may reasonably be expected to result, in a residue, component or derivative of that substance in or on a food and includes any pest control product as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act, plant growth regulator, fertilizer or any adjuvant or carrier used with that substance. This definition does not include any

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: food additive that is set out in, and used in accordance with, the Lists of Permitted Food Additives,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: nutritive substance that is used, recognized or commonly sold as food or as an ingredient of food,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: vitamin, mineral nutrient or amino acid,

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: supplemental ingredient,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: essential oil, flavouring preparation, natural extractive, oleoresin, seasoning or spice,

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: food packaging material or any substance of which that material is composed, or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: drug recommended for administration to animals that may be consumed as food; (produit chimique agricole)

Definition.Text: available display surface, in respect of a prepackaged product, means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bottom of an ornamental container or the total surface area of both sides of a tag attached to the ornamental container, whichever is greater,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the total surface area of both sides of a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the total surface area of any other package, excluding the bottom if the contents of the package leak out or are damaged when the package is turned over,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any area of a package on which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase,

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any part of a package that is intended to be destroyed when it is opened, other than a package of a food that is intended to be consumed by one person at a single eating occasion, or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the area occupied by the universal product code; (surface exposée disponible)

Definition.Text: close proximity, in respect of information that is shown on a label or a sign, means immediately adjacent to the information and without any intervening printed, written or graphic material; (à proximité)
common name, in respect of a food, means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the food printed in boldface type, but not in italics, in a section of the Food Compositional Standards Document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the food printed in boldface type, but not in italics, in a section of the Standards of Identity Document, as defined in section 1 of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, the name by which it is generally known or a name that is not generic and that describes the food; (nom usuel)

Definition.Text: Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document means the document entitled Common Names for Ingredients and Components, prepared by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency and published on its website, as amended from time to time; (document sur les noms usuels d’ingrédients et de constituants)
component means an individual unit of food that is combined as an individual unit of food with one or more other individual units of food to form an ingredient; (constituant)
daily value means, in respect of a nutrient, the quantity applicable to the nutrient according to subsection B.01.001.1(2); (valeur quotidienne)

Directory of NFT Formats means the document entitled Nutrition Labelling – Directory of Nutrition Facts Table Formats published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Répertoire des modèles de TVN)

Directory of Nutrition Symbol Specifications means the document entitled Nutrition Labelling — Directory of Nutrition Symbol Specifications, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Répertoire des spécifications des symboles nutritionnels)

durable life means the period, commencing on the day on which a prepackaged product is packaged for retail sale, during which the product, when it is stored under conditions appropriate to that product, will retain, without any appreciable deterioration, its normal wholesomeness, palatability, nutritional value and any other qualities claimed for it by the manufacturer; (durée de conservation)
durable life date means the date on which the durable life of a prepackaged product ends; (date limite de conservation)

energy value means, in respect of a food, the amount of energy made available to a person’s body when the chemical constituents of the food, including protein, fat, carbohydrate and alcohol, are metabolized following ingestion of the food by the person; (valeur énergétique)
extended meat product means a meat product to which a meat product extender has been added; (produit de viande avec allongeur)
extended poultry product means a poultry product to which a poultry product extender has been added; (produit de volaille avec allongeur)
fish product means fish or prepared fish; (produit de poisson)
flavouring preparation includes any food for which a standard is set out in Volume 9 of the Food Compositional Standards Document; (préparation aromatisante)

food additive means any substance the use of which results, or may reasonably be expected to result, in it or its by-products becoming a part of or affecting the characteristics of a food, but does not include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any nutritive material that is used, recognized or commonly sold as an article or ingredient of food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: vitamins, mineral nutrients and amino acids, other than those substances set out in the Lists of Permitted Food Additives;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: supplemental ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: spices, seasonings and flavouring preparations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: agricultural chemicals, other than those substances set out in the Lists of Permitted Food Additives;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: food packaging materials and components thereof; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: drugs recommended for administration to animals that may be consumed as food; (additif alimentaire)

Definition.Text: food colour means any food additive used to add or restore colour to a food; (colorant alimentaire)

Food Compositional Standards Document means the document entitled Canadian Food Compositional Standards, prepared by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency and published on its website, as amended from time to time; (Document sur les normes de composition des aliments)
fully hydrogenated, in respect of a fat or oil, means a fat or oil that is hydrogenated and has an iodine value of 4 or less; (entièrement hydrogénée)

functional substitute for a sweetening agent means, in respect of a prepackaged product, a food — other than any sweetener or sweetening agent, including any sugars — that replaces a sweetening agent and that has one or more of the functions of the sweetening agent including, sweetening, thickening, texturing or caramelizing; (substitut fonctionnel d’un agent édulcorant)
hermetically sealed container means a container designed and intended to be secure against the entry of microorganisms, including spores; (récipient hermétiquement scellé)
infant means an individual who is under the age of one year; (bébé)
infant food means a food that is labelled or advertised for consumption by infants; (aliment pour bébés)

ingredient means an individual unit of food that is combined as an individual unit of food with one or more other individual units of food to form an integral unit of food that is sold as a prepackaged product; (ingrédient)
list of cautionary statements means the list shown on the label of a supplemented food in accordance with subsection B.29.020(1); (liste des mises en garde)

List of Contaminants and Other Adulterating Substances in Foods means the List of Contaminants and Other Adulterating Substances in Foods, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Liste des contaminants et autres substances adultérantes dans les aliments)

List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients means the document entitled List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Liste des ingrédients supplémentaires autorisés)

List of Permitted Supplemented Food Categories means the document entitled List of Permitted Supplemented Food Categories, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Liste des catégories autorisées d’aliments supplémentés)
Lists of Permitted Food Additives means one or more of the following lists that are published by the Government of Canada on its website, as they are amended from time to time:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Acidity Regulators and Acid-Reacting Materials;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Anticaking Agents;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Food Colours;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Emulsifying, Gelling, Stabilizing or Thickening Agents;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Firming Agents;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Flour Treatment Agents;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Food Additives with Other Purposes of Use;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Food Enzymes;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Glazing Agents;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Preservatives;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Sequestering Agents;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Solvents;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Starch-Modifying Agents;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Sweeteners;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: the List of Permitted Yeast Foods; (Listes des additifs alimentaires autorisés)

Definition.Text: main dish means a combination dish, as set out in the Table of Reference Amounts, that does not require the addition of ingredients, other than water, for its preparation and that contains food from at least two of the following categories:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: dairy products and their alternatives, except butter, cream, sour cream, ice cream, ice milk, sherbet and alternatives for those foods;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meat products, poultry products, marine and fresh water animal products, and their alternatives such as eggs, tofu, legumes, nuts, seeds, nut or seed butters and spreads made from legumes;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fruits and vegetables except pickles, relishes, olives and garnishes; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: breads, breakfast cereals, rice and other grains, and alimentary pastes; (plat principal)

Definition.Text: meal replacement means a formulated food that, by itself, can replace one or more daily meals; (substitut de repas)
meat product means meat, meat by-product, prepared meat or prepared meat by-product; (produit de viande)
meat product extender means a food that is a source of protein and that is represented as being for the purpose of extending meat products; (allongeur de produit de viande)
mechanically tenderized beef means uncooked solid cut beef that is prepared in either of the following ways:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the integrity of the surface of the beef is compromised by being pierced by blades, needles or other similar instruments; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the beef is injected with a marinade or other tenderizing solution; (boeuf attendri mécaniquement)

Definition.Text: monounsaturated fatty acids, monounsaturated fat, monounsaturates or monounsaturated means cis-monounsaturated fatty acids; (acides gras monoinsaturés, graisses monoinsaturées, gras monoinsaturés, lipides monoinsaturés ou monoinsaturés)
mutiple-serving prepackaged product means a prepackaged product other than a single-serving prepackaged product; (produit préemballé à portions multiples)

nutritional supplement means a food sold or represented as a supplement to a diet that may be inadequate in energy and essential nutrients. It does not include a human milk fortifier; (supplément nutritif)
nutrition facts table means the nutrition facts table that is required by subsection B.01.401(1) to be carried on the label of a prepackaged product; (tableau de la valeur nutritive)
nutrition symbol means a symbol that is carried on the principal display panel of a prepackaged product under subsection B.01.350(1); (symbole nutritionnel)
omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids, omega-3 polyunsaturated fat, omega-3 polyunsaturates, omega-3 polyunsaturated or omega-3 means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 9-cis, 12-cis, 15-cis octadecatrienoic acid or α-linolenic acid,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 8-cis, 11-cis, 14-cis, 17-cis eicosatetraenoic acid,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 5-cis, 8-cis, 11-cis, 14-cis, 17-cis eicosapentaenoic acid or EPA,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 7-cis, 10-cis, 13-cis, 16-cis, 19-cis docosapentaenoic acid, or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: 4-cis, 7-cis, 10-cis, 13-cis, 16-cis, 19-cis docosahexaenoic acid or DHA; (acides gras polyinsaturés oméga-3, graisses polyinsaturées oméga-3, gras polyinsaturés oméga-3, lipides polyinsaturés oméga-3, polyinsaturés oméga-3 ou oméga-3)

Definition.Text: omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids, omega-6 polyunsaturated fat, omega-6 polyunsaturates, omega-6 polyunsaturated or omega-6 means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 9-cis, 12-cis octadecadienoic acid or linoleic acid,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 6-cis, 9-cis, 12-cis octadecatrienoic acid,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 8-cis, 11-cis, 14-cis eicosatrienoic acid or di-homo-γ-linolenic acid,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 5-cis, 8-cis, 11-cis, 14-cis eicosatetraenoic acid or arachidonic acid,

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: 7-cis, 10-cis, 13-cis, 16-cis docosatetraenoic acid, or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: 4-cis, 7-cis, 10-cis, 13-cis, 16-cis docosapentaenoic acid; (acides gras polyinsaturés oméga-6, graisses polyinsaturées oméga-6, gras polyinsaturés oméga-6, lipides polyinsaturés oméga-6, polyinsaturés oméga-6 ou oméga-6)

Definition.Text: ornamental container means a container that, except on the bottom, does not have any promotional or advertising material thereon, other than a trademark or common name and that, because of any design appearing on its surface or because of its shape or texture, appears to be a decorative ornament and is sold as a decorative ornament in addition to being sold as the container of a product; (emballage décoratif)

overage means the amount of a vitamin or mineral nutrient that is, within the limits of good manufacturing practice, added to a food in excess of the amount declared on the label, in order to ensure that the amount of the vitamin or mineral nutrient declared on the label is maintained throughout the durable life of the food; (surtitrage)
parts per million or p.p.m.[Repealed, SOR/2024-244, s. 2]
parts per million, p.p.m. or ppm means parts per million by weight unless otherwise stated; (parties par million, p.p.m. ou ppm)
per cent or % means per cent by weight, unless otherwise stated; (pour cent ou %)
point means the unit of measurement for type size that is known as a PostScript point and is equal to 0.3527777778 mm; (point)

polyunsaturated fatty acids, polyunsaturated fat, polyunsaturates or polyunsaturated means cis-methylene interrupted polyunsaturated fatty acids; (acides gras polyinsaturés, graisses polyinsaturées, gras polyinsaturés, lipides polyinsaturés ou polyinsaturés)
poultry product means poultry meat, prepared poultry meat, poultry meat by-product or prepared poultry meat by-product; (produit de volaille)
poultry product extender means a food that is a source of protein and that is represented as being for the purpose of extending poultry products; (allongeur de produit de volaille)

prepackaged meal means a prepackaged selection of foods for one individual that requires no preparation other than heating and that contains at least one serving, as described in Canada’s Food Guide to Healthy Eating, published in 1992 by the Department of Supply and Services by authority of the Minister of National Health and Welfare, of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: meat, fish, poultry, legumes, nuts, seeds, eggs or milk or milk products other than butter, cream, sour cream, ice-cream, ice milk and sherbet; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: vegetables, fruit or grain products; (repas préemballé)

Definition.Text: prepackaged product means any food that is contained in a package in the manner in which it is ordinarily sold to or used or purchased by a person; (produit préemballé)
principal display panel means, despite the meaning assigned to that term in section A.01.010,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a label that is applied to a consumer prepackaged food within the meaning of section 1 of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations, the principal display panel as described in paragraphs (a) to (c) of the definition of that term in that section,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a label that is applied to a prepackaged product other than a consumer prepackaged food subject to the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations, the part of the label that is applied to all or part of any side or surface of the container that is displayed or visible under normal or customary conditions of sale or use and, if the container does not have such a side or surface, the part of the label that is applied to any part of the container except on the bottom, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a label that is applied to a food that is not a prepackaged product, the part of the label that is applied to all or part of the side or surface of the food that is displayed or visible under normal or customary conditions of sale or use; (espace principal)

Definition.Text: principal display surface, in respect of a prepackaged product, means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the package has a surface that is displayed or visible under customary conditions of sale or use, the total area of that surface, excluding any surface that is the top of the package,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the package has a lid that is the part of the package that is displayed or visible under customary conditions of sale or use, the total area of the top surface of the lid,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the package does not have a particular surface that is displayed or visible under customary conditions of sale or use, 40% of the total surface area of the package, excluding any surface area that is its top and bottom, if it is possible for that proportion of the total surface area to be displayed or visible under customary conditions of sale or use,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the package is a bag with surfaces of equal dimensions, the total area of one of the surfaces,

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the package is a bag with surfaces of different dimensions, the total area of one of the largest surfaces,

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: despite paragraphs (a) to (e), if the package does not have a surface that is displayed or visible under customary conditions of sale or use to which a label can be applied, the total area of one side of a tag that is attached to the package,

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: despite paragraphs (a) to (e), if the package contains wine that is exposed for sale, any part of the surface of the package, excluding its top and bottom, that can be seen without having to turn the package, and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the package is a wrapper or confining band that is so narrow in relation to the size of the food that it cannot reasonably be considered to have any surface that is displayed or visible under customary conditions of sale or use, the total area of one side of a tag that is attached to the package; (principale surface exposée)

Definition.Text: reasonable daily intake, in respect of a food set out in Column I of an item of Schedule K, means the amount of that food set out in Column II of that item; (ration quotidienne raisonnable)
reference amount means, in respect of a food set out in column 1 of the Table of Reference Amounts, the amount of that food set out in column 2; (quantité de référence)
saturated fatty acids, saturated fat, saturates or saturated means all fatty acids that contain no double bonds; (acides gras saturés, graisses saturées, gras saturés, lipides saturés ou saturés)
simulated meat product means any food that does not contain any meat product, poultry product or fish product but that has the appearance of a meat product; (simili-produit de viande)
simulated poultry product means any food that does not contain any poultry product, meat product or fish product but that has the appearance of a poultry product; (simili-produit de volaille)

single-serving prepackaged product means a prepackaged product in respect of which the net quantity of food in the package is the serving of stated size for the food as set out in paragraph B.01.002A(1)(b); (produit préemballé à portion individuelle)
solid cut meat means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a whole cut of meat; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a product consisting of pieces of meat of which at least 80 per cent of the pieces weigh at least 25 g each; (viande coupée solide)

Definition.Text: solid cut poultry meat means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a whole cut of poultry meat; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a product consisting of pieces of poultry meat of which at least 80 per cent of the pieces weigh at least 25 g each; (viande de volaille coupée solide)

Definition.Text: sugars means all monosaccharides and disaccharides; (sucres)
sugars-based ingredient means, in respect of a prepackaged product,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an ingredient that is a monosaccharide or disaccharide or a combination of these;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an ingredient that is a sweetening agent other than one referred to in paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any other ingredient that contains one or more sugars and that is added to the product as a functional substitute for a sweetening agent; (ingrédient à base de sucres)

Definition.Text: supplemental ingredient means a nutrient — including a vitamin, mineral nutrient or amino acid — or any other substance listed in column 1 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients and added as an ingredient to a food in accordance with the applicable conditions of use set out in columns 2 to 5; (ingrédient supplémentaire)

supplemented food means a prepackaged product that belongs to a food category set out in column 1 of the List of Permitted Supplemented Food Categories and to which a supplemental ingredient has been added, but does not include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a food for special dietary use as defined in section B.24.001 and referred to in any of paragraphs B.24.003(1)(f) to (f.2) and (h) to (j), even if the food for special dietary use is also a gluten-free food referred to in paragraph B.24.003(1)(g);

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: infant food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a food that is labelled or advertised for consumption by

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: children one year of age or older but less than four years of age, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: women who are pregnant or breastfeeding;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any of the following foods set out in column I of the Table to section D.03.002:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a food referred to in any of items 1, 2.1, 2.2, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9.1, 10 to 13, 15, 17 to 19, 21 to 25 and 27, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prepackaged ice;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a food that has not been processed or that has been minimally processed; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a beverage with an alcohol content of more than 0.5%; (aliment supplémenté)

Definition.Text: supplemented food caution identifier means the identifier carried on the principal display panel of a supplemented food under subsection B.29.021(1); (identifiant des aliments supplémentés avec mise en garde)

supplemented food facts table means the supplemented food facts table required by subsection B.29.002(1) to be carried on the label of a supplemented food; (tableau des renseignements sur les aliments supplémentés)
sweetener means any food additive used to impart a sweet taste to a food; (édulcorant)
sweetening agent includes any food for which a standard is set out in Volume 15 of the Food Compositional Standards Document, but does not include a sweetener; (agent édulcorant)

Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food means the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Tableau des caractéristiques chimiques, physiques et nutritionnelles des aliments)

Table of Daily Values means the document entitled Nutrition Labelling – Table of Daily Values published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Tableau des valeurs quotidiennes)

Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims means the document entitled Nutrition Labelling — Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Tableau des mentions et des allégations autorisées concernant la teneur nutritive)

Table of Reference Amounts means the document entitled Nutrition Labelling – Table of Reference Amounts for Food published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Tableau des quantités de référence)

trans fatty acids, trans fat or trans means unsaturated fatty acids that contain one or more isolated or non-conjugated double bonds in a trans-configuration; (acides gras trans, graisses trans, gras trans, lipides trans ou trans)
unstandardized, in relation to a food, means that a standard is not set out in the Food Compositional Standards Document for that food; (non normalisé)

weighted recommended nutrient intake, in respect of a vitamin or mineral nutrient set out in column I of Table II to Division 1 of Part D or in column I of Table II to Division 2 of Part D, means the amount set out in column III; (apport nutritionnel recommandé pondéré)
yolk-replaced egg means a food that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not contain egg yolk but contains fluid, dried or frozen egg albumen or mixtures thereof,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is intended as a substitute for whole egg, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements of section B.22.032; (oeuf à jaune substitué)

Subsection.Text: A reference in these Regulations to any of the lists referred to in the definition Lists of Permitted Food Additives is a reference to the list as published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time.
The definitions in this subsection apply for the purposes of the Act.

Definition.Text: agricultural chemical has the same meaning as in subsection (1). (produit chimique agricole)
food additive has the same meaning as in subsection (1). (additif alimentaire)

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: human milk fortifier has the same meaning as in section B.25.001. (fortifiant pour lait humain)
human milk substitute has the same meaning as in section B.25.001. (succédané de lait humain)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the definitions supplemental ingredient and supplemented food in subsection (1), if a supplemented food is used as an ingredient in the manufacture of a second supplemented food, a supplemental ingredient in the first supplemented food is deemed to also have been added as a supplemental ingredient to — and not to be a component of an ingredient of — the second supplemented food if it is contained in the second supplemented food in accordance with the applicable conditions of use set out in columns 2 to 5 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients.
For the purposes of the definition solid cut meat in subsection (1), meat has the same meaning as in section B.14.001.
For the purposes of the definition solid cut poultry meat in subsection (1), poultry meat has the same meaning as in section B.22.001.
For the purpose of subsection (2), the term fat used in the Table of Daily Values means all fatty acids expressed as triglycerides.
The daily value for a nutrient in a food is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a nutrient set out in column 1 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values, the quantity

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: set out in column 2, if the food is intended solely for children one year of age or older but less than four years of age, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: set out in column 3, if the food is intended for children one year of age or older but less than four years of age or for children four years of age or older and adults; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a vitamin or mineral nutrient set out in column 1 of Part 2 of the Table of Daily Values, the quantity

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: set out in column 2, if the food is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: set out in column 3, if the food is intended for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age or for children one year of age or older but less than four years of age, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: set out in column 4, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (2) does not apply if the food is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a human milk fortifier; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a human milk substitute intended solely for infants less than six months of age.

Section.Label: B.01.001.2
Section.Text: For the purposes of interpreting any food-related document published by the Government of Canada on its website and incorporated by reference into parts A, B or D, words and expressions that are used but not defined in that document have the same meaning as in those parts.

Section.Label: B.01.001.3
Section.Text: For the purposes of interpreting the Lists of Permitted Food Additives, a reference in those lists to a food that is subject to a standard set out in the Food Compositional Standards Document means that food for which the standard is set out in that document.

Section.Label: B.01.002
Section.Text: The Food Compositional Standards Document sets out the standards of composition, strength, potency, purity, quality or other property of the foods that are referred to in that document.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Part, a serving of stated size of a food shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: based on the food as offered for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in either of the following cases, the net quantity of the food in the package:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the quantity of food in the package can reasonably be consumed by one person at a single eating occasion, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the package contains less than 200% of the reference amount for the food; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in all other cases, the amount indicated for the food according to the criteria set out in column 3A of the Table of Reference Amounts.

Subsection.Text: A serving of stated size of a food shall be expressed as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a single-serving prepackaged product to which paragraph (1)(b) applies, per package and using the following units:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in grams, if the net quantity of the food is shown on the label by weight or by count, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in millilitres, if the net quantity of the food is shown on the label by volume; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a multiple-serving prepackaged product to which paragraph (1)(c) applies, according to the following units set out in column 3B of the Table of Reference Amounts and according to the manner set out in that column:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the household measure that applies to the product, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the metric measure that applies to the product.

Subsection.Text: The following foods shall carry a label when offered for sale:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all prepackaged products other than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: prepackaged confections, commonly known as one bite confections, that are sold individually, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prepackaged products consisting of fresh fruits or fresh vegetables that are packaged in a wrapper or confining band of less than 1/2 inch in width;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meat and meat by-products that are barbecued, roasted or broiled on the retail premises;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: poultry, poultry meat or poultry meat by-products that are barbecued, roasted or broiled on the retail premises;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: horse-meat or horse-meat by-product;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any substance or mixture of substances for use as a food additive or food additive preparation; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: flour and whole wheat flour that has been treated with gamma radiation from Cobalt 60 Source.

Subsection.Text: All or part of the label referred to in section B.01.003 shall be applied

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a prepackaged product, to the container in which the prepackaged product is sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a food that is not a prepackaged product, to the food itself.

Subsection.Text: The label shall be applied in such a manner that the container of the prepackaged product or the food, as the case may be, will bear the label at the time it is sold.
Subject to subsections (2) to (5), the information required to be shown on a label shall not be shown on that part of the label, if any, that is applied to the bottom of a food or container.

The information required to be shown on a label may be shown on that part of the label, if any, that is applied to the bottom of a food or to the bottom of a container if such information is also shown in those parts of the label that are not applied to the bottom of the food or container.

Despite subsection (2), if the container of a prepackaged product is an ornamental container and the label is applied to the bottom of the container, the information required to be shown may be shown on the label that is applied to the bottom of the container.

Despite subsection (2), the information required by subparagraph B.01.007(1.1)(b)(i) and paragraphs B.24.103(g), B.24.202(d), B.24.304(h), B.25.020(1)(h) and B.25.057(1)(f) and (2)(f) may be shown on that part of the label that is applied to the bottom of the package if a reference to where that information is located on the label appears elsewhere on the label.
Despite subsection (2), the information required by paragraph B.27.005(a) may be shown on that part of the label that is applied to the bottom of the package.

Despite subsection (2), the nutrition facts table, supplemented food facts table and list of cautionary statements may be shown on that part of the label that is applied to the bottom of the food or container if the available display surface includes the bottom.
The common name of the food shall be shown on the principal display panel.

Notwithstanding subsection (1), the common name of a fresh fruit or fresh vegetable that is prepackaged in such a manner that the fruit or vegetable is visible and identifiable in the package is not required to be shown on the label.

Section.Label: B.01.006.1
Section.Text: Except as otherwise provided in these Regulations or in the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations, if a prepackaged product is likely to be mistaken for another food, words describing the true nature of the prepackaged product so as to distinguish it from the other food shall appear on the principal display panel and may be in regard to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type of liquid packaging medium, including brine, vegetable oil or syrup;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its style or form, including firm, extra firm, whole, sliced or diced; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its condition, including dried, concentrated, reconstituted, carbonated or smoked, which, if shown, shall form part of the common name.

Subsection.Text: In this section, packaging date means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which a food is placed for the first time in a package in which it will be offered for sale to a consumer; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which a prepackaged product is weighed by a retailer in a package in which it will be offered for sale for the first time to a consumer.

Subsection.Text: The following information shall be shown on any part of the label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the identity and principal place of business of the person by or for whom the food was manufactured or produced;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where a prepackaged product having a durable life of 90 days or less is packaged at a place other than the retail premises from which it is to be sold,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the durable life date, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: instructions for the proper storage of the prepackaged product if it requires storage conditions that differ from normal room temperature; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where a prepackaged product having a durable life of 90 days or less is packaged on the retail premises from which it is to be sold,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the packaging date, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the durable life of the food, except when the durable life appears on a poster next to the food.

Subsection.Text: The packaging date referred to in paragraph (1.1)(c) shall be shown in the form and manner prescribed for the durable life date by subsections (4) and (5) and the terms “best before” and “meilleur avant” on the label shall be replaced by the terms “packaged on” and “empaqueté le”.

Paragraph (1.1)(a) does not apply to fresh fruits or fresh vegetables that are prepackaged on retail premises in such a manner that the fruits or vegetables are visible and identifiable in the package.
Paragraphs (1.1)(b) and (c) do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged products consisting of fresh fruits or fresh vegetables;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged individual portions of food that are served by a restaurant or other commercial enterprise with meals or snacks;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged individual servings of food that are prepared by a commissary and sold by automatic vending machines or mobile canteens; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged donuts.

Subsection.Text: The durable life date shall be shown in the following manner:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the words “best before” and “meilleur avant” shall be shown grouped together with the durable life date unless a clear explanation of the significance of the durable life date appears elsewhere on the label;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where, for the sake of clarity, it is necessary to show the year in which the durable life date occurs, the year shall be shown first and shall be expressed by at least the last two numbers of the year;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the month shall be shown in words after the year, if the year is shown, and may be abbreviated as prescribed by subsection (5); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the day of the month shall be shown after the month and shall be expressed in numbers.

Subsection.Text: The month of the durable life date, when abbreviated, shall be abbreviated as follows and only one such abbreviation shall be used for the English language and the French language:

Except as otherwise provided in these Regulations, no person shall use a durable life date marking system on the label of a prepackaged product or in advertising a prepackaged product other than the marking system set out in this section.
Paragraph (1.1)(b) does not apply to prepackaged fresh yeast, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which it is estimated that the product has lost its effectiveness is shown on the label in the form and manner prescribed for the durable life date by subsections (4) and (5); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the terms “best before” and “meilleur avant” are replaced by the terms “use by” and “employez avant”.

Subsection.Text: The following information shall be shown grouped together on any part of the label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any information required by these Regulations, other than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information required to appear on the principal display panel, nutrition facts table or supplemented food facts table,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any statement required to be shown on the label of a supplemented food in accordance with column 5 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where a prepackaged product consists of more than one ingredient, a list of all ingredients, including, subject to section B.01.009, components, if any.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(b) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged products packaged from bulk on retail premises, except prepackaged products that are a mixture of nuts;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged individual portions of food that are intended solely to be served by a restaurant or other commercial enterprise with meals or snacks;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged individual servings of food that are prepared by a commissary and sold by automatic vending machines or mobile canteens;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged meat and meat by-products that are barbecued, roasted or broiled on the retail premises;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged poultry, poultry meat or poultry meat by-products that are barbecued, roasted or broiled on the retail premises;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged products that comply with the standards set out in sections 2.1.1 to 2.1.4, 2.2.1, 2.3.1, 2.3.2, 2.4.1 to 2.4.7, 2.5.1, 2.6.1, 2.7.1 to 2.7.8, 2.8.1, 2.8.2 and 2.9.1 of Volume 2 of the Food Compositional Standards Document;

Paragraph.Label: (f.1)
Paragraph.Text: Scotch whisky, Irish whisky, Armagnac brandy, Cognac brandy, Bourbon whisky, Tennessee whisky, Tequila and Mezcal; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged products that comply with the standards set out in sections 16.1.1 to 16.1.5 of Volume 16 of the Food Compositional Standards Document.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(b), the following items are not required to be shown on the label of a prepackaged product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: wax coating compounds and their components, used as an ingredient or component of prepackaged fresh fruit or vegetables;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sausage casings, used as an ingredient or component of prepackaged sausages;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: hydrogen, used as an ingredient or component of a prepackaged product if used for hydrogenation purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: components of ingredients of a sandwich, if the sandwich is made with bread; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: added water used as an ingredient that has been removed during the manufacture of the prepackaged product.

Subsection.Text: Information appearing on the label of a prepackaged product according to sections B.01.008.2 to B.01.010.4, B.16.016 and B.29.020 must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a single colour of type that is a visual equivalent of 100% solid black type on a white background or a uniform neutral background with a maximum 5% tint of colour;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a single standard sans serif font that is not decorative and in a manner that the characters never touch each other or any differentiating feature under subsection B.01.008.2(2);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in type of normal or condensed width that is not scaled down so that the characters take up less space horizontally and, if a nutrition facts table or supplemented food facts table appears on the label, the width of type must be the same as that required for the type used to show the nutrients that appear in the nutrition facts table or the supplemental ingredients that appear in the supplemented food facts table, as the case may be;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in regular type, except as otherwise provided in those sections; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in type that is the same height that is not less than 1.1 mm with identical leading of not less than 2.5 mm, except as otherwise provided in this section or those sections.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(a), a list of ingredients appearing on the label of the following prepackaged products is not required to be shown on a white background or a uniform neutral background with a maximum 5% tint of colour:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a prepackaged product that is intended solely for use as an ingredient in the manufacture of other prepackaged products intended for sale to a consumer at the retail level or as an ingredient in the preparation of food by a commercial or industrial enterprise or an institution; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a prepackaged product that is a ready-to-serve multiple-serving prepackaged product intended solely to be served in a commercial or industrial enterprise or an institution.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise provided in subsection (4) and sections B.01.008.2 to B.01.010.4, if a nutrition facts table or supplemented food facts table appears on the label of a prepackaged product and the type size of the nutrients shown in the nutrition facts table or the supplemental ingredients shown in the supplemented food facts table is not less than 8 points, the information referred to in subsection (1) must be shown in type that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the same height as the type in which the nutrients are shown in the nutrition facts table or the supplemental ingredients are shown in the supplemented food facts table, as the case may be; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: of a height that is not less than 1.4 mm with identical leading of not less than 3.2 mm.

Subsection.Text: A title that introduces a list of ingredients, a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement as defined in subsection B.01.010.1(1), a declaration referred to in subsection B.01.010.4(1) or a list of cautionary statements may be shown in type that is of a greater height than the type used to show the information in either of the lists, the statement or the declaration, as the case may be.
If more than one of the titles referred to in subsection (4) appears on a label, the characters of each title must be of the same height.
For the purpose of this section, the height of type means the height of the lower case letter “x”.
A list of ingredients shall be introduced by a title that shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consist of the term

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: “Ingredients”, “Ingredients:” or “Ingredients :” in the English version of the list, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: “Ingrédients”, “Ingrédients:” or “Ingrédients:” in the French version of the list;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be shown in bold type; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be shown without any intervening printed, written or graphic material appearing between the title and the first ingredient shown in the list.

Subsection.Text: A list of ingredients shall be shown in a manner that clearly differentiates it on the label, by means of one or both of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: graphics in the form of a solid-line border around the list or one or more solid lines appearing immediately above, below or at the sides of the list that are the same colour as that of the type used to show the information referred to in subsection B.01.008.1(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a background colour that creates a contrast between the background colour of the list and the background colour used on the adjacent surface of the label, other than the surface used to display

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement as defined in subsection B.01.010.1(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration referred to in subsection B.01.010.4(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any statement referred to in subsection B.16.016(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a nutrition facts table,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a supplemented food facts table, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of cautionary statements.

Subsection.Text: In a list of ingredients, ingredients shall be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in descending order of their proportion by weight of the prepackaged product, determined before they are combined to form the prepackaged product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in lower case letters, except that upper case letters shall be used to show

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the first letter of each ingredient or, in the case of a food additive or supplemental ingredient shown in whole or in part by an acronym, the entire acronym, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the alpha-descriptor that forms a part of the common name for a food additive, vitamin, supplemental ingredient or microorganism; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: separated by a bullet point or a comma.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (3)(a), the following ingredients may be shown at the end of the list of ingredients, in any order:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: spices, herbs and other seasonings, other than salt added separately, if the total weight of those other seasonings is no more than two per cent of the total weight of ingredients used in the manufacture of the prepackaged product excluding added water used as an ingredient that has been removed during its manufacture;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: natural flavours and artificial flavours;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: flavour enhancers;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: food additives, except ingredients of food additive preparations or mixtures of substances for use as a food additive;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: vitamins;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: salts or derivatives of vitamins;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: mineral nutrients;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: salts of mineral nutrients; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: supplemental ingredients.

Subsection.Text: In a list of ingredients, the components of an ingredient shall be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in parentheses, immediately after the ingredient, unless the source of a food allergen or gluten is shown immediately after the ingredient, in which case components of the ingredient shall be shown immediately after that source;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in descending order of their proportion by weight of the ingredient, determined before the components are combined to form the ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in lower case letters, except that upper case letters shall be used to show

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a food additive or supplemental ingredient shown in whole or in part by an acronym, the entire acronym, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the alpha-descriptor that forms a part of the common name for a food additive, vitamin, supplemental ingredient or microorganism; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: separated by a comma.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph B.01.008(1)(b) and paragraphs (5)(a) and (b), but subject to section B.01.009, if one or more components of an ingredient are required by these Regulations to be shown in a list of ingredients, the ingredient is not required to be shown in the list if all components of the ingredient are shown in the list by their common names and in accordance with subsection (3) as if they were ingredients.
In a list of ingredients, the source of a food allergen or gluten shall be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: immediately after the ingredient or component to which it applies in accordance with subsections B.01.010.1(8) and (10);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: entirely in lower case letters; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: separated by a comma from any other source of a food allergen or gluten that is shown for the same ingredient or component.

Subsection.Text: If the English and French versions of a list of ingredients appear on the label, they shall be displayed on a continuous surface of the available display surface, but need not be on the same continuous surface of the available display surface.

If the English and French versions of a list of ingredients appear on the same continuous surface of the label, the version that follows the other version shall not begin on the same line as that on which the other version ends, except in the case of a prepackaged product that has an available display surface of less than 100 cm2.

If a prepackaged product contains one or more sugars-based ingredients, despite the order of presentation referred to in paragraph B.01.008.2(3)(a), the sugars-based ingredient or ingredients shall be shown in the list of ingredients, in parentheses, immediately following the term

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “Sugars” in the English version of the list; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “Sucres” in the French version of the list.

Subsection.Text: The term “Sugars” referred to in subsection (1) shall be shown in the list of ingredients

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in descending order of the proportion by weight of all the sugars-based ingredients in the prepackaged product, before they are combined to form the product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: separated from other ingredients by a bullet point or a comma.

Subsection.Text: Each sugars-based ingredient mentioned immediately following the term “Sugars” shall be shown,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: despite paragraph B.01.008.2(3)(b), entirely in lower case letters; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of more than one sugars-based ingredient,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in descending order of its proportion by weight of the prepackaged product as prescribed by subsection B.01.008.2(3), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: separated by a comma.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1) to (3) do not apply to the following prepackaged products:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a sweetening agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fruit or vegetable juice or vegetable drink that does not contain any sweetening agent, as well as any mixture of those juices and drinks, including any of those juices and drinks

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to which fruit or vegetable purée or any mixture of those purées has been added,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that are reconstituted, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: that are a concentrate intended for dilution and consumption as juice or drink;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fruit or vegetable purée that does not contain any sweetening agent as well as any mixture of those purées;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged products that contain only one sugars-based ingredient that contains the word “sugar” in its common name;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: formulated liquid diets, human milk fortifiers and human milk substitutes; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged products that contain less than 0.5 g of sugars per serving of stated size.

Subsection.Text: Components of ingredients or of classes of ingredients set out in the following table are not required to be shown on a label:

row.entry: breads that comply with the standards set out in sections 12.2.1 to 12.2.6 of Volume 12 of the Food Compositional Standards Document
milks that comply with the standards set out in sections 7.1.1 to 7.1.20 of Volume 7 of the Food Compositional Standards Document
sweetening agents that comply with the standards set out in sections 15.1.1 to 15.1.14 of Volume 15 of the Food Compositional Standards Document
vinegars that comply with the standards set out in sections 16.1.1 to 16.1.5 of Volume 16 of the Food Compositional Standards Document

alcoholic beverages that comply with the standards set out in sections 2.1.1 to 2.1.4, 2.2.1, 2.3.1, 2.3.2, 2.4.1 to 2.4.7, 2.5.1, 2.6.1, 2.7.1 to 2.7.8, 2.8.1, 2.8.2 and 2.9.1 of Volume 2 of the Food Compositional Standards Document, Scotch whisky, Irish whisky, Armagnac brandy, Cognac brandy, Bourbon whisky, Tennessee whisky, Tequila and Mezcal;

cheeses that comply with the standards set out in Division 7.4 of Volume 7 of the Food Compositional Standards Document, if the total amount of those cheeses is less than 10 per cent of the prepackaged product
