jams, marmalades and jellies that comply with the standards set out in sections 10.4.1 to 10.4.10 of Volume 10 of the Food Compositional Standards Document, if the total amount of those ingredients is less than 5 per cent of the prepackaged product
olives, pickles, relish and horse-radish when the total amount of those ingredients is less than 10 per cent of a prepackaged product

vegetable or animal fats or oils that comply with the standards set out in sections 8.1.1 to 8.1.9, 8.2.1 to 8.2.4 and 8.3.1 to 8.3.3 of Volume 8 of the Food Compositional Standards Document, and modified, interesterified or fully hydrogenated vegetable or animal fats or oils, if the total amount of those fats and oils is less than 15 per cent of the prepackaged product

prepared or preserved meat, fish, poultry meat, meat by-product or poultry by-product when the total amount of those ingredients is less than 10 per cent of a prepackaged product that consists of an unstandardized food
alimentary paste that does not contain egg in any form or any flour other than wheat flour
whey, whey powder, concentrated whey, whey butter and whey butter oil
toasted wheat crumbs used in or as a binder, filler or breading in or on a food product

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), where a preparation or mixture set out in the table to this subsection is added to a food, the ingredients and components of the preparation or mixture are not required to be shown on the label of that food.

row.entry: seasoning mixtures, other than those set out in item 4 and salt added separately, if the total weight of those seasoning ingredients is no more than 2% of the total weight of ingredients used in the manufacture of the prepackaged product excluding added water used as an ingredient that has been removed during its manufacture
food additive preparations, including food colour preparations and rennet preparations
compressed, dry, active or instant yeast preparations

Subsection.Text: Where a preparation or mixture set out in the table to subsection (2) is added to a food, and the preparation or mixture contains one or more of the following ingredients or components, those ingredients or components shall be shown by their common names in the list of the ingredients of the food to which they are added as if they were ingredients of that food:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: salt;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: glutamic acid or its salts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: hydrolyzed plant protein;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: aspartame;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: potassium chloride;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any ingredient or component that performs a function in, or has any effect on, that food; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any supplemental ingredient.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsections (1) and (2), where any of the following components is contained in an ingredient set out in the tables to those subsections, that component shall be shown in the list of ingredients:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: peanut oil;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fully hydrogenated peanut oil; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: modified peanut oil.

Subsection.Text: In this section, common name includes a name set out in the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document.
An ingredient or component shall be shown in the list of ingredients by its common name.
For the purposes of subsection (2),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredient or component set out in the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document shall be shown in the list of ingredients by the common name of that ingredient or component that is set out in that Document; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredient or component set out in the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document may be shown in the list of ingredients by the common name of that ingredient or component that is set out in that Document.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2) and subsection B.01.008.2(5), if a food contains ingredients of the same class, those ingredients may be shown by a class name if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they consist of more than one component and are not listed in the table to subsection B.01.009(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: their components are shown

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: immediately after the class name of the ingredients of which they are components, in such a manner as to indicate that they are components of the ingredients, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in descending order of their collective proportion by weight of those ingredients.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and in sections B.01.010.2 to B.01.010.4.

Definition.Text: food allergen means any protein from any of the following foods, or any modified protein, including any protein fraction, that is derived from any of the following foods:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: almonds, Brazil nuts, cashews, hazelnuts, macadamia nuts, pecans, pine nuts, pistachios or walnuts;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: peanuts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sesame seeds;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: wheat or triticale;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: eggs;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: milk;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: soybeans;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: crustaceans;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: molluscs;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: fish; or

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: mustard seeds. (allergène alimentaire)

Definition.Text: food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement means a statement appearing on the label of a prepackaged product that indicates the source of a food allergen or gluten that is present in the product or the presence in the product of added sulphites in a total amount of 10 p.p.m. or more. (mention des sources d’allergènes alimentaires ou de gluten et des sulfites ajoutés)
gluten means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any gluten protein from the grain of any of the following cereals or from the grain of a hybridized strain that is created from at least one of the following cereals:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: barley,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: oats,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: rye,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: triticale,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: wheat; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any modified gluten protein, including any gluten protein fraction, that is derived from the grain of any of the cereals referred to in paragraph (a) or from the grain of a hybridized strain referred to in that paragraph. (gluten)

Definition.Text: height, in respect of type, means the height of the lower case letter “x”. (hauteur)

Subsection.Text: If a food allergen or gluten is present in a prepackaged product, the source of the food allergen or gluten, as the case may be, must be shown on the label of the product in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the list of ingredients; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (2) does not apply to a food allergen or gluten that is present in a prepackaged product as a result of cross-contamination.

Subsection (2) does not apply to a to a food allergen or gluten that is present in a prepackaged product referred to in paragraphs B.01.008(2)(a) to (e) unless a list of ingredients is shown on the product’s label.
The source of a food allergen required to be shown under subsection (2) must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from a food referred to in one of paragraphs (a), (b) and (e) of the definition food allergen in subsection (1) or derived from that food, by the name of the food as shown in the applicable paragraph, expressed in the singular or plural;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from the food referred to in paragraph (c) of the definition food allergen in subsection (1) or derived from that food, by the name “sesame”, “sesame seed” or “sesame seeds”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from a food referred to in one of paragraphs (d) and (f) of the definition food allergen in subsection (1) or derived from that food, by the name of the food as shown in the applicable paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from the food referred to in paragraph (g) of the definition food allergen in subsection (1) or derived from that food, by the name “soy”, “soya”, “soybean” or “soybeans”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from a food referred to in one of paragraphs (h) to (j) of the definition food allergen in subsection (1) or derived from that food, by the common name of the food that is set out in the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from the food referred to in paragraph (k) of the definition food allergen in subsection (1) or derived from that food, by the name “mustard”, “mustard seed” or “mustard seeds”.

Subsection.Text: The source of gluten required to be shown under subsection (2) must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for gluten from the grain of a cereal referred to in one of subparagraphs (a)(i) to (v) of the definition gluten in subsection (1) or derived from that grain, by the name of the cereal as shown in the applicable subparagraph; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for gluten from the grain of a hybridized strain created from one or more of the cereals referred to in subparagraphs (a)(i) to (v) of the definition gluten in subsection (1) or derived from that grain, by the names of the cereals as shown in the applicable subparagraphs.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of paragraph (2)(a), the source of the food allergen or gluten must be shown in the list of ingredients, in parentheses, as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: immediately after the ingredient that is shown in that list, if the food allergen or gluten

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is that ingredient,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is present in that ingredient, but is not a component of or present in a component of that ingredient, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is, or is present in, a component of that ingredient and the component is not shown in the list of ingredients; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: immediately after the component that is shown in the list of ingredients, if the food allergen or gluten is that component or is present in that component.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), the source of the food allergen or gluten must be shown on the label of the product in the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement if the food allergen or gluten

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is, or is present in, an ingredient that is not shown in the list of ingredients, but is not a component of that ingredient or present in a component of that ingredient; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is, or is present in, a component and neither the component nor the ingredient in which it is present is shown in the list of ingredients.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (8), the source of the food allergen or gluten is not required to be shown in parentheses immediately after the ingredient or component, as the case may be, if the source of the food allergen or gluten appears

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the list of ingredients

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: as part of the common name of the ingredient or component, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in parentheses, under subsection (8), immediately after another ingredient or component; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, nothing in subsection (8) affects how an ingredient or component may be shown in the list of ingredients under paragraph B.01.010(3)(b).
In this section and in section B.01.010.3, sulphites means the food additives that are set out in the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document and are present in a prepackaged product.
For greater certainty, the definition sulphites in subsection (1) includes only sulphites that are present in the prepackaged product as a result of being added.

If sulphites are present in a prepackaged product in a total amount of 10 parts per million or more and none are required to be shown in the list of ingredients under section B.01.008 or B.01.009, the sulphites must be shown on the label of the product in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the list of ingredients; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement that complies with the requirements of subsection B.01.010.3(1).

Subsection.Text: Subsection (3) does not apply to sulphites present in the prepackaged products referred to in paragraphs B.01.008(2)(a) to (e) unless a list of ingredients is shown on the product’s label.
Sulphites that are shown on a label of the product under subsection (3) must be shown as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the sulphites are shown in the list of ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: individually by the name of the food additive that is set out in the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document, except that the name “sodium dithionite”, “sulphur dioxide” or “sulphurous acid” must be followed, in parentheses, by one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the sulphites are shown in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, by one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”.

Subsection.Text: Sulphites that are shown in the list of ingredients under paragraph (6)(a) must be shown as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sulphites that are a component of an ingredient that is shown in the list of ingredients must be shown either in parentheses immediately after the ingredient or at the end of that list where they may be shown in any order with the other ingredients that are shown at the end of that list in accordance with subsection B.01.008.2(4); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in all other cases, the sulphites must be shown at the end of the list of ingredients where they may be shown in any order with the other ingredients that are shown at the end of that list in accordance with subsection B.01.008.2(4).

Subsection.Text: If sulphites are present in a prepackaged product in a total amount of 10 parts per million or more and any of them are required to be shown in the list of ingredients under section B.01.008 or B.01.009, in the case of sulphites shown individually by the name “sodium dithionite”, “sulphur dioxide” or “sulphurous acid”, that name must be followed, in parentheses, by one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”.

If the total amount of sulphites present in the prepackaged product is 10 parts per million or more, sulphites that are required to be shown in a list of ingredients under section B.01.008 or B.01.009 may also be shown on the label of the product in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement that complies with the requirements of subsection B.01.010.3(1).

Despite subparagraph (6)(a)(ii) and subsection (8), if sulphites are shown individually in a list of ingredients, by the name “sodium dithionite”, “sulphur dioxide” or “sulphurous acid”, that name is not required to be followed, in parentheses, by one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents” if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the list of ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the term “sulfite” or “sulphite” appears in the common name of another sulphite, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents” is shown in parentheses following another sulphite; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents” is shown in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement on the label of the product.

Subsection.Text: A food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement must

Paragraph.Label: a)
Paragraph.Text: be introduced by a title that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: consists of the terms

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: “Contains”, “Contains:” or “Contains :” in the English version of the statement, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: “Contient”, “Contient :” or “Contient :” in the French version of the statement,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is shown in bold type,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is shown without any intervening printed, written or graphic material appearing between it and the rest of the statement, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the statement is preceded by a statement referred to in subsection B.16.016(1) and begins on the line on which that statement ends, is shown in a type that is of a height that is at least 0.2 mm greater than the height of the type used in that statement;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: appear, in respect of each linguistic version, immediately after any statement referred to in subsection B.16.016(1) appearing in the same language or, if there is no such statement, immediately after the list of ingredients appearing in the same language and, in either case, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material;

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: appear on the same continuous surface as the statement or list that immediately precedes it and be shown in the same manner as the list of ingredients is shown under subsection B.01.008.2(2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include all of the following information, even if all or part of that information is also shown in the list of ingredients:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the source for each food allergen that is present in the prepackaged product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: each source for the gluten that is present in the product, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”, if the total amount of sulphites present in the product is 10 parts per million or more; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: show information entries in regular or bold type, using lower case letters except for the first letter of each entry, which shall be an upper case letter, and shall use a bullet point or comma to separate each entry.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(b), the following information is not required to be shown in the statement more than once:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the same source of a food allergen;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the same source of gluten; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: one of the common names “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”.

Subsection.Text: If the English and French versions of the statement appear on the same continuous surface of the label, the version that follows the other version shall not begin on the same line as that on which the other version ends, except in the case of a prepackaged product that has an available display surface of less than 100 cm2.
If the label of a prepackaged product includes a declaration alerting consumers that, due to a risk of cross-contamination, the product may contain the source of a food allergen or gluten,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the declaration must appear immediately after

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, if there is one,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any statement referred to in subsection B.16.016(1), if no food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement appears on the label, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the list of ingredients, if neither of the statements referred to in subparagraph (ii) appears on the label;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the declaration must appear in both English and French if the statement or list immediately preceding it appears in both languages;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the declaration must appear on the same continuous surface as the statement or list that immediately precedes it and be shown in the same manner as the list of ingredients is shown under subsection B.01.008.2(2);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the declaration must appear without any intervening printed, written or graphic material between it and the statement or list that immediately precedes it, except that a solid line may appear before the declaration if the declaration begins on a different line than the line on which the statement or list ends;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the declaration must be shown in bold type if it begins on the line on which the statement or list that immediately precedes it ends and if it is not introduced by a title;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any title that introduces the declaration must be shown in bold type if the declaration begins on the line on which the statement or list that immediately precedes it ends; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the declaration is preceded by a statement referred to in subsection B.16.016(1) and begins on the line on which the statement ends, the title of the declaration — or the declaration itself, if no title appears — must be shown in a type that is of a height that is at least 0.2 mm greater than the height of the type used in the statement.

Subsection.Text: If the English and French versions of the declaration appear on the same continuous surface of the label, the version that follows the other version must not begin on the line on which the other version ends unless the prepackaged product has an available display surface of less than 100 cm2.
Where it is an acceptable manufacturing practice for a manufacturer to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: omit from his prepackaged product any food that is ordinarily an ingredient or component, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: substitute in whole or in part in his prepackaged product any other food for a food that is ordinarily an ingredient or component,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: the list of ingredients for the 12-month period commencing from the time the label is applied to the prepackaged product may show as ingredients or components the foods that may be omitted and the foods that may be used as substitutes if

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: all the foods that may be used as ingredients or components throughout the 12-month period are shown in the list of ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it is clearly stated as part of the list of ingredients that the food shown as an ingredient or component may not be present or that another food may be substituted for a food shown as an ingredient or component; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the foods that may be omitted or substituted are grouped with the same class of foods that are used as ingredients or components and the foods within each such group are listed in descending order of the proportion by weight in which they will probably be used during the 12-month period.

Subsection.Text: Where it is an acceptable manufacturing practice for a manufacturer to vary the proportions of ingredients or components of his prepackaged product, the list of ingredients for the 12-month period commencing from the time the label is applied to the prepackaged product may show the ingredients or components in the same proportions throughout the 12-month period if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is clearly stated as part of the list of ingredients that the proportions indicated are subject to change; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredients or components are listed in descending order of the proportion by weight in which they will probably be used during the 12-month period.

Subsection.Text: In this section,

Definition.Text: local government unit means a city, metropolitan government area, town, village, municipality or other area of local government but does not include any local government unit situated within a bilingual district established under the Official Languages Act; (collectivité locale)
local food means a food that is manufactured, processed, produced or packaged in a local government unit and sold only in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the local government unit in which it is manufactured, processed or packaged,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: one or more local government units that are immediately adjacent to the one in which it is manufactured, processed, produced or packaged, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the local government unit in which it is manufactured, processed, produced or packaged and in one or more local government units that are immediately adjacent to the one in which it is manufactured, processed, produced or packaged; (produit alimentaire local)

Definition.Text: mother tongue means the language first learned in childhood by persons in any area of Canada and still understood by them as ascertained by the decennial census taken immediately preceding the date on which the food referred to in subsection (3) is sold to the consumer; (langue maternelle)
official languages means the English language and the French language; (langues officielles)
specialty food means a food — other than a human milk fortifier or supplemented food — that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has special religious significance and is used in religious ceremonies; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is an imported food

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that is not widely used by the population as a whole in Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for which there is no readily available substitute that is manufactured, processed, produced or packaged in Canada and that is generally accepted as being a comparable substitute; (aliment spécial)

Definition.Text: test market food means a food that, prior to the date of the notice of intention respecting that food referred to in subsection (5), was not sold in Canada in that form and that differs substantially from any other food sold in Canada with respect to its composition, function, state or packaging form and includes a food referred to in section B.01.054. (produit alimentaire d’essai)

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (9), (10) and (11), all information required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of a food shall be shown in both official languages.
Subject to subsections (4) to (6), subsection (2) does not apply to a local food or test market food if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is sold in a local government unit in which one of the official languages is the mother tongue of less than 10 per cent of the total number of persons residing in the local government unit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of a food is shown in the official language that is the mother tongue of at least 10 per cent of the total number of persons residing in the local government unit.

Subsection.Text: Where one of the official languages is the mother tongue of less than 10 per cent of the total number of persons residing in a local government unit and the other official language is the mother tongue of less than 10 per cent of the total number of persons residing in the same local government unit, subsection (3) does not apply.

Subsection (3) does not apply to a test market food unless the person who intends to conduct the test marketing of the food has, six weeks prior to conducting the test marketing, filed with the President of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency a notice of intention in a form acceptable to the President.

A test market food shall, for the purposes of subsection (3), cease to be a test market food upon the expiration of 12 cumulative months after the date on which it was first offered for sale as a test market food but any test market food that was acquired for resale by a person, other than the person who filed the notice of intention referred to in subsection (5), before the expiration of those 12 cumulative months, shall continue to be a test market food for the purposes of subsection (3) until it is sold.
Subsection (2) does not apply to a specialty food if the information required by these Regulations to be shown on the label thereon is shown in one of the official languages.

Where there are one or more surfaces on the label of a food that are of at least the same size and prominence as the principal display panel, the information required by these Regulations to be shown on the principal display panel may be shown in one official language if such information is shown in the other official language on one of those other surfaces.

Subsection (2) does not apply to the identity and principal place of business of the person by or for whom the food was manufactured, processed, produced or packaged for resale if this information is shown in one of the official languages.
Subsection (2) does not apply to the following common names if the common name appears on the principal display panel in the following manner:
Subsection (2) does not apply to the label of a shipping container destined to a commercial or industrial enterprise or an institution, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the shipping container and its contents are not resold as a one unit prepackaged product to a consumer at the retail level; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all information required by these Regulations to be shown on a label of a food is shown in one of the official languages.

Subsection.Text: Unless specifically required by the Act or these Regulations, no reference, direct or indirect, to the Act or to these Regulations shall be made on any label of, or in any advertisement for, a food.

Despite subsection (1), the label of, or an advertisement for, a food may include a statement that a food “complies with the standard for (naming the common name of the food in respect of which the claim is made) in the Food and Drug Regulations” if the food complies with the standard prescribed by these Regulations for that food and the manufacturer of the food has substantiated, by means of the results of tests carried out before the statement is made or by other evidence that exists before the statement is made, that the food complies with the standard.

Except in the case of a formulated liquid diet, human milk fortifier or human milk substitute, it is prohibited to sell a food represented in any manner as containing hydrolyzed or partially hydrolyzed collagen, hydrolyzed or partially hydrolyzed gelatin or hydrolyzed or partially hydrolyzed casein unless the label carries the following statement on the principal display panel in the same size type used for the common name:

Provision.Text: “CAUTION, DO NOT USE AS SOLE SOURCE OF NUTRITION”.

Subsection.Text: In this section, formulated liquid diet means a food that meets the requirements of sections B.24.101 to B.24.103.

Subject to subsection (8), where an irradiated food referred to in column 1 of the table to Division 26 is offered for sale as a prepackaged product, the principal display panel of the label applied to the package shall carry the symbol described in subsection (5).

Where an irradiated food referred to in column 1 of the table to Division 26 is not a prepackaged product and is offered for sale, a sign that carries the symbol described in subsection (5) shall be displayed immediately next to the food.

The symbol required pursuant to subsection (1) or (2) shall appear in close proximity on the principal display panel referred to in subsection (1) or on the sign referred to in subsection (2) to one of the following statements or a written statement that has the same meaning:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “treated with radiation”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “treated by irradiation”; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “irradiated”.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell a food referred to in column 1 of the table to Division 26 that has been irradiated in the manner set out in subsection B.26.003(2) unless the requirements of subsections (1) to (3) are met.
For the purposes of subsections (1) to (3), the symbol that indicates the irradiated food shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have an outer diameter

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case referred to in subsection (1), equal to or greater than the height of the numerical quantity prescribed by paragraph 229(1)(a) and subsections 229(2) and (3) of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations for the declaration of net quantity of the package, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case referred to in subsection (2), not less than 5 cm; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be in the following form:

ImageGroup.AlternateText: Symbol for irradiated food consisting of a plant in a circle in which the top half of the circle is dashed.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsection B.01.009(1), any food referred to in column 1 of the table to Division 26 that is an ingredient or component of a prepackaged product and that has been irradiated shall, if the food constitutes 10 per cent or more of the prepackaged product, be included in the list of ingredients and preceded by the statement “irradiated”.

The label attached to a shipping container that contains a food set out in column 1 of the table to Division 26 that has been subjected to the maximum absorbed dose set out in column 5 shall carry the statement that is required by subsection (3) and the statement “Do not irradiate again.”.

Where a shipping container constitutes the package of the prepackaged product, the label attached to the shipping container shall carry the statement required by subsection (7) but need not carry the symbol required by subsection (5).
Any advertising of an irradiated food referred to in column 1 of the table to Division 26 shall identify the food as having been irradiated.
The statements referred to in subsections (3) and (6) to (8) shall be in both official languages in accordance with subsection B.01.012(2).

Section.Label: B.01.042
Section.Text: If a standard for a food is set out in the Food Compositional Standards Document:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food must contain only the ingredients set out in the standard for the food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the food must contain each ingredient in a quantity within any limits set out in the standard for that ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the food must be labelled and advertised in accordance with any requirements set out in the standard; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the food must comply with any other requirements set out in the standard in relation to the composition, strength, potency, purity, quality or other property of the food.

Section.Label: B.01.043
Section.Text: Despite paragraph B.01.042(a), if a substance — other than a supplemental ingredient — is required or permitted by a provision of these Regulations in a food for which a standard is set out in the Food Compositional Standards Document, that food must contain the required substance and may contain the permitted substance.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: BSE means Bovine Spongiform Encephalopathy. (ESB)
specified risk material means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the skull, brain, trigeminal ganglia, eyes, tonsils, spinal cord and dorsal root ganglia of cattle aged 30 months or older; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the distal ileum of cattle of all ages. (matériel à risque spécifié)

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or import for sale food that contains specified risk material.
Subsection (2) does not apply in respect of food that originates from a country that is designated as being free from BSE in accordance with section 7 of the Health of Animals Regulations.
Subsection (2) does not apply in respect of food that is packaged for sale or imported for sale before the day on which this subsection comes into force.
No person shall sell

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any animal intended for consumption as food if any product containing any drug listed in subsection (2) has been administered to the animal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any food that is derived from an animal if any product containing a drug listed in subsection (2) has been administered to the animal; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any food that is derived from an animal if the food contains any residue of a drug listed in subsection (2).

Subsection.Text: The drugs referred to in subsection (1) are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: chloramphenicol and its salts and derivatives;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a 5-nitrofuran compound;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: clenbuterol and its salts and derivatives;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a 5-nitroimidazole compound; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: diethylstilbestrol and other stilbene compounds.

Section.Label: B.01.049
Section.Text: No person shall use, in labelling, packaging, advertising or selling a food that does not meet the requirements of the kashruth applicable to it, the word “kosher” or any letters of the Hebrew alphabet or any other word, expression, depiction, sign, symbol, mark, device or other representation that indicates or that is likely to create an impression that the food is kosher.

Section.Label: B.01.050
Section.Text: A person must not use, in labelling, packaging, advertising or selling a food, the word “halal” — or any letters of the Arabic alphabet or any other word, expression, depiction, sign, symbol, mark, device or other representation that indicates or that is likely to create an impression that the food is halal — unless the name of the person or body that certified the food as halal is indicated on the label or package or in the advertisement or sale.

Section.Label: B.01.053
Section.Text: No person shall sell a product represented as a ready breakfast or instant breakfast or by any similar designation unless each serving of stated size of the product contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 4.0 mg. iron;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Vitamin A, thiamine, riboflavin, niacin or niacinamide and Vitamin C;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a good dietary source of protein; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: where consumed as directed, not less than 300 calories.

Subsection.Text: In order to generate information in support of an amendment to the Regulations, the Minister may issue to the manufacturer or distributor of a food, where the food or the packaging, labelling or advertising of the food does not comply with the requirements of these Regulations, a Temporary Marketing Authorization Letter that authorizes the sale of the food described therein or the packaging, labelling or advertising of the food described therein for a specified period of time, within a designated area and in a specified quantity, in the manner specified in the Letter if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer or distributor of the food has supplied to the Minister the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the purpose for which the temporary marketing authorization of the food is required,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the food including a sample and proposed label,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of any proposed variation from the requirements of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: adequate data to show that the use of the food will not be detrimental to the health of the purchaser or user,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the proposed quantity of the food to be sold,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the proposed period of time required for such sale,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the proposed area designated for such sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: such other data as the Minister may require; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer or distributor of the food has agreed to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: describe the food on a label or in an advertisement in a manner that is not false, misleading or deceptive,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: use such marks or statements on the label or in any advertisement as the Minister may require,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: on request, submit to the Minister results of the temporary marketing, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: on request, withdraw the product from sale where the Minister is of the opinion that it is in the public interest to do so.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall, in any Temporary Marketing Authorization Letter issued pursuant to subsection (1), set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the common name and description of the food to be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer or distributor of the food;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the purpose for which the temporary marketing of the food is authorized;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the food that is authorized for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (d.1)
Paragraph.Text: the type of packaging, labelling or advertising authorized in respect of the food where the Letter is intended to authorize a variation from a requirement of any provision of the Regulations respecting packaging, labelling or advertising;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the period of time during which the food may be sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the designated area within which the food may be sold.

Subsection.Text: A manufacturer or distributor named in a Temporary Marketing Authorization Letter issued pursuant to subsection B.01.054(1) may, for the purpose set out in the Letter, sell the food in the manner authorized in the Letter and package, label or advertise that food in the manner authorized in the Letter for the period of time, within the designated area and in the quantity set out in the Letter.

No provision of these Regulations made pursuant to paragraph 30(1)(b) of the Act applies in respect of a food or the packaging, labelling or advertising of a food for which a Temporary Marketing Authorization Letter has been issued pursuant to subsection B.01.054(1) to the extent that the food, or the packaging, labelling or advertising of the food, as authorized in the Letter, does not comply with that provision.

Section.Label: B.01.071
Section.Text: Where a prepackaged product is a mixture of nuts, the percentage and common name of the nut that is present in the product in the greatest amount by weight shall be applied to the principal display panel of the package in close proximity to the common name of the product.

Section.Label: B.01.072
Section.Text: Notwithstanding any requirement prescribed in Part B, a food product that has been subjected to heat in the presence of a vaporized liquid solution of smoke derived from hardwood, hardwood sawdust or corn cobs may be described as “smoked”.

Subsection.Text: In this section, frozen means preserved by freezing temperature and does not include any surface freezing that may occur during holding and transportation.

Where meat, meat by-products, poultry meat, poultry by-products or fish, or meat of any marine or fresh water animal, that has been frozen is thawed prior to sale, the words “previously frozen” shall be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the principal display panel in close proximity to the common name of the food and in letters at least as legible and conspicuous as those used in the common name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: anywhere on the principal display panel in letters of not less than 1/4 of an inch (6.4 millimetres) in height; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: on a sign displayed adjacent to the food in letters that are easily visible and legible to a prospective purchaser.

Subsection.Text: Where part of a food referred to in subsection (2) has been frozen and thawed prior to sale, the words “Made from fresh and frozen portions” or “Made from fresh and frozen (naming the food)” shall be shown in the manner described in paragraph (2)(a), (b) or (c).

No person shall offer for sale at retail any solid cut meat or solid cut poultry meat to which phosphate salts or water has been added, unless that meat or poultry meat is contained in a package and carries a label.

The label referred to in subsection (1) shall contain a statement of the minimum percentage of meat protein as part of the common name of the product on the principal display panel of the package in type that is as legible and conspicuous as any other type on that display panel, and in letters that are at least one half of the size of the letters used in the common name of the product but that are not less than 1.6 mm in height.

Section.Label: B.01.091
Section.Text: The label of any solid cut meat or solid cut poultry meat that has had phosphate salts or water added to it, that is not cured and that is prepackaged at retail shall contain a statement of the ingredients contained in the food in accordance with subsections B.01.008.2(1) to (5) and (7).

Section.Label: B.01.092
Section.Text: Sections B.01.090 and B.01.091 do not apply in respect of side bacon, Wiltshire bacon, pork jowls, salt pork or salt beef.

Subsection.Text: The common name of a simulated meat product or simulated poultry product shall be the common name of the meat product or poultry product that is simulated, modified by the word “simulated”.

The word “simulated” in the common name of a simulated meat product or simulated poultry product shall be shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those used in the remainder of the common name of that product.

Where a simulated meat product or a simulated poultry product is not a prepackaged product, the common name of the product and the other information required by this section to be shown on the label of a simulated meat product or simulated poultry product shall be shown on a sign displayed on or adjacent to the product in letters that are legible and conspicuous to a prospective purchaser.
The words

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “contains no meat”, in the case of a simulated meat product, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “contains no poultry”, in the case of a simulated poultry product,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: shall be shown on the principal display panel of the label of a simulated meat product or simulated poultry product in close proximity to the common name and in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those shown in the common name.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section and section B.01.102, source of protein means any food that contains protein, but does not include spices, seasonings, flavours, artificial flavours, flavour enhancers, food additives and similar foods that contain only small amounts of protein.
The common name of a meat product extender shall be the common name of each food in the meat product extender that is a source of protein, plus

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the word “meat”, or the common name of the meat product that is to be extended, plus the word “extender”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the words “extender for” plus the common name of the meat product that is to be extended.

Subsection.Text: The common name of a poultry product extender shall be the common name of each food in the poultry product extender that is a source of protein, plus

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the word “poultry”, or the common name of the poultry product that is to be extended plus the word “extender”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the words “extender for” plus the common name of the poultry product that is to be extended.

Subsection.Text: Foods that are a source of protein in the meat product extender or poultry product extender shall be shown by their common names in the common name of that meat product extender or poultry product extender

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in descending order of their proportion by weight of the meat product extender or poultry product extender; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those used in the remainder of the common name of the meat product extender or poultry product extender.

Subsection.Text: The common name of an extended meat product or an extended poultry product shall be the common name of the meat product or poultry product that is extended, modified by the common name of each of the foods that are sources of protein in the extended meat product or extended poultry product.
Notwithstanding subsection (1),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the word or words “meat”, “meat product”, “poultry”, “poultry meat” or “poultry meat by-product” as the case may be, may be used in the common name of an extended meat product or extended poultry product as the common name of the food therein that is a source of protein derived from a meat product or poultry product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where it is an acceptable manufacturing practice for a manufacturer to omit from his meat product extender or poultry product extender any source of protein derived from a plant that is ordinarily an ingredient of that meat product extender or poultry product extender, or to substitute in whole or in part in his meat product extender or poultry product extender any source of protein derived from a plant for a source of protein that is ordinarily an ingredient of that meat product extender or poultry product extender, the word “plant” may be used in the common name of an extended meat product or extended poultry product as the common name of the food therein that is a source of protein derived from a plant.

Subsection.Text: Foods that are a source of protein in an extended meat product or extended poultry product shall be shown by their common names in the common name of that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in descending order of their proportion by weight of that product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those used in the remainder of the common name of that product.

Subsection.Text: Where an extended meat product or extended poultry product is not a prepackaged product, the common name of that product and the information required by this section to be shown on the label of an extended meat product or extended poultry product shall be shown on a sign displayed on or adjacent to that product in letters that are legible and conspicuous to a prospective purchaser.

No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, other than in the nutrition facts table or supplemented food facts table, if any, include a declaration of the food’s energy value or the amount of a nutrient or supplemental ingredient contained in the food unless it is declared in the following manner, per serving of stated size:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the energy value, in Calories;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a vitamin referred to in subsection D.01.002(1) that is not one of the following vitamins, in the applicable unit set out in subsection D.01.003(1):

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: beta-carotene as a form of vitamin A or retinol, including its derivatives, as a form of vitamin A, or both, if either is a supplemental ingredient, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: niacin, if it is a supplemental ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b.01)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the following vitamins, in the applicable unit set out in column 3 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: beta-carotene as a form of vitamin A or retinol, including its derivatives, as a form of vitamin A, or both, if either is a supplemental ingredient, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: niacin, if it is a supplemental ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the following mineral nutrients:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for sodium, potassium, calcium, phosphorus, magnesium, iron, zinc, chloride, copper and manganese, in milligrams, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for iodide, chromium, selenium and molybdenum, in micrograms;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cholesterol, in milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the mineral ion content of prepackaged water or ice, in parts per million;

Paragraph.Label: (d.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a supplemental ingredient other than a vitamin or mineral nutrient referred to in this subsection, in the applicable unit referred to in column 3 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, in grams.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection D.01.003(1) and for the purposes of this section, the amount in metric units of the vitamins referred to in paragraph (1)(b.01) must be determined in terms of their amount in the supplemented food in accordance with column 5 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients, as applicable.

Despite subsection (1), a person may, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, other than in the nutrition facts table or supplemented food facts table, if any, include a declaration of the percentage of the daily value of a nutrient contained in the food if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a food that is not a supplemented food, the nutrient is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.401 or the table to section B.01.402 and the percentage of the daily value of the nutrient is required or permitted to be declared in the nutrition facts table;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a supplemented food, the nutrient is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.29.002 or the table to section B.29.003, or referred to in column 2 of item 18 of the table to section B.29.002, and the percentage of the daily value of the nutrient is required or permitted to be declared in the supplemented food facts table; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the percentage of the daily value of the nutrient is declared per serving of stated size.

Subsection.Text: A declaration referred to in subsection (1) or (2) that appears on the label of a food shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in English and French; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in one of those languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the food may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

Section.Label: B.01.302
Section.Text: If the label of a multiple-serving prepackaged product indicates that the product contains or, if prepared as directed in or on the package, provides a specified number of servings or portions, that information must be based on the serving of stated size set out in the nutrition facts table or supplemented food facts table, as the case may be.

Subsection.Text: No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make a representation, express or implied, respecting a protein unless the food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 8 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “source of protein” set out in column 1.
No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, other than a supplemented food, make a representation, express or implied, respecting an amino acid unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 8 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “source of protein” set out in column 1; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the label or advertisement includes a declaration of the amount of histidine, isoleucine, leucine, lysine, methionine, phenylalanine, threonine, tryptophan and valine contained in the food, expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a formulated liquid diet, human milk fortifier, human milk substitute or food represented as containing a human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: foods represented for use in gluten-free diets, protein restricted diets, low (naming the amino acid) diets and (naming the amino acid) free diets;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the word “protein” when used as part of the common name of an ingredient in the list of ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the declaration of amino acids in the list of ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the common names that are set out in the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document, if shown in the list of ingredients in accordance with paragraph B.01.010(3)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the common name of a single amino acid preparation that may be sold as a food;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any statement referred to in subsection B.16.016(1);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 4 of item 7 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims respecting the subject “low in protein” set out in column 1;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration of the amount of protein in the nutrition facts table or supplemented food facts table, as the case may be;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the protein content of a food as required by paragraph B.24.103(c), subparagraph B.24.202(a)(ii), paragraph B.24.304(b) or B.25.057(1)(a) or subparagraph B.25.057(2)(c)(i) or (d)(i); or

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that a food is not a source of protein.

Subsection.Text: A representation referred to in subsection (1) or (2) that appears on the label of a food shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in English and French; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in one of those languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the food may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), no person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make a representation, express or implied, concerning the action or effect of the food’s energy value or of a nutrient contained in the food.
The label of or advertisement for a food may carry a statement or claim set out in column 1 of the table following section B.01.603.

Subject to section B.01.312, the label of or advertisement for a food may carry a statement or claim to the effect that the food’s energy value or a nutrient contained in the food is generally recognized as an aid in maintaining the functions of the body necessary to the maintenance of good health and normal growth and development.

If a statement or claim described in subsection (3) concerns a nutrient not listed in column 1 of the tables to sections B.01.401 and B.01.402 — or, as the case may be, not listed in column 1 of the tables to sections B.29.002 and B.29.003 and not referred to in column 2 of item 18 of the table to section B.29.002 — the amount of the nutrient contained in the food must be expressed on any part of the label in grams per serving of stated size.
A statement or claim referred to in subsection (2) or (3) that appears on the label of a food shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in English and French; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in one of those languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the food may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

Subsection.Text: If a statement or claim described in subsection B.01.311(3) is made on the label of or in an advertisement for a food that is not a prepackaged product or in an advertisement for a prepackaged product that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the label or advertisement shall include a declaration, per serving of stated size, of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the energy value, if the energy value is the subject of the statement or claim; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the nutrient, if a nutrient is the subject of the statement or claim.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply if the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating.
If the statement or claim is made in an advertisement other than a radio or television advertisement, the declaration referred to in subsection (1) shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Subsection.Text: If the statement or claim is made in a radio advertisement or in the audio portion of a television advertisement, the declaration referred to in subsection (1) shall immediately precede or follow the statement or claim.
If the statement or claim is made in a television advertisement, the declaration referred to in subsection (1) shall be communicated

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the audio mode, if the statement or claim is made only in the audio portion of the advertisement or in both the audio and visual portions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the audio or visual mode, if the statement or claim is made only in the visual portion of the advertisement.

Subsection.Text: If the declaration referred to in subsection (1) is communicated in the visual mode of a television advertisement, it shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appear concurrently with and for at least the same amount of time as the statement or claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise provided in this section, the principal display panel of a prepackaged product must carry a symbol that is set out in Schedule K.1 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the product, as offered for sale, contains a nutrient that is set out in column 1 of the table to this section; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the nutrient, calculated as a percentage of the daily value, meets or exceeds the applicable threshold set out in columns 2 to 7 of that table.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), the percentage of the daily value for the nutrient is calculated on the basis of the amount of the nutrient, by weight, per serving of stated size or per reference amount, whichever is greater.

Despite subsection (2), if the prepackaged product requires reconstitution with water or another liquid or the addition of any other ingredient for its preparation and the reference amount applicable to the product only refers to the food in its prepared form, the percentage of the daily value for the nutrient is calculated on the basis of the amount of the nutrient, by weight, per serving of stated size.

In the case of a prepackaged product referred to in subsection (3), the applicable threshold set out in columns 2 to 7 of the table to this section is determined on the basis of the product’s serving of stated size rather than its reference amount.
Subsection (1) does not apply to the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shipping containers, unless the containers and their contents are sold as a one unit prepackaged product to a consumer at the retail level;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged products with an available display surface of less than 15 cm2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged individual portions of food that are intended solely to be served by a restaurant or other commercial enterprise with meals or snacks;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: ready-to-serve multiple-serving prepackaged products that are intended solely to be served in a commercial or industrial enterprise or an institution;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged products that are intended solely for use as an ingredient in the manufacture of other prepackaged products intended for sale to a consumer at the retail level or as an ingredient in the preparation of food by a commercial or industrial enterprise or an institution;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: milk, partly skimmed milk, skim milk, goat’s milk, partly skimmed goat’s milk, skimmed goat’s milk, (naming the flavour) milk, (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk, (naming the flavour) skim milk or cream sold in a refillable glass container;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: sweetening agents, including maple sugar and maple syrup;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: salt for table or general household use, celery salt, garlic salt, onion salt and any other seasoning salt if “salt” forms part of the common name of the food;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: fats and oils, including fish and other marine fats and oils, butter, ghee and margarine and other similar substitutes for butter; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: individual rations intended for use by military personnel engaged in operations or exercises.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply, in respect of a nutrient, to the following prepackaged products if the only ingredients containing the nutrient are, in the case of saturated fat or sodium, ingredients set out in subsection (7) or, in the case of sugars, ingredients set out in subsection (8):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whole or cut fruits or vegetables, including frozen, canned or dried fruits or vegetables;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: milk obtained from any animal, in liquid or powdered form;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whole eggs, including liquid, frozen or dried eggs, or whole egg mixes;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: nuts, seeds or nut or seed butters in which less than 30% of the total fat content consists of saturated fat;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: vegetable oils or marine oils in which less than 30% of the total fat content consists of saturated fat;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: marine and fresh water animal products in which less than 30% of the total fat content consists of saturated fat; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any combination of the foods referred to in paragraphs (a) to (f).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (6) in relation to saturated fat and sodium, the ingredients are the following ingredients to which no saturated fat or sodium has been added:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whole or cut fruits or vegetables, including frozen, canned or dried fruits or vegetables;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: milk obtained from any animal, in liquid or powdered form;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whole eggs, including liquid, frozen or dried eggs, or whole egg mixes;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: nuts, seeds or nut or seed butters in which less than 30% of the total fat content consists of saturated fat;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: vegetable oils or marine oils in which less than 30% of the total fat content consists of saturated fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: marine and fresh water animal products in which less than 30% of the total fat content consists of saturated fat.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (6) in relation to sugars, the ingredients are the following ingredients to which no sugars have been added:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredients set out in paragraphs (7)(a), (b) and (d);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: dairy products other than those referred to in paragraph (7)(b);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: grains; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: legumes.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply, in respect of saturated fat and sugars, to prepackaged products that are cheese or yogurt – including drinkable yogurt – that are made from dairy products, kefir or buttermilk unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of saturated fat, the product contains an ingredient, other than any of the following ingredients, that contains saturated fat:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: milk ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: modified milk ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: nuts or seeds in which less than 30% of the total fat content consists of saturated fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: vegetable oils or marine oils in which less than 30% of the total fat content consists of saturated fat, or

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: marine and fresh water animal products in which less than 30% of the total fat content consists of saturated fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of sugars, the product contains an ingredient, other than any of the following ingredients, that contains sugars or the product contains any of the following ingredients to which sugars have been added:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: whole or cut fruits or vegetables, including frozen, canned or dried fruits or vegetables,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: dairy products,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: grains,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: legumes, or

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: nuts or seeds.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraphs (6)(a) and (7)(a), fruit does not include coconut.
Subsection (1) does not apply, in respect of sodium, to prepackaged products that are cheese made from dairy products.
For the application of subsections (9) and (11), the prepackaged products must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have a reference amount of 30 g or 30 mL or less and contain 10% or more of the daily value for calcium per serving of stated size or per reference amount, whichever is greater; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: have a reference amount greater than 30 g or 30 mL and contain 15% or more of the daily value for calcium per serving of stated size or per reference amount, whichever is greater.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to the following prepackaged products unless they are required to carry a nutrition facts table on their label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a beverage with an alcohol content of more than 0.5%;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a raw single ingredient meat, meat by-product, poultry meat or poultry meat by-product that is not ground;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a raw single ingredient marine or fresh water animal product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a product sold only in the retail establishment where it is prepared and processed from its ingredients, including from a pre-mix if an ingredient other than water is added to the pre-mix during the preparation and processing of the product;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a product sold only at a road-side stand, craft show, flea market, fair, farmers’ market or sugar bush by the individual who prepared and processed the product;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an individual serving that is sold for immediate consumption and that has not been subjected to a process to extend its durable life, including special packaging;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a product sold only in the retail establishment where it is packaged, if it is labelled by means of a sticker and has an available display surface of less than 200 cm2; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a product with an available display surface of less than 100 cm2.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a prepackaged product that is a raw single ingredient meat, meat by-product, poultry meat or poultry meat by-product that is ground unless it meets any of the conditions that are set out in paragraph B.01.401(3)(a), (b) or (e).

Subject to subsection (13.2), subsection (1) does not apply to a supplemented food that has an available display surface of less than 100 cm2 other than a supplemented food that is referred to in paragraph B.29.018(2)(b).

Subsection (1) does not apply to a supplemented food that has an available display surface of less than 100 cm2, whether or not the supplemented food is referred to in paragraph B.29.018(2)(b), if the supplemented food carries a supplemented food caution identifier.

If, as a result of the application of any provision in subsections (5) to (13.2), subsection (1) does not apply to a prepackaged product or does not apply to a prepackaged product in respect of a particular nutrient, that provision prevails over any other provision in subsections (5) to (13.2) that indicates otherwise.
Despite any other provision in this section, the label of the following prepackaged products must not carry a symbol referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a prepackaged product intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a human milk fortifier;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a human milk substitute or a food represented as containing a human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a formulated liquid diet as defined in section B.24.001;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a meal replacement;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a nutritional supplement;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a food represented for protein-restricted diets;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a food represented for low (naming the amino acid) diets; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a food represented for use in a very low energy diet as defined in section B.24.001.
