10% of the daily value for the sum of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids set out in column 2 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
30% of the daily value for the sum of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids set out in column 2 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
15% of the daily value for sugars set out in column 3 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
10% of the daily value for sugars set out in column 3 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
30% of the daily value for sugars set out in column 3 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
15% of the daily value for sugars set out in column 2 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
10% of the daily value for sugars set out in column 2 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
30% of the daily value for sugars set out in column 2 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
15% of the daily value for sodium set out in column 3 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
10% of the daily value for sodium set out in column 3 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
30% of the daily value for sodium set out in column 3 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
15% of the daily value for sodium set out in column 2 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
10% of the daily value for sodium set out in column 2 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values
30% of the daily value for sodium set out in column 2 of Part 1 of the Table of Daily Values

Subsection.Text: A nutrition symbol must be displayed in black and white and must be in accordance with the applicable symbol set out in Schedule K.1.
Subject to subsection (3), a nutrition symbol must be presented in one of the following formats:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unilingual horizontal format, where two separate versions of the symbol are shown, one in English (EH) and one in French (FH); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: bilingual horizontal format (BH), where the symbol is shown in both official languages.

Subsection.Text: If the principal display surface is less than or equal to 450 cm2 and the width of the nutrition symbol in either of the horizontal formats that could apply exceeds the width of the principal display panel, the symbol must be presented in one of the following formats:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unilingual vertical format, where two separate versions of the symbol are shown, one in English (EV) and one in French (FV); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: bilingual vertical format (BV), where the symbol is shown in both official languages.

Subsection.Text: If, in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7), the information required by these Regulations may be shown on the label of a prepackaged product in English only or in French only and is shown in that language, the nutrition symbol may be displayed on the principal display panel of the product in that language only on a continuous surface of the available display surface.
If a nutrition symbol is presented in a bilingual format, the order in which the languages appear may be reversed from the order shown in the applicable symbol set out in Schedule K.1.

The version of the nutrition symbol that must be carried on a prepackaged product that has a principal display surface that is within a range set out in column 1 of the table to this section and that contains a nutrient set out in column 2 in an amount that meets or exceeds the applicable threshold referred to in subsection B.01.350(1) is the version that is referred to in column 3 or 5 of the table or, if applicable, column 4 or 6 of the table.

Despite subsection (1), a prepackaged product that has a principal display surface that is greater than 250 cm2 may carry the applicable version of the nutrition symbol that is referred to in item 4, column 2, of Table 1 or 3 in the Directory of Nutrition Symbol Specifications if the product is sold only in the retail establishment where it is packaged and is labelled by means of a sticker.
A nutrition symbol must be displayed in accordance with the applicable specifications set out in the Directory of Nutrition Symbol Specifications.

Despite subsection (3), a nutrition symbol may be displayed with larger dimensions than those set out in column 3 of the applicable table in the Directory of Nutrition Symbol Specifications if the symbol is enlarged in a proportional manner vertically and horizontally.

table.title: Nutrition Symbols and Formats

row.entry: Nutrients that meet or exceed threshold in subsection B.01.350(1)
Nutrition symbol in unilingual horizontal format
Nutrition symbol in unilingual vertical format
Nutrition symbol in bilingual horizontal format
Nutrition symbol in bilingual vertical format
Saturated fat (Sat fat), sugars and sodium
Saturated fat (Sat fat), sugars and sodium

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if a prepackaged product contains an assortment of foods and one or more of the foods requires a nutrition symbol, the nutrition symbols must be displayed in a manner that clearly indicates the applicable nutrients that are contained in each food.

If a prepackaged product contains ingredients that are intended to be combined together or foods that are intended to be consumed together, the nutrition symbol must display the nutrients that are contained in the product as a whole.

Section.Label: B.01.354
Section.Text: The characters and other elements of a nutrition symbol must not touch each other.

Subsection.Text: A nutrition symbol must be displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a prepackaged product with a principal display panel whose height is less than its width, on the right half of the panel; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any other prepackaged product, on the upper half of the principal display panel.

Subsection.Text: The nutrition symbol must be surrounded by a buffer that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a width that is equal to or greater than that set out in column 4 of the applicable table in the Directory of Nutrition Symbol Specifications; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: does not contain any text or other graphic material.

Subsection.Text: If a prepackaged product is cylindrical in shape, the outer edge of the buffer must be a minimum distance of 10% of the width of the principal display surface from the edge of the left or right side of that surface.

If it is impossible to comply with both paragraph (1)(a) and subsection (3), the nutrition symbol may be displayed partially in the left half of the principal display panel but only to the extent necessary to comply with that subsection.

Section.Label: B.01.356
Section.Text: A nutrition symbol must be oriented in the same manner as most of the other information that appears on the principal display panel unless the panel is displayed in the vertical plane and most of the other information is not displayed parallel with the base of the package, in which case the symbol must be oriented in such a manner that the words appearing in it are parallel with the base.

Subsection.Text: If both a nutrition symbol and a health-related representation appear on the principal display panel of a prepackaged product and the representation relates to a nutrient that is referred to in the nutrition symbol,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the height of the upper case letters in the representation must not exceed the height of the upper case letters, excluding any accents, in the nutrition symbol, other than in the words “Health Canada” and “Santé Canada”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the height of the tallest ascender of the lower case letters in the representation must not exceed the height of the tallest ascender of the lower case letters in the nutrition symbol, other than in the words “Health Canada” and “Santé Canada”.

Subsection.Text: If both a nutrition symbol and a health-related representation appear on the principal display panel of a prepackaged product and the representation does not relate to a nutrient that is referred to in the nutrition symbol,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the height of the upper case letters in the representation must not exceed two times the height of the upper case letters, excluding any accents, in the nutrition symbol, other than in the words “Health Canada” and “Santé Canada”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the height of the tallest ascender of the lower case letters in the representation must not exceed two times the height of the tallest ascender of the lower case letters in the nutrition symbol, other than in the words “Health Canada” and “Santé Canada”.

Subsection.Text: In this section, health-related representation means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration referred to in subsection B.01.301(1) or (2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim referred to in subsection B.01.311(2) or (3);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a representation referred to in any of sections B.01.503 to B.01.513;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim referred to in subsection B.01.601(1); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any other health-related statement, logo, symbol, seal of approval or mark, other than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name or product name of a prepackaged product, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement or claim referred to in any of sections D.01.004 to D.01.007 and D.02.002 to D.02.005.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: label a prepackaged product with any representation, including a word, phrase, illustration, sign, mark, symbol or design, that is likely to be mistaken for a nutrition symbol; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: advertise or sell a prepackaged product that is labelled with a representation referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), a representation does not include a supplemented food caution identifier.
For the purpose of sections B.01.401 to B.01.603, fat means all fatty acids expressed as triglycerides.
For the purpose of sections B.01.401 to B.01.603, the amount of vitamins shall be determined in accordance with section D.01.003.

Except as otherwise provided in this section and sections B.01.402 to B.01.406 and B.01.467 to B.01.469, the label of a prepackaged product shall carry a nutrition facts table that contains only the information set out in column 1 of the table to this section, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in the unit set out in column 3 and in the manner set out in column 4.

For the purpose of subsection (1), the serving of stated size set out in a nutrition facts table for a prepackaged product, as expressed in a metric unit, shall be used as the basis for determining the information appearing in the nutrition facts table in respect of the energy value and nutrient content of the product.

The percentage of the daily value for a mineral nutrient shown in the nutrition facts table for a prepackaged product in accordance with subsection (1) shall be established on the basis of the amount, by weight, of the mineral nutrient per serving of stated size for the product, rounded off in the applicable manner set out in column 4 of the table to this section.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a prepackaged product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all the information set out in column 1 of the table to this section, other than in respect of item 1 (“Serving of stated size”), may be expressed as “0” in the nutrition facts table in accordance with this section;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the product is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a beverage with an alcohol content of more than 0.5%,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a raw single ingredient meat, meat by-product, poultry meat or poultry meat by-product,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a raw single ingredient marine or fresh water animal product,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: sold only in the retail establishment where the product is prepared and processed from its ingredients, including from a pre-mix if an ingredient other than water is added to the pre-mix during the preparation and processing of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: sold only at a road-side stand, craft show, flea market, fair, farmers’ market or sugar bush by the individual who prepared and processed the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual serving that is sold for immediate consumption and that has not been subjected to a process to extend its durable life, including special packaging, or

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: sold only in the retail establishment where the product is packaged, if the product is labelled by means of a sticker and has an available display surface of less than 200 cm2; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the product is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prepackaged individual portion of food that is intended solely to be served by a restaurant or other commercial enterprise with meals or snacks, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: milk, partly skimmed milk, skim milk, goat’s milk, partly skimmed goat’s milk, skimmed goat’s milk, (naming the flavour) milk, (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk, (naming the flavour) skim milk or cream sold in a refillable glass container.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraphs (2)(a) and (b), subsection (1) applies to a prepackaged product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the product contains an added vitamin or mineral nutrient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a vitamin or mineral nutrient is declared as a component of one of the product’s ingredients other than flour;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the product is a meat, meat by-product, poultry meat or poultry meat by-product that is ground; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the label of the product, or any advertisement for the product that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a reference to the energy value, a nutrient set out in column 1 of the table to this section or in column 1 of the table to section B.01.402 or a constituent of such a nutrient, other than information required by Division 12 or a reference to the common name of an ingredient in the list of ingredients for the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a representation that expressly or implicitly indicates that the product has particular nutritional or health-related properties, including any statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims or column 1 of the table following section B.01.603 or referred to in section B.01.311, D.01.006 or D.02.004,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a health-related name, statement, logo, symbol, seal of approval or mark, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the phrase “nutrition facts”, “valeur nutritive” or “valeurs nutritives”.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a formulated liquid diet, human milk fortifier, human milk substitute, food represented as containing a human milk substitute, meal replacement, nutritional supplement, food represented for use in a very low energy diet or supplemented food.

The label of, or an advertisement for, a formulated liquid diet, human milk fortifier, human milk substitute, food represented as containing a human milk substitute, meal replacement, nutritional supplement, food represented for use in a very low energy diet or supplemented food shall not contain a nutrition facts table or the phrase “nutrition facts”, “valeur nutritive” or “valeurs nutritives”.

If, for a prepackaged product other than one intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age, the information in respect of six or more of the energy value and nutrients referred to in column 1 of items 2 to 5 and 7 to 15 of the table to this section may be expressed as “0” in the nutrition facts table in accordance with this section, the nutrition facts table need only include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the serving of stated size;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the energy value;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of fat;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of carbohydrate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of protein;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any nutrient that is the subject of a representation referred to in subparagraph (3)(e)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any sugar alcohol, vitamin or mineral nutrient added to the prepackaged product, other than iodide added to salt for table or general household use or fluoride added to prepackaged water or ice;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any vitamin or mineral nutrient that is declared as a component of one of the prepackaged product’s ingredients other than flour;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any nutrient referred to in column 1 of any of items 4, 5, 7, 8, 10, 11 and 13 to 15 of the table to this section that may not be expressed as “0” in the nutrition facts table; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the statement “Not a significant source of (naming each nutrient that is omitted from the nutrition facts table in accordance with this subsection)” or, if the prepackaged product meets the condition specified in subsection B.01.455(3), the statement “Not a significant source of other nutrients”.

Subsection.Text: The nutrition facts table of a single-serving prepackaged product, other than one that is a prepackaged meal, need only include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the serving of stated size;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the energy value;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of fat;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of carbohydrate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of protein;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any nutrient that is the subject of a representation referred to in subparagraph (3)(e)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any sugar alcohol, vitamin or mineral nutrient added to the prepackaged product, other than iodide added to salt for table or general household use or fluoride added to prepackaged water or ice;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any nutrient referred to in column 1 of item 4 or 5 of the table to this section and the sum of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids if any of the amounts or the sum may not be expressed as “0” in the nutrition facts table; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any nutrient referred to in column 1 of item 8 or 11 of the table to this section that may not be expressed as “0” in the nutrition facts table;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the % Daily Value interpretative statement.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a prepackaged product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is intended solely for use as an ingredient in the manufacture of other prepackaged products intended for sale to a consumer at the retail level or as an ingredient in the preparation of food by a commercial or industrial enterprise or an institution; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is a multiple-serving ready-to-serve prepackaged product intended solely to be served in a commercial or industrial enterprise or an institution.

Subsection.Text: If the nutrition facts table on the label of a prepackaged product corresponds to Figure 6.5(B), 6.6(B), 6.5.1(B), 6.6.1(B), 7.3(B), 7.4(B), 7.3.1(B), 7.4.1(B), 17.2(E) and (F), 17.2.1(E) and (F), 24.1 (E) and (F) to 24.6(E) and (F), 25.1 (B) to 25.6(B), 26.1(B) to 26.4(B), 32.1(E) and (F) or 32.2(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats, the nutrition facts table is not required to show the % Daily Value interpretative statement referred to in item 16 of the table to this section.

table.title: Core Information

row.entry: “Serving Size (naming the serving size)”, “Serving (naming the serving size)” or “Per (naming the serving size)”

Provision.Text: The size is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in the case of a single-serving prepackaged product,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: per package, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in grams or millilitres, in accordance with subparagraph B.01.002A(2)(a)(i) or (ii); and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in the case of a multiple-serving prepackaged product, in the following units set out in column 3B of the Table of Reference Amounts:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: the household measure that applies to the product, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: the metric measure that applies to the product.
The size when expressed in a metric unit is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 10 g or 10 mL, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g or 0.1 mL; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 10 g or more or 10 mL or more, to the nearest multiple of 1 g or 1 mL.
The size when expressed as a fraction is represented by a numerator and a denominator separated by a line.
The size shall include the word “assorted” if the information in the nutrition facts table of a prepackaged product that contains an assortment of foods is set out as a composite value.

row.entry: The value is expressed in Calories per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The value is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 5 Calories

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: if the product meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 1 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject ”free of energy” set out in column 1, to “0” Calorie, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1 Calorie;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 5 Calories or more but not more than 50 Calories, to the nearest multiple of 5 Calories; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 50 Calories, to the nearest multiple of 10 Calories.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in grams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: if the product meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 11 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of fat” set out in column 1 and the amounts of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids are declared as “0 g” in the nutrition facts table or are omitted from that table in accordance with subsection B.01.401(6) and no other fatty acids are declared in an amount greater than 0 g, to “0 g”, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more but not more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 g; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 g”, to “0%“; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.

row.entry: The amount is expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: if the product meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 18 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of saturated fatty acids” set out in column 1, to “0 g”, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more but not more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 g; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.

row.entry: The amount is expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: if the product meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 22 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of trans fatty acids” set out in column 1, to “0 g”, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more but not more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 g; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.

row.entry: The sum of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids
“Saturated Fat + Trans Fat”, “Saturated Fatty Acids + Trans Fatty Acids”, “Saturated + Trans” or “Saturates + Trans”
The sum is expressed as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amounts of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids are declared as “0 g”, to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: is expressed in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: may also be expressed as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the product meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 27 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of cholesterol” set out in column 1, to “0 mg”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 5 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 mg” to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 5 mg

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: if the product meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 31 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of sodium or salt” set out in column 1, to “0 mg”, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1 mg;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 5 mg or more but not more than 140 mg, to the nearest multiple of 5 mg; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 140 mg, to the nearest multiple of 10 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 mg”, to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.

row.entry: The amount is expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g, to “0 g”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in grams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g, to “0 g”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 g”, to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in grams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g, to “0 g”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 g”, to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.

row.entry: The amount is expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 5 mg, to “0 mg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 5 mg or more but less than 50 mg, to the nearest multiple of 10 mg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 50 mg or more but less than 250 mg, to the nearest multiple of 25 mg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 250 mg or more, to the nearest multiple of 50 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as 0 mg, to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 5 mg, to “0 mg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 5 mg or more but less than 50 mg, to the nearest multiple of 10 mg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 50 mg or more but less than 250 mg, to the nearest multiple of 25 mg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 250 mg or more, to the nearest multiple of 50 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as 0 mg, to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.

Provision.Label: (a)

Provision.Label: (b)

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.05 mg, to “0 mg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.05 mg or more but less than 0.5 mg, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 mg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 mg or more but less than 2.5 mg, to the nearest multiple of 0.25 mg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 2.5 mg or more, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 mg.

Provision.Label: (a)

Provision.Label: (b)

row.entry: “*5% or less is a little, 15% or more is a lot”
The “% Daily Value” or “% DV” subheading is followed by an asterisk in order to reference the % Daily Value interpretative statement shown in the nutrition facts table.

Subsection.Text: The nutrition facts table may also contain information set out in column 1 of the table to this section.

If information set out in column 1 of the table to this section is included in the nutrition facts table, it shall be expressed using a description set out in column 2, in the unit set out in column 3 and in the manner set out in column 4.

For the purpose of subsection (2), the serving of stated size set out in a nutrition facts table for a prepackaged product, expressed in the metric unit, shall be used as the basis for determining the information appearing in the nutrition facts table in respect of the energy value and nutrient content of the product.

The percentage of the daily value for a vitamin or mineral nutrient shown in the nutrition facts table for a prepackaged product in accordance with subsection (2) shall be established on the basis of the amount, by weight, of the vitamin or mineral nutrient per serving of stated size for the product, rounded off in the applicable manner set out in column 4 of the table to this section.
The amount of omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids, omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids and monounsaturated fatty acids shall be in the nutrition facts table if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any of those groups of fatty acids or the amount of polyunsaturated fatty acids is in the nutrition facts table or is shown on the label of the prepackaged product or in any advertisement for the product that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any specific fatty acid is shown on the label of the prepackaged product or in any advertisement for the product that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product.

Subsection.Text: If the label of a prepackaged product, or any advertisement for the product that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, contains a representation, express or implied, that includes information that is set out in column 1 of the table to this section, that information shall also be in the nutrition facts table.

The nutrition facts table shall show the amount of any sugar alcohol, vitamin or mineral nutrient added to the prepackaged product, except in the case of iodide added to salt for table or general household use or fluoride added to prepackaged water or ice.
The nutrition facts table shall show the amount of any vitamin or mineral nutrient that is declared as a component of one of the prepackaged product’s ingredients other than flour.
If information set out in column 1 of the table to this section is included in the nutrition facts table, it shall be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in English and French; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in one of those languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the product may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

table.title: Additional Information

row.entry: “Servings per Container”, “(number of units) per Container”, “Servings per Package”, “(number of units) per Package”, “Servings per (naming the package type)”, or “(number of units) per (naming the package type)”
The quantity is expressed in number of servings.

Provision.Text: The quantity is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 2, to the nearest multiple of 1;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is between 2 and 5, to the nearest multiple of 0.5; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 5, to the nearest multiple of 1.
If a quantity is rounded off, it shall be preceded by the word “about”.
If the product is of a random weight, the quantity may be declared as “varied”.

row.entry: The value is expressed in kilojoules per serving of stated size.
The value is rounded off to the nearest multiple of 10 kilojoules.
The amount is expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 1 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 1 g or more but not more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 g; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.

row.entry: Amount of omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids

Provision.Text: If the nutrition facts table includes the amount of polyunsaturated fatty acids: “Omega-6”, “Omega-6 Polyunsaturated Fat”, “Omega-6 Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids”, “Omega-6 Polyunsaturates” or “Omega-6 Polyunsaturate
In all other cases: “Omega-6 Polyunsaturated Fat”, “Omega-6 Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids”, “Omega-6 Polyunsaturates” or “Omega-6 Polyunsaturated”

The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.0015 mg, to “0 mg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.0015 mg or more but less than 0.025 mg, to the nearest multiple of 0.002 mg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.025 mg or more but less than 0.05 mg, to the nearest multiple of 0.005 mg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.05 mg or more, to the nearest multiple of 0.01 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as 0 mg, to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.005 mg, to “0 mg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.005 mg or more but less than 0.05 mg, to the nearest multiple of 0.01 mg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.05 mg or more but less than 0.25 mg, to the nearest multiple of 0.025 mg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.25 mg or more, to the nearest multiple of 0.05 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as 0 mg, to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in micrograms per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.05 µg, to “0 µg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.05 µg or more but less than 0.5 µg, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 µg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 µg or more but less than 2.5 µg, to the nearest multiple of 0.25 µg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 2.5 µg or more, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 µg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as 0 µg, to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in micrograms per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.05 µg, to “0 µg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.05 µg or more but less than 0.5 µg, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 µg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 µg or more but less than 2.5 µg, to the nearest multiple of 0.25 µg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 2.5 µg or more, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 µg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as 0 µg, to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 5 mg, to “0 mg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 5 mg or more but less than 50 mg, to the nearest multiple of 10 mg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 50 mg or more but less than 250 mg, to the nearest multiple of 25 mg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 250 mg or more, to the nearest multiple of 50 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as 0 mg, to “0%”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.

Heading.TitleText: Foods for Infants Six Months of Age or Older but Less Than One Year of Age

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a prepackaged product that is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age.

The nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product shall not contain the percentage of the daily value of fat, fibre, sugars, cholesterol or sodium or of the sum of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids.
The nutrition facts table of the product may omit the amount of saturated fatty acids, trans fatty acids and cholesterol.
Despite subsection (3), if the amount of cholesterol is in the nutrition facts table, the amounts of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids shall also be in the nutrition facts table.

If the information in respect of five or more of the energy value and nutrients referred to in column 1 of items 2, 3 and 8 to 15 of the table to section B.01.401 may be expressed as “0” in the nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product in accordance with that section, the nutrition facts table need only include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the serving of stated size;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the energy value;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of fat;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of carbohydrate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of protein;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any nutrient that is the subject of a representation referred to in subparagraph B.01.401(3)(e)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any sugar alcohol, vitamin or mineral nutrient added to the product, other than fluoride added to prepackaged water or ice;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any vitamin or mineral nutrient that is declared as a component of one of the product’s ingredients other than flour;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any nutrient referred to in column 1 of any of items 8, 10 or 11 and 13 to 15 of the table to section B.01.401 that may not be expressed as “0” in the nutrition facts table;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: except in the case described in paragraph (k), the statement “Not a significant source of (naming each nutrient that is omitted from the nutrition facts table in accordance with this subsection)”, but such a statement may be omitted in respect of saturated fatty acids, trans fatty acids and cholesterol; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: if the product meets the condition specified in subsection B.01.462(3), the statement “Not a significant source of other nutrients” or the statement referred to in paragraph (j).

Heading.TitleText: Food for Use in Manufacturing Other Foods

Subsection.Text: Subject to section B.29.004, this section applies to a prepackaged product intended solely for use as an ingredient in the manufacture of other prepackaged products intended for sale to a consumer at the retail level or as an ingredient in the preparation of food by a commercial or industrial enterprise or an institution.
No person shall sell the product unless written nutrition information concerning the product accompanies the product when it is delivered to the purchaser.
The nutrition information

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall include the information that would, but for subsection B.01.401(7), be required by sections B.01.401 and B.01.402 to be included in a nutrition facts table for the product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may include other information that is permitted by section B.01.402 to be included in that nutrition facts table; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall be expressed in accordance with sections B.01.401 and B.01.402, subject to the following modifications, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: information for vitamins referred to in subsection D.01.002(1) shall be expressed in the applicable unit referred to in subsection D.01.003(1), and information for mineral nutrients referred to in paragraphs D.02.001(1)(a) to (j), (l) to (n) and (p) shall be expressed in milligrams for sodium, potassium, calcium, phosphorus, magnesium, iron, zinc, chloride, copper and manganese and in micrograms for iodide, chromium, selenium and molybdenum,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: per gram or 100 grams of the food, if the net quantity of the food is declared on the label by weight or by count, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: per millilitre or 100 millilitres of the food, if the net quantity of the food is declared on the label by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: information for other nutrients and the energy value set out in column 1 of the table to section B.01.401 or in column 1 of the table to section B.01.402 shall be expressed in the units referred to in column 3,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: per gram or 100 grams of the food, if the net quantity of the food is declared on the label by weight or by count, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: per millilitre or 100 millilitres of the food, if the net quantity of the food is declared on the label by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: percentages of daily values and information on servings of stated size may be omitted, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the nutrition information shall be stated with a degree of precision that corresponds to the accuracy of the analytical methodology used to produce the information.

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a prepackaged product, other than a supplemented food, that is a ready-to-serve multiple-serving prepackaged product intended solely to be served in a commercial or industrial enterprise or an institution.
No person shall sell the product unless written nutrition information concerning the product accompanies the product when it is delivered to the purchaser.
The nutrition information

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall include the information that would, but for subsection B.01.401(7), be required by sections B.01.401 and B.01.402 to be included in a nutrition facts table for the product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may include other information that is permitted by section B.01.402 to be included in that nutrition facts table; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall be expressed in accordance with sections B.01.401 and B.01.402.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) to (8), the information in the nutrition facts table shall be set out only on the basis of the prepackaged product as offered for sale.

If a prepackaged product contains separately packaged ingredients or foods that are intended to be consumed together, the information in the nutrition facts table shall be set out for each ingredient or food or for the entire product.
If a prepackaged product contains an assortment of foods of the same type and the typical serving consists of only one of those foods, the information in the nutrition facts table shall be set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the basis of each of the foods contained in the product, if the nutrition information set out in column 1 of the table to section B.01.401 for each of those foods is different; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the basis of one of the foods contained in the product, if the nutrition information set out in column 1 of the table to section B.01.401 for each of those foods is the same.

Subsection.Text: If a prepackaged product contains an assortment of foods of the same type and the typical serving consists of more than one of those foods, the information in the nutrition facts table shall be set out for each of the foods contained in the product or as a composite value.

If a prepackaged product contains a food that is to be prepared in accordance with directions provided in or on the package or that is commonly combined with other ingredients or another food or cooked before being consumed, the nutrition facts table may also set out information for the food as prepared, in which case

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nutrition facts table shall set out the following information for the food as prepared, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: except in the case described in subparagraph (ii), the amount of the food expressed using the unit referred to in column 3 of subparagraph 1(b)(i) of the table to section B.01.401 as “about (naming the serving size)” or “about (naming the serving size) prepared” and, if applicable, in the manner specified in column 4 of subitems 1(1) and (2), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the food is commonly served combined with another food, the amount of the other food expressed using the unit referred to in column 3 of subparagraph 1(b)(i) of the table to section B.01.401,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the energy value, expressed using a description set out in column 2 of item 2 of the table to section B.01.401, in the unit set out in column 3 and in the manner set out in column 4, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 3, 6 to 8, 11 and 13 to 15 of the table to section B.01.401 and in column 1 of items 14 to 37 of the table to section B.01.402 that is declared as a percentage of the daily value in the nutrition facts table for the food as sold, expressed using a description set out in column 2, as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size and in the manner specified in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the nutrition facts table may also set out the following information for the added ingredients or the other food, if it is declared in the nutrition facts table for the food as sold, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 3 to 5 and 7 to 12 of the table to section B.01.401, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in milligrams for the information set out in column 1 of items 7 and 8 and in grams for the information set out in column 1 of items 3 to 5 and 9 to 12 and in the manner specified in column 4,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 5 to 8 and 10 to 13 of the table to section B.01.402, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in grams and in the manner specified in column 4; and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of item 2 of the table to section B.01.401, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in the unit set out in column 3 per serving of stated size of the food as prepared, and in the manner specified in column 4.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (5) does not apply in respect of a prepackaged product that is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age.

Subject to subsection (8), the information in the nutrition facts table may also be set out on the basis of other amounts of a food that reflect different uses or different units of measurement of a food, in which case

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nutrition facts table shall set out the following information for each of the other amounts of food, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of the food expressed in a household measure and a metric measure and in the manner specified in column 4 of subitems 1(1) and (2) of the table to section B.01.401,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the energy value, expressed using a description set out in column 2 of item 2 of the table to section B.01.401, in the unit set out in column 3 and in the manner set out in column 4, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 3, 6 to 8, 11 and 13 to 15 of the table to section B.01.401 and in column 1 of items 14 to 37 of the table to section B.01.402 that is declared as a percentage of the daily value in the nutrition facts table for the first amount of food for which information is declared, expressed using a description set out in column 2, as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size and in the manner specified in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the nutrition facts table is set out in a version of the aggregate format specified in section B.01.459 or B.01.464, it shall also set out the following information for each of the other amounts of food, if that information is declared in the nutrition facts table for the first amount of food for which information is declared, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 3 to 5 and 7 to 12 of the table to section B.01.401, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in milligrams for the information set out in column 1 of items 7 and 8 and in grams for the information set out in column 1 of items 3 to 5 and 9 to 12 and in the manner specified in column 4, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 5 to 8 and 10 to 13 of the table to section B.01.402, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in grams and in the manner specified in column 4.

Subsection.Text: If the nutrition facts table of a prepackaged product that is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age sets out information in accordance with subsection (7), it shall set out the information referred to in paragraphs (7)(a) and (c).

Subject to subsections (2) to (6), the nutrition facts table shall be presented in accordance with the format specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of NFT Formats, having regard to matters such as order of presentation, dimensions, spacing and the use of upper and lower case letters and bold type.

The characters and rules in the nutrition facts table shall be displayed in a single colour that is a visual equivalent of 100% solid black type on a white background or on a uniform neutral background with a maximum 5% tint of colour.
The characters in the nutrition facts table

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be displayed in a single standard sans serif font that is not decorative and in such a manner that the characters never touch each other or the rules; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may be displayed with larger dimensions than those specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of NFT Formats if all the characters in the table are enlarged in a uniform manner.

Subsection.Text: The type size shown in parentheses for a version referred to in a table to sections B.01.454 to B.01.459 or sections B.01.461 to B.01.464 is the minimum type size that may be used in a nutrition facts table to show nutrients set out in the tables to sections B.01.401 and B.01.402 in accordance with that version.
A rule that is specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of NFT Formats as being a 1 point rule or a 2 point rule may be displayed with larger dimensions in the nutrition facts table.
The information in the nutrition facts table shall be in accordance with sections B.01.400 to B.01.403 and B.01.406.
In a nutrition facts table consisting of a table in both English and French, the order of languages may be reversed from the order shown in the applicable figure in the Directory of NFT Formats.
Subject to subsection (2), the nutrition facts table shall be displayed on the label of the prepackaged product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a table in English and a table in French on the same continuous surface of the available display surface;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a table in both English and French on a continuous surface of the available display surface; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in a table in English on a continuous surface of the available display surface and a table in French on another continuous surface of the available display surface that is of the same size and prominence as the first surface.

Subsection.Text: If in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information required by these Regulations may be shown on the label of a prepackaged product in English only or in French only and is shown in that language, the nutrition facts table may be displayed on the label of the prepackaged product in a table in that language only on a continuous surface of the available display surface.
Subject to subsection (2), the nutrition facts table shall be oriented in the same manner as other information appearing on the label of the prepackaged product.

If a version of a nutrition facts table cannot be oriented in the same manner as other information appearing on the label of the prepackaged product, it shall be oriented in another manner if there is sufficient space to do so and the food contained in the package does not leak out and is not damaged when the package is turned over.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a nutrition facts table that is set out on the top or bottom of a prepackaged product.
Sections B.01.454 to B.01.460 apply to prepackaged products other than those that are intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age.
Sections B.01.461 to B.01.465 apply to prepackaged products that are intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age.
This section applies to a prepackaged product unless any of sections B.01.455 to B.01.459 applies to the product.

Subject to subsection (3), the nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, a nutrition facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the nutrition facts table shall be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual standard format in accordance with Figure 3.5(B), 3.6(B) or 3.7(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual horizontal format in accordance with Figure 4.3(B), 4.4(B) or 4.5(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the linear format in accordance with Figures 16.1(E) and (F) or 16.2(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a manner described in section B.01.466.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section, in determining whether a version of a nutrition facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, the nutrition facts table shall include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included in that table.

Despite subsections (2) and (3), if the prepackaged product is sold only in the retail establishment where the product is packaged, is labelled by means of a sticker and has an available display surface of 200 cm2 or more, its nutrition facts table shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of items 1 to 3 of Parts 1 to 3 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Despite subsections (2) and (3), if the nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it shall be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a prepackaged product if it satisfies the condition set out in subsection B.01.401(6) and its nutrition facts table includes only the information referred to in paragraphs B.01.401(6)(a) to (j).

Subject to subsection (3), the nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, a nutrition facts table containing only the information referred to in paragraphs B.01.401(6)(a) to (j) in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the nutrition facts table shall be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual simplified standard format in accordance with Figure 6.5(B) or 6.6(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual simplified horizontal format in accordance with Figure 7.3(B) or 7.4(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the simplified linear format in accordance with Figures 17.1(E) and (F) or 17.2(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a manner described in section B.01.466.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsections (2) and (3), if the prepackaged product is sold only in the retail establishment where the product is packaged, is labelled by means of a sticker and has an available display surface of 200 cm2 or more, its nutrition facts table shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of items 1 to 3 of Parts 1 and 2 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Despite subsections (2) and (3), if the nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it shall be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a single-serving prepackaged product, other than one that is a prepackaged meal, whose nutrition facts table includes only the information referred to in paragraphs B.01.401(6.1)(a) to (j).

Subject to subsection (3), the nutrition facts table of the single-serving prepackaged product shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations, on 15% or less of the available display surface of the single-serving prepackaged product a nutrition facts table containing only the information referred to in paragraphs B.01.401(6.1)(a) to (j) in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the nutrition facts table shall be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual simplified standard format in accordance with Figure 6.5.1(B) or 6.6.1(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual simplified horizontal format in accordance with Figure 7.3.1(B) or 7.4.1(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the simplified linear format in accordance with Figures 17.1.1(E) and (F) or 17.2.1(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a manner described in section B.01.466.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsections (2) and (3), if the single-serving prepackaged product is sold only in the retail establishment where the product is packaged, is labelled by means of a sticker and has an available display surface of 200 cm2 or more, its nutrition facts table shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of items 1 to 3 of Part 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Despite subsections (2) and (3), if the nutrition facts table of the single-serving prepackaged product is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it shall be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the nutrition facts table of a prepackaged product includes information referred to in subsection B.01.406(5), the nutrition facts table shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, a nutrition facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the nutrition facts table shall be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual dual format in accordance with Figure 9.5(B) or 9.6(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section, in determining whether a version of a nutrition facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, the nutrition facts table shall include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included in the table, together with the information referred to in subsection B.01.406(5).

Despite subsections (1) and (2), if the nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it shall be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (2)(a) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Heading.TitleText: Aggregate Format — Different Kinds of Foods

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the nutrition facts table of a prepackaged product includes separate information for each food or ingredient as provided in subsection B.01.406(2), paragraph B.01.406(3)(a) or subsection B.01.406(4), the nutrition facts table shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, a nutrition facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the nutrition facts table shall be set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in subsection B.01.406(2) or (4), in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the bilingual aggregate format in accordance with Figure 11.5(B) or 11.6(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in paragraph B.01.406(3)(a), in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the bilingual aggregate format in accordance with Figure 11.5(B) or 11.6(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a manner described in section B.01.466.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section, in determining whether a version of a nutrition facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, the nutrition facts table shall include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included for each food or ingredient for which separate information is set out in the table.

Despite subsections (1) and (2), if the nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it shall be set out in a version that is described in subparagraph (2)(a)(i) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Heading.TitleText: Dual Format — Different Amounts of Food

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the nutrition facts table of a prepackaged product includes separate information for different amounts of the food as provided in paragraph B.01.406(7)(a) without including the information referred to in paragraph B.01.406(7)(c), the nutrition facts table shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, a nutrition facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the nutrition facts table shall be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual dual format in accordance with Figure 13.5(B) or 13.6(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section, in determining whether a version of a nutrition facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, the nutrition facts table shall include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included for each amount of the food for which separate information is set out in the table.

Despite subsections (1) and (2), if the nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it shall be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (2)(a) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Heading.TitleText: Aggregate Format — Different Amounts of Food

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the nutrition facts table of a prepackaged product includes separate information for different amounts of the food as provided in paragraphs B.01.406(7)(a) and (c), the nutrition facts table shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, a nutrition facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the nutrition facts table shall be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual aggregate format in accordance with Figure 15.5(B) or 15.6(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section, in determining whether a version of a nutrition facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, the nutrition facts table shall include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included for each amount of the food for which separate information is set out in the table.

Despite subsections (1) and (2), if the nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it shall be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (2)(a) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Subsection.Text: If information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.01.402 is included in a nutrition facts table that is set out in a version consisting of a table in English and a table in French or a table in English or French, that information shall be displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with the order of presentation, the use of indents and the presentation of footnotes illustrated in Figures 18.1(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of matters other than those referred to in paragraph (a), in accordance with the format that is specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of NFT Formats.

Subsection.Text: If information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.01.402 is included in a nutrition facts table that is set out in a version consisting of a table in both English and French, that information shall be displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with the order of presentation, the use of indents and the presentation of footnotes illustrated in Figure 19.1(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of matters other than those referred to in paragraph (a), in accordance with the format that is specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of NFT Formats.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(a), the use of indents illustrated in Figures 18.1(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats is not applicable if information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.01.402 is set out in the linear format referred to in paragraph B.01.454(3)(c) or the simplified linear format referred to in paragraph B.01.455(3)(c).

Heading.TitleText: Standard and Horizontal Formats — Infants Six Months of Age or Older but Less Than One Year of Age

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a prepackaged product that is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age unless section B.01.462, B.01.463 or B.01.464 applies to the product.

Subject to subsection (3), the nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, a nutrition facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the nutrition facts table shall be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual standard format in accordance with Figure 22.5(B), 22.6(B) or 22.7(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual horizontal format in accordance with Figure 23.3(B) or 23.4(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the linear format in accordance with Figures 31.1(E) and (F) or 31.2(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a manner described in section B.01.466.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section, in determining whether a version of a nutrition facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, the nutrition facts table shall include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included in that table.
