Heading.TitleText: Simplified Formats — Infants Six Months of Age or Older but Less Than One Year of Age

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a prepackaged product that is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age if it satisfies the condition set out in subsection B.01.403(5) and its nutrition facts table includes only the information referred to in paragraphs B.01.403(5)(a) to (k).

Subject to subsection (3), the nutrition facts table of the prepackaged product shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, a nutrition facts table containing only the information referred to in paragraphs B.01.403(5)(a) to (k) in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the nutrition facts table shall be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual simplified standard format in accordance with Figure 25.5(B) or 25.6(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual simplified horizontal format in accordance with Figure 26.3(B) or 26.4(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the simplified linear format in accordance with Figures 32.1(E) and (F) or 32.2(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a manner described in section B.01.466.

table.title: Bilingual Simplified Horizontal Format — Infants Six Months of Age or Older but Less Than One Year of Age

row.entry: Figure in Directory of NFT Formats (Version)
The versions in Parts 1 and 2 cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface.
(nutrients to be shown in a type size of not less than 7 points (condensed))
The versions in Parts 1 and 2 and in item 1 cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface.
(nutrients to be shown in a type size of not less than 6 points (condensed))

Heading.TitleText: Aggregate Format — Different Kinds of Foods — Infants Six Months of Age or Older but Less Than One Year of Age

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the nutrition facts table of a prepackaged product that is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age includes separate information for each food or ingredient as provided in subsection B.01.406(2), paragraph B.01.406(3)(a) or subsection B.01.406(4), the nutrition facts table shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, a nutrition facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the nutrition facts table shall be set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in subsection B.01.406(2) or (4), in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the bilingual aggregate format in accordance with Figure 28.5(B) or 28.6(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in paragraph B.01.406(3)(a), in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the bilingual aggregate format in accordance with Figure 28.5(B) or 28.6(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a manner described in section B.01.466.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section, in determining whether a version of a nutrition facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, the nutrition facts table shall include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included for each food or ingredient for which separate information is set out in the table.

Heading.TitleText: Aggregate Format — Different Amounts of Food — Infants Six Months of Age or Older but Less Than One Year of Age

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the nutrition facts table of a prepackaged product that is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age includes separate information for different amounts of the food as provided in subsection B.01.406(8), the nutrition facts table shall be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, a nutrition facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the nutrition facts table shall be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual aggregate format in accordance with Figure 30.5(B) or 30.6(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the nutrition facts table.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section, in determining whether a version of a nutrition facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, the nutrition facts table shall include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included for each amount of the food for which separate information is set out in the table.

Heading.TitleText: Presentation of Additional Information — Infants Six Months of Age or Older but Less Than One Year of Age

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a prepackaged product that is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age.

If information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.01.402 is included in a nutrition facts table that is set out in a version consisting of a table in English and a table in French or a table in English or French, that information shall be displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with the order of presentation, the use of indents and the presentation of footnotes illustrated in Figures 33.1(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of matters other than those referred to in paragraph (a), in accordance with the format that is specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of NFT Formats.

Subsection.Text: If information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.01.402 is included in a nutrition facts table that is set out in a version consisting of a table in both English and French, that information shall be displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with the order of presentation, the use of indents and the presentation of footnotes illustrated in Figure 34.1(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of matters other than those referred to in paragraph (a), in accordance with the format that is specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of NFT Formats.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (2)(a), the use of indents illustrated in Figures 33.1(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats is not applicable if information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.01.402 is set out in the linear format referred to in paragraph B.01.461(3)(c) or the simplified linear format referred to in paragraph B.01.462(3)(c).

Despite section A.01.016, the nutrition facts table of a prepackaged product that meets the condition specified in subsection B.01.454(3) or B.01.455(3), paragraph B.01.457(2)(b), subsection B.01.461(3) or B.01.462(3) or paragraph B.01.463(2)(b) may be set out on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a tag attached to the package;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a package insert;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the inner side of a label;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a fold-out label; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an outer sleeve, overwrap or collar.

Subsection.Text: If the nutrition facts table is set out in a manner described in paragraph (1)(b) or (c), the outer side of the label of the package shall indicate in a type size of not less than 8 points where the nutrition facts table is located.
If the nutrition facts table is set out in a manner described in subsection (1), it shall be set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in subsection B.01.454(3), in a version that is described in paragraph B.01.454(3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.454;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in subsection B.01.455(3), in a version that is described in paragraph B.01.455(3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.455;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in paragraph B.01.457(2)(b), in a version that is described in subparagraph B.01.457(2)(b)(i) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.457;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in subsection B.01.461(3), in a version that is described in paragraph B.01.461(3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.461;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in subsection B.01.462(3), in a version that is described in paragraph B.01.462(3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.462; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in paragraph B.01.463(2)(b), in a version that is described in subparagraph B.01.463(2)(b)(i) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.463.

Subsection.Text: Despite section A.01.016 and subject to subsection (2), if the available display surface of a prepackaged product is less than 100 cm2, the label of the product need not carry a nutrition facts table if the outer side of the label contains an indication of how a purchaser or consumer may obtain the nutrition information that would otherwise be required to be set out in a nutrition facts table on the label of the product.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a prepackaged product that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: described in paragraph B.01.401(3)(a), (b) or (e); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contained in a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase.

Subsection.Text: However, subsection (1) applies to a prepackaged product that is referred to in subparagraph B.01.401(3)(e)(ii) and that meets the conditions set out in item 37, column 2, of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “Free of sugars” set out in column 1 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the product does not contain an added vitamin or mineral nutrient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the energy value expressed in Calories per serving of stated size and the amount of sugar alcohols expressed in grams per serving of stated size are shown immediately after whichever of the following elements appears last on the label:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the list of ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement as defined in subsection B.01.010.1(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration referred to in subsection B.01.010.4(1), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any statement referred to in subsection B.16.016(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any statement or claim that is set out in item 37, column 4, of the table for the subject “Free of sugars” set out in column 1 and that appears on the label is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: legibly set out on the principal display panel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in lower case letters except for the first letter of each word of the statement or claim, which may be an upper case letter,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: of at least the same size and prominence as the letters used in the numerical portion of the declaration of net quantity as required under paragraph 229(1)(a) and subsections 229(2) and (3) of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: displayed in a colour contrasting with the background of the label.

Subsection.Text: An indication referred to in subsection (1)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be set out in a type size of not less than 8 points;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall include a postal address or a toll-free telephone number; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in English and French, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in one of those languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the product may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer of the prepackaged product shall provide the information referred to in subsection (1) to a purchaser or consumer on request

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: without charge;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the following manner, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the official language in which the information is requested or, if specified by the purchaser or consumer, in both official languages, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in one of the official languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the product may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the form of a nutrition facts table that is set out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in a format, other than a horizontal format, that is specified in any of sections B.01.454 to B.01.459 or B.01.461 to B.01.464 and that would otherwise be carried on the label of the product in accordance with these Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a version of that format that is listed in column 1 of item 1 of any Part of the table to the applicable section referred to in subparagraph (i).

Subsection.Text: In this section, official languages means the English language and the French language.
Subject to subsection (2), if a prepackaged product has an available display surface of less than 100 cm2 and has a nutrition facts table on its label, the nutrition facts table need only include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the serving of stated size;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the energy value and, subject to subsection (2), the amount of nutrients referred to in column 1 of items 2 to 15 of the table to section B.01.401 if the amount shown in the nutrition facts table may not be expressed as “0” according to the manner set out in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any sugar alcohol, vitamin or mineral nutrient added to the prepackaged product.

Subsection.Text: If the label of a prepackaged product, or any advertisement for the product that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, contains a representation, express or implied, that includes information that is set out in column 1 of the table to section B.01.401 or B.01.402, that information shall also be in the nutrition facts table.

Section.Label: B.01.469
Section.Text: Despite subsection B.01.401(1), the label of a prepackaged product that has an available display surface of less than 15 cm2 need not carry a nutrition facts table.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and in the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims.

Definition.Text: combination foods means the category of food to which belong foods that contain as ingredients foods from more than one food group, or foods from one or more food groups mixed with foods from the category of other foods, such as pizza or lasagna. (aliments composés)
food group means one of the following categories of foods:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: milk products, and milk product alternatives such as fortified plant-based beverages;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meat, poultry and fish, and alternatives such as legumes, eggs, tofu or peanut butter;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: bread and grain products; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: vegetables and fruit. (groupe alimentaire)

Definition.Text: other foods means the category of food to which belong foods that are not part of any food group, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: foods that are mostly fats, such as butter, margarine, oil or lard;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: foods that are mostly sugars, such as jam, honey, syrup or confectionery;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: snack foods, such as potato chips or pretzels;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: beverages, such as water, tea, coffee or soft drinks; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: herbs, spices and condiments, such as pickles, mustard or ketchup. (autres aliments)

Definition.Text: reference food of the same food group means a food that can be substituted in the diet for the food to which it is compared and that belongs to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the same food group as the food to which it is compared, such as cheese as a reference food for milk, or chicken as a reference food for tofu;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the category of other foods, if the food to which it is compared also belongs to that category, such as pretzels as a reference food for potato chips; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the category of combination foods, if the food to which it is compared also belongs to that category, such as pizza as a reference food for lasagna. (aliment de référence du même groupe alimentaire)

Definition.Text: similar reference food means a food of the same type as the food to which it is compared and that has not been processed, formulated, reformulated or otherwise modified in a manner that increases or decreases the energy value or the amount of a nutrient that is the subject of the comparison, such as whole milk as a similar reference food for partly skimmed milk or regular chocolate chip cookies as a similar reference food for fat-reduced chocolate chip cookies. (aliment de référence similaire)

Subsection.Text: The similar reference food referred to in column 3 of item 45 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims, with respect to the subject “light in energy or fat” set out in column 1, shall have a nutrient value that is representative of foods of that type that have not been processed, formulated, reformulated or otherwise modified in a manner that increases the energy value or the amount of fat.

Section.Label: B.01.501
Section.Text: The representations provided for in sections B.01.503 to B.01.513 that appear on the label of a food shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in English and French; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in one of those languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the food may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

Subsection.Text: No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make a representation, express or implied, that characterizes the energy value of the food or the amount of a nutrient contained in the food.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a representation otherwise provided for in these Regulations, including one that is in the form of a nutrition symbol;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a representation provided for by section 273 of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a representation provided for by column 1 of Table 2 to Volume 7 of the Standards of Identity Document, as defined in section 1 of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the amount of lactose in a food;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the addition of salt to a food, other than any statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the addition of sugars to a food, other than any statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the amount of starch in a food, if the food is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the representations “defatted (naming the food)”, “demineralized (naming the food)” and “high (naming the monosaccharide or disaccharide) (naming the syrup)”;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the amount of a fatty acid in a vegetable oil and forms part of its common name;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the amount of alcohol in a beverage;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the representation “light salted” with respect to fish; or

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the English representation “lean” with respect to a prepackaged meal represented for use in a weight reduction diet or a weight maintenance diet.

Subsection.Text: A person may, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims, with respect to a subject set out in column 1, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food meets the applicable conditions set out in column 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the label or advertisement meets the conditions, if any, set out in column 3, in accordance with sections B.01.504 to B.01.506; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a food that is not a prepackaged product, or a prepackaged product for which an advertisement is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the label or advertisement includes, per serving of stated size, and in accordance with section B.01.505 or B.01.506 if applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the declaration of the energy value, if the energy value is the subject of the statement or claim, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of the nutrient, if a nutrient is the subject of the statement or claim.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), no person shall, on the principal display panel of a prepackaged product, make a statement or claim that is set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims and that relates to a nutrient that is referred to in a nutrition symbol that appears on the panel unless it is a statement or claim respecting one of the following subjects set out in column 1:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in saturated fatty acids”, set out in item 20;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in sodium or salt”, set out in item 33; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in sugars”, set out in item 38.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), no person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food that is intended solely for children under four years of age, make a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims unless it is a statement or claim respecting one of the following subjects set out in column 1:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “source of protein”, set out in item 8;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “excellent source of protein”, set out in item 9;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “more protein”, set out in item 10;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “no added sodium or salt”, set out in item 35; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “no added sugars”, set out in item 40.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsections (1) and (2), it is prohibited, on the label of or in any advertisement for a human milk fortifier, to make a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims.

The information required by paragraph (1)(c) need not be included on the label of or in any advertisement for a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating, if a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims is made on the label or advertisement.

If a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims is made on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, all the words, numbers, signs or symbols that constitute the statement or claim shall be of the same size and prominence.
In the English version of the statements or claims, the word “fibre” may be spelled as “fiber”.

Section.Label: B.01.504
Section.Text: If a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims is made on the label of a food, the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the most prominent statement or claim on the principal display panel or, if none appears there, the most prominent statement or claim elsewhere on the label, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: those of the most prominent statement or claim on the principal display panel or, if none appears there, the most prominent statement or claim elsewhere on the label, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Section.Label: B.01.505
Section.Text: If a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims is made in an advertisement for a food, other than a radio or television advertisement, the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 and, if applicable, the information required by paragraph B.01.503(1)(c), shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Subsection.Text: If a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims is made in a radio or television advertisement, the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 and, if applicable, the information required by paragraph B.01.503(1)(c), shall be provided in the advertisement, except for the information required under the condition set out in paragraph (a) of column 3, in respect of the following subjects set out in column 1, which may be on the label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in energy”, set out in item 3;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in fat”, set out in item 13;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in saturated fatty acids”, set out in item 20;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in trans fatty acids”, set out in item 23;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in cholesterol”, set out in item 29;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in sodium or salt”, set out in item 33;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: “lightly salted”, set out in item 36;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in sugars”, set out in item 38; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: “light in energy or fat”, set out in item 45.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), if the statement or claim is made in a radio or television advertisement that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the food, the information required under the condition set out in paragraph (a) of column 3 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims, in respect of the subjects set out in paragraphs (1)(a) to (i), shall be provided in the advertisement.

If the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims and the information required by paragraph B.01.503(1)(c) is provided in a radio advertisement or in the audio portion of a television advertisement, that information shall immediately precede or follow the statement or claim.

In the case of a television advertisement, the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims and, if applicable, the information required by paragraph B.01.503(1)(c), shall be communicated

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the audio mode, if the statement or claim is made only in the audio portion of the advertisement or in both the audio and visual portions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the audio or visual mode, if the statement or claim is made only in the visual portion of the advertisement.

Subsection.Text: If the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims and the information required by paragraph B.01.503(1)(c) is communicated in the visual mode of a television advertisement, it shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appear concurrently with and for at least the same amount of time as the statement or claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Section.Label: B.01.507
Section.Text: A person may, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make a representation, express or implied, that the food is for use in an energy-reduced diet, if a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims, in respect of any of the following subjects set out in column 1, is made on the label of or in the advertisement for the food, in accordance with section B.01.503:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “free of energy”, set out in item 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “low in energy”, set out in item 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in energy”, set out in item 3;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “lower in energy”, set out in item 4; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “free of sugars”, set out in item 37.

Subsection.Text: A person may, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make a representation, express or implied, that the food is for use in a sodium-restricted diet, if a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims, in respect of any of the following subjects set out in column 1, is made on the label of or in the advertisement for the food, in accordance with section B.01.503:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “free of sodium or salt”, set out in item 31;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “low in sodium or salt”, set out in item 32;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in sodium or salt”, set out in item 33; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “lower in sodium or salt”, set out in item 34.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), no person shall, on the principal display panel of a prepackaged product, make a representation, express or implied, that the product is for use in a sodium-restricted diet if a nutrition symbol referring to sodium appears on the panel.
A person may, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make the statement or claim that the food is “unsweetened” if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food meets the conditions set out in item 40, column 2, of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “No added sugars” set out in column 1; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the food does not contain a sweetener.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), no person shall, on the principal display panel of a prepackaged product, make a statement or claim that the product is “unsweetened” if a nutrition symbol referring to sugars appears on the panel.

Section.Label: B.01.510
Section.Text: A statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims, respecting the following subjects set out in column 1, that is made on the label of or in an advertisement for a breakfast cereal with milk, shall be accompanied by an indication that it refers to 30 g of the breakfast cereal combined with 125 mL of milk:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “source of protein”, set out in item 8;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “excellent source of protein”, set out in item 9; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “more protein”, set out in item 10.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty and subject to subsections (2) to (4), a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims that is made on the label of or in any advertisement for a food may be preceded or followed by other words, numbers, signs or symbols, but none of those shall be interposed between the words, numbers, signs or symbols of the statement or claim.
The words “very”, “ultra” and “extra”, and all other words, numbers, signs or symbols that modify the nature of a statement or claim, shall not precede or follow the statement or claim.

A statement or claim that is made on the label of or in any advertisement for a food that has not been processed, formulated, reformulated or otherwise modified to meet the conditions set out in column 2 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims shall not be accompanied by the brand name of the food.

Any words, numbers, signs or symbols preceding or following the statement or claim referred to in subsection (3) shall accompany the statement or claim in such a manner that the statement or claim characterizes all foods of that type, and not only the specific food.

Section.Label: B.01.512
Section.Text: If a food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for more than one of the subjects set out in column 1, it is not necessary to repeat the common element of the statements or claims set out in column 4 that are used on the label of or in the advertisement for the food, and the remaining elements may be joined by means of a conjunction or punctuation, as appropriate.

Subsection.Text: No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make the statement or claim “light” or “léger” — including any phonetic rendering of that statement or claim — respecting a sensory characteristic of the food unless the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the statement or claim “light” or “léger” is made on the label of a food, the sensory characteristic shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the most prominent statement or claim on the principal display panel or, if none appears there, the most prominent statement or claim elsewhere on the label, if the statement or claim is made more than once, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: those of the most prominent statement or claim on the principal display panel or, if none appears there, the most prominent statement or claim elsewhere on the label, if the statement or claim is made more than once;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the statement or claim “light” or “léger” is made in an advertisement for a food, other than a radio or television advertisement, the sensory characteristic shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the statement or claim “light” or “léger” is made in a radio advertisement or in the audio portion of a television advertisement, the sensory characteristic shall immediately precede or follow the statement or claim; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the statement or claim “light” or “léger” is made in the visual portion of a television advertisement, the sensory characteristic shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: appear concurrently with and for the same amount of time as the statement or claim,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: be adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: be shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to the statement or claim “light” or “léger” when it is used with respect to rum.

Section.Label: B.01.600
Section.Text: A statement or claim set out in column 1 of the table following section B.01.603 that appears on the label of a food shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in English and French; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in one of those languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the food may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

Subsection.Text: A food with a label or advertisement that carries a statement or claim set out in column 1 of the table following section B.01.603 is exempt from the provisions of the Act and its Regulations with respect to drugs, and from subsections 3(1) and (2) of the Act, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food meets the applicable conditions set out in column 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the label of or the advertisement for the food meets the applicable conditions set out in column 3; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the food is not

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: intended solely for children under four years of age, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a food represented for use in a very low energy diet.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a food that comes within the definition of drug as defined in section 2 of the Act for a reason other than the fact that its label or advertisement carries a statement or claim referred to in that subsection.
Subsection (1) applies even if the word “graisses” in the French version of the statement or claim is replaced by the word “lipides”.

The information required under the conditions set out in column 3 of the table following section B.01.603 that appears in an advertisement for a food that is not a prepackaged product, or in an advertisement for a prepackaged product that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, shall,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an advertisement, other than a radio or television advertisement, be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim set out in column 1, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a radio advertisement or the audio portion of a television advertisement, immediately precede or follow the statement or claim set out in column 1; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a television advertisement, be communicated

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the audio mode, if the statement or claim set out in column 1 is made only in the audio portion of the advertisement or in both the audio and visual portions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the audio or visual mode, if the statement or claim set out in column 1 is made only in the visual portion of the advertisement.

Subsection.Text: The information that is communicated in the visual mode of a television advertisement in accordance with subparagraph (1)(c)(ii) shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appear concurrently with and for at least the same amount of time as the statement or claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, a statement or claim set out in column 1 of the table following this section that is made on the label of or in any advertisement for a food may be preceded or followed by other words, numbers, signs or symbols, but none of those shall be interposed between the words, numbers, signs or symbols of the statement or claim.

If a food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of the table following this section for more than one item of that table, it is not necessary to repeat the common element of the statements or claims set out in column 1 that are used on the label of or in the advertisement for the food, and the remaining elements may be joined by means of a conjunction or punctuation, as appropriate.

Provision.Text: “A healthy diet containing foods high in potassium and low in sodium may reduce the risk of high blood pressure, a risk factor for stroke and heart disease. (Naming the food) is sodium-free.”
“A healthy diet containing foods high in potassium and low in sodium may reduce the risk of high blood pressure, a risk factor for stroke and heart disease. (Naming the food) is low in sodium.”

“A healthy diet containing foods high in potassium and low in sodium may reduce the risk of high blood pressure, a risk factor for stroke and heart disease. (Naming the food) is a good source of potassium and is sodium-free.”

“A healthy diet containing foods high in potassium and low in sodium may reduce the risk of high blood pressure, a risk factor for stroke and heart disease. (Naming the food) is a good source of potassium and is low in sodium.”

“A healthy diet containing foods high in potassium and low in sodium may reduce the risk of high blood pressure, a risk factor for stroke and heart disease. (Naming the food) is high in potassium and is sodium-free.”

“A healthy diet containing foods high in potassium and low in sodium may reduce the risk of high blood pressure, a risk factor for stroke and heart disease. (Naming the food) is high in potassium and is low in sodium.”
The food

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: other than a vegetable or fruit, does not meet the conditions set out in column 2 of item 2 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “low in energy” set out in column 1;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: contains at least 10% of the weighted recommended nutrient intake of a vitamin or a mineral nutrient

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: per reference amount and per serving of stated size, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 19 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “low in saturated fatty acids” set out in column 1;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: contains 0.5% or less alcohol;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 31 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of sodium or salt” set out in column 1, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (1), (3) or (5) set out in column 1 of this item;

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 32 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “low in sodium or salt” set out in column 1, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (2), (4) or (6) set out in column 1 of this item; and

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: contains 350 mg or more of potassium, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (3), (4), (5) or (6) set out in column 1 of this item,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: per reference amount and per serving of stated size, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal.

If the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a food that is not a prepackaged product, or in the advertisement for a prepackaged product that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the label or advertisement shall include the amount of sodium and potassium per serving of stated size, in accordance with section B.01.602, if applicable. However, this requirement does not apply if the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating.

“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is a good source of calcium.”
“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is high in calcium.”

“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is an excellent source of calcium.”
“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is very high in calcium.”

“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is an excellent source of calcium and vitamin D.”

“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is very high in calcium and vitamin D.”
The food

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: other than a vegetable or fruit, does not meet the conditions set out in column 2 of item 2 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “low in energy” set out in column 1;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: contains no more phosphorus, excluding that provided by phytate, than calcium;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: contains 0.5% or less alcohol;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: contains, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (1) or (2) set out in column 1 of this item,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: 200 mg or more of calcium per reference amount and per serving of stated size, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: 300 mg or more of calcium per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: contains, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (3), (4), (5) or (6) set out in column 1 of this item,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: 275 mg or more of calcium per reference amount and per serving of stated size, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: 400 mg or more of calcium per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal; and

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: contains 1.25 µg or more of vitamin D, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (5) or (6) set out in column 1 of this item,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: per reference amount and per serving of stated size, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal.

If the statement or claim is made on the label of a prepackaged product, or in any advertisement for the prepackaged product that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the amount of vitamin D and phosphorus shall be included in, as the case may be,

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: the nutrition facts table in accordance with subsection B.01.402(2); or

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: the supplemented food facts table in accordance with subsection B.29.002(1), in respect of the description referred to in column 2, the unit referred to in column 3 and the manner of expression referred to in column 4 of the table to section B.29.002, or with subsection B.29.003(3), or with both, as the case may be.

If the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a food that is not a prepackaged product, or in the advertisement for a prepackaged product that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the label or advertisement shall include the amount of vitamin D, calcium and phosphorus per serving of stated size, in accordance with section B.01.602, if applicable. However, this requirement does not apply if the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating.
“A healthy diet low in saturated and trans fats may reduce the risk of heart disease. (Naming the food) is free of saturated and trans fats.”
“A healthy diet low in saturated and trans fats may reduce the risk of heart disease. (Naming the food) is low in saturated and trans fats.”
The food

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: other than a vegetable or fruit, does not meet the conditions set out in column 2 of item 2 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “low in energy” set out in column 1;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: contains at least 10% of the weighted recommended nutrient intake of a vitamin or a mineral nutrient

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: per reference amount and per serving of stated size, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: contains 100 mg or less of cholesterol per 100 g of food;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: contains 0.5% or less alcohol;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: if it is a fat or an oil, meets the conditions set out in

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: column 2 of item 25 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “source of omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids” set out in column 1,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: column 2 of item 26 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “source of omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids” set out in column 1, or

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: subparagraphs (i) and (ii);

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: contains

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: 480 mg or less of sodium per reference amount and per serving of stated size, and per 50 g if the reference amount is 30 g or 30 mL or less, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: 960 mg or less of sodium per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal;

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 18 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of saturated fatty acids” set out in column 1, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (1) set out in column 1 of this item; and

Provision.Label: (h)
Provision.Text: meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 19 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “low in saturated fatty acids” set out in column 1, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (2) set out in column 1 of this item.

If the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a food that is not a prepackaged product, or in the advertisement for a prepackaged product that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the label or advertisement shall include the amount of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids per serving of stated size, in accordance with section B.01.602, if applicable. However, this requirement does not apply if the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating.
“A healthy diet rich in a variety of vegetables and fruit may help reduce the risk of some types of cancer.”
The food

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: is one of the following foods and does not contain ingredients other than food additives that are set out in column 1 of the Lists of Permitted Food Additives, sweetening agents, salt, herbs, spices, seasonings and water:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a fresh, frozen, canned or dried vegetable,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a fresh, frozen, canned or dried fruit,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: a vegetable or fruit juice, or

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: a combination of the foods set out in subparagraphs (i) to (iii);

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: is not one of the following:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: potatoes, yams, cassava, plantain, corn, mushrooms, mature legumes and their juices,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: vegetables or fruit used as condiments, garnishes or flavourings, including maraschino cherries, glacé fruit, candied fruit and onion flakes,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: jams or jam-type spreads, marmalades, preserves and jellies,

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: olives, or

Provision.Label: (v)
Provision.Text: powdered vegetables or fruit; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: contains 0.5% or less alcohol.
“A healthy diet rich in a variety of vegetables and fruit may help reduce the risk of heart disease.”
The food

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: is one of the following foods and does not contain ingredients other than food additives that are set out in column 1 of the Lists of Permitted Food Additives, salt, herbs, spices, seasonings and water:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a fresh, frozen, canned or dried vegetable,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a fresh, frozen, canned or dried fruit,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: a vegetable juice or vegetable drink, or

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: a combination of the foods set out in any of subparagraphs (i) to (iii);

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: is not one of or does not contain any of the following:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: potatoes, yams, cassava, plantain, mature legumes and their juices,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: vegetables or fruit used as condiments, garnishes or flavourings, including maraschino cherries, glacé fruit, candied fruit and onion flakes,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: jams or jam-type spreads, marmalades, preserves and jellies,

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: olives,

Provision.Label: (v)
Provision.Text: a fruit juice or fruit drink,

Provision.Label: (vi)
Provision.Text: powdered vegetables or fruit, or

Provision.Label: (vii)
Provision.Text: the seed of a fruit known as a drupe, including almonds, cashews and coconuts;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: contains 0.5% or less alcohol; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: contains less than 15% of the daily value of sodium per reference amount and per serving of stated size, and per 50 g if the reference amount is 30 g or 30 mL or less.
“Won’t cause cavities.”
“Does not promote tooth decay.”
“Does not promote dental caries.”
“Non-cariogenic.”
The food is a chewing gum, hard candy or breath freshener product that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: contains 0.25% or less starch, dextrins, mono-, di- and oligosaccharides or other fermentable carbohydrates combined; or

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: does not, if it contains more than 0.25% fermentable carbohydrates, lower plaque pH below 5.7 by bacterial fermentation during 30 minutes after consumption as measured by the indwelling plaque pH test, referred to in “Identification of Low Caries Risk Dietary Components” by T.N. Imfeld, Volume 11, Monographs in Oral Science, 1983.

If the statement or claim is made on the label of a prepackaged product, or in any advertisement for the prepackaged product that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the amount of sugar alcohols, if present, shall be included in, as the case may be,

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: the nutrition facts table, in accordance with subsection B.01.402(2); or

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: the supplemented food facts table, in accordance with subsection B.29.003(3).

Section.Label: B.02.002
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: age means the period during which an alcoholic beverage is kept under such conditions of storage as may be necessary to develop its characteristic flavour and bouquet; (âge)
alcohol means ethyl alcohol; (alcool)
flavouring means, in respect of a spirit, any other spirit or wine, domestic or imported, added as a flavouring to that spirit as authorized under the Excise Act; (substance aromatique)
small wood means wood casks or barrels of not greater than 700 L capacity. (petit fût)

Section.Label: B.02.003
Section.Text: If an alcoholic beverage contains 1.1% or more alcohol by volume, the percentage by volume of alcohol present in the alcoholic beverage shall be shown on the principal display panel

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: followed by the words “alcohol by volume” or the abbreviation “alc./vol.” or “alc/vol”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: preceded by the abbreviation “alc.” or “alc” and followed by the abbreviation “vol.” or “vol”.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell flavoured purified alcohol in a container with a capacity of 1,000 mL or less unless it contains 25.6 mL or less of alcohol.
Subsection (1) does not apply to flavoured purified alcohol that is sold in a glass container with a capacity of at least 750 mL.
For the purposes of this section, flavoured purified alcohol means an alcoholic beverage

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is obtained from an alcohol base that has been purified during the course of manufacture through a process other than distillation and from which most of the naturally occurring substances other than alcohol and water have been removed; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to which has been added during the course of manufacture any substance or mixture of substances that imparts flavour.

Section.Label: B.02.017
Section.Text: No person shall blend or modify Scotch whisky that is imported in bulk for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Scotch whisky except by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: blending with other Scotch whisky,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust to a required strength, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of caramel.

Section.Label: B.02.019
Section.Text: No person shall blend or modify Irish whisky that is imported in bulk for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Irish whisky except by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: blending with other Irish whisky,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust to a required strength, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of caramel.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), no person shall make any claim with respect to the age of Canadian whisky, other than for the period during which the whisky has been held in small wood.

Where Canadian whisky has been aged in small wood for a period of at least three years, any period not exceeding six months during which that whisky was held in other containers may be claimed as age.

Section.Label: B.02.022
Section.Text: No person shall modify Bourbon whisky that is imported for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Bourbon whisky except by the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust the Bourbon whisky to a required strength.

Section.Label: B.02.022.1
Section.Text: No person shall modify Tennessee whisky that is imported for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Tennessee whisky except by the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust the Tennessee whisky to a required strength.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell whisky for consumption in Canada, other than Bourbon whisky or Tennessee whisky, unless it has been aged for at least three years in small wood.

Nothing in subsection (1) applies in respect of flavouring contained in whisky, but no person shall sell for consumption in Canada whisky containing any flavouring, other than wine, that has not been aged for a period of at least two years in small wood.
No person shall sell rum for consumption in Canada unless it has been aged for at least one year in small wood.

Nothing in subsection (1) applies in respect of flavouring contained in rum, but no person shall sell for consumption in Canada rum containing any flavouring, other than wine, that has not been aged for a period of at least one year in small wood.

Section.Label: B.02.043
Section.Text: No person shall make any claim for age for gin but gin that has been held in suitable containers may bear a label declaration to that effect.

Section.Label: B.02.059
Section.Text: No person shall blend or modify brandy that is imported in bulk for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as imported brandy, except by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: blending with other imported brandy;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of caramel; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust the brandy to a required strength.

Section.Label: B.02.060
Section.Text: Where brandy is wholly distilled in a country other than Canada, the label shall indicate the country of origin.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell brandy unless it has been aged for at least one year in wooden containers or at least six months in small wood.

Nothing in subsection (1) applies in respect of flavouring contained in brandy, but no person shall sell brandy containing any flavouring, other than wine, that has not been aged for a period of at least one year in wooden containers or at least six months in small wood.

Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply in respect of Armagnac brandy, Cognac brandy or any other brandy that complies with the standards set out in sections 2.4.2 to 2.4.7 of Volume 2 of the Food Compositional Standards Document.
No person shall make any claim with respect to the age of brandy other than for the period during which the brandy has been held in wooden containers or in small wood.

Section.Label: B.02.090
Section.Text: No person shall modify Tequila that is imported for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Tequila except by the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust the Tequila to a required strength.

Section.Label: B.02.091
Section.Text: No person shall modify Mezcal that is imported for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Mezcal except by the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust the Mezcal to a required strength.

Section.Label: B.02.101
Section.Text: No person shall sell wine unless it has an amount of volatile acidity, expressed as acetic acid, that is equal to or less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4.

Section.Label: B.02.108
Section.Text: A clear indication of the country of origin shall be shown on the principal display panel of a wine.

Section.Label: B.02.123
Section.Text: No person shall sell cider unless it has an amount of volatile acidity, expressed as acetic acid, that is equal to or less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4.

Section.Label: B.08.002
Section.Text: Except as provided in these Regulations, a dairy product that contains a fat other than milk fat is adulterated.

Section.Label: B.08.002.1
Section.Text: Paragraphs B.08.002.3(a) to (i) and sections B.08.003 to B.08.028 do not apply to a lacteal secretion obtained from the mammary gland of any animal other than a cow, genus Bos, or a product or derivative of such secretion.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell the normal lacteal secretion obtained from the mammary gland of the cow, genus Bos, or of any other animal, or sell a dairy product made with any such secretion, unless the secretion or dairy product has been pasteurized by being held at a temperature and for a period that ensure the reduction of the alkaline phosphatase activity so as to meet the tolerances specified in official method MFO-3, Determination of Phosphatase Activity in Dairy Products, dated November 30, 1981.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cheese; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any food that is sold for further manufacturing or processing in order to pasteurize it in the manner described in subsection (1).

Section.Label: B.08.002.3
Section.Text: The percentage of milk fat contained in the following dairy products must be shown on the principal display panel followed by the words “milk fat” or the abbreviation “B.F.” or “M.F.”:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: partly skimmed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: partly skimmed milk with added milk solids;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: evaporated partly skimmed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) milk;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk with added milk solids;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: cream;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: canned cream;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: sour cream;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: yogurt;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: cottage cheese; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: creamed cottage cheese.

Section.Label: B.08.003
Section.Text: Despite sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, no person shall sell any of the following dairy products for which a standard is set out in Volume 7 of the Food Compositional Standards Document unless the food contains 2 μg of vitamin D per 100 mL:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: milk;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sterilized milk; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) milk.

Section.Label: B.08.004
Section.Text: Despite sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, no person shall sell milk powder for which a standard is set out in Volume 7 of the Food Compositional Standards Document unless it contains 2 μg of vitamin D per 100 mL when reconstituted according to directions for use.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell a food referred to in subsection (2) unless it contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: despite sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the food contains at least 1,200 I.U. and not more than 2,500 I.U. of vitamin A; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: despite sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, 2 μg of vitamin D per 100 mL.

Subsection.Text: The foods to which subsection (1) applies are the following dairy products for which a standard is set out in Volume 7 of the Food Compositional Standards Document:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: skim milk;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: partly skimmed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) skim milk;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: skim milk with added milk solids;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: partly skimmed milk with added milk solids;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) skim milk with added milk solids; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk with added milk solids.

Section.Label: B.08.006
Section.Text: No person shall sell skim milk powder for which a standard is set out in Volume 7 of the Food Compositional Standards Document unless it contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: despite sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the dairy product contains at least 1,200 I.U. and not more than 2,500 I.U. of vitamin A; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: despite sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, 2 μg of vitamin D per 100 mL when reconstituted according to directions for use.

Section.Label: B.08.010
Section.Text: No person shall sell evaporated milk for which a standard is set out in Volume 7 of the Food Compositional Standards Document unless it contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: despite sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, vitamin C in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the dairy product contains at least 60 mg and not more than 75 mg of vitamin C; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: despite sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, 2 μg of vitamin D per 100 mL when reconstituted to its original volume.

Section.Label: B.08.011
Section.Text: No person shall sell evaporated skim milk or evaporated partly skimmed milk for which a standard is set out in Volume 7 of the Food Compositional Standards Document unless it contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: despite sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the dairy product contains at least 1,200 I.U. and not more than 2,500 I.U. of vitamin A;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: despite sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, vitamin C in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the dairy product contains at least 60 mg and not more than 75 mg of vitamin C; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: despite sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, 2 μg of vitamin D per 100 mL when reconstituted to its original volume.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell a food referred to in subsection (2) in which the content of vitamin D has been increased by either addition or irradiation unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the addition of vitamin D, the menstruum containing the vitamin D contributes not more than 0.01 per cent fat foreign to milk; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in cases where the vitamin D content is increased by irradiation, the principal display panel carries the statement “Vitamin D Increased” immediately preceding or following the name of the food, without intervening written, printed or graphic matter.

Subsection.Text: The foods to which subsection (1) applies are the following dairy products for which a standard is set out in Volume 7 of the Food Compositional Standards Document:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: milk;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: skim milk;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: partly skimmed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: skim milk with added milk solids;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: partly skimmed milk with added milk solids;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) milk;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) skim milk;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) skim milk with added milk solids;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk with added milk solids;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: condensed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: evaporated milk;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: evaporated skim milk;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: evaporated partly skimmed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: milk powder; and

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: skim milk powder.

Section.Label: B.08.024
Section.Text: No person shall sell milk for manufacture into dairy products unless the milk contains an amount of sediment equal to or less than that set out in column 3 of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4.

Section.Label: B.08.027
Section.Text: Despite anything contained in these Regulations, the following dairy products for which a standard is set out in Volume 7 of the Food Compositional Standards Document are not required to contain added vitamins if they are used in or sold for the manufacture of other foods:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: milk;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: skim milk;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: partly skimmed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: sterilized milk;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: evaporated milk;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: evaporated skim milk;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: evaporated partly skimmed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: milk powder;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: skim milk powder;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: skim milk with added milk solids; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: partly skimmed milk with added milk solids.

Section.Label: B.08.028.1
Section.Text: A lacteal secretion obtained from themammary gland of any animal other than a cow, genus Bos, and a product or derivative of such secretion shall be labelled so as to identify that animal.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell goat’s milk or goat’s milk powder to which vitamin D has been added unless 100 mL of that food, when ready-to-serve, contains 2 μg of vitamin D.
