No person shall sell skimmed or partly skimmed goat’s milk or skimmed or partly skimmed goat’s milk powder to which vitamin A or D has been added unless 100 mL of that food, when ready-to-serve, contains both vitamin A and D in the following amounts:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 140 I.U. and not more than 300 I.U. of vitamin A; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 2 μg of vitamin D.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell evaporated goat’s milk to which any of the following vitamins have been added unless 100 mL of that food, when reconstituted to its original volume, contains each of the following vitamins in the following amounts:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 7 mg and not more than 9 mg of vitamin C;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 2 μg of vitamin D; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 10 μg and not more than 20 μg of folic acid.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell evaporated partly skimmed goat’s milk or evaporated skimmed goat’s milk to which any of the following vitamins have been added unless 100 mL of that food, when reconstituted to its original volume, contains each of the following vitamins in the following amounts:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 140 I.U. and not more than 300 I.U. of vitamin A;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 7 mg and not more than 9 mg of vitamin C;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 2 μg of vitamin D; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 10 μg and not more than 20 μg of folic acid.

Subsection.Text: In this Division, when used with respect to cheese,

Definition.Text: pasteurized source means milk, skim milk, cream, reconstituted milk powder, reconstituted skim milk powder or any combination thereof that has been pasteurized by being held at a temperature of not less than 61.6°C for a period of not less than 30 minutes, or for a time and a temperature that is equivalent thereto in phosphatase destruction, as determined by official method MFO-3, Determination of Phosphatase Activity in Dairy Products, November 30, 1981; (matière première pasteurisée)
stored means to have been kept or held at a temperature of 2°C or more for a period of 60 days or more from the date of the beginning of the manufacturing process; (entreposé)
whole means of the original size and shape as manufactured. (entier)

Section.Label: B.08.031
Section.Text: A cheese made from milk that is the normal lacteal secretion of the mammary gland of animals other than the cow, genus Bos, must be labelled to show the source of the milk on the principal display panel.

Subsection.Text: Cheeses, other than cottage cheese and creamed cottage cheese, must be labelled to show on the principal display panel a statement of the percentage of milk fat in the food followed by the words “milk fat” or the abbreviation “B.F.” or “M.F.”, and the percentage of moisture in the food followed by the word “moisture” or “water”.

Subject to subsection B.01.301(1), no person shall make any direct or indirect reference on the label of a food referred to in subsection (1) to the milk fat content or moisture content of the food except as required by subsection (1).

Section.Label: B.08.042
Section.Text: No manufacturer shall sell whole cheese that is not made from a pasteurized source unless the date of the beginning of the manufacturing process is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: marked or branded thereon within three days thereof; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: marked on the label at the time of packaging, if the cheese is such that, because of its texture, consistency, or physical structure, such date cannot be effectively branded or marked on the cheese.

Section.Label: B.08.043
Section.Text: No manufacturer shall sell cheese that is not made from a pasteurized source if it has been cut into smaller portions unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it has been duly stored; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each portion of cut cheese is marked, branded or labelled with the date of the beginning of the manufacturing process.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell cheese, including cheese curd, that is not made from a pasteurized source unless it has been stored.

Cheese, including cheese curd, that is not made from a pasteurized source may be used as an ingredient in any food providing such food is manufactured or processed so as to pasteurize the cheese in the manner described in the definition pasteurized source in section B.08.030(1).

Section.Label: B.08.045
Section.Text: Notwithstanding B.08.044, cheese that has not been manufactured from a pasteurized source and has not been stored but is marked or branded with the date of the beginning of the manufacturing process, may be sold to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a wholesaler;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a jobber; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in quantities of not less than 900 pounds, to a retailer.

Section.Label: B.08.046
Section.Text: No person shall sell any whole cheese that has not been made from a pasteurized source unless there is stamped thereon the date of the beginning of the manufacturing process.

Section.Label: B.08.047
Section.Text: Every manufacturer, wholesaler, or jobber who sells cheese not made from a pasteurized source and which has not been stored shall keep a record of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registered number of the cheese factory,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of manufacture of the cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the vat number or vat numbers,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person to whom the cheese is sold, and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the weight sold from each vat,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: for each lot of cheese sold.

Section.Label: B.08.053
Section.Text: All dairy products used in the preparation of cottage cheese shall be from a pasteurized source.

Heading.TitleText: Ice Cream Mix and Ice Milk Mix

Section.Label: B.08.071
Section.Text: No person shall sell ice cream mix or ice milk mix unless it has been pasteurized or unless the dairy products that are contained in the mix have been pasteurized.

Section.Label: B.08.077
Section.Text: No person shall sell sour cream unless it has been prepared with pasteurized cream.

Section.Label: B.09.002
Section.Text: No person shall sell animal fats and oils obtained from slaughtered animals unless they are derived from animals that were healthy at the time of slaughter.

Section.Label: B.09.010
Section.Text: Despite the common name set out in the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document, if a vegetable fat or oil is an ingredient of any cooking oil, salad oil or table oil, the fat or oil shall be shown in the list of ingredients by its common name.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell margarine or calorie-reduced margarine for which a standard is set out in Volume 8 of the Food Compositional Standards Document unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the margarine or calorie-reduced margarine contains at least 3,300 I.U. of vitamin A per 100 g; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: despite sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, the margarine or calorie-reduced margarine contains 26 μg of vitamin D per 100 g.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell margarine or calorie-reduced margarine for which a standard is set out in Volume 8 of the Food Compositional Standards Document and to which vitamin E has been added unless the finished product contains at least 0.6 I.U. of alpha-tocopherol per gram of linoleic acid.

Section.Label: B.10.008
Section.Text: On any label of or in any advertisement for an artificial or imitation flavouring preparation, the word “artificial”, or “imitation” shall be an integral part of the name of such flavouring preparation and shall be set out in identical type and identically displayed with such name.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 11
Heading.TitleText: Fruits, Vegetables, Their Products and Substitutes

Section.Label: B.11.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: fruit juice means the unfermented liquid expressed from sound ripe fresh fruit, and includes any such liquid that is heat treated and chilled; (jus de fruit)
sweetening ingredient means sugar, invert sugar, honey, dextrose, glucose or glucose solids or any combination thereof in dry or liquid form. (ingrédient édulcorant)

Section.Label: B.11.002
Section.Text: No person shall sell canned vegetables unless they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have been obtained by heat processing fresh vegetables; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are packaged in hermetically sealed containers.

Section.Label: B.11.003
Section.Text: No person shall sell canned mushrooms unless they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have been obtained by heat processing cultivated mushrooms; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are packaged in hermetically sealed containers.

Section.Label: B.11.005
Section.Text: No person shall sell canned tomatoes unless they have been obtained by heat processing fresh tomatoes.

Section.Label: B.11.007
Section.Text: No person shall sell tomato juice unless it has been pasteurized.

Section.Label: B.11.011
Section.Text: No person shall sell tomato pulp or tomato puree unless it has been obtained by heat processing tomatoes.

Section.Label: B.11.012
Section.Text: No person shall sell tomato catsup unless it has been obtained by heat processing the liquid extracted from tomatoes.

Section.Label: B.11.025
Section.Text: No person shall sell potatoes, sweet potatoes or yams that have been artificially coloured.

Section.Label: B.11.101
Section.Text: No person shall sell canned fruit unless it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has been obtained by heat processing fresh fruit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is packaged in hermetically sealed containers.

Section.Label: B.11.150
Section.Text: No person shall label, package, sell or advertise a fruit flavoured drink in a manner that is likely to create an impression that the fruit flavoured drink contains vitamins or has any other nutritional value commonly associated with any fruit juice unless the following requirements are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is sold as a substitute for fruit juice or as a breakfast drink;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is not carbonated;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it is not represented to be or is not commonly known as

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a soft drink, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a thirst-quenching or refreshment drink; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: notwithstanding sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it contains vitamin C in an amount not less than 24 milligrams and not more than 48 milligrams, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it contains

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: where folic acid has been added, an amount of folic acid of not less than 40 micrograms and not more than 80 micrograms,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: where thiamine has been added, an amount of thiamine of not less than 0.08 milligram and not more than 0.11 milligram,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: where iron has been added, an amount of iron of not less than 0.56 milligram and not more than 0.80 milligram, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: where potassium has been added, an amount of potassium of not less than 100 milligrams and not more than 200 milligrams,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: per 100 millilitres when the drink is ready to serve.

Section.Label: B.11.151
Section.Text: No person shall label, package, sell or advertise a base, concentrate or mix that is used for making a fruit flavoured drink in a manner that is likely to create an impression that the drink made therefrom will contain vitamins or have any other nutritional value commonly associated with fruit juice unless the following requirements are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the base, concentrate or mix

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is sold for the purpose of making a breakfast drink or a substitute for fruit juice,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is not represented to be or is not commonly known as a product that is used for making a soft drink or a thirst-quenching or refreshment drink; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where a drink is made therefrom as directed, the drink meets the requirements described in paragraph B.11.150(d).

Section.Label: B.11.201
Section.Text: No person shall sell fruit jam or jam containing rhubarb unless the jam has been obtained by boiling the fruit or rhubarb, as the case may be, with water and a sweetening ingredient.

Section.Label: B.11.220
Section.Text: No person shall sell a citrus fruit marmalade unless it has been obtained by boiling the zest or peel, pulp and juice of the citrus fruit with water and a sweetening ingredient.

Section.Label: B.11.221
Section.Text: No person shall sell a pineapple marmalade or fig marmalade unless it has been obtained by boiling the pulp and juice of the pineapple or fig, as the case may be, with water and a sweetening ingredient.

Section.Label: B.11.240
Section.Text: No person shall sell fruit jelly unless it has been obtained by boiling the fruit, the juice of the fruit or a concentrate of the juice of the fruit with water and a sweetening ingredient.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell water represented as mineral water or spring water unless it is potable water obtained from an underground source and not from a public community water supply.

No person shall sell water represented as mineral water or spring water for which a standard is set out in Volume 11 of the Food Compositional Standards Document, to which fluoride has been added unless the total fluoride ion content is equal to or less than one part per million.

Section.Label: B.12.002
Section.Text: The label on a container of water represented as mineral water or spring water shall carry a statement

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: of the geographical location of the underground source from which it is obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: of the total dissolved mineral salt content expressed in parts per million; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: of the total fluoride ion content expressed in parts per million.

Section.Label: B.12.004
Section.Text: No person shall sell water in sealed containers, other than water represented as mineral water or spring water, if it contains

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: naturally occurring fluoride ion in an amount that exceeds its naturally occurring amount; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: added fluoride in such an amount that the total amount of fluoride ion exceeds one part per million.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell prepackaged ice if it contains

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: naturally occurring fluoride ion in an amount that exceeds its naturally occurring amount; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: added fluoride in such an amount that the total amount of fluoride ion exceeds one part per million.

Subsection.Text: No person shall manufacture prepackaged ice for sale if the water from which it is made

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is not potable;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains naturally occurring fluoride ion in an amount that exceeds its naturally occurring amount; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: contains added fluoride in such an amount that the total amount of fluoride ion exceeds one part per million.

Section.Label: B.12.007
Section.Text: Despite section B.01.008, chlorine or any compounds of chlorine need not be shown as ingredients on any part of the label on a sealed container of water, other than water represented as mineral water or spring water, when chlorine or any compounds of chlorine have been used in the treatment of the water and subsequently removed from the water together with any chlorine and compounds of chlorine produced in the water.

Section.Label: B.12.008
Section.Text: A statement of the total fluoride ion content expressed in parts per million shall appear on the principal display panel of the label on a sealed container of water, other than water represented as mineral water or spring water and on the label on a container of prepackaged ice.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell white flour for which a standard is set out in Volume 12 of the Food Compositional Standards Document unless the white flour contains, per 100 g,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 0.64 mg of thiamine;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 0.40 mg of riboflavin;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 5.30 mg of niacin or niacinamide;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 0.15 mg of folic acid; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: 4.4 mg of iron.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell white flour for which a standard is set out in Volume 12 of the Food Compositional Standards Document and to which any of the following vitamins or mineral nutrients have been added unless each 100 g of the white flour contains, in total, the following amount of the added vitamin or mineral nutrient:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 0.31 mg of vitamin B6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 1.3 mg of d-pantothenic acid;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 190 mg of magnesium; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 140 mg of calcium from one or any combination of the following sources:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium carbonate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: edible bone meal,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: chalk (B.P.),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: ground limestone,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium sulphate.

Section.Label: B.13.002
Section.Text: Despite subsection B.13.001(1), white flour used in or sold for the manufacture of gluten or starch is not required to contain added thiamine, riboflavin, niacin, folic acid or iron.

Subsection.Text: In this section, pre-cooked rice means rice, for which a standard is set out in Volume 12 of the Food Compositional Standards Document, that has been polished and cooked in water or steam and dried in a way that allows the rice grains to remain porous and open-structured.

Notwithstanding sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009, no person shall sell pre-cooked rice to which a vitamin or mineral nutrient set out in Column I of an item of the table to this section has been added, either singly or in any combination, unless each 100 g of the pre-cooked rice as sold contains the added vitamin or mineral nutrient in the amount set out in Column II of that item.

row.entry: Amount per 100 g of Pre-cooked Rice

Subsection.Text: No person shall represent pre-cooked rice as “enriched” unless the food contains added thiamine, niacin and iron.
No person shall sell enriched white bread for which a standard is set out in Volume 12 of the Food Compositional Standards Document unless the enriched white bread contains, per 100 g,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 0.40 mg of thiamine;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 0.24 mg of riboflavin;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 3.3 mg of niacin or niacinamide;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 0.10 mg of folic acid; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: 2.76 mg of iron.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell enriched white bread for which a standard is set out in Volume 12 of the Food Compositional Standards Document and that is made from white flour to which any of the following vitamins or mineral nutrients have been added unless each 100 g of the enriched white bread contains, in total, the following amount of the added vitamin or mineral nutrient:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 0.14 mg of vitamin B6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 0.6 mg of d-pantothenic acid;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 90 mg of magnesium; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 66 mg of calcium.

Section.Label: B.13.051
Section.Text: No person shall sell macaroni, spaghetti, noodles or similar alimentary pastes, as egg macaroni, egg spaghetti, egg noodles or egg alimentary pastes, respectively, unless they contain, on the dry basis, not less than four per cent, egg-yolk solids derived from whole egg, dried egg, frozen egg or frozen egg-yolk.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009, no person shall sell an alimentary paste to which a vitamin or a mineral nutrient set out in column I of any item of the table to this section has been added unless each 100 g of the alimentary paste contains the added vitamin or mineral nutrient in an amount not less than the minimum amount set out in column II of that item and not more than the maximum amount set out in column III of that item.
No person shall represent an alimentary paste as “enriched” unless the alimentary paste contains added thiamine, riboflavin, niacin, folic acid and iron, in accordance with the table to this section.

row.entry: Minimum Amount per 100 g of Alimentary Paste
Maximum Amount per 100 g of Alimentary Paste

Section.Label: B.13.060
Section.Text: Notwithstanding sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009, no person shall sell a breakfast cereal to which a vitamin or mineral nutrient set out in Column I of an item of the table to this section has been added, either singly or in any combination, unless each 100 g of the breakfast cereal contains the added vitamin or mineral nutrient in the amount set out in Column II of that item.

row.entry: Amount per 100 g of Breakfast Cereal

Section.Label: B.14.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: animal means any animal used as food, but does not include marine and fresh water animals; (animal)
filler means any vegetable material (except tomato or beetroot), milk, egg, yeast or any derivative or combination thereof that is acceptable as food. (agent de remplissage)
meat means the edible part of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the skeletal muscle of an animal; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the muscle that is found in the tongue, diaphragm, heart or oesophagus of an animal.

ContinuedDefinition.Text: This definition also applies to the muscle tissue when it is overlaid with or includes fat, portions of bone, skin, sinew, nerve or blood vessels that are normally attached to it and are not separated from it in the process of dressing. This definition does not include muscle found in the lips, snout, scalp or ears; (viande)

Definition.Text: meat by-product means any edible part of an animal, other than meat. (sous-produit de viande)

Section.Label: B.14.002
Section.Text: No person shall sell meat, a meat by-product or edible bone meal unless it is derived from animals that were healthy at the time of slaughter.

Section.Label: B.14.004
Section.Text: Meat, meat by-products, preparations of meat or preparations of meat by-products are adulterated if any organ or portion of an animal that is not commonly sold as food — including mucous membranes, organs or portions of the genital system, black gut, spleens, udders and lungs — is present in or has been added to the food.

Section.Label: B.14.006
Section.Text: Powdered fully hydrogenated cottonseed oil may be applied as a release agent to the surface of meat, meat by-product, prepared meat, prepared meat by-product, extended meat product and simulated meat product in an amount not greater than 0.25% of the product.

Section.Label: B.14.008
Section.Text: No person shall sell a meat binder, filler or preparations for pumping pickle, cover pickle or dry cure represented for use in meat products unless its label sets out directions for use that, when followed, produces a food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that complies with the requirements of section B.14.030 in relation to the filler; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that does not contain food additives, if any, in excess of the maximum level of use or maximum level of residue for that food set out in the Lists of Permitted Food Additives.

Section.Label: B.14.010
Section.Text: No person shall sell as food a dead animal or any part thereof.

Section.Label: B.14.011
Section.Text: No person shall sell as food, meat, meat by-products, preparations containing meat or meat derivatives obtained, prepared or manufactured from a dead animal.

Section.Label: B.14.012
Section.Text: For the purpose of Sections B.14.010 and B.14.011, dead animal means a dead animal that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was not killed for the purpose of food in accordance with commonly accepted practice of killing animals for the purpose of food, which shall include exsanguination; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: was affected with disease at the time it was killed.

Section.Label: B.14.015C
Section.Text: No person shall sell ground beef unless it contains an amount of beef fat equal to or less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4.

Section.Label: B.14.016
Section.Text: No person shall sell horse-meat or horse-meat by-product, or any food containing horse-meat or horse-meat by-product unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is labelled as such when offered or exposed for sale; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when in package form, the principal display panel of the label carries a declaration of the presence of horse-meat or of horse-meat by-product in type at least as legible and conspicuous as any other type upon such principal display panel.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if a carcass of beef or veal, or a portion of a carcass of beef or veal that weighs 7 kg or more, is advertised for sale, the advertisement shall indicate

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a carcass other than an imported carcass, the grade that was assigned to the carcass under the Safe Food for Canadians Act or a provincial law;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an imported beef carcass, the grade that was assigned to the carcass under the Safe Food for Canadians Act or a provincial law or the grade that was assigned to the carcass by a grading authority established under the laws of the country from which the carcass was imported;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an imported veal carcass, the grade that was assigned to the carcass by a grading authority established under the laws of the country from which the carcass was imported; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a beef carcass, the yield class, if any, that was assigned to the carcass under the Safe Food for Canadians Act.

Subsection.Text: Where, in the case of a carcass referred to in subsection (1), no grade has been assigned thereto as described in that subsection and the carcass or portion thereof that weighs 7 kg or more is advertised for sale, the advertisement shall clearly indicate that the carcass has not been graded.
Where a carcass of beef, veal, pork or lamb or a portion thereof that weighs 7 kg or more is advertised for sale and a selling price is stated in the advertisement, the advertisement shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contain the words “price per kilogram is based on carcass weight before cutting, boning and trimming” or the words “price per kilogram is based on the weight of the meat after cutting, boning and trimming”, whichever words are applicable; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where in addition to the selling price a charge is payable for cutting, boning, trimming, wrapping or freezing the carcass or portion thereof, indicate

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of the additional charge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where the additional charge is payable on a price per unit weight basis, whether the additional charge is based on the weight of the carcass or portion thereof before or after the carcass has been cut, boned and trimmed.

Subsection.Text: Any information required by subsection (1) to appear in an advertisement shall be located therein immediately adjacent to the selling price stated therein, without any intervening written, printed or graphic matter.
No person shall sell solid cut meat to which food additives or water have been added unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of meat, other than side bacon, Wiltshire bacon, pork jowls, salt pork and salt beef, the meat

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: where cooked, contains a meat protein content of not less than 12 per cent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where uncooked, contains a meat protein content of not less than 10 per cent.

Subsection.Text: A bone or a visible fat layer shall not be included in any calculation used to determine meat protein content for the purposes of paragraph (1)(a).

Section.Label: B.14.022
Section.Text: No person shall sell mechanically tenderized beef unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the beef is identified as mechanically tenderized when it is offered or exposed for sale; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the beef has a label on it with a principal display panel that, subject to section B.01.012, includes all of the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in type at least as legible and prominent as that of the common name,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the expression “mechanically tenderized” in the English version of the label, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the expression “attendri mécaniquement”, with any necessary grammatical modifications, in the French version of the label, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in type at least as legible and prominent as that of any other information other than the common name,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in the English version of the label,

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: the message “Cook to a minimum internal temperature of 63°C (145°F).”, and

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: in the case of steak, the additional message “Turn steak over at least twice during cooking.”, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in the French version of the label,

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: the message “Faire cuire jusqu’à ce que la température interne atteigne au moins 63 °C (145 °F).”, and

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: in the case of steak, the additional message “Retourner le bifteck au moins deux fois durant la cuisson.”.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3) and section B.14.030A, no person shall sell a prepared meat or prepared meat by-product with a meat protein content of less than 1.5 percentage points below the total protein requirement for that food.
Subsection (1) does not apply to an extended meat product.

Where gelatin is an ingredient of a prepared meat or prepared meat by-product, that gelatin shall not be included when calculating the total protein content of the prepared meat or prepared meat by-product.

Section.Label: B.14.030A
Section.Text: For the purposes of sections B.14.030 and B.14.074 to B.14.077 and Division 13.3 of Volume 13 of the Food Compositional Standards Document, if any non-meat ingredients are present in a prepared meat or a prepared meat by-product in pieces that are distinguishable from the other ingredients, those non-meat ingredients must be excluded when calculating the total fat or protein content of the prepared meat or prepared meat by-product.

Section.Label: B.14.033
Section.Text: No person shall sell any of the following foods unless they are cooked or unless the meat and meat by-products, as the case may be, contained in them are cooked:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: potted meat;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meat loaf;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: meat roll;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: luncheon meat;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: potted meat by-product;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: meat by-product loaf;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: meat and meat by-product loaf;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: headcheese; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: brawn.

Section.Label: B.14.040
Section.Text: Subject to Division 13.3 of Volume 13 of the Food Compositional Standards Document, no person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of ground meat and filler, of ground meat by-product and filler or of ground meat, ground meat by-product and filler unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 13 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, in the case of a mixture containing pork meat or pork meat by-product or both; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, in the case of any other meat mixture.

Section.Label: B.14.041
Section.Text: Subject to Division 13.3 of Volume 13 of the Food Compositional Standards Document, no person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of ground meat and spices and seasonings, of ground meat by-product and spices and seasonings, of ground meat, ground meat by-product and spices and seasonings or of ground meat and ground meat by-product unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, in the case of a mixture containing pork meat or pork meat by-product or both; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, in the case of any other meat mixture.

Heading.TitleText: Sale of Barbecued, Roasted or Broiled Meat or Meat By-Products

Section.Label: B.14.072
Section.Text: No person shall sell meat or a meat by-product that has been barbecued, roasted or broiled and is ready for consumption unless the cooked meat or meat by-product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at all times

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has a temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has been stored at an ambient temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: carries on the principal display panel of the label a statement to the effect that the food must be stored at a temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher.

Section.Label: B.14.073
Section.Text: No person shall sell a meat product extender intended to be used in a food consisting of a mixture described in section B.14.074, B.14.075, B.14.076, B.14.077 or B.14.078, unless that extender

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has, in the rehydrated state,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a protein quality of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.074
Section.Text: Subject to sections B.14.075 to B.14.079, no person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product and meat product extender, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.075
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product and meat product extender and that resembles fresh sausage, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than nine per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.076
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product and meat product extender and that resembles cooked sausage, meat loaf, meat by-product loaf, meat roll, or luncheon meat, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 11 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.077
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product and meat product extender and that resembles potted meat, or potted meat by-product, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than nine per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.078
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product and meat product extender and that resembles regular ground beef, medium ground beef or lean ground beef, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, if the product is represented as being regular,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, if the product is represented as being medium, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, if the product is represented as being lean; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.079
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product, filler and meat product extender, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 13 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.085
Section.Text: Subject to sections B.14.086 to B.14.090 no person shall sell a simulated meat product unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has, in the rehydrated state,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a protein quality of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.086
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated meat product that resembles fresh sausage, unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than nine per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein quality of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.087
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated meat product that resembles cooked sausage, meat loaf, meat by-product loaf, meat roll, or luncheon meat, unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 11 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein quality of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.088
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated meat product that resembles potted meat, or potted meat by-product, unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than nine per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein quality of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.089
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated meat product that resembles regular ground beef, medium ground beef or lean ground beef, unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein quality of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, if the product is represented as being regular,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, if the product is represented as being medium, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, if the product is represented as being lean;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient, respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.090
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated meat product that resembles side bacon, unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 25 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein quality of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Subsection.Text: A food referred to in column 2 of Part 1 of the List of Contaminants and Other Adulterating Substances in Foods is adulterated if the corresponding substance referred to, by name or class, in column 1 is present in or on the food.

A food referred to in column 2 of Part 2 of the List of Contaminants and Other Adulterating Substances in Foods is adulterated if the corresponding substance referred to, by name or class, in column 1 is present in or on the food in an amount that exceeds the maximum level set out in column 3.

If a substance referred to, by name or class, in column 1 in Part 2 the List of Contaminants and Other Adulterating Substances in Foods is present in or on the corresponding food referred to in column 2, the food is, in respect of the presence of the substance, exempt from the application of paragraph 4(1)(a) of the Act if the amount of the substance does not exceed the maximum level set out in column 3.
Subsections (1) to (3) do not apply to a substance that is present in or on a food as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a food additive;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: a supplemental ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a pest control product as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act or its components or derivatives; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a veterinary drug or its metabolites.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a food is adulterated if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a pest control product as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act or its components or derivatives, for which no maximum residue limit has been specified under sections 9 or 10 of that Act for that food, are present in or on the food, singly or in any combination, in an amount exceeding 0.1 part per million; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an agricultural chemical or its components or derivatives, other than a pest control product as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act or its components or derivatives, are present in or on the food, singly or in any combination, in an amount exceeding 0.1 part per million.

Subsection.Text: A food is exempt from paragraph 4(1)(d) of the Act if the following agricultural chemicals, or their components or derivatives, are the only agricultural chemicals, or components or derivatives of agricultural chemicals, that are present in or on the food, singly or in any combination:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a fertilizer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an adjuvant or a carrier of an agricultural chemical;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an inorganic bromide salt;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: silicon dioxide;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: sulphur;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: viable spores of Bacillus thuringiensis Berliner; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: Kaolin.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (2) does not apply to a food if there is present in or on the food an agricultural chemical, or a component or derivative of that agricultural chemical, referred to in that subsection that is a pest control product as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act, or a component or derivative of that product, in respect of which a maximum residue limit has been specified under sections 9 or 10 of that Act for that food.

Section.Label: B.16.001
Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: dye, in relation to a synthetic colour, means the principal dye and associated subsidiary and isomeric dyes contained in the synthetic colour. (pigment)
synthetic colour means any organic food colour, other than caramel, that is produced by chemical synthesis and that has no counterpart in nature. (colorant synthétique)

Section.Label: B.16.002
Section.Text: A food is adulterated if a food additive is present in or on, or has been added to, the food.

Section.Label: B.16.003
Section.Text: Subject to sections B.16.005 and B.16.006, if a food additive set out in column 1 of the Lists of Permitted Food Additives is added to a corresponding food set out in column 3, that food does not have a poisonous or harmful substance in or on it for the purposes of paragraph 4(1)(a) of the Act — or is not adulterated for the purposes of paragraph 4(1)(d) of the Act — by reason only that the food additive is in or on it, or has been added to it, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food additive is obtained from any corresponding source set out in column 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the food additive is used for any corresponding purpose of use set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the food additive does not exceed

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any corresponding maximum level of use and any corresponding maximum level of residue set out in column 5, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount that is required to accomplish the purpose for which it is added, in the case where the words “Good Manufacturing Practice” appear in column 5 for that food additive in the food; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any other corresponding condition set out in column 5 is met.

Section.Label: B.16.004
Section.Text: If a food additive set out in column 1 of the Lists of Permitted Food Additives is combined with other ingredients to manufacture a pre-mix — other than a pre-mix set out in column 3 — the pre-mix is not adulterated for the purposes of paragraph 4(1)(d) of the Act by reason only that the food additive is in or on it if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pre-mix is intended solely for use as an ingredient in the manufacture of another food intended for sale to a consumer at the retail level or as an ingredient in the preparation of another food by a commercial or industrial enterprise or an institution;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the pre-mix is not intended for sale to a consumer at the retail level;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the food additive is obtained from any corresponding source set out in column 2; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the food additive is intended for any corresponding purpose of use set out in column 4 in relation to a corresponding food set out in column 3.

Section.Label: B.16.005
Section.Text: If a food that, under section B.16.003, does not contain a poisonous or harmful substance in or on it for the purposes of paragraph 4(1)(a) of the Act — or is not adulterated for the purposes of paragraph 4(1)(d) of the Act — is used as an ingredient in another food, that other food also does not contain a poisonous or harmful substance in or on it for the purposes of paragraph 4(1)(a) of the Act and is not adulterated for the purposes of paragraph 4(1)(d) of the Act by reason only that the food additive referred to in section B.16.003 is present in or on that other food, or has been added to the ingredient.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) to (4), sections B.16.003 and B.16.005 do not apply to an infant food.
Sections B.16.003 and B.16.005 apply to an infant food if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is a bakery product; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the food additive in or on the food is citric acid.

Subsection.Text: Section B.16.003 applies to an infant food if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the word “infant” is mentioned in column 3 of the Lists of Permitted Food Additives in relation to a food set out in that column; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is a human milk fortifier set out in column 3 of the Lists of Permitted Food Additives.

Subsection.Text: Section B.16.005 applies to an infant food if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it contains, as an ingredient, a food set out in column 3 of the Lists of Permitted Food Additives to which a corresponding food additive set out in column 1 has been added, and the use of that ingredient in that infant food is mentioned in column 3; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is an infant formula that contains, as an ingredient, a food set out in column 3 of the List of Permitted Food Enzymes that contains a corresponding food additive set out in column 1.

Subsection.Text: Sections B.16.003, B.16.005 and B.16.006 apply to the foods referred to in those sections if the other requirements of these Regulations that apply with respect to the food additive referred to in those sections are met.
Section B.16.004 applies to the pre-mix referred to in that section if the other requirements of these Regulations that apply with respect to the food additive referred to in that section are met.

Section.Label: B.16.008
Section.Text: No person shall sell any fresh fruit or vegetable, except grapes, to which sulphurous acid or any of its salts has been added and that is intended to be consumed raw.

Section.Label: B.16.009
Section.Text: No person shall sell a substance as a food additive unless the substance is set out in column 1 of the Lists of Permitted Food Additives.

Section.Label: B.16.010
Section.Text: No person shall sell vanilla extract or vanilla flavour for which a standard is set out in Volume 9 of the Food Compositional Standards Document to which a food colour has been added.

Subsection.Text: A food additive set out in column 1 of the Table of Food Additive Specifications must meet the specifications set out in column 2 for that food additive.

If a food additive is not listed in the Table of Food Additive Specifications, but specifications are set out for the food additive in one of the following publications, the food additive must meet the specifications set out for it in that publication:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Food Chemicals Codex, published by the United States Pharmacopeial Convention, including its supplements, as amended from time to time; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Combined Compendium of Food Additive Specifications, prepared by the Joint FAO/WHO Expert Committee on Food Additives and published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations on its website, as amended from time to time.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, the specifications referred to in subsection (1) may incorporate portions of the publications referred to in paragraphs (2)(a) and (b).
In this section, Table of Food Additive Specifications means the Table of Food Additive Specifications, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time.

Section.Label: B.16.012
Section.Text: If a food additive is a water soluble synthetic colour, its lake must be the calcium or aluminum salt of the synthetic colour adsorbed or precipitated on alumina.

Section.Label: B.16.013
Section.Text: A quantitative statement of the amount of each food additive present or directions for use that, if followed, will produce a food that does not contain these food additives in excess of the maximum levels of use or maximum levels of residue prescribed by these Regulations must be shown, grouped together with the list of ingredients, in respect of any substance or mixture of substances for use as a food additive.

Section.Label: B.16.014
Section.Text: A quantitative statement of the amount of each food additive referred to in section B.16.004 and directions for use that, if followed, will produce a corresponding food set out in column 3 of the Lists of Permitted Food Additives that does not contain these food additives in excess of the maximum levels of use or maximum levels of residue prescribed by these Regulations must be shown, grouped together with the list of ingredients, in respect of a pre-mix referred to in that section.

Section.Label: B.16.015
Section.Text: No person shall sell for household use in or on a food, a food colour preparation containing one or more synthetic colours unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Food Colour Preparation” appear on the principal display panel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a liquid food colour preparation, the container has a capacity of 60 mL or less and permits dropwise discharge only; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the food colour preparation contains less than 3% dye.

Subsection.Text: The label of a food that contains aspartame must carry a statement warning individuals with phenylketonuria that the food contains phenylalanine or a statement to the effect that aspartame contains phenylalanine.
The statement must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be shown in bold type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: appear, in respect of each linguistic version, immediately after the list of ingredients appearing in the same language, either on the same line as the last ingredient in the list or on the following line, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: appear on the same continuous surface as the list of ingredients and be shown in the same manner as that list is shown in accordance with subsection B.01.008.2(2).

Section.Label: B.16.017
Section.Text: The label of a food that contains polydextrose must indicate the amount of polydextrose, expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Subsection.Text: The label of a food that contains erythritol must carry a statement indicating the amount of erythritol, expressed in grams per serving of stated size, unless the label carries a nutrition facts table or supplemented food facts table.
The statement of the amount of erythritol must be grouped together with the statement of the amount of any other sugar alcohols and the amount of polydextrose.

Section.Label: B.16.019
Section.Text: The label of a table-top sweetener that contains aspartame, sucralose, acesulfame-potassium or neotame must carry a statement of the sweetness per serving, expressed in terms of the amount of sugar required to produce an equivalent degree of sweetness.

Subsection.Text: The label of cured beef, the cuts of which have been cured with pumping pickle that contains any proteolytic food enzyme, must carry, on the principal display panel, immediately preceding or following the common name, the statement “Tenderized with (naming the proteolytic food enzyme)”.
In this section, food enzyme means any enzyme that is a food additive used to catalyze a chemical reaction in a food.

No person shall sell, for table or general household use, salt for which a standard is set out in Volume 14 of the Food Compositional Standards Document unless the salt contains 0.01% potassium iodide.
The presence of iodide must be shown on the principal display panel.

Section.Label: B.17.004
Section.Text: Salt for table or general household use referred to in section B.17.003 may contain dextrose to stabilize potassium iodide.

Section.Label: B.18.005
Section.Text: No person shall sell liquid sugar or liquid invert sugar unless the label carries a statement of the percentage of its sugar or invert sugar content, as the case may be.

Section.Label: B.19.001
Section.Text: Vinegar shall be the liquid obtained by the acetous fermentation of an alcoholic liquid and shall contain not less than 4.1 per cent and not more than 12.3 per cent acetic acid.

Section.Label: B.19.002
Section.Text: The percentage of acetic acid by volume contained in vinegar must be shown on the principal display panel followed by the words “acetic acid”.

Section.Label: B.19.008
Section.Text: No person shall name any of the varieties of vinegar forming a blended vinegar unless the label of such blended vinegar carries a complete list of all the varieties of vinegar present, in descending order of proportionate content, based on acetic acid.

Section.Label: B.19.009
Section.Text: The maximum limits for the acetic acid content of a vinegar described in section B.19.001 do not apply to vinegar sold only for manufacturing use if the words “For Manufacturing Use Only” are shown on the principal display panel and upon all documents pertaining to such vinegar.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 21
Heading.TitleText: Marine and Fresh Water Animal Products

Subsection.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: filler means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: flour or meal prepared from grain or potato, but not from a legume,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: processed wheat flour containing an amount of reducing sugars, expressed as dextrose equivalent, of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: bakery products, except those containing a legume,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: milk powder, skim milk powder, buttermilk powder or whey powder, and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: starch; (agent de remplissage)

Definition.Text: marine and fresh water animal includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: fish,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: crustaceans, molluscs, other marine invertebrates,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: marine mammals, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: frogs; (animaux marins et animaux d’eau douce)

Definition.Text: meat means the clean and dressed flesh of crustaceans, molluscs, other marine invertebrates and marine mammals. (chair)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of sections B.21.005, B.21.008 and B.21.020, except the terms fish protein and fish binder, fish means clean and dressed fish.

Section.Label: B.21.005
Section.Text: Fish or fish preparations, except fish protein, and meat products or meat product preparations are adulterated if any mucous membranes, any organ or portion of the genital system or any other organ or portion of a marine or fresh water animal that is not commonly sold as food is present in or has been added to them.

Section.Label: B.21.008
Section.Text: No person shall sell filler or a fish binder represented for use in fish products either by label or in any advertisement unless the label carries adequate directions for use in accordance with the requirements of sections B.21.020 and B.21.021, as the case may be.

Section.Label: B.21.009
Section.Text: Powdered fully hydrogenated cottonseed oil may be applied as a release agent to the surface of marine and fresh water animal products in an amount not greater than 0.25% of the product.

Section.Label: B.21.020
Section.Text: No person shall sell prepared fish that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: more than that amount of filler, fish binder and other ingredients that is represented by an amount of reducing sugars, expressed as dextrose equivalent, that is set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: more than 70% moisture, in the case of prepared fish that contains filler.

Section.Label: B.21.021
Section.Text: No person shall sell prepared meat that contains more than that amount of filler, fish binder and other ingredients that is represented by an amount of reducing sugars, expressed as dextrose equivalent, that is set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4.

Section.Label: B.21.024
Section.Text: Despite section B.21.021, lobster paste must not contain more than 2% filler or fish binder.

Section.Label: B.21.025
Section.Text: No person shall sell marine and fresh water animals, or marine and fresh water animal products, that are packed in a container that has been sealed to exclude air and that are smoked or to which liquid smoke flavour or liquid smoke flavour concentrate has been added, unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the container has been heat-processed after sealing at a temperature and for a time sufficient to destroy all spores of the species Clostridium botulinum;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of the container contain an amount of salt not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of the container are customarily cooked before eating; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of the container are frozen and the principal display panel of the label of the container carries the statement “Keep Frozen Prior to Use” in the same size type used for the common name of the contents of the container.

Section.Label: B.21.027
Section.Text: No person shall sell fish protein unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it has a total protein content of at least 75%; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quality of the protein is not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 22
Heading.TitleText: Poultry, Poultry Meat, Their Preparations and Products

Section.Label: B.22.001
Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: poultry means any bird that is commonly used as food. (volaille)
poultry meat means poultry flesh, including the heart and gizzard. (viande de volaille)

poultry meat by-product means any part of poultry, other than poultry meat, commonly used as food, including the liver and skin but excluding the oesophagus, feet and head. (sous-produit de viande de volaille)

Section.Label: B.22.002
Section.Text: No person shall sell poultry meat or a poultry meat by-product unless it is clean, dressed and derived from eviscerated poultry that was healthy at the time of slaughter.

Section.Label: B.22.005
Section.Text: Poultry meat, poultry meat by-products, preparations of poultry meat or preparations of poultry meat by-products are adulterated if any organ or portion of poultry that is not commonly sold as food is present in or has been added to them.

Section.Label: B.22.009
Section.Text: No person shall sell

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any poultry intended for consumption as food if any preparation having oestrogenic activity has been administered to the poultry; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: poultry meat or poultry meat by-product that contains any residues of exogenous oestrogenic substances.

Section.Label: B.22.010
Section.Text: Powdered fully hydrogenated cottonseed oil may be applied as a release agent to the surface of poultry meat, poultry meat by-product, prepared poultry meat, prepared poultry meat by-product, extended poultry product and simulated poultry product in an amount not greater than 0.25% of the product.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell solid cut poultry meat to which food additives or water have been added unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the meat is cooked, it has a meat protein content of at least 12 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the meat is uncooked, it has a meat protein content of at least 10 per cent.

Subsection.Text: A bone or visible fat layer is excluded in calculating the meat protein content.

Section.Label: B.22.013
Section.Text: No person shall sell the whole or any part of a dressed poultry carcass that has been placed in a chilling tank containing fluids to which phosphate salts or lactate salts have been added.

Heading.TitleText: Prepared Poultry Meats, Prepared Poultry Meat By-Products

Section.Label: B.22.026
Section.Text: No person shall sell poultry, poultry meat or poultry meat by-product that has been barbecued, roasted or broiled and is ready for consumption unless the cooked poultry, poultry meat or poultry meat by-product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at all times

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has a temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has been stored at an ambient temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: carries on the principal display panel of the label a statement to the effect that the food must be stored at a temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher.

Section.Label: B.22.027
Section.Text: No person shall sell a poultry product extender unless that extender

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has, in the rehydrated state,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent; and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a protein quality of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to Division 14 in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.22.028
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of poultry product and poultry product extender, unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food has a total protein content of at least 16%;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the food has a protein quality of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the poultry product extender meets the requirements of paragraphs B.22.027(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.22.029
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated poultry product unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein quality of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 15 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to Division 14 in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.22.032
Section.Text: No person shall sell any product simulating whole egg unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is made from liquid, dried or frozen egg albumen or mixtures thereof;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein quality of not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, contains, per 100 grams on a ready-to-use basis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 50 milligrams calcium,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: 2.3 milligrams iron,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: 1.5 milligrams zinc,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: 130 milligrams potassium,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: 1000 International Units Vitamin A,

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: 0.10 milligram thiamine,

Clause.Label: (G)
Clause.Text: 0.30 milligram riboflavin,

Clause.Label: (H)
Clause.Text: 3.60 milligrams niacin,

Clause.Label: (I)
Clause.Text: 1.60 milligrams pantothenic acid,

Clause.Label: (J)
Clause.Text: 0.20 milligram Vitamin B6′,

Clause.Label: (K)
Clause.Text: 0.50 microgram Vitamin B12′,

Clause.Label: (L)
Clause.Text: 0.02 milligram folic acid, and

Clause.Label: (M)
Clause.Text: 2.0 International Units alpha tocopherol, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 3 milligrams cholesterol;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has a calcium to phosphorous ratio of not less than one part calcium to four parts phosphorous; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: contains in the total fat of any fat or oil used not less than 40 per cent cis-cis methylene interrupted polyunsaturated fatty acids and not more than 20 per cent saturated fatty acids.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use a common name for a food identified in subsection (2.1) that has been subjected to a process, other than a process referred to in Division 19.4 of Volume 19 of the Food Compositional Standards Document, if that process results in a decrease in the amount of a vitamin or mineral nutrient that was present in the food before processing in an amount equal to at least 10% of the weighted recommended nutrient intake per 100 g, unless the amount of the vitamin or mineral nutrient is restored to the amount that was present before processing.

Despite sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009, a person may sell the foods identified in subsection (2.1) to which a vitamin or mineral nutrient referred to in column II of item 27 of the table to section D.03.002 has been added to restore the vitamin or mineral nutrient to the amount that was present in the food before processing.
Subsection (2) applies to the following foods for which a standard is set out in Volume 19 of the Food Compositional Standards Document:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: liquid whole egg;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: dried whole egg;
