Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: frozen whole egg;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: liquid yolk;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: dried yolk;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: frozen yolk;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: liquid egg-white;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: dried egg-white;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: frozen egg-white;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: liquid whole egg mix;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: dried whole egg mix;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: frozen whole egg mix;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: liquid yolk mix;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: dried yolk mix; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: frozen yolk mix.

Subsection.Text: In this section, weighted recommended nutrient intake has the same meaning as in subsection D.01.001(1).

Section.Label: B.23.001
Section.Text: No person shall sell any food in a package that may yield to its contents any substance that may be injurious to the health of a consumer of the food.

Section.Label: B.23.002
Section.Text: Subject to section B.23.003 no person shall sell any food in a package that has been manufactured from a polyvinyl chloride formulation containing an octyltin chemical.

Section.Label: B.23.003
Section.Text: A person may sell food, other than milk, skim milk, partly skimmed milk, sterilized milk, malt beverages and carbonated non-alcoholic beverage products, in a package that has been manufactured from a polyvinyl chloride formulation containing any or all of the octyltin chemicals, namely, di(n-octyl)tin S,S′-bis(isooctylmercaptoacetate), di(n-octyl)tin maleate polymer and (n-octyl)tin S,S′,S″-tris(isooctylmercaptoacetate) if the proportion of such chemicals, either singly or in combination, does not exceed a total of three per cent of the resin, and the food in contact with the package contains not more than one part per million total octyltin.

Subsection.Text: Di (n-octyl)tin S,S′-bis (isooctylmercaptoacetate) shall be the octyltin chemical made from di (n-octyl)tin dichloride and shall contain 15.1 to 16.4 per cent of tin and 8.1 to 8.9 per cent of mercapto sulfur.

For the purposes of this Division, di (n-octyl)tin dichloride shall be the chemical having an organotin composition of not less than 95 per cent di (n-octyl)tin dichloride and shall contain no more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: five per cent total of n-octyltin trichloride or tri(n-octyl)tin chloride or both;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 0.2 per cent total of other eight (8) carbon isomeric alkyltin derivatives; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 0.1 per cent total of the higher and lower homologous alkyltin derivatives.

Section.Label: B.23.005
Section.Text: Di(n-octyl)tin maleate polymer shall be the octyltin chemical made from di(n-octyl)tin dichloride and shall have the formula ((C8H17)2 SnC4H2O4)n (where n is between 2 and 4 inclusive), and a saponification number of 225 to 255, and shall contain 25.2 to 26.6 per cent of tin.

Subsection.Text: (n-octyl)tin S,S′,S″-tris (isooctylmercaptoacetate), being an octyltin chemical having the formula n-C8H17Sn(SCH2CO2C8H17)3, shall be made from (n-octyl)tin trichloride and shall contain 13.4 to 14.8 per cent of tin and 10.9 to 11.9 per cent of mercapto sulfur.
For the purposes of this Division, (n-octyl)tin trichloride shall be the chemical having an organotin composition of not less than 95 per cent (n-octyl)tin trichloride and shall contain not more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: five per cent total of di(n-octyl)tin dichloride, tri(n-octyl)tin chloride or the higher (more than eight (8) carbons) alkyltin chlorides or any combination of the foregoing;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 0.2 per cent total of alkyltin derivatives; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 0.1 per cent of the lower (less than eight carbons) homologous alkyltin derivatives.

Section.Label: B.23.007
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food in a package that may transfer to the food any amount of vinyl chloride or acrylonitrile, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4 of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food.

Section.Label: B.24.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: expiration date means, in respect of a formulated liquid diet, a food represented for use in a very low-energy diet, a meal replacement or a nutritional supplement, the date

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: after which the manufacturer does not recommend that it be consumed, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: up to which it maintains its microbiological and physical stability and the nutrient content declared on the label; (date limite d’utilisation)

Definition.Text: food for special dietary use means food that has been specially processed or formulated to meet the particular requirements of a person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in whom a physical or physiological condition exists as a result of a disease, disorder or injury, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for whom a particular effect, including but not limited to weight loss, is to be obtained by a controlled intake of foods; (aliment à usage diététique spécial)

Definition.Text: formulated liquid diet means a food that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is sold for consumption in liquid form, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is sold or represented as a nutritionally complete diet for oral or tube feeding of a person described in paragraph (a) of the definition “food for special dietary use”; (préparation pour régime liquide)

Definition.Text: hospital means a facility

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is licensed, approved or designated as a hospital by a province, in accordance with the laws of the province, to provide care or treatment to persons suffering from any form of disease or illness, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is owned or operated by the government of Canada or of a province and that provides health services; (hôpital)

Definition.Text: major change means, in respect of a food that is represented for use in a very low energy diet, any change in any of the following, where the manufacturer’s experience or generally accepted theory would predict an adverse effect on the levels or availability of nutrients in, the microbiological or chemical safety of or the safe use of the food:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an ingredient or the amount of an ingredient in the food,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturing process or the packaging of the food, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for the preparation and use of the food; (changement majeur)

Definition.Text: pharmacist means a person who is registered and entitled under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy and who is practising pharmacy under those laws in that province; (pharmacien)
physician means a person who is registered and entitled under the laws of a province to practise medicine and who is practicing medicine under those laws in that province; (médecin)
target body weight means the anticipated body weight at the end of the weight reduction diet, as determined by the physician before the weight reduction diet begins; (poids corporel cible)
very low energy diet means a diet for weight reduction that provides less than 900 kilocalories per day when followed as directed. (régime à très faible teneur en énergie)

Subsection.Text: No person shall label, package, sell or advertise a food in a manner likely to create an impression that it is a food for special dietary use unless the food is

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a formulated liquid diet that meets the requirements contained in sections B.24.101 and B.24.102;

Paragraph.Label: (f.1)
Paragraph.Text: a meal replacement for special dietary use that meets the requirements contained in section B.24.200;

Paragraph.Label: (f.2)
Paragraph.Text: a nutritional supplement that meets the requirements contained in section B.24.201;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a gluten-free food that meets the requirements contained in section B.24.018;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: represented for protein-restricted diets;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: represented for low (naming the amino acid) diets; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a food represented for use in a very low energy diet, where the food meets the requirements contained in section B.24.303.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), a person may label, package, sell or advertise a food in a manner likely to create an impression that it is a food for special dietary use if its label carries a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims, in accordance with section B.01.503, in respect of any of the following subjects set out in column 1:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “free of energy”, set out in item 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “low in energy”, set out in item 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “free of sodium or salt”, set out in item 31;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “low in sodium or salt”, set out in item 32; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “free of sugars”, set out in item 37.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a human milk fortifier or human milk substitute as defined in section B.25.001.
No person shall label, package, sell or advertise a food in a manner likely to create an impression that it is for use in a weight reduction diet unless that food is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a meal replacement that meets the compositional requirements contained in section B.24.200;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a prepackaged meal;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a food sold by a weight reduction clinic to clients of the clinic for use in a weight reduction program supervised by the staff of the clinic; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a food represented for use in a very low-energy diet that meets the compositional requirements contained in section B.24.303.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise permitted by these Regulations, no person shall label, package, sell or advertise a food as “dietetic” or “diet”, or use those words as part of the brand name of the food, unless its label carries a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims, in accordance with section B.01.503, in respect of any of the following subjects set out in column 1:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “free of energy”, set out in item 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “low in energy”, set out in item 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in energy”, set out in item 3;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “lower in energy”, set out in item 4; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “free of sugars”, set out in item 37.

Subsection.Text: Where the manufacturer of a formulated liquid diet, a meal replacement or a food represented for use in a very low energy diet is requested in writing by the Minister to submit, on or before a specified day, evidence with respect to that product, the manufacturer shall make no further sales of that product after that day unless the manufacturer has submitted the evidence requested.
If the Minister determines that the evidence submitted by a manufacturer under subsection (1) is not sufficient, he or she shall so notify the manufacturer in writing.

Where, pursuant to subsection (2), a manufacturer is notified that the evidence with respect to a formulated liquid diet, a meal replacement or a food represented for use in a very low energy diet is not sufficient, the manufacturer shall make no further sales of that product unless the manufacturer submits further evidence and is notified in writing by the Minister that the further evidence is sufficient.

A reference in this section to evidence with respect to a formulated liquid diet, a meal replacement or a food represented for use in a very low energy diet means evidence to establish that the food is nutritionally adequate to be used as the sole source of nutrition in meeting the nutritional needs of a person for whom it is intended, when the food is consumed in accordance with the directions for use.

Section.Label: B.24.018
Section.Text: It is prohibited to label, package, sell or advertise a food in a manner likely to create an impression that it is a gluten-free food if the food contains any gluten protein or modified gluten protein, including any gluten protein fraction, referred to in the definition gluten in subsection B.01.010.1(1).

Section.Label: B.24.100
Section.Text: No person shall advertise a formulated liquid diet to the general public.

Section.Label: B.24.101
Section.Text: No person shall sell a formulated liquid diet unless the food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if sold ready to serve, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if not sold ready to serve, when diluted with water, milk, or water and milk,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is a complete substitute for the total diet in meeting the nutritional requirements of a person.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), a formulated liquid diet shall contain, when ready to serve,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at least 20 g of protein, the quality of which is not less than that set out in column 3 for that item of the Table of Chemical, Physical and Nutritional Characteristics of Food, as determined by the corresponding method set out in column 4, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: such an amount and quality of protein, including those proteins to which amino acids are added, that, when the quality of the protein is expressed as a fraction of the quality of casein,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the fraction will not be less than 85/100, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the result obtained by multiplying the fraction by the gram weight of the protein will not be less than 20; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than one gram linoleic acid in the form of a glyceride.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009, a formulated liquid diet shall contain, when ready to serve, the vitamins and minerals named in Column I of the table to this section in amounts,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the recommended intake of the food is 2,500 kilocalories per day or less, not less than the amounts set out in Column II and not more than the amounts, if any, set out in Column III of that table opposite those vitamins and minerals; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the recommended intake of the food is greater than 2,500 kilocalories per day, not less than the amounts set out in Column IV and not more than the amounts, if any, set out in Column V of the table opposite those vitamins and minerals.

Subsection.Text: The amounts of the nutrients specified in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) and subsection (2) shall be calculated

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: per 1,000 available kilocalories, where the recommended intake of the food is 2,500 kilocalories per day or less; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: per 1,500 available kilocalories, where recommended intake of the food is greater than 2,500 kilocalories per day.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(a) does not apply to a formulated liquid diet represented as being for a protein restricted diet or a low (named amino acid) diet.

Section.Label: B.24.103
Section.Text: The label of a formulated liquid diet shall carry the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the food is intended to be consumed orally or by tube feeding;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the energy value of the food, expressed in Calories

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content in the food of protein or protein equivalent, fat, linoleic acid, available carbohydrate and, where present, crude fibre, expressed in grams

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content of vitamins and mineral nutrients that are listed in the table to section B.24.102, expressed in International Units, milligrams or micrograms

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content of any vitamin or mineral nutrient that is not listed in the table to section B.24.102, expressed in milligrams or micrograms

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: complete directions for the preparation and use of the food and for its storage after the container has been opened; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the formulated liquid diet.

Heading.TitleText: Meal Replacements, Nutritional Supplements, Prepackaged Meals and Foods Sold by Weight Reduction Clinics

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise a meal replacement unless, when in a ready-to-serve form or when prepared according to directions for use, with water, milk, partially skim milk or skim milk, or a combination thereof, it meets the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the meal replacement provides a minimum of 225 kcal or 945 kJ per serving;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 15 per cent and not more than 40 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from its protein content, except that a meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet shall derive not less than 20 per cent of its available energy from its protein content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2), not more than 35 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from its fat content;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 3.0 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from linoleic acid in the form of a glyceride and not less than 0.5 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from n-3 linolenic acid in the form of a glyceride, and the ratio of linoleic acid to n-3 linolenic acid is not less than 4 to 1 and not more than 10 to 1;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the proteins present in the meal replacement are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality equivalent to that of casein, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality and in an amount sufficient to yield a result of not less than 15 per cent, or not less than 20 per cent in the case of a meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet, when the nutritional quality of those proteins is divided by the nutritional quality of casein and multiplied by the percentage of energy available from the proteins present in the meal replacement; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each serving of the meal replacement contains each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in column I of the table to this section

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsection (3), in an amount not less than the minimum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column II of the table, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsections (4) and (5), in an amount that, including overage, is not more than the maximum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column III of the table.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise a meal replacement that is represented as a replacement for all daily meals unless, when in a ready-to-serve form or when prepared according to directions for use, with water, milk, partially skim milk or skim milk, or a combination thereof, it meets the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 30 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from its fat content; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 10 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from its saturated fatty acid content.

Subsection.Text: The minimum amount required under subparagraph (1)(f)(i) for selenium, chromium or molybdenum does not apply in respect of a meal replacement that is not represented as a replacement for all daily meals and that does not contain added selenium, chromium or molybdenum, as the case may be.
A vitamin or mineral nutrient that is not an added ingredient in the meal replacement shall not be taken into account for the purposes of subparagraph (1)(f)(ii).
The maximum amount shown for vitamin C in column III of the table to this section does not include overage.
No person shall sell or advertise a nutritional supplement that contains less than 225 kcal or 945 kJ per serving, unless it meets the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nutritional supplement contains at least 150 kcal or 630 kJ per serving;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 15 per cent and no more than 40 per cent of the energy available from the nutritional supplement is derived from its protein content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the proteins present in the nutritional supplement are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality equivalent to that of casein, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality and in an amount sufficient to yield a result of not less than 15 per cent when the nutritional quality of those proteins is divided by the nutritional quality of casein and multiplied by the percentage of energy available from the proteins present in the nutritional supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the nutritional supplement contains, per 100 kcal or 420 kJ, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in column I of the table to this section

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsection (3), in an amount not less than the minimum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column II of the table, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsections (4) and (5), in an amount that, including overage, is not more than the maximum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column III of the table.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise a nutritional supplement that provides 225 kcal or 945 kJ, or more, per serving unless, when in a ready-to-serve form or when prepared according to directions for use, with water, milk, partially skim milk, skim milk, or a combination thereof, it meets the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nutritional supplement provides at least 225 kcal or 945 kJ per serving;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 35 per cent of the energy available from the nutritional supplement is derived from its fat content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 3.0 per cent of the energy available from the nutritional supplement is derived from linoleic acid in the form of a glyceride and not less than 0.5 per cent of the energy available from the nutritional supplement is derived from n-3 linolenic acid in the form of a glyceride, and the ratio of linoleic acid to n-3 linolenic acid is not less than 4 to 1 and not more than 10 to 1;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 15 per cent and not more than 40 per cent of the energy available from the nutritional supplement is derived from its protein content;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the proteins present in the nutritional supplement are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality equivalent to that of casein, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality and in an amount sufficient to yield a result of not less than 15 per cent when the nutritional quality of those proteins is divided by the nutritional quality of casein and multiplied by the percentage of energy available from the proteins present in the nutritional supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the nutritional supplement contains, per 100 kcal or 420 kJ, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in column I of the table to this section

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsection (3), in an amount not less than the minimum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column II of the table, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsections (4) and (5), in an amount that, including overage, is not more than the maximum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column III of the table.

Subsection.Text: The minimum amount required under subparagraph (1)(d)(i) or (2)(f)(i) for selenium, chromium or molybdenum does not apply in respect of a nutritional supplement that does not contain added selenium, chromium or molybdenum, as the case may be.
A vitamin or mineral nutrient that is not an added ingredient in the nutritional supplement shall not be taken into account for the purposes of subparagraphs (1)(d)(ii) and (2)(f)(ii).
The maximum amount shown for vitamin C in column III of the table to this section does not include overage.

row.entry: Minimum Amount per Available 100 Kcal or 420 KJ
Maximum Amount per Available 100 Kcal or 420 KJ

Section.Label: B.24.202
Section.Text: The label of a meal replacement or nutritional supplement shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: show the following information per serving of stated size and per stated quantity of food, when prepared according to the directions for use:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the energy value of the food, expressed in Calories (Calories or Cal) and kilojoules (kilojoules or kJ),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the protein, fat, linoleic acid, n-3 linolenic acid, saturated fatty acid and carbohydrate contents of the food, expressed in grams,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the vitamin A, vitamin D, vitamin E, vitamin C, thiamin or vitamin B1, riboflavin or vitamin B2, niacin, vitamin B6, vitamin B12, folate and pantothenic acid or pantothenate contents of the food, expressed

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in the case of a meal replacement, as a percentage of the daily value specified in column 4 of Part 2 of the Table of Daily Values for that vitamin, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in the case of a nutritional supplement, in the applicable unit referred to in subsection D.01.003(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the calcium, phosphorus, iron, iodide, magnesium and zinc contents of the food, expressed

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in the case of a meal replacement, as a percentage of the daily value specified in column 4 of Part 2 of the Table of Daily Values, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in the case of a nutritional supplement, in milligrams for calcium, phosphorus, iron, magnesium and zinc and in micrograms for iodide,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the copper, potassium, sodium and manganese contents of the food, expressed in milligrams, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the biotin, selenium, chromium and molybdenum contents of the food, expressed in micrograms;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a meal replacement or a nutritional supplement to which milk, partially skim milk or skim milk is to be added, carry a statement that the nutrient content of the food has been determined taking into consideration the milk, partially skim milk or skim milk that will be added according to the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a meal replacement that is sold or advertised as a replacement for all daily meals in a weight reduction diet, include directions for use that would result in a daily energy intake of at least 900 kcal or 3 780 kJ;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: include the expiration date of the meal replacement or nutritional supplement;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet, carry the statement “USEFUL IN WEIGHT REDUCTION ONLY AS PART OF AN ENERGY-REDUCED DIET / UTILE POUR PERDRE DU POIDS SEULEMENT DANS LE CADRE D’UN RÉGIME À TENEUR RÉDUITE EN ÉNERGIE” prominently displayed on the principal display panel; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet that is not represented as a replacement for all daily meals in a diet, include the information required under section B.24.204.

Section.Label: B.24.203
Section.Text: The label of a prepackaged meal for use in a weight reduction diet or of a food to be sold in a weight reduction clinic shall

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: carry the statement “USEFUL IN WEIGHT REDUCTION ONLY AS PART OF AN ENERGY-REDUCED DIET / UTILE POUR PERDRE DU POIDS SEULEMENT DANS LE CADRE D’UN RÉGIME À TENEUR RÉDUITE EN ÉNERGIE” prominently displayed on the principal display panel; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: include the information required under section B.24.204.

Section.Label: B.24.204
Section.Text: The label of a prepackaged meal, or of a meal replacement other than a meal replacement represented as a replacement for all daily meals in a diet, that is packaged, sold or advertised for use in a weight reduction diet, or of a food to be sold in a weight reduction clinic, shall include, in the directions for use, a sample seven-day menu in which the prepackaged meal, meal replacement or food is used and which meets the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: each daily meal includes a minimum of one serving, as described in Canada’s Food Guide to Healthy Eating, published in 1992 by the Department of Supply and Services by authority of the Minister of National Health and Welfare, of one food from each of the following groups:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: milk, milk products or their alternatives,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: meat and meat alternatives,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: bread and grain products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: vegetables and fruit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the daily energy intake provided for is not less than 1 200 kcal or 5 040 kJ;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 30 per cent of the total daily energy intake of the seven-day menu is derived from its fat content and not more than 10 per cent of the total daily energy intake of the menu is derived from its saturated fatty acid content;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the mean daily intake of each nutrient listed in column I of the table to this section is not less than the amount shown in column II, in the case of a menu recommended for men, or in column III, in the case of a menu recommended for women; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the menu does not include any reference to vitamin or mineral supplements.

Subsection.Text: No person shall label, package, sell or advertise a prepackaged meal or meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet, or a food to be sold in a weight reduction clinic, in a manner likely to create an impression that consumption of a vitamin or mineral supplement must be part of a weight reduction diet.

No person shall, on a label of or in an advertisement for a prepackaged meal or meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet, or a food to be sold in a weight reduction clinic, make any direct or indirect reference to a vitamin or mineral supplement.

Every person who advertises a prepackaged meal or meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet, or a food to be sold in a weight reduction clinic, shall include in the advertisement the statement “USEFUL IN WEIGHT REDUCTION ONLY AS PART OF AN ENERGY-REDUCED DIET / UTILE POUR PERDRE DU POIDS SEULEMENT DANS LE CADRE D’UN RÉGIME À TENEUR RÉDUITE EN ÉNERGIE”.

Heading.TitleText: Foods Represented for Use in Very Low Energy Diets

Section.Label: B.24.300
Section.Text: No person shall advertise to the general public a food represented for use in a very low energy diet.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell, without a written order from a physician, a food represented for use in a very low energy diet.
Notwithstanding subsection (1), a person may sell, without a written order from a physician, a food represented for use in a very low energy diet to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a physician;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a wholesale druggist;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital.

Subsection.Text: No person other than a pharmacist shall sell to the general public a food represented for use in a very low energy diet.

Section.Label: B.24.302
Section.Text: A pharmacist shall retain the written order of a physician for a food represented for use in a very low energy diet for at least two years after the date on which the order is filled.

Subsection.Text: A food represented for use in a very low energy diet, whether ready to serve or diluted with water according to the manufacturer’s directions, shall provide, per daily allowance recommended by the manufacturer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 60 g of protein of a nutritional quality equivalent to that of casein, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: such an amount and quality of protein that, when the quality of the protein is expressed as a fraction of the quality of casein,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the fraction is not less than 85/100, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the product obtained by multiplying the fraction by the gram weight of the protein is not less than 60;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each vitamin or mineral nutrient named in column I of an item of the table to this subsection, in an amount not less than the minimum amount per day set out in column II of that item; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any nutritive substance added to the food other than those referred to in paragraph (a) or (b), in an amount that is appropriate for the purpose of the substance in the food as determined from clinical trials.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding paragraph (1)(a), a food represented for use in a very low energy diet shall be accompanied by directions for use that when followed would result in the daily intake by a person of at least 1.2 g of protein per kilogram target body weight.

Section.Label: B.24.304
Section.Text: The label of a food represented for use in a very low energy diet shall carry the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the energy value of the food, expressed in Calories (Calories or Cal) and kilojoules (kilojoules or kJ) per 100 g or 100 mL of the food as offered for sale and per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content in the food of protein, fat, carbohydrate and, where present, fibre expressed in grams per 100 g or 100 mL of the food as offered for sale and per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content in the food of all those vitamins and mineral nutrients that are listed in the table to subsection B.24.303(1) expressed in milligrams, in the case of vitamin A expressed in retinol equivalents (RE), per 100 g or 100 mL of the food as offered for sale and per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content in the food of any other nutritive substance added to the food in an amount described in paragraph B.24.303(1)(c), expressed in milligrams or in grams per 100 g or 100 mL of the food as offered for sale and per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the statement “USE ONLY UNDER MEDICAL SUPERVISION” prominently displayed on the principal display panel;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: directions for use of the food, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the rationale for the use of the food,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: criteria to be used for the selection of the persons to whom the food may be prescribed,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: instructions for consultation with and evaluation of the patient and patient follow-up, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement concerning adequate precautions and contra-indications;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: directions for the preparation of the food, and storage instructions for the food before and after the container has been opened; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the food.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food represented for use in a very low energy diet unless the manufacturer, at least 90 days before the sale or advertisement, notifies the Minister in writing of the intention to sell the food or advertise the food for sale.
The notification referred to in subsection (1) shall be signed by the manufacturer and shall include, in respect of the food represented for use in a low energy diet, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name under which the food is to be sold or advertised for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the principal place of business of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of each establishment in which the food is manufactured;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the ingredients of the food, stated quantitatively;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the specifications for nutrient, microbiological and physical quality for each ingredient and for the food;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: details of quality control procedures respecting the testing of the ingredients and of the food;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: details of the manufacturing process and quality control procedures used throughout the process;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the results of tests carried out to determine the expiration date of the food;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the food meets the nutritional requirements, other than energy requirements, of a person for whom it is intended, when the food is consumed in accordance with the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the type of packaging to be used;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the written text of all labels, including package inserts, to be used in connection with the food; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the notification and the date of signature.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsection (1), a person may sell or advertise for sale a food represented for use in a very low energy diet, if the Minister, after having been notified by the manufacturer pursuant to that subsection, has informed the manufacturer in writing that the notification meets the requirements of subsection (2).

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food represented for use in a very low energy diet that has undergone a major change, unless the manufacturer, at least 90 days before the sale or advertisement, notifies the Minister in writing of the intention to sell or advertise for sale the food that has undergone the major change.

The notification referred to in subsection (1) shall be signed by the manufacturer and shall include, in respect of the food represented for use in a very low energy diet that has undergone a major change, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name under which the food is to be sold or advertised for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the principal place of business of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the major change;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the food meets the nutritional requirements, other than energy requirements, of a person for whom it is intended, when the food is consumed in accordance with the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the major change has no adverse effect on the food or its use;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the written text of all labels, including package inserts, to be used in connection with the food; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the notification and the date of signature.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsection (1), a person may sell or advertise for sale a food represented for use in a very low energy diet that has undergone a major change, if the Minister, after having been notified by the manufacturer pursuant to that subsection, has informed the manufacturer in writing that the notification meets the requirements of subsection (2).

Section.Label: B.25.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: expiration date means, in respect of a human milk fortifier or human milk substitute, the date

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: after which the manufacturer does not recommend that it be consumed, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: up to which it maintains its microbiological and physical stability and the nutrient content declared on the label; (date limite d’utilisation)

Definition.Text: human milk fortifier means a food that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: includes at least one added vitamin, mineral nutrient or amino acid, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is labelled or advertised as intended to be added to human milk to increase its nutritional value in order to meet the particular requirements of an infant in whom a physical or physiological condition exists as a result of a disease, disorder or abnormal physical state; (fortifiant pour lait humain)

Definition.Text: human milk substitute means any food that is labelled or advertised

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for use as a partial or total replacement for human milk and as intended for consumption by infants, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for use as an ingredient in a food referred to in paragraph (a); (succédané de lait humain)

Definition.Text: junior (naming a food) means the named food where it contains particles of a size to encourage chewing by infants, but may be readily swallowed by infants without chewing; ((nom d’un aliment) pour enfants en bas âge)

major change means, in respect of a human milk fortifier or human milk substitute, any change of an ingredient, the amount of an ingredient or the processing or packaging of the human milk fortifier or human milk substitute where the manufacturer’s experience or generally accepted theory would predict an adverse effect on the levels or availability of nutrients in, or the microbiological or chemical safety of, the human milk fortifier or human milk substitute; (changement majeur)
new human milk substitute means a human milk substitute that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: manufactured for the first time,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sold in Canada for the first time, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: manufactured by a person who manufactures it for the first time; (succédané de lait humain nouveau)

Definition.Text: strained (naming a food) means the named food where it is of a generally uniform particle size that does not require and does not encourage chewing by infants before being swallowed. ((nom d’un aliment) en purée ou tamisé)

Section.Label: B.25.002
Section.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale an infant food that is set out in Column I of an item of Table I to this Division and contains more than the amount of sodium set out in Column II of that item.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell infant food that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: strained fruit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fruit juice,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fruit drink, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: cereal,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: if sodium chloride has been added to that food.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to strained desserts containing any of the foods mentioned in paragraphs (1)(a) to (d).

Section.Label: B.25.010
Section.Text: Subject to section B.25.013, it is prohibited to sell or advertise for sale a human milk fortifier unless the Minister has notified the manufacturer under paragraph B.25.012(1)(a) or (3)(a) that those activities are authorized.

Section.Label: B.25.011
Section.Text: An application to sell or advertise for sale a human milk fortifier shall be submitted by the manufacturer and signed by the manufacturer or an individual authorized to sign on their behalf and shall include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name and product name under which the human milk fortifier will be sold or advertised for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s name and address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of each establishment in which the human milk fortifier is manufactured;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all of the human milk fortifier’s ingredients, stated quantitatively;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the scientific rationale for the formulation of the human milk fortifier;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the specifications for nutrient, microbiological and physical quality for the human milk fortifier and its ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: details of the quality control procedures respecting the testing of the human milk fortifier and its ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: details of the human milk fortifier’s manufacturing process and the quality control procedures used throughout the process;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the results of the tests carried out to determine the expiration date of the human milk fortifier;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence that establishes that the human milk fortifier is nutritionally adequate to promote acceptable growth and development in infants when consumed in accordance with the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the type of packaging to be used for the human milk fortifier;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: directions for use for the human milk fortifier;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the written text of all labels, including package inserts, to be used in connection with the human milk fortifier; and

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the individual who signed the application and the date of signature.

Subsection.Text: After having conducted an assessment of the information submitted under section B.25.011 and any other information related to the assessment of the application, the Minister shall notify the manufacturer in writing that the sale or advertisement for sale of the human milk fortifier that is the subject of the application

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is authorized if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the application meets the requirements set out in section B.25.011, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information is sufficient to establish the safety of the human milk fortifier; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not authorized, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: If the conditions set out in paragraph (1)(a) are not satisfied, the Minister may request the manufacturer to submit in writing the additional information that is necessary to satisfy the conditions.

After having conducted an assessment of any additional information that is submitted by the manufacturer, the Minister shall notify the manufacturer in writing that the sale or advertisement for sale of the human milk fortifier

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is authorized, if the conditions set out in paragraph (1)(a) are satisfied; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not authorized, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraphs (1)(a) and (3)(a), the Minister shall not authorize the sale or advertisement for sale of the human milk fortifier if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that any of the information that the manufacturer has submitted is false, misleading or deceptive.

Section.Label: B.25.013
Section.Text: The prohibition set out in section B.25.010 does not apply in respect of a human milk fortifier that is set out in the List of Human Milk Fortifiers Sold in Canada as of March 25, 2021 that is published on a Government of Canada website if, on or before April 30, 2022,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer of the human milk fortifier submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an attestation signed and dated by the manufacturer, or by an individual authorized to sign on their behalf, confirming that the human milk fortifier has not undergone a major change since the date set out in the List in connection with the human milk fortifier, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the written text of all labels, including package inserts, that will be required to be used in connection with the human milk fortifier after the second anniversary of the day on which section B.25.020 comes into force; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister notifies the manufacturer under subsection B.25.014(1) or paragraph B.25.014(3)(a) that they are authorized to continue to sell or advertise for sale the human milk fortifier.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall notify the manufacturer in writing that they are authorized to continue to sell or advertise for sale the human milk fortifier if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer has submitted the information referred to in paragraph B.25.013(a) in sufficient time for the Minister to assess the information before April 30, 2022; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the written text of the labels submitted under subparagraph B.25.013(a)(ii) satisfies the relevant requirements of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: If the information that is submitted is insufficient to satisfy the conditions set out in subsection (1), the Minister may request the manufacturer to submit in writing the additional information that is necessary to satisfy the conditions.
After having conducted an assessment of any additional information that is submitted by the manufacturer, the Minister shall notify the manufacturer in writing that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they are authorized to continue to sell or advertise for sale the human milk fortifier, if the conditions set out in subsection (1) are satisfied; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they are not authorized to continue to sell or advertise for sale the human milk fortifier, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited to sell or advertise for sale a human milk fortifier that has undergone a major change unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer of the human milk fortifier submits to the Minister an application in accordance with subsection (2) that reflects the major change; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister notifies the manufacturer under paragraph B.25.016(1)(a) or (3)(a) that the sale or advertisement for sale of the human milk fortifier is authorized.

Subsection.Text: The application shall be signed by the manufacturer or an individual authorized to sign on their behalf and shall include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name and product name under which the human milk fortifier will be sold or advertised for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s name and address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of, and the rationale for, the major change;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence that establishes that the human milk fortifier is nutritionally adequate to promote acceptable growth and development in infants when consumed in accordance with the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence that establishes that the major change has had no adverse effect on the human milk fortifier;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the written text of all labels, including package inserts, to be used in connection with the human milk fortifier; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the individual who signed the application and the date of signature.

Subsection.Text: After having conducted an assessment of the information submitted under subsection B.25.015(2) and any other information related to the assessment of the application, the Minister shall notify the manufacturer in writing that the sale or advertisement for sale of the human milk fortifier that is the subject of the application

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is authorized if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the application meets the requirements set out in subsection B.25.015(2), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information is sufficient to establish the safety of the human milk fortifier; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not authorized, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: If the conditions set out in paragraph (1)(a) are not satisfied, the Minister may request the manufacturer to submit in writing the additional information that is necessary to satisfy the conditions.

After having conducted an assessment of any additional information that is submitted by the manufacturer, the Minister shall notify the manufacturer in writing that the sale or advertisement for sale of the human milk fortifier

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is authorized, if the conditions set out in paragraph (1)(a) are satisfied; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not authorized, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraphs (1)(a) and (3)(a), the Minister shall not authorize the sale or advertisement for sale of the human milk fortifier if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that any of the information that the manufacturer has submitted is false, misleading or deceptive.

Section.Label: B.25.017
Section.Text: A manufacturer named in the List of Human Milk Fortifiers Sold in Canada as of March 25, 2021 referred to in section B.25.013 is not entitled to submit an application referred to in paragraph B.25.015(1)(a) in respect of a human milk fortifier set out in the List unless the Minister has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: notified them under paragraph B.25.012(1)(a) or (3)(a) that the sale or advertisement for sale of the human milk fortifier is authorized; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notified them under subsection B.25.014(1) or paragraph B.25.014(3)(a) that they are authorized to continue to sell or advertise for sale the human milk fortifier.

Subsection.Text: If the manufacturer of a human milk fortifier is requested in writing by the Minister to submit evidence with respect to the human milk fortifier within a time limit specified by the Minister, the manufacturer shall make no further sales of the human milk fortifier — and shall not advertise it for sale — after the expiry of the time limit unless they have submitted the requested evidence.
The time limit cannot be less than 24 hours after the request is made unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that there is a serious and imminent risk of injury to human health.
If the Minister determines that the evidence submitted by the manufacturer is insufficient, the Minister shall notify the manufacturer accordingly in writing.

If the manufacturer is notified that the evidence with respect to the human milk fortifier is insufficient, the manufacturer shall make no further sales of the human milk fortifier – and shall not advertise it for sale — unless they submit additional evidence and are notified in writing by the Minister that the additional evidence is sufficient.
In this section, evidence with respect to the human milk fortifier means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: evidence that establishes that the human milk fortifier is nutritionally adequate to promote acceptable growth and development in infants when consumed in accordance with the directions for use; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the results of tests carried out to determine the expiration date of the human milk fortifier.

Subsection.Text: Even if the Minister has notified the manufacturer of a human milk fortifier that the sale or advertisement for sale of the human milk fortifier is authorized, it may only be sold in the following situations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is sold by the manufacturer to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a hospital, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual, if

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the individual has received a written order for a human milk fortifier from a physician or from a nurse practitioner or dietitian who is authorized to write the order under the laws of a province, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the manufacturer has received a written request from a hospital that specifies the product name and quantity of the human milk fortifier that needs to be provided to the individual; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is sold by a hospital to an individual who has received a written order for a human milk fortifier from a physician or from a nurse practitioner or dietitian who is authorized to write the order under the laws of a province.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: dietitian means a person who is registered and entitled under the laws of a province to practise as a dietitian and who is practising as a dietitian under those laws in that province. (diététiste)
hospital has the same meaning as in section B.24.001. (hôpital)
nurse practitioner has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations. (infirmier praticien)
physician has the same meaning as in section B.24.001. (médecin)

Subsection.Text: The following information is required to be displayed on the outer label of a human milk fortifier:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the quantity, expressed in grams, of protein, fat, available carbohydrate and, where present, fibre in a quantity of human milk fortifier specified in the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the energy value, expressed in Calories, in a quantity of human milk fortifier specified in the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the quantity, expressed in milligrams, micrograms or International Units, of all vitamins, mineral nutrients and amino acids set out in item 6, Column II, of the table to section D.03.002 that are present in a quantity of human milk fortifier specified in the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the quantity, expressed in grams, milligrams, micrograms or International Units, of any other nutritive substance that is present in a quantity of human milk fortifier specified in the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: directions for the storage of the human milk fortifier before and after the package has been opened;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use for the human milk fortifier, including directions for the preparation, use and storage of the mixture of human milk fortifier and human milk;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a statement indicating that the human milk fortifier is to be used only under medical supervision;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the human milk fortifier; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number of the human milk fortifier.

Subsection.Text: If the human milk fortifier does not have an outer label,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in subsection (1) is required to be displayed on the inner label, except as otherwise provided in paragraph (b); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs (1)(e) and (f) may, despite section A.01.016, be displayed on a leaflet that is affixed or attached to the container that is in direct contact with the human milk fortifier.

Subsection.Text: If the human milk fortifier has an outer label, the information referred to in paragraphs (1)(h) and (i) is also required to be displayed on the inner label.

Section.Label: B.25.021
Section.Text: It is prohibited, on the label of or in any advertisement for a human milk fortifier, to make any statement or claim relating to the content in the human milk fortifier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the percentage of the daily value of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: sugars,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: fibre, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: cholesterol; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of Calories from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: fat, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids.

Heading.TitleText: Human Milk Substitutes and Food Containing Human Milk Substitutes

Section.Label: B.25.045
Section.Text: The common name of a human milk substitute or a new human milk substitute shall be infant formula. (préparation pour nourrissons)

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale a new human milk substitute unless the manufacturer, at least 90 days before the sale or advertisement, notifies the Minister in writing of the intention to sell or advertise for sale the new human milk substitute.
The notification referred to in subsection (1) shall be signed and shall include, in respect of the new human milk substitute, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name under which it will be sold or advertised for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and the address of the principal place of business of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the names and addresses of each establishment in which it is manufactured;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all of its ingredients, stated quantitatively;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the specifications for nutrient, microbiological and physical quality for the ingredients and for the new human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: details of quality control procedures respecting the testing of the ingredients and of the new human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: details of the manufacturing process and quality control procedures used throughout the process;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the results of tests carried out to determine the expiration date of the new human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the new human milk substitute is nutritionally adequate to promote acceptable growth and development in infants when consumed in accordance with the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the type of packaging to be used;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the written text of all labels, including package inserts, to be used in connection with the new human milk substitute; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the notification and the date of signature.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsection (1), a person may sell or advertise for sale a new human milk substitute if the manufacturer has notified the Minister pursuant to subsection (1) and is informed in writing by the Minister that the notification is satisfactory.

Section.Label: B.25.047
Section.Text: Sections B.25.051 to B.25.059 apply in respect of new human milk substitutes.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute that has undergone a major change unless the manufacturer of the human milk substitute, at least 90 days before the sale or advertisement, notifies the Minister in writing of the intention to sell or advertise for sale the human milk substitute.
The notification referred to in subsection (1) shall be signed and shall include, in respect of the human milk substitute, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name under which it will be sold or advertised for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and the address of the principal place of business of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the major change;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the human milk substitute is nutritionally adequate to promote acceptable growth and development in infants when consumed in accordance with the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the major change has had no adverse effect on the human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the written text of all labels, including package inserts, to be used in connection with the human milk substitute; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the notification and the date of signature.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsection (1), a person may sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute that has undergone a major change if the manufacturer has notified the Minister pursuant to subsection (1) and is informed in writing by the Minister that the notification is satisfactory.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute unless, when prepared according to directions for use, it complies with the provisions of this Division respecting human milk substitutes.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food that is represented as containing a human milk substitute unless the human milk substitute portion of the food complies with the nutritional requirements set out in this Division for human milk substitutes.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute unless it meets the nutritional requirements of infants with normal or special dietary needs and it is of such a consistency that, when ready-to-serve, it passes freely through a nursing bottle nipple.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food that is represented as containing a human milk substitute unless the human milk substitute portion of the food meets the nutritional requirements of infants with normal or special dietary needs.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute that requires, when prepared according to directions for use, the addition of a nutritive substance, other than water or a source of carbohydrate or both.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food represented as containing a human milk substitute that requires, when prepared according to directions for use, the addition of a nutritive substance other than water.
Except as otherwise provided in this Division, no person shall sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute unless it contains, when prepared according to directions for use,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: per 100 available kilocalories

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 3.3 and not more than 6.0 grams of fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 500 milligrams of linoleic acid in the form of a glyceride,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 1.8 and not more than 4.0 grams of protein,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 1.8 grams of protein of nutritional quality equivalent to casein, or such an amount and quality of protein, including those proteins to which amino acids are added, that, when the quality of the protein is expressed as a fraction of the quality of casein,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the fraction will not be less than 85/100, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the product obtained by multiplying the fraction by the gram weight of the protein will not be less than 1.8,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: notwithstanding sections D.01.010, D.01.011 and D.02.009, the vitamin and mineral nutrient set out in Column I of an item of Table II to this Division in an amount not less than the amount set out in Column II of that item and not more than the amount set out in Column III of that item, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 12 milligrams of choline; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a ratio of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: alpha-tocopherol to linoleic acid of not less than 0.6 International Units to one gram,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium to phosphorus of not less than 1.2 grams to one gram and not more than 2.0 grams to one gram, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: vitamin B6 to protein of not less than 15 micrograms to one gram.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food that is represented as containing a human milk substitute unless the human milk substitute portion of the food complies with subsection (1).
Subparagraph B.25.054(1)(a)(i) does not apply to a human milk substitute represented as being for a fat-modified diet.

Subparagraph B.25.054(1)(a)(iv), except that portion thereof that prescribes the maximum amount of protein, and subparagraph B.25.054(1)(a)(v) do not apply to a human milk substitute represented as being for a low (naming the amino acid) diet.

All that portion of subparagraph B.25.054(1)(a)(vi) that prescribes the minimum amounts of vitamin D, calcium and phosphorus and subparagraph B.25.054(1)(b)(ii) do not apply to a human milk substitute represented as being for a low (naming the mineral) diet or a low vitamin D diet or both.

Section.Label: B.25.056
Section.Text: No person shall sell a human milk substitute or a food that is represented as containing a human milk substitute

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains an added nutritive substance that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: normally contained in human milk, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not referred to in paragraph B.25.054(1)(a)

ContinuedParagraph.Text: unless the amount of that substance present per 100 available kilocalories of the human milk substitute or human milk substitute portion of the food, when prepared according to directions for use, is equal to the amount thereof present per 100 available kilocalories of human milk; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that contains added amino acids unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amino acids are required to improve the quality of the protein in the human milk substitute or human milk substitute portion of the food and are present in an amount not exceeding the minimum required for that purpose, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the protein content of the human milk substitute or human milk substitute portion of the food is supplied by isolated amino acids or by protein hydrolysate, or both

ContinuedParagraph.Text: and only the L forms of the amino acids have been added.

Subsection.Text: The label of a human milk substitute shall carry the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content of protein, fat, available carbohydrate, ash and, where present, crude fibre in the food

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in grams per 100 grams or in grams per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in grams in a stated quantity of the human milk substitute when ready-to-serve;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the energy value expressed in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: calories per 100 grams or calories per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: calories in a stated quantity of the human milk substitute when ready-to-serve;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the quantity of all vitamins and mineral nutrients listed in Table II to this Division

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in International Units or milligrams per 100 grams or in International Units or milligrams per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in International Units or milligrams in a stated quantity of the human milk substitute when ready-to-serve;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the quantity of choline and of any added nutritive substance normally contained in human milk and not referred to in paragraph B.25.054(1)(a)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in milligrams or grams per 100 grams, or in milligrams or grams per 100 millilitres, of the human milk substitute as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in milligrams or grams in a stated quantity of the human milk substitute when ready-to-serve;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: adequate directions for the preparation, use and storage of the human milk substitute after the container has been opened; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the human milk substitute.

Subsection.Text: The label of a food that is represented as containing human milk substitute shall carry the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement on the principal display panel of the proportion of the human milk substitute contained in the food as offered for sale in close proximity to any claim regarding the presence of the human milk substitute and given equal prominence to such a claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the common name of the human milk substitute in the list of ingredients to be followed by a statement of all the components contained in the human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the content of protein, fat, available carbohydrate, ash and, where present, crude fibre contained in the human milk substitute portion of the food, expressed in grams per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute portion of the food as offered for sale,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the energy value of the human milk substitute portion of the food expressed in calories per 100 grams or in calories per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute portion of the food as offered for sale,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of all the vitamins and mineral nutrients set out in Table II to this Division that are contained in the human milk substitute portion of the food in International Units or milligrams per 100 grams or in International Units or milligrams per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute portion of the food as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of choline and of any added nutritive substance normally contained in human milk and not referred to in paragraph B.25.054(1)(a) contained in the human milk substitute portion of the food in milligrams or grams per 100 grams or in milligrams or grams per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute portion of the food as offered for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the content of protein, fat, available carbohydrate, ash and, where present, crude fibre in grams per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale and in grams per stated quantity of ready-to-serve food,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the energy value expressed in calories per 100 grams or in calories per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale and in grams per a stated quantity of the food when ready-to-serve,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of all vitamins and mineral nutrients set out in Table II to this Division in International Units or milligrams per 100 grams or in International Units or milligrams per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale and in International Units or milligrams in a stated quantity of the food when ready-to-serve, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of choline and of any added nutritive substance normally contained in human milk and not referred to in paragraph B.25.054(1)(a) in milligrams or grams per 100 grams or in milligrams or grams per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale and in milligrams or grams in a stated quantity of the food when ready-to-serve;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: adequate directions for the preparation, use and storage of the food after the container has been opened; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the food.

Section.Label: B.25.058
Section.Text: Notwithstanding section D.02.005, no person shall make any claim with respect to the iron content of a human milk substitute except as required by paragraph B.25.057(1)(c), unless the human milk substitute contains at least one milligram of iron per 100 available kilocalories.

Section.Label: B.25.059
Section.Text: No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a human milk substitute or a food represented as containing a human milk substitute, make any statement or claim relating to the content in the food of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the percentage of the daily value of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: sugars,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: fibre, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: cholesterol; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of Calories from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: fat, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids.
