Subsection.Text: Where the manufacturer of a human milk substitute or of a food that is represented as containing a human milk substitute is requested in writing by the Minister to submit on or before a specified day evidence with respect to the human milk substitute, the manufacturer shall make no further sales of that human milk substitute or food that is represented as containing human milk substitute after that day unless he has submitted the evidence requested.
If the Minister determines that the evidence submitted by a manufacturer under subsection (1) is not sufficient, he or she shall so notify the manufacturer in writing.

Where, pursuant to subsection (2), a manufacturer is notified that the evidence with respect to the human milk substitute is not sufficient, he shall make no further sales of that human milk substitute or of that food that is represented as containing the human milk substitute unless he submits further evidence and is notified in writing by the Minister that the further evidence is sufficient.
In this section, evidence with respect to the human milk substitute means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: evidence that establishes that the human milk substitute is nutritionally adequate to promote acceptable growth and development in infants when consumed in accordance with the directions for use; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the results of tests carried out to determine the expiration date of the human milk substitute.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall include on the label of a food any representation respecting the consumption of the food by an infant who is less than six months of age.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a human milk fortifier, human milk substitute or new human milk substitute.

table.title: Sodium Content in Infant Foods

row.entry: Total Sodium in Grams per 100 Grams of Food
Junior Meat, Junior Meat Dinners, Junior Dinners, Junior Breakfasts
Strained Meats, Strained Meat Dinners, Strained Dinners, Strained Breakfasts

Section.Label: B.26.001
Section.Text: In this Division, irradiation means treatment with ionizing radiation.

Section.Label: B.26.002
Section.Text: This Division does not apply to foods exposed to ionizing radiation from a measuring instrument used to determine weight, estimate bulk solids, measure the total solids in liquids or perform other inspection procedures.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell a food that has been irradiated.
A food that is set out in column 1 of the table to this Division that has been irradiated may be sold if both of the following requirements are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the ionizing radiation is of a type and from a source set out in column 2 for the purpose of irradiation set out in column 3; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the ionizing radiation that is absorbed by the food is either within the range set out in columns 4 and 5 or, if there is no minimum absorbed dose set out in column 4, is not more than the maximum absorbed dose set out in column 5.

Subsection.Text: A manufacturer who sells a food that has been irradiated shall keep on their premises, for at least two years after the date of the irradiation, a record that contains all of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the food that was irradiated and the quantity and lot numbers of the food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the purpose of the irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the dose of ionizing radiation that was absorbed by the food;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the type and source of the ionizing radiation;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that indicates whether the food was previously irradiated and, if it was previously irradiated, the information referred to in paragraphs (a) to (e) in respect of that previous irradiation.

Subsection.Text: A person who imports a food for sale in Canada that has been irradiated shall keep on their premises, for at least two years after the date of importation, a record of the information required by subsection (1).

Section.Label: B.26.005
Section.Text: A request that a food be added or a change made to the table to this Division shall be accompanied by a submission to the Minister containing the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the purpose and details of the proposed irradiation — including the type and source of the ionizing radiation — and the proposed number of treatments and the minimum and maximum absorbed doses of the ionizing radiation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: data indicating that the minimum dose of ionizing radiation proposed to be used accomplishes the intended purpose of the irradiation and the maximum dose of ionizing radiation proposed does not exceed the amount required to accomplish the purpose of the irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: information on the nature of the dosimeter used, the frequency of the dosimetry on the food and data pertaining to the dosimetry and phantoms used to assure that the dosimetry readings reflect the dose absorbed by the food during irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: data indicating the effects, if any, on the nutritional quality of the food, raw and ready-to-serve, under the proposed conditions of irradiation and any other processes that are combined with the irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: data establishing that the irradiated food has not been significantly altered in chemical, physical or microbiological characteristics to render the food unfit for human consumption;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: where the Minister so requests, data establishing that the proposed irradiation is safe under the conditions proposed for the irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended conditions of storage and shipment of the irradiated food including the time, temperature and packaging and a comparison of the recommended conditions for the same food that has not been irradiated;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: details of any other processes to be applied to the food prior to or after the proposed irradiation; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: such other data as the Minister may require to establish that consumers and purchasers of the irradiated food will not be deceived or misled as to the character, value, composition, merit or safety of the irradiated food.

Wheat, flour, whole wheat flour (Triticum spp.)

Provision.Label: (a)

Gamma radiation from cobalt-60

To reduce microbial load, including pathogens
Electrons from machine sources operated at or below 10 MeV
To reduce microbial load, including pathogens
X-rays from machine sources operated at or below one of the following:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: 7.5 MeV when the target material is tantalum or gold;

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: To reduce microbial load, including pathogens;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: 5 MeV in any other case.

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: To reduce microbial load, including pathogens.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 27
Heading.TitleText: Low-Acid Foods Packaged in Hermetically Sealed Containers

Section.Label: B.27.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: commercially sterile means the condition obtained in a food that has been processed by the application of heat, alone or in combination with other treatments, to render the food free from viable forms of microorganisms, including spores, capable of growing in the food at temperatures at which the food is designed normally to be held during distribution and storage; (stérilité commerciale)
low-acid food means a food, other than an alcoholic beverage, where any component of the food has a pH greater than 4.6 and a water activity greater than 0.85; (aliment peu acide)
refrigeration means exposure to a temperature of 4°C or less but does not mean frozen; (réfrigéré)
shipping container means a receptacle, package or wrapper in which containers of food are placed for transportation; (contenant d’expédition)
water activity means the ratio of the water vapour pressure of a food to the vapour pressure of pure water, at the same temperature and pressure. (activité de l’eau)

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell a low-acid food packaged in a hermetically sealed container unless the food is commercially sterile.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a low-acid food packaged in a hermetically sealed container where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the low-acid food is kept under refrigeration and the statement “Keep Refrigerated” and “Garder réfrigéré” is carried on the principal display panel of the label of its container, as well as on the label of its shipping container; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the low-acid food is kept frozen and the statement “Keep Frozen” and “Garder congelé” is carried on the principal display panel of the label of its container, as well as on the label of its shipping container.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of tomatoes or tomato products packaged in hermetically sealed containers where the tomatoes or tomato products have a pH of 4.7 or less after heat processing.

Section.Label: B.27.003
Section.Text: No person shall sell a low-acid food packaged in a hermetically sealed container where the container

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is swollen;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not properly sealed; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has any defect that may adversely affect its hermetic seal.

Subsection.Text: Where, in the opinion of the Minister, the sale of a low-acid food packaged in a hermetically sealed container may contravene section B.27.002 or B.27.003, the Minister may, by notice in writing, request that the manufacturer or importer of the food submit, on or before the date specified in the notice, evidence that establishes that the processes used to manufacture, process and package the food rendered and maintained the food commercially sterile.

Where a manufacturer or an importer receives a notice issued pursuant to subsection (1), the manufacturer or importer shall make no further sales of the food on or after the day specified in the notice until he has submitted the evidence requested in that notice.

Where the Minister is of the opinion that the evidence submitted by a manufacturer or importer pursuant to subsection (1) is not sufficient, the Minister shall notify the manufacturer or importer in writing that the evidence is not sufficient.

Where, pursuant to subsection (3), a manufacturer or importer is notified that the evidence he has submitted is not sufficient, the manufacturer or importer shall make no further sales of the food until he submits further evidence and is notified in writing by the Minister that the further evidence is sufficient.

Section.Label: B.27.005
Section.Text: No person shall sell a commercially sterile low-acid food packaged in a hermetically sealed container unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the label or container of the food bears a code or lot number that identifies, in a legible and permanent manner,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the establishment in which the product was rendered commercially sterile, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the day, month and year on which the food was rendered commercially sterile; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the exact meaning of each item in any code or lot number referred to in paragraph (a) is available to an inspector at the establishment or, where the food is imported, from the importer.

Section.Label: B.28.001
Section.Text: The definitions in this section apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: genetically modify means to change the heritable traits of a plant, animal or microorganism by means of intentional manipulation. (modifier génétiquement)

major change means, in respect of a food, a change in the food that, based on the manufacturer’s experience or generally accepted nutritional or food science theory, places the modified food outside the accepted limits of natural variations for that food with regard to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the composition, structure or nutritional quality of the food or its generally recognized physiological effects;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manner in which the food is metabolized in the body; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the microbiological safety, the chemical safety or the safe use of the food. (changement majeur)

Definition.Text: novel food means any of the following substances and foods, other than a supplemental ingredient or supplemented food:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a substance, including a microorganism, that does not have a history of safe use as a food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a food that has been manufactured, prepared, preserved or packaged by a process that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has not been previously applied to that food, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: causes the food to undergo a major change; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a food that is derived from a plant, animal or microorganism that has been genetically modified such that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the plant, animal or microorganism exhibits characteristics that were not previously observed in that plant, animal or microorganism,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the plant, animal or microorganism no longer exhibits characteristics that were previously observed in that plant, animal or microorganism, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: one or more characteristics of the plant, animal or microorganism no longer fall within the anticipated range for that plant, animal or microorganism. (aliment nouveau)

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale a novel food unless the manufacturer or importer of the novel food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has notified the Minister in writing of their intention to sell or advertise for sale the novel food; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has received a written notice from the Minister under paragraph B.28.003(1)(a) or subsection B.28.003(2).

Subsection.Text: A notification referred to in paragraph (1)(a) shall be signed by the manufacturer or importer, or a person authorized to sign on behalf of the manufacturer or importer, and shall include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the common name under which the novel food will be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the principal place of business of the manufacturer and, if the address is outside Canada, the name and address of the principal place of business of the importer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the novel food, together with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting its development,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: details of the method by which it is manufactured, prepared, preserved, packaged and stored,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: details of the major change, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting its intended use and directions for its preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting its history of use as a food in a country other than Canada, if applicable, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: information relied on to establish that the novel food is safe for consumption;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: information respecting the estimated levels of consumption by consumers of the novel food;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the text of all labels to be used in connection with the novel food; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the notification and the date of signing.

Subsection.Text: Within 45 days after receiving a notification referred to in paragraph B.28.002(1)(a), the Minister shall review the information included in the notification and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the information establishes that the novel food is safe for consumption, notify the manufacturer or importer in writing that the information is sufficient; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if additional information of a scientific nature is necessary in order to assess the safety of the novel food, request in writing that the manufacturer or importer submit that information.

Subsection.Text: Within 90 days after receiving the additional information requested under paragraph (1)(b) the Minister shall assess it and, if it establishes that the novel food is safe for consumption, notify the manufacturer or importer in writing that the information is sufficient.
The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: Directory of SFFT Formats means the document entitled Directory of Supplemented Food Facts Table Formats, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (Répertoire des modèles de TRAS)

Directory of Supplemented Food Caution Identifier Specifications means the document entitled Directory of Supplemented Food Caution Identifier Specifications, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (Répertoire des spécifications sur l’identifiant des aliments supplémentés avec mise en garde)
fat means all fatty acids expressed as triglycerides. (lipides)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Division and subject to subsection (3), the amount of vitamins must be determined in accordance with section D.01.003.

For the purposes of this Division, the amount in metric units of the following vitamins must be determined in terms of their amount in the supplemented food in accordance with column 5 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients, as applicable, and expressed in the applicable unit set out in column 3 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: beta-carotene as a form of vitamin A or retinol, including its derivatives, as a form of vitamin A, or both, if either is a supplemental ingredient; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: niacin, if it is a supplemental ingredient.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise provided in this section and sections B.29.003 to B.29.005, B.29.018 and B.29.019, the label of a supplemented food must carry a supplemented food facts table that contains only the information set out in column 1 of the table to this section, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in the unit set out in column 3 and in the manner set out in column 4.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the serving of stated size set out in the supplemented food facts table, as expressed in a metric unit, must be used as the basis for determining the information appearing in the supplemented food facts table in respect of the energy value of, and the content of nutrients and supplemental ingredients in, the supplemented food.

Subject to subsection (8), the percentage of the daily value for a vitamin or mineral nutrient shown in the supplemented food facts table in accordance with subsection (1) must be established on the basis of the amount, by weight, of the vitamin or mineral nutrient per serving of stated size of the supplemented food, rounded off in the applicable manner set out in column 4 of the table to this section.

If the information in respect of six or more of the energy value and nutrients referred to in column 1 of items 2 to 5 and 7 to 15 of the table to this section may be expressed as “0” in the supplemented food facts table in accordance with this section, the supplemented food facts table need only include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the serving of stated size;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the energy value;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of fat;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of carbohydrate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of protein;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any nutrient that is the subject of a representation on the label of the supplemented food, or in any advertisement for the supplemented food that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the supplemented food, if the representation expressly or implicitly indicates that the supplemented food has particular nutritional or health-related properties, including any statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims or column 1 of the table following section B.01.603 or referred to in section B.01.311, D.01.006 or D.02.004;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any added sugar alcohol;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any supplemental ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any vitamin or mineral nutrient that is declared as a component of an ingredient, other than flour, of the supplemented food;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any nutrient referred to in column 1 of any of items 4, 5, 7, 8, 10, 11 and 13 to 15 of the table to this section that may not be expressed as “0” in the supplemented food facts table;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the statement “Not a significant source of (naming each nutrient that is omitted from the supplemented food facts table in accordance with this subsection)” or, if the supplemented food meets the condition specified in subsection B.29.010(3), the statement “Not a significant source of other nutrients”;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the % Daily Value interpretative statement; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the “Supplemented with” interpretative statement.

Subsection.Text: The supplemented food facts table of a supplemented food that is a single-serving prepackaged product need only include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the serving of stated size;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the energy value;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of fat;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of carbohydrate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of protein;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any nutrient that is the subject of a representation on the label of the supplemented food, or in any advertisement for the supplemented food that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the supplemented food, if the representation expressly or implicitly indicates that the supplemented food has particular nutritional or health-related properties, including any statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims or column 1 of the table following section B.01.603 or referred to in section B.01.311, D.01.006 or D.02.004;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any added sugar alcohol;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any supplemental ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the amounts of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids and the sum of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids, if any of the amounts or the sum may not be expressed as “0” in the supplemented food facts table;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any nutrient referred to in column 1 of item 8 or 11 of the table to this section that may not be expressed as “0” in the supplemented food facts table;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the % Daily Value interpretative statement; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the “Supplemented with” interpretative statement.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a supplemented food intended solely for use as an ingredient in the manufacture of other supplemented foods intended for sale to a consumer at the retail level.

If the supplemented food facts table on the label of a supplemented food corresponds to Figure 6.5(B), 6.6(B), 6.5.1(B), 6.6.1(B), 7.3(B), 7.4(B), 7.3.1(B), 7.4.1(B), 17.2(E) and (F) or 17.2.1(E) and (F) of the Directory of SFFT Formats, the supplemented food facts table is not required to show the % Daily Value interpretative statement or the “Supplemented with” interpretative statement.

Subject to subsection (10), if a substance has been added as a supplemental ingredient, the amount referred to in item 18 of the table to this section includes the total amount of the substance in the supplemented food, unless otherwise provided in column 3 or 5 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients.

If any amount of a nutrient referred to in column 1 of the table to this section has been added as a supplemental ingredient, the amount of the nutrient may only be expressed in the supplemented food facts table in accordance with item 18 of the table to this section.

If a substance other than a nutrient has been added as a supplemental ingredient and the substance has one or more constituents for which a maximum amount is specified in column 3 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients, the amount of each constituent set out in the supplemented food facts table must include the total amount of the constituent in the supplemented food, unless otherwise provided in column 3 or 5 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients.

table.title: Core Information

row.entry: “Serving Size (naming the serving size)”, “Serving (naming the serving size)” or “Per (naming the serving size)”

Provision.Text: The size is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in the case of a supplemented food that is a single-serving prepackaged product,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: per package, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in grams or millilitres, in accordance with subparagraph B.01.002A(2)(a)(i) or (ii); and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in the case of a supplemented food that is a multiple-serving prepackaged product, in the following units set out in column 3B of the Table of Reference Amounts:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: the household measure that applies to the supplemented food, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: the metric measure that applies to the supplemented food.
The size if expressed in a metric unit is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 10 g or 10 mL, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g or 0.1 mL; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 10 g or more or 10 mL or more, to the nearest multiple of 1 g or 1 mL.
The size if expressed as a fraction is represented by a numerator and a denominator separated by a line.

The size must include the word “assorted” if the information in the supplemented food facts table of a prepackaged product containing an assortment of supplemented foods is set out as a composite value.

row.entry: The value is expressed in Calories per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The value is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 5 Calories,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: if the supplemented food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 1 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of energy” set out in column 1, to “0” Calorie, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1 Calorie;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 5 Calories or more but not more than 50 Calories, to the nearest multiple of 5 Calories; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 50 Calories, to the nearest multiple of 10 Calories.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in grams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: if the supplemented food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 11 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of fat” set out in column 1 and the amounts of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids are declared as “0 g” in the supplemented food facts table or are omitted from that table in accordance with subsection B.29.002(4) and no other fatty acids are declared in an amount greater than 0 g, to “0 g”, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more but not more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 g; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 g”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.

row.entry: The amount is expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: if the supplemented food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 18 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of saturated fatty acids” set out in column 1, to “0 g”, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more but not more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 g; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.

row.entry: The amount is expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: if the supplemented food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 22 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of trans fatty acids” set out in column 1, to “0 g”, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more but not more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 g; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.

row.entry: The sum of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids
“Saturated Fat + Trans Fat”, “Saturated Fatty Acids + Trans Fatty Acids”, “Saturated + Trans” or “Saturates + Trans”
The sum is expressed as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amounts of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids are declared as “0 g”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: is expressed in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: may also be expressed as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the supplemented food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 27 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of cholesterol” set out in column 1, to “0 mg”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 5 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 mg”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 5 mg,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: if the supplemented food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 31 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “free of sodium or salt” set out in column 1, to “0 mg”, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1 mg;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 5 mg or more but not more than 140 mg, to the nearest multiple of 5 mg; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 140 mg, to the nearest multiple of 10 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 mg”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.

row.entry: The amount is expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g, to “0 g”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in grams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g, to “0 g”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 g”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in grams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g, to “0 g”; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 g”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.

row.entry: The amount is expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.5 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 g or more, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 5 mg, to “0 mg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 5 mg or more but less than 50 mg, to the nearest multiple of 10 mg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 50 mg or more but less than 250 mg, to the nearest multiple of 25 mg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 250 mg or more, to the nearest multiple of 50 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 mg”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 5 mg, to “0 mg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 5 mg or more but less than 50 mg, to the nearest multiple of 10 mg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 50 mg or more but less than 250 mg, to the nearest multiple of 25 mg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 250 mg or more, to the nearest multiple of 50 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 mg”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.05 mg, to “0 mg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.05 mg or more but less than 0.5 mg, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 mg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 mg or more but less than 2.5 mg, to the nearest multiple of 0.25 mg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 2.5 mg or more, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 mg”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.

row.entry: “*5% or less is a little, 15% or more is a lot”
The “% Daily Value” or “% DV” subheading is followed by an asterisk in order to reference the % Daily Value interpretative statement shown in the supplemented food facts table.
“† Includes naturally occurring and supplemental amounts”
The “Supplemented with” subheading is followed by a dagger in order to reference the “Supplemented with” interpretative statement shown in the supplemented food facts table.
The supplemental ingredient is described in accordance with column 1 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients.

Provision.Text: The amount is expressed in

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: the applicable unit referred to in column 3 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients, per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in the case of a nutrient with a daily value, as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off to the nearest whole number and expressed in the manner set out in column 3 and, if applicable, column 5 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients.
Unless otherwise provided in column 5 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients, the percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount declared in the applicable unit referred to in column 3 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients is “0”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the supplemented food facts table may also contain information set out in column 1 of the table to this section.

This section does not apply in respect of a vitamin or mineral nutrient that is set out in the supplemented food facts table in accordance with subsection B.29.002(1) if any amount of that vitamin or mineral nutrient has been added as a supplemental ingredient.

If information set out in column 1 of the table to this section is included in the supplemented food facts table, it must be expressed using a description set out in column 2, in the unit set out in column 3 and in the manner set out in column 4.

For the purposes of subsection (3), the serving of stated size set out in the supplemented food facts table, as expressed in a metric unit, must be used as the basis for determining the information appearing in the supplemented food facts table in respect of the energy value and nutrient content of the supplemented food.

The percentage of the daily value for a vitamin or mineral nutrient shown in the supplemented food facts table in accordance with subsection (3) must be established on the basis of the amount, by weight, of the vitamin or mineral nutrient per serving of stated size for the supplemented food, rounded off in the applicable manner set out in column 4 of the table to this section.
The amount of omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids, omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids and monounsaturated fatty acids must be shown in the supplemented food facts table if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any of those groups of fatty acids or the amount of polyunsaturated fatty acids is shown in the supplemented food facts table or on the label of the supplemented food or in any advertisement for the supplemented food that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the supplemented food; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any specific fatty acid is shown on the label of the supplemented food or in any advertisement for the supplemented food that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the supplemented food.

Subsection.Text: If the label of the supplemented food, or any advertisement for the supplemented food that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer, contains a representation, express or implied, that includes information that is set out in column 1 of the table to this section, that information must also be shown in the supplemented food facts table.
The supplemented food facts table must show the amount of any added sugar alcohol.
The supplemented food facts table must show the amount of any vitamin or mineral nutrient that is declared as a component of an ingredient, other than flour.
If information set out in column 1 of the table to this section is included in the supplemented food facts table, it must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in English and French; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in one of those languages, if, in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3), the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

table.title: Additional Information

row.entry: “Servings per Container”, “(number of units) per Container”, “Servings per Package”, “(number of units) per Package”, “Servings per (naming the package type)”, or “(number of units) per (naming the package type)”
The quantity is expressed in number of servings.

Provision.Text: The quantity is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 2, to the nearest multiple of 1;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is between 2 and 5, to the nearest multiple of 0.5; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 5, to the nearest multiple of 1.
If a quantity is rounded off, it must be preceded by the word “about”.
If the product is of a random weight, the quantity may be declared as “varied”.

row.entry: The value is expressed in kilojoules per serving of stated size.
The value is rounded off to the nearest multiple of 10 kilojoules.
The amount is expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Provision.Text: The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 1 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 g;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 1 g or more but not more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 g; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.

row.entry: Amount of omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids

Provision.Text: If the supplemented food facts table includes the amount of polyunsaturated fatty acids: “Omega-6”, “Omega-6 Polyunsaturated Fat”, “Omega-6 Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids”, “Omega-6 Polyunsaturates” or “Omega-6 Polyunsaturated”
In all other cases: “Omega-6 Polyunsaturated Fat”, “Omega-6 Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids”, “Omega-6 Polyunsaturates” or “Omega-6 Polyunsaturated”

row.entry: The amount is expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is more than 5 g, to the nearest multiple of 1 g.

row.entry: Amount of omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids

In all other cases: “Omega-3 Polyunsaturated Fat”, “Omega-3 Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids”, “Omega-3 Polyunsaturates” or “Omega-3 Polyunsaturated”

The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 mg”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in micrograms per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.05 µg, to “0 µg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.05 µg or more but less than 0.5 µg, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 µg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 µg or more but less than 2.5 µg, to the nearest multiple of 0.25 µg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 2.5 µg or more, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 µg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 µg”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in micrograms per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 0.05 µg, to “0 µg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.05 µg or more but less than 0.5 µg, to the nearest multiple of 0.1 µg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 0.5 µg or more but less than 2.5 µg, to the nearest multiple of 0.25 µg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 2.5 µg or more, to the nearest multiple of 0.5 µg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 µg”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.
The amount is expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in milligrams per serving of stated size; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size.
The amount is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if it is less than 5 mg, to “0 mg”;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: if it is 5 mg or more but less than 50 mg, to the nearest multiple of 10 mg;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it is 50 mg or more but less than 250 mg, to the nearest multiple of 25 mg; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: if it is 250 mg or more, to the nearest multiple of 50 mg.
The percentage is rounded off

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: if the amount is declared as “0 mg”, to 0%; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in all other cases, to the nearest multiple of 1%.

Heading.TitleText: Supplemented Foods for Use in Manufacturing Other Supplemented Foods

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a supplemented food intended solely for use as an ingredient in the manufacture of other supplemented foods intended for sale to a consumer at the retail level.

It is prohibited to sell the supplemented food unless the information referred to in subsection (3) in respect of the supplemented food is provided in writing and accompanies the supplemented food when it is delivered to the purchaser.
The information

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must include the information that would, but for subsection B.29.002(6), be required by sections B.29.002 and B.29.003 to be included in a supplemented food facts table;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may include other information that is permitted by section B.29.003 to be included in that supplemented food facts table; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: must be expressed in accordance with sections B.29.002 and B.29.003, subject to the following modifications, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: information in respect of supplemental ingredients must be expressed according to the applicable unit referred to in column 3 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: per gram or 100 g of the supplemented food, if the net quantity of the supplemented food is declared on the label by weight or by count, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: per millilitre or 100 mL of the supplemented food, if the net quantity of the supplemented food is declared on the label by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: information — other than in respect of supplemental ingredients — for vitamins referred to in subsection D.01.002(1) must be expressed in the applicable unit referred to in subsection D.01.003(1) and for mineral nutrients referred to in paragraphs D.02.001(1)(a) to (j), (l) to (n) and (p) must be expressed in milligrams for sodium, potassium, calcium, phosphorus, magnesium, iron, zinc, chloride, copper and manganese and in micrograms for iodide, chromium, selenium and molybdenum,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: per gram or 100 g of the supplemented food, if the net quantity of the supplemented food is declared on the label by weight or by count, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: per millilitre or 100 mL of the supplemented food, if the net quantity of the supplemented food is declared on the label by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: information for other nutrients and the energy value set out in column 1 of the table to section B.29.002 or the table to section B.29.003 must be expressed in the units referred to in column 3,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: per gram or 100 g of the supplemented food, if the net quantity of the supplemented food is declared on the label by weight or by count, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: per millilitre or 100 mL of the supplemented food, if the net quantity of the supplemented food is declared on the label by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: percentages of daily values and information on servings of stated size may be omitted, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the information must be stated with a degree of precision that corresponds to the accuracy of the analytical methodology used to produce the information.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) to (5), the information in the supplemented food facts table must be set out only on the basis of the supplemented food as offered for sale.

If a prepackaged product contains an assortment of supplemented foods of the same type and the typical serving consists of only one of those supplemented foods, the information in the supplemented food facts table must be set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the basis of each of the supplemented foods contained in the prepackaged product, if the information set out in column 1 of the table to section B.29.002 for each of those supplemented foods is different; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the basis of one of the supplemented foods contained in the prepackaged product, if the information set out in column 1 of the table to section B.29.002 for each of those supplemented foods is the same.

Subsection.Text: If a prepackaged product contains an assortment of supplemented foods of the same type and the typical serving consists of more than one of those supplemented foods, the information in the supplemented food facts table must be set out for each of the supplemented foods contained in the prepackaged product or as a composite value.

If a supplemented food is to be prepared in accordance with directions provided in or on the package or is commonly combined with other ingredients or another food or cooked before being consumed, the supplemented food facts table may also set out information for the supplemented food as prepared, in which case

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the supplemented food facts table must set out the following information for the supplemented food as prepared, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: except in the case described in subparagraph (ii), the amount of the supplemented food expressed using the unit referred to in column 3 of subparagraph 1(b)(i) of the table to section B.29.002 as “about (naming the serving size)” or “about (naming the serving size) prepared” and, if applicable, in the manner specified in column 4 of subitems 1(1) and (2),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the supplemented food is commonly served combined with another food, the amount of the other food expressed using the unit referred to in column 3 of subparagraph 1(b)(i) of the table to section B.29.002,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the energy value, expressed using a description set out in column 2 of item 2 of the table to section B.29.002, in the unit set out in column 3 and in the manner set out in column 4,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 3, 6 to 8, 10, 11 and 13 to 15 of the table to section B.29.002 and in column 1 of items 11 to 34 of the table to section B.29.003 that is declared as a percentage of the daily value in the supplemented food facts table for the supplemented food as sold, expressed using a description set out in column 2 of those tables, as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size and in the manner specified in column 4 of those tables, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the information referred to in column 1 of item 18 of the table to section B.29.002, expressed using the description referred to in column 2, in the unit referred to in column 3 and in the manner referred to in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the supplemented food facts table may also set out the following information for the added ingredients or the other food, if it is declared in the supplemented food facts table for the supplemented food as sold, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 3 to 5 and 7 to 12 of the table to section B.29.002, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in milligrams for the information set out in column 1 of items 7 and 8 and in grams for the information set out in column 1 of items 3 to 5 and 9 to 12 and in the manner specified in column 4,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 3 to 10 of the table to section B.29.003, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in grams and in the manner specified in column 4, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of item 2 of the table to section B.29.002, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in the unit set out in column 3 per serving of stated size of the supplemented food as prepared, and in the manner specified in column 4.

Subsection.Text: The information in the supplemented food facts table may also be set out on the basis of other amounts of the supplemented food that reflect different uses or different units of measurement of the supplemented food, in which case

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the supplemented food facts table must set out the following information for each of the other amounts of the supplemented food, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of the supplemented food expressed in a household measure and a metric measure and in the manner specified in column 4 of subitems 1(1) and (2) of the table to section B.29.002,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the energy value, expressed using a description set out in column 2 of item 2 of the table to section B.29.002, in the unit set out in column 3 and in the manner set out in column 4,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 3, 6 to 8, 10, 11 and 13 to 15 of the table to section B.29.002 and in column 1 of items 11 to 34 of the table to section B.29.003 that is declared as a percentage of the daily value in the supplemented food facts table for the first amount of the supplemented food for which information is declared, expressed using a description set out in column 2 of those tables, as a percentage of the daily value per serving of stated size and in the manner specified in column 4 of those tables, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the information referred to in column 1 of item 18 of the table to section B.29.002, expressed using the description referred to in column 2, the unit referred to in column 3 and in the manner referred to in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the supplemented food facts table is set out in a version of the aggregate format specified in section B.29.015, it must also set out the following information for each of the other amounts of the supplemented food, if that information is declared in the supplemented food facts table for the first amount of the supplemented food for which information is declared, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 3 to 5 and 7 to 15 of the table to section B.29.002, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in milligrams for the information set out in column 1 of items 7, 8 and 13 to 15, and in grams for the information set out in column 1 of items 3 to 5 and 9 to 12 and in the manner specified in column 4, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in column 1 of items 3 to 34 of the table to section B.29.003, expressed using a description set out in column 2, in micrograms for the information set out in column 1 of items 11, 13, 15, 21, 22, 26, 29, 32 and 33, in micrograms of dietary folate equivalents for the information set out in column 1 of item 20, in milligrams for the information set out in column 1 of items 12, 14, 16 to 19, 23 to 25, 27, 28, 30, 31 and 34, and in grams for the information set out in column 1 of items 3 to 10 and in the manner specified in column 4.

Heading.TitleText: Presentation of Supplemented Food Facts Table

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) to (7), the supplemented food facts table must be presented in accordance with the format specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of SFFT Formats, having regard to matters such as order of presentation, dimensions, spacing and the use of upper and lower case letters and bold type.

The characters and rules in the supplemented food facts table must be displayed in a single colour that is a visual equivalent of 100% solid black type on a white background or on a uniform neutral background with a maximum 5% tint of colour.
The characters in the supplemented food facts table

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must be displayed in a single standard sans serif font that is not decorative and in such a manner that the characters never touch each other or the rules; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may be displayed with larger dimensions than those specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of SFFT Formats if all the characters in the table are enlarged in a uniform manner.

Subsection.Text: The type size shown in parentheses for a version referred to in a table to sections B.29.009 to B.29.015 is the minimum type size that may be used in a supplemented food facts table to show nutrients and supplemental ingredients set out in the tables to sections B.29.002 and B.29.003 in accordance with that version.

A rule that is specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of SFFT Formats as being a 1 point rule or a 2 point rule may be displayed with larger dimensions in the supplemented food facts table.
The information in the supplemented food facts table must be in accordance with subsections B.29.001(2) and (3) and sections B.29.002, B.29.003 and B.29.005.

In a supplemented food facts table consisting of a table in both English and French, the order of languages may be reversed from the order shown in the applicable figure in the Directory of SFFT Formats.

Heading.TitleText: Location of Supplemented Food Facts Table

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the supplemented food facts table must be displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a table in English and a table in French on the same continuous surface of the available display surface;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a table in both English and French on a continuous surface of the available display surface; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in a table in English on a continuous surface of the available display surface and a table in French on another continuous surface of the available display surface that is of the same size and prominence as the first surface.

Subsection.Text: If, in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3), the information required by these Regulations may be shown on the label of a supplemented food in English only or in French only and is shown in that language, the supplemented food facts table may be displayed on the label in a table in that language only on a continuous surface of the available display surface.

Heading.TitleText: Orientation of Supplemented Food Facts Table

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the supplemented food facts table must be oriented in the same manner as other information appearing on the label of a supplemented food.

If a version of a supplemented food facts table cannot be oriented in the same manner as other information appearing on the label, it must be oriented in another manner if there is sufficient space to do so and the food contained in the package does not leak out and is not damaged when the package is turned over.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a supplemented food facts table that is set out on the top or bottom of a package.
This section applies to a supplemented food unless any of sections B.29.010 to B.29.015 applies to it.

Subject to subsection (3), the supplemented food facts table must be set out in a version listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the supplemented food, a supplemented food facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the supplemented food facts table must be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual standard format in accordance with Figure 3.5(B), 3.6(B) or 3.7(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual horizontal format in accordance with Figure 4.3(B), 4.4(B) or 4.5(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the linear format in accordance with Figures 16.1(E) and (F) or 16.2(E) and (F) of the Directory of SFFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the supplemented food facts table; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a manner described in section B.29.017.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, in determining whether a version of a supplemented food facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the supplemented food, the supplemented food facts table must include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included in that table.

Despite subsections (2) and (3), if the supplemented food facts table is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it must be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a supplemented food if it satisfies the condition set out in subsection B.29.002(4) and its supplemented food facts table includes only the information referred to in paragraphs B.29.002(4)(a) to (m).

Subject to subsection (3), the supplemented food facts table must be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the supplemented food, a supplemented food facts table containing only the information referred to in paragraphs B.29.002(4)(a) to (m) in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the supplemented food facts table must be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual simplified standard format in accordance with Figure 6.5(B) or 6.6(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual simplified horizontal format in accordance with Figure 7.3(B) or 7.4(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the simplified linear format in accordance with Figures 17.1(E) and (F) or 17.2(E) and (F) of the Directory of SFFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the supplemented food facts table; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a manner described in section B.29.017.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsections (2) and (3), if the supplemented food facts table is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it must be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Heading.TitleText: Simplified Formats — Supplemented Foods that are Single-serving Prepackaged Products

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a supplemented food that is a single-serving prepackaged product, whose supplemented food facts table includes only the information referred to in paragraphs B.29.002(5)(a) to (l).

Subject to subsection (3), the supplemented food facts table of the supplemented food that is a single-serving prepackaged product must be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the supplemented food that is a single-serving prepackaged product, a supplemented food facts table containing only the information referred to in paragraphs B.29.002(5)(a) to (l) in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the supplemented food facts table must be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual simplified standard format in accordance with Figure 6.5.1(B) or 6.6.1(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual simplified horizontal format in accordance with Figure 7.3.1(B) or 7.4.1(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the simplified linear format in accordance with Figures 17.1.1(E) and (F) or 17.2.1(E) and (F) of the Directory of SFFT Formats;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the supplemented food facts table; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a manner described in section B.29.017.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsections (2) and (3), if the supplemented food facts table of the supplemented food that is a single-serving prepackaged product is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it must be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Heading.TitleText: Dual Format — Supplemented Foods Requiring Preparation

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the supplemented food facts table includes information referred to in subsection B.29.005(4), the supplemented food facts table must be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the supplemented food, a supplemented food facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the supplemented food facts table must be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual dual format in accordance with Figure 9.5(B) or 9.6(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the supplemented food facts table.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, in determining whether a version of a supplemented food facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the supplemented food, the supplemented food facts table must include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included in the table, together with the information referred to in subsection B.29.005(4).

Despite subsections (1) and (2), if the supplemented food facts table is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it must be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (2)(a) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Heading.TitleText: Aggregate Format — Different Kinds of Supplemented Foods

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the supplemented food facts table of a prepackaged product containing an assortment of supplemented foods includes separate information for each supplemented food as provided in paragraph B.29.005(2)(a) or subsection B.29.005(3), the supplemented food facts table must be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, a supplemented food facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the supplemented food facts table must be set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a prepackaged product described in paragraph B.29.005(2)(a), in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the bilingual aggregate format in accordance with Figure 11.5(B) or 11.6(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the supplemented food facts table, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a manner described in section B.29.017; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a prepackaged product described in subsection B.29.005(3), in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the bilingual aggregate format in accordance with Figure 11.5(B) or 11.6(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the supplemented food facts table.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, in determining whether a version of a supplemented food facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the prepackaged product, the supplemented food facts table must include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included for each supplemented food for which separate information is set out in the table.

Despite subsections (1) and (2), if the supplemented food facts table of the prepackaged product is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it must be set out in a version that is described in subparagraph (2)(b)(i) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Heading.TitleText: Dual Format — Different Amounts of Supplemented Food

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the supplemented food facts table includes separate information for different amounts of the supplemented food as provided in paragraph B.29.005(5)(a) without including the information referred to in paragraph B.29.005(5)(b), the supplemented food facts table must be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the supplemented food, a supplemented food facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the supplemented food facts table must be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual dual format in accordance with Figure 13.5(B) or 13.6(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the supplemented food facts table.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, in determining whether a version of a supplemented food facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the supplemented food, the supplemented food facts table must include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included for each amount of the supplemented food for which separate information is set out in the table.

Despite subsections (1) and (2), if the supplemented food facts table is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it must be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (2)(a) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Heading.TitleText: Aggregate Format — Different Amounts of Supplemented Food

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the supplemented food facts table includes separate information for different amounts of the supplemented food as provided in paragraphs B.29.005(5)(a) and (b), the supplemented food facts table must be set out in a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section and in respect of which the condition specified in column 2 is satisfied.

If it is not possible to display, in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the supplemented food, a supplemented food facts table in any of the versions that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, the supplemented food facts table must be set out in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual aggregate format in accordance with Figure 15.5(B) or 15.6(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a version that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, even though more than 15% of the available display surface would be required to display the supplemented food facts table.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, in determining whether a version of a supplemented food facts table cannot be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on 15% or less of the available display surface of the supplemented food, the supplemented food facts table must include only the information that is required by these Regulations to be included for each amount of the supplemented food for which separate information is set out in the table.

Despite subsections (1) and (2), if the supplemented food facts table of the supplemented food is set out on a tag attached to an ornamental container or a tag attached to a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase, it must be set out in a version that is described in paragraph (2)(a) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to this section, without regard to any condition specified in column 2.

Subsection.Text: If information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.29.003 is included in a supplemented food facts table that is set out in a version consisting of a table in English and a table in French or a table in English or French, that information must be displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with the order of presentation, the use of indents and the presentation of footnotes illustrated in Figures 18.1(E) and (F) of the Directory of SFFT Formats; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of matters other than those referred to in paragraph (a), in accordance with the format that is specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of SFFT Formats.

Subsection.Text: If information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.29.003 is included in a supplemented food facts table that is set out in a version consisting of a table in both English and French, that information must be displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with the order of presentation, the use of indents and the presentation of footnotes illustrated in Figure 19.1(B) of the Directory of SFFT Formats; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
