Paragraph.Text: in respect of matters other than those referred to in paragraph (a), in accordance with the format that is specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of SFFT Formats.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(a), the use of indents illustrated in Figures 18.1(E) and (F) of the Directory of SFFT Formats is not applicable if information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.29.003 is set out in the linear format referred to in paragraph B.29.009(3)(c) or the simplified linear format referred to in paragraph B.29.010(3)(c).

Despite section A.01.016 and subject to subsection (2), a supplemented food facts table that meets the conditions specified in subsection B.29.009(3), B.29.010(3) or B.29.011(3) or paragraph B.29.013(2)(a) may be set out on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a tag attached to the package;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a package insert;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the inner side of a label;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a fold-out label; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an outer sleeve, overwrap or collar.

Subsection.Text: The supplemented food facts table must not be set out in a manner described in paragraph (1)(b) or (c) if the label of the supplemented food is required to show a list of cautionary statements.

If the supplemented food facts table is set out in a manner described in paragraph (1)(b) or (c), the outer side of the label of the package must indicate in a type size of not less than 8 points where the supplemented food facts table is located.
If the supplemented food facts table is set out in a manner described in subsection (1), it must be set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a supplemented food described in subsection B.29.009(3), in a version that is described in paragraph B.29.009(3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.29.009;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a supplemented food described in subsection B.29.010(3), in a version that is described in paragraph B.29.010(3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.29.010;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a supplemented food described in subsection B.29.011(3), in a version that is described in paragraph B.29.011(3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.29.011; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a prepackaged product containing an assortment of supplemented foods described in paragraph B.29.013(2)(a), in a version that is described in subparagraph B.29.013(2)(a)(i) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.29.013.

Subsection.Text: Despite section A.01.016 and subject to subsection (2), if the available display surface of a supplemented food is less than 100 cm2, the label of the supplemented food need not carry a supplemented food facts table if the outer side of the label contains an indication of how a purchaser or consumer may obtain the information that would otherwise be required to be set out in a supplemented food facts table on the label of the supplemented food.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a supplemented food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the label of the supplemented food is required to show a list of cautionary statements; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is the subject of any of the following representations on the label of the supplemented food or in any advertisement for the supplemented food that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the supplemented food:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any declaration of the supplemented food’s energy value or the amount of a nutrient or supplemental ingredient contained in the supplemented food,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any representation that expressly or implicitly indicates that the supplemented food or any substance it contains has particular nutritional or health-related properties, including any statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims or column 1 of the table following section B.01.603 or referred to in section B.01.311, D.01.006 or D.02.004, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any health-related statement, name, logo, symbol, seal of approval or mark.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (2)(b), subsection (1) applies to a supplemented food that meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 37 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “Free of sugars” set out in column 1 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the supplemented food is not the subject of any representation referred to in paragraph (2)(b) other than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 4 of item 37 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “Free of sugars” set out in column 1,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the energy value of the supplemented food expressed in Calories per serving of stated size, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of sugar alcohols expressed in grams per serving of stated size;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the statement or claim set out in column 4 of item 37 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims for the subject “Free of sugars” set out in column 1 and that appears on the label is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: legibly set out on the principal display panel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in lower case letters except for the first letter of each word of the statement or claim, which may be an upper case letter,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: of at least the same size and prominence as the letters used in the numerical portion of the declaration of net quantity as required under paragraph 229(1)(a) and subsections 229(2) and (3) of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: displayed in a colour contrasting with the background of the label;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the energy value of the supplemented food expressed in Calories per serving of stated size and the amount of sugar alcohols expressed in grams per serving of stated size are shown immediately after whichever of the following elements appears last on the label:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the list of ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement as defined in subsection B.01.010.1(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration referred to in subsection B.01.010.4(1), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any statement referred to in subsection B.16.016(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the label of the supplemented food is not required to show a list of cautionary statements.

Subsection.Text: An indication referred to in subsection (1)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must be set out in a type size of not less than 8 points;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: must include a postal address, website address or toll-free telephone number; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: must be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in English and French, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in one of those languages, if, in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3), the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the supplemented food may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer of the supplemented food must provide the information referred to in subsection (1) to a purchaser or consumer on request

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: without charge;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the following manner, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the official language in which the information is requested or, if specified by the purchaser or consumer, in both official languages, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in one of the official languages, if, in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3), the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the supplemented food may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the form of a supplemented food facts table that is set out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in a format, other than a horizontal format, that is specified in any of sections B.29.009 to B.29.015 and that would otherwise be carried on the label of the supplemented food in accordance with these Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a version of that format that is listed in column 1 of item 1 of any Part of the table to the applicable section referred to in subparagraph (i).

Section.Label: B.29.019
Section.Text: If a supplemented food has an available display surface of less than 100 cm2 and has a supplemented food facts table on its label, the supplemented food facts table need only include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the serving of stated size;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.29.002 or the table to section B.29.003 in respect of the energy value of the supplemented food and the amount of any nutrient or supplemental ingredient that is the subject of a representation on the label of the supplemented food, or in any advertisement for the supplemented food that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the supplemented food, if the representation expressly or implicitly indicates that the supplemented food has particular nutritional or health-related properties, including any statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims or column 1 of the table following section B.01.603 or referred to in section B.01.311, D.01.006 or D.02.004;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any added sugar alcohol;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any saturated fat, sugars or sodium if the amount meets or exceeds the applicable threshold set out in columns 2, 3, 5 or 6 of the table to section B.01.350; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any supplemental ingredient for which a cautionary statement set out in the list of cautionary statements is applicable.

Subsection.Text: Every applicable cautionary statement set out in column 4 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients in respect of the supplemental ingredients contained in a supplemented food must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a list on the label of the supplemented food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: grouped together and introduced by the title, in bold type,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: “Caution”, “Caution:” or “Caution :” in the English version, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: “Attention”, “Attention :” or “Attention:” in the French version;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: without any intervening printed, written or graphic material appearing between the title and the first cautionary statement;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in regular or bold type;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in lower case letters, except that upper case letters must be used to show the first letter of each cautionary statement; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: separated by a bullet point or comma.

Subsection.Text: The list of cautionary statements must be shown in a manner that clearly differentiates it on the label by means of one or both of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: graphics in the form of a solid-line border around the list or one or more solid lines appearing immediately above, below or at the sides of the list that are the same colour as that of the type used to show the information referred to in subsection B.01.008.1(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a background colour that creates a contrast between the background colour of the list and the background colour used on the adjacent surface of the label, other than the surface used to display

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement as defined in subsection B.01.010.1(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a declaration referred to in subsection B.01.010.4(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any statement referred to in subsection B.16.016(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a nutrition facts table, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a supplemented food facts table.

Subsection.Text: The list of cautionary statements must be shown on the label without any intervening printed, written or graphic material,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in English and French, adjacent to each linguistic version of the supplemented food facts table appearing in the same language, if there are separate English and French versions of the table;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in English and French, adjacent to a bilingual version of the supplemented food facts table, with one linguistic version of the list following the other linguistic version; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in English or French, adjacent to the supplemented food facts table in the same language, if, in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3), the information required by these Regulations to be shown on the label may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

Subsection.Text: If the English and French versions of a list of cautionary statements appear on the label, they must be displayed on a continuous surface of the label’s available display surface, but need not be on the same continuous surface of the label’s available display surface.

If the English and French versions of a list of cautionary statements appear on the same continuous surface of the label, the version that follows the other version must not begin on the same line as that on which the other version ends, unless the available display surface is less than 100 cm2.

The principal display panel of a supplemented food must carry the supplemented food caution identifier that is set out in Schedule K.2 if a list of cautionary statements is shown on the label of the supplemented food.
The supplemented food caution identifier must be displayed in black and white and must be in accordance with the identifier set out in Schedule K.2.
Subject to subsection (4), the supplemented food caution identifier must be presented in one of the following formats:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the unilingual standard format, where two separate versions of the identifier are shown, one in English (ES) and one in French (FS); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the bilingual standard format (BS), where the identifier is shown in both official languages.

Subsection.Text: If the principal display surface is less than or equal to 450 cm2 and the width of each of the versions of the supplemented food caution identifier in the unilingual standard format or the width of the identifier in the bilingual standard format exceeds the width of the principal display panel, the identifier must be presented in the bilingual compact format (BC) in which the identifier is shown in both official languages.
The supplemented food caution identifier must be displayed in accordance with the applicable specifications set out in the Directory of Supplemented Food Caution Identifier Specifications.

Despite subsection (5), the supplemented food caution identifier may be displayed with larger dimensions than those set out in column 3 of the applicable table in the Directory of Supplemented Food Caution Identifier Specifications if the identifier is enlarged in a proportional manner vertically and horizontally.

If, in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3), the information required by these Regulations may be shown on the label of a supplemented food in English only or in French only and is shown in that language, the supplemented food caution identifier may be displayed on the principal display panel of the supplemented food in that language only on a continuous surface of the available display surface.

If the supplemented food caution identifier is presented in a bilingual format, the order in which the languages appear may be reversed from the order shown in the applicable identifier set out in Schedule K.2.
The characters and other elements of the supplemented food caution identifier must not touch each other.
The supplemented food caution identifier must be displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a supplemented food with a principal display panel whose height is less than its width, on the right half of the principal display panel; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any other supplemented food, on the upper half of the principal display panel.

Subsection.Text: The supplemented food caution identifier must be surrounded by a buffer that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a width that is equal to or greater than that set out in column 4 of the applicable table in the Directory of Supplemented Food Caution Identifier Specifications, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: does not contain any text or other graphic material.

Subsection.Text: If a supplemented food is cylindrical in shape, the outer edge of the buffer must be a minimum distance of 10% of the width of the principal display surface from the edge of the left or right side of that surface.

If it is impossible to comply with both paragraph (1)(a) and subsection (3), the supplemented food caution identifier may be displayed partially in the left half of the principal display panel but only to the extent necessary to comply with that subsection.

Section.Label: B.29.023
Section.Text: The supplemented food caution identifier must be oriented in the same manner as most of the other information that appears on the principal display panel unless the panel is displayed in the vertical plane and most of the other information is not displayed parallel with the base of the package, in which case the identifier must be oriented in such a manner that the words appearing in it are parallel with the base.

Section.Label: B.29.024
Section.Text: It is prohibited to label a prepackaged product with a supplemented food caution identifier or sell a product that is so labelled, unless a list of cautionary statements is shown on the label.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited to label a prepackaged product with any representation, including a word, phrase, illustration, sign, mark, symbol or design, that is likely to be mistaken for a supplemented food caution identifier, or sell a prepackaged product that is so labelled.
For the purposes of subsection (1), a representation does not include a nutrition symbol.

Despite anything in these Regulations, it is prohibited, on the label of or in any advertisement for a supplemented food, to make a statement or claim to the effect that a supplemental ingredient that is a nutrient contained in the supplemented food is generally recognized as an aid in maintaining the functions of the body necessary to the maintenance of good health, if the supplemental ingredient is one for which a cautionary statement set out in the list of cautionary statements is applicable.

However, the label of or advertisement for a supplemented food may carry such a statement or claim if it is accompanied by a statement or claim about the specific action or effect of the supplemental ingredient in maintaining the functions of the body necessary to the maintenance of good health.

If the label of or any advertisement for the supplemented food carries a statement or claim referred to in subsection (1), that statement or claim and the statement or claim referred to in subsection (2) must,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if made on the label of or in an advertisement, other than a radio or television advertisement, for the supplemented food,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be adjacent to one another without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: be shown in letters of the same size and prominence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if made in a radio advertisement or in the audio portion of a television advertisement for the supplemented food, immediately follow one another; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if made in the visual portion of a television advertisement for the supplemented food,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: appear concurrently and for the same amount of time,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: be adjacent to one another without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: be shown in letters of the same size and prominence.

Section.Label: B.29.027
Section.Text: Despite anything in these Regulations, if a supplemented food is required to show a cautionary statement that is set out in the list of cautionary statements and recommends against consumption by any individual less than 18 years of age that is part of a group identified in the cautionary statement, it is prohibited, on the label of or in any advertisement for the supplemented food, to make a statement or claim to the effect that a nutrient contained in the supplemented food is generally recognized as an aid in maintaining the functions of the body necessary to normal growth and development.

Subsection.Text: Despite anything in these Regulations, if the label of a supplemented food is required to carry the statement “high caffeine content” in accordance with column 5 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients, it is prohibited to make a representation, express or implied, on the label of or in any advertisement for the supplemented food with respect to any vitamin or mineral nutrient contained in the supplemented food.

Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a declaration of a vitamin in a list of ingredients or supplemented food facts table, or in respect of a declaration of a mineral nutrient in a list of ingredients, nutrition symbol or supplemented food facts table.
If a list of cautionary statements is shown on the label of a supplemented food, the representations set out in subsection (2) must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the representation is displayed on the principal display panel,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the height of the upper case letters in the representation must not exceed two times the height of the upper case letters, excluding any accents, in the supplemented food caution identifier, other than in the words “Health Canada” and “Santé Canada”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the height of the tallest ascender of the lower case letters in the representation must not exceed two times the height of the tallest ascender of the lower case letters in the supplemented food caution identifier, other than in the words “Health Canada” and “Santé Canada”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the representation is displayed on any continuous surface, other than on the principal display panel,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the height of the upper case letters in the representation must not exceed two times the height of the upper case letters, excluding any accents, in the cautionary statements, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the height of the tallest ascender of the lower case letters in the representation must not exceed two times the height of the tallest ascender of the lower case letters in the cautionary statements.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), the representations are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration referred to in subsection B.01.301(1) or (2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any representation that expressly or implicitly indicates that the supplemented food or any substance it contains has particular nutritional or health-related properties, including any statement or claim set out in column 4 of the Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims or column 1 of the table following section B.01.603 or referred to in section B.01.311, D.01.006 or D.02.004; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any health-related statement, logo, symbol, seal of approval or mark.

Subsection.Text: This section does not apply to the brand name or product name of a supplemented food.

Section.Label: B.29.030
Section.Text: A prepackaged product, other than a supplemented food, is adulterated if it contains a supplemented food as an ingredient.

Section.Label: B.29.031
Section.Text: A prepackaged product, other than a supplemented food, is adulterated if a substance listed in column 1 of the List of Permitted Supplemental Ingredients has been added to it other than in accordance with these Regulations.

Section.Label: B.29.032
Section.Text: A supplemented food does not have a poisonous or harmful substance in or on it for the purposes of paragraph 4(1)(a) of the Act — or is not adulterated for the purposes of paragraph 4(1)(d) of the Act — by reason only that a supplemental ingredient has been added to it.

Section.Label: B.30.001
Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: equivalent method means a method of analysis that is equivalent to a microbiological reference method as determined in accordance with the document entitled Canadian Requirements for Determining the Equivalence of Food Microbiological Methods of Analysis, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (méthode équivalente)

microbiological reference method means a method of analysis set out in column 2 of the document entitled Table of Microbiological Reference Methods for Food, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time, in respect of a corresponding microorganism set out in column 1. (méthode de référence microbiologique)

Table of Microbiological Criteria means the document entitled Table of Microbiological Criteria for Food, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (Tableau des critères microbiologiques)

Section.Label: B.30.002
Section.Text: A food set out in column 1 of the Table of Microbiological Criteria is adulterated if a corresponding microorganism set out in column 2 is present in or on the food and at least one of the following conditions is met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of sample units of the food with a level of the microorganism greater than that set out in column 5 is greater than the number set out in column 4; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the level of the microorganism in any of the sample units of the food is greater than the level, if any, set out in column 6.

Section.Label: B.30.003
Section.Text: A food set out in column 1 of the Table of Microbiological Criteria is, in respect of the presence of a corresponding microorganism set out in column 2, exempt from the application of paragraph 4(1)(a) of the Act, if neither condition described in paragraphs B.30.002(a) or (b) is met in relation to the microorganism.

Section.Label: B.30.004
Section.Text: For the purpose of sections B.30.002 and B.30.003,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of sample units taken for a food set out in column 1 of the Table of Microbiological Criteria for the purpose of determining the level of a microorganism set out in column 2 must be the number of sample units set out in column 3 in relation to that microorganism; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the level of a microorganism present in or on a food is to be determined in accordance with an applicable microbiological reference method or an equivalent method.

Subsection.Text: In this Part

Definition.Text: acetaminophen product has the same meaning as in Division 9; (produit d’acétaminophène)
adult standard dosage unit has, with reference to a drug, the same meaning as in Division 9; (dose normale pour adultes)

adverse drug reaction means a noxious and unintended response to a drug, which occurs at doses normally used or tested for the diagnosis, treatment or prevention of a disease or the modification of an organic function; (réaction indésirable à une drogue)

antibiotic means any drug or combination of drugs such as those named in C.01.410 to C.01.592 which is prepared from certain micro-organisms, or which formerly was prepared from micro-organisms but is now made synthetically and which possesses inhibitory action on the growth of other micro-organisms; (antibiotique)
brand name means, with reference to a drug, the name, whether or not including the name of any manufacturer, corporation, partnership or individual, in English or French,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is assigned to the drug by its manufacturer,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under which the drug is sold or advertised, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that is used to distinguish the drug; (marque nominative)

Definition.Text: case report means a detailed record of all relevant data associated with the use of a drug in a subject; (fiche d’observation)
children’s standard dosage unit has, with reference to a drug, the same meaning as in Division 9; (dose normale pour enfants)
child resistant package means a package that meets the requirements of subsection (2); (emballage protège-enfants)
common name means, with reference to a drug, the name in English or French by which the drug is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: commonly known, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: designated in scientific or technical journals, other than the publications referred to in Schedule B to the Act; (nom usuel)

Definition.Text: COVID-19 means the coronavirus disease 2019; (COVID-19)
COVID-19 drug means a drug, other than a veterinary health product, that is manufactured, sold or represented for use in relation to COVID-19; (drogue contre la COVID-19)

discontinue means, in respect of the sale of a drug by the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for the drug, to permanently cease the sale of the drug; (cesser)
expiration date means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug in dosage form, the earlier of the following dates, expressed at minimum as a year and month:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date up to and including which the drug maintains its labelled potency, purity and physical characteristics, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date after which the manufacturer recommends that the drug not be used; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an active ingredient, whichever of the following dates is applicable, expressed at minimum as a year and month:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the retest date, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date after which the manufacturer recommends that the active ingredient not be used; (date limite d’utilisation)

Definition.Text: flavour means a non-medicinal ingredient or combination of non-medicinal ingredients added to a drug solely to produce or mask a particular taste. It does not include an ingredient or combination of ingredients that impart only a sweet taste to the drug; (saveur)
fragrance means a non-medicinal ingredient or combination of non-medicinal ingredients added to a drug to produce or mask a particular odour; (parfum)
immediate container means the receptacle that is in direct contact with a drug; (récipient immédiat)
internal use means ingestion by mouth or application for systemic effect to any part of the body in which the drug comes into contact with mucous membrane; (usage interne)

ISAD Interim Order means the Interim Order Respecting the Importation, Sale and Advertising of Drugs for Use in Relation to COVID-19 made by the Minister on September 16, 2020 and published in Part I of the Canada Gazette on October 3, 2020; (arrêté d’urgence IVPD)

List A means the document, entitled List of Certain Antimicrobial Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients, that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Liste A)

List B means the document, entitled List of Certain Veterinary Drugs Which May Be Imported But Not Sold, that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Liste B)
List C means the document, entitled List of Veterinary Health Products, that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Liste C)

List D means the document entitled List of Certain Non-prescription Drugs for Distribution as Samples that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Liste D)

non-medicinal ingredient means a substance — other than the pharmacologically active drug — that is added during the manufacturing process and that is present in the finished drug product; (ingrédient non médicinal)
official drug means any drug

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for which a standard is provided in these Regulations, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for which no standard is provided in these Regulations but for which a standard is provided in any of the publications mentioned in Schedule B to the Act; (drogue officielle)

Definition.Text: parenteral use means administration of a drug by means of a hypodermic syringe, needle or other instrument through or into the skin or mucous membrane; (usage parentéral)
per cent means per cent by weight unless otherwise stated; (pour cent)
pharmaceutical ink means a non-medicinal ingredient or combination of non-medicinal ingredients used to imprint the drug with marks or symbols; (encre pharmaceutique)
pharmacist means a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is registered or otherwise entitled under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is practising pharmacy in that province; (pharmacien)

Definition.Text: pharmacy technician means a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is registered or otherwise entitled under the laws of a province to practise as a pharmacy technician; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is practising as a pharmacy technician in that province; (technicien en pharmacie)

Definition.Text: practitioner means a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is entitled under the laws of a province to treat patients with a prescription drug, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is practising their profession in that province; (praticien)

Definition.Text: prescription means an order given by a practitioner directing that a stated amount of any drug or mixture of drugs specified therein be dispensed for the person named in the order; (ordonnance)
proper name means, with reference to a drug, the name in English or French

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: assigned to the drug in section C.01.002,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that appears in bold-face type for the drug in these Regulations and, where the drug is dispensed in a form other than that described in this Part, the name of the dispensing form,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: specified in the Canadian licence in the case of drugs included in Schedule C or Schedule D to the Act, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: assigned in any of the publications mentioned in Schedule B to the Act in the case of drugs not included in paragraph (a), (b) or (c); (nom propre)

Definition.Text: salicylate product has the same meaning as in Division 9; (produit de salicylate)

serious adverse drug reaction means a noxious and unintended response to a drug that occurs at any dose and that requires in-patient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, causes congenital malformation, results in persistent or significant disability or incapacity, is life-threatening or results in death; (réaction indésirable grave à une drogue)

serious unexpected adverse drug reaction means a serious adverse drug reaction that is not identified in nature, severity or frequency in the risk information set out on the label of the drug; (réaction indésirable grave et imprévue à une drogue)
teaspoon means, for the purpose of calculation of dosage, a volume of 5 cubic centimetres; (cuillerée à thé)
test group means a group that meets the requirements of subsection (3); (groupe d’essai)

veterinary health product means any of the following drugs that is in dosage form and that is not manufactured, sold or represented for use in the diagnosis, treatment, mitigation or prevention of a disease, disorder or abnormal physical state, or its symptoms:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a substance set out in Column I of Part 1 of List C that is consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II to V, or any combination of any substances in which all the medicinal ingredients are substances set out in Column I of Part 1 of that list if that combination is, in respect of each of those substances, consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II and III and the descriptive information set out in Columns IV and V that is, within each of those columns, common to those substances;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a homeopathic medicine set out in Column I of Part 2 of List C that is consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II to V, or any combination of homeopathic medicines set out in Column I of Part 2 of that list if that combination is, in respect of each of those homeopathic medicines, consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II and III and the descriptive information set out in Columns IV and V that is, within each of those columns, common to those homeopathic medicines; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a traditional medicine set out in Column I of Part 3 of List C that is consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II to V, or any combination of traditional medicines set out in Column I of Part 3 of that list if that combination is, in respect of each of those traditional medicines, consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II and III and the descriptive information set out in Columns IV and V that is, within each of those columns, common to those traditional medicines; (produit de santé animale)

Definition.Text: withdrawal period means the length of time between the last administration of a drug to an animal and the time when tissues or products collected from the treated animal for consumption as food contain a level of residue of the drug that would not likely cause risk to human health. (délai d’attente)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the Act, serious adverse drug reaction has the same meaning as in subsection (1).
A child resistant package is a package that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: when tested in accordance with an acceptable method,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a test group comprising children, cannot be opened

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: by at least 85 per cent of those children prior to a demonstration to them of the proper means of opening the package, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: by at least 80 per cent of those children after the demonstration, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a test group comprising adults

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: can be opened by at least 90 per cent of those adults, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: where the package is designed so that, once opened and reclosed, it continues to meet the requirements of subparagraph (i), can be so reclosed by at least 90 per cent of those adults; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: complies with the requirements of one of the following standards, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Canadian Standards Association Standard CAN/CSA-Z76.1-M90, entitled Recloseable Child-Resistant Packages, published January 1990, as amended from time to time,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: European Standard EN 28317:1992, entitled Child-resistant packaging — Requirements and testing procedures for reclosable packages, as adopted by the European Committee for Standardization on October 30, 1992, recognized by the British Standards Institution, and effective February 15, 1993 and by the Association française de normalisation, and effective December 20, 1992, and which reiterates fully the international standard ISO 8317:1989, as amended from time to time, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: Code of Federal Regulations (United States), Title 16, Section 1700.15, entitled Poison prevention packaging standards, as amended from time to time.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, test group means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in relation to children, a group of at least 200 children who

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: are healthy and have no obvious physical or mental disability,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: are between 42 and 51 months of age, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: represent evenly, within plus or minus 10 per cent, each monthly age between 42 and 51 months calculated to the nearest month; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in relation to adults, a group of at least 100 adults who

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: are healthy and have no obvious physical or mental disability,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: are between 18 and 45 years of age, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: represent evenly, within plus or minus 10 per cent, each yearly age between 18 and 45 years calculated to the nearest year.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section, an amendment from time to time to a standard referred to in paragraph (2)(b) becomes effective 18 months after the date designated by the competent authority as the effective date for the amendment.

Section.Label: C.01.002
Section.Text: The Proper Name of a drug shown opposite an item number in the following Table in the column headed “Chemical Names and Synonyms” shall be the name shown opposite that item number in the column headed “Proper Names”.

row.entry: N-2-Bromobenzyl-N-ethyl-N, N-dimethylammonium tosylate (Tosylic acid is trivial name for p-toluenesulphonic acid)
3-{[(4-methyl-1-piperazinyl)imino]methyl} rifamycin SV : Rifampicin (I.N.N.) (Rifamycin SV is an antibiotic produced by Streptomyces mediterranei)

Disodium 5,5′-(2-hydroxytrimethylenedioxy) bis[4-oxo-4H-1-benzopyran-2- carboxylate]: Disodium 4,4′-dioxo-5,5′-(2-hydroxytrimethylenedioxy)di (chromene-2-carboxylate): Cromolyn Sodium (USP): Disodium Cromoglycate
An alkaloid derived from Vinca rosea
An alkaloid derived from Vinca rosea

Section.Label: C.01.003
Section.Text: No person shall sell a drug that is not labelled as required by these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The inner and outer labels of a drug shall show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the principal display panel

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name, if any, of the drug which, if there is a brand name for the drug, shall immediately precede or follow the brand name in type not less than one-half the size of that of the brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if there is no proper name, the common name of the drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in both official languages, the notation “sterile” “stérile” if the drug is required to be sterile by these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the upper left quarter of the principal display panel

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the symbol “Pr” in the case of a prescription drug, but the symbol “Pr” shall not appear on the label of any other drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the symbol “Symbol consisting of a diamond shape outline in which an uppercase letter C is centred.” in a clear manner and a conspicuous colour and size, in the case of a controlled drug, other than a controlled drug contained in an agricultural implant and set out in Part III of the schedule to Part G,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the symbol “N” in a colour contrasting with the rest of the label or in type not less than half the size of any letters used thereon, in the case of a narcotic as defined in the Narcotic Control Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a targeted substance as defined in section 1 of the Benzodiazepines and Other Targeted Substances Regulations, the following symbol in a colour contrasting with the rest of the label and in type not less than half the size of any other letter used on the main panel, namely,

ImageGroup.AlternateText: Symbol consisting of a square outline divided in half from top left corner to bottom right corner. The top right half has an uppercase letter C inside and lower left half has an uppercase letter T inside.

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: on any panel

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the lot number of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: adequate directions for use of the drug, except in the case of a drug to which section C.01.004.02 applies,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a quantitative list of the medicinal ingredients of the drug by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names, except in the case of a drug to which section C.01.004.02 applies,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiration date of the drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a new drug for extraordinary use in respect of which a notice of compliance has been issued under section C.08.004.01, the following statement, displayed in capital letters and in a legible manner:

Provision.Text: “HEALTH CANADA HAS AUTHORIZED THE SALE OF THIS EXTRAORDINARY USE NEW DRUG FOR [naming purpose] BASED ON LIMITED CLINICAL TESTING IN HUMANS.
SANTÉ CANADA A AUTORISÉ LA VENTE DE CETTE DROGUE NOUVELLE POUR USAGE EXCEPTIONNEL AUX FINS DE [indication de la fin] EN SE FONDANT SUR DES ESSAIS CLINIQUES RESTREINTS CHEZ L’ÊTRE HUMAIN.”.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the requirements of subsection (1), the outer label of a drug shall display the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net amount of the drug in the container in terms of weight, measure or number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug intended for parenteral use, a quantitative list of any preservatives present therein by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug for human use that contains mercury or a salt or derivative thereof as a preservative, a quantitative list of all mercurial preservatives present therein by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names.

Subsection.Text: Where the container of a drug is too small to accommodate an inner label that conforms to the requirements of these Regulations, the inner label requirements of these Regulations do not apply to the drug in that container if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there is an outer label that complies with the labelling requirements of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the inner label shows

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name of the drug, the common name of the drug if there is no proper name or, in the case of a drug with more than one medicinal ingredient, the brand name of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the potency of the drug except where, in the case of a drug with more than one medicinal ingredient, the name used pursuant to subparagraph (i) for that drug is unique for a particular potency of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the net contents of the drug if it is not in a discrete dosage form,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the route of administration of the drug if other than oral,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the lot number of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiration date of the drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the identification of special characteristics of the dosage form if they are not evident from the name of the drug under subparagraphs (i) or (ii).

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1) to (3) do not apply to a drug that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sold to a drug manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sold by a pharmacist under a prescription or by a practitioner, if its label shows suitable directions for use and meets the requirements set out in section C.01.005; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: listed in Schedule D to the Act.

Subsection.Text: Every label of a drug for human use in dosage form shall display the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a telephone number, email address, website address, postal address or any other information that enables communication with a contact person in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement to the effect that any injury to a person’s health that is suspected of being associated with the use of the drug may be reported to the contact person.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the labels of a drug that is listed in Schedule C or D to the Act and that is in dosage form; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the inner and outer labels of a drug to which section C.01.004.02 applies.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the requirements of section C.01.004, the outer label of a drug for human use in dosage form shall display, either one bilingual table, placed on any panel, that contains only the following information in both English and French or one table in English and one table in French, each of which is placed on any panel, that contains only the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adequate directions for use of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a quantitative list of the drug’s medicinal ingredients by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s non-medicinal ingredients listed in alphabetical order or in descending order of predominance by their proportion in the drug, preceded by words that clearly distinguish them from the medicinal ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in subsection C.01.004.01(1).

Subsection.Text: If a package is too small to accommodate an outer label that displays one bilingual table that lists all of the drug’s non-medicinal ingredients or two unilingual tables, each of which lists all of the drug’s non-medicinal ingredients, the list of non-medicinal ingredients shall be displayed in both English and French on a tag, tape or card that is attached to the package.

If pharmaceutical ink, a fragrance or a flavour has been added to the drug, the following expressions may be included in the list of non-medicinal ingredients to indicate that those ingredients have been added to the drug, instead of listing them individually:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where a bilingual table referred to in subsection (1) is displayed, the expressions “flavour/saveur”, “fragrance/parfum” and “pharmaceutical ink/encre pharmaceutique”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where two unilingual tables referred to in subsection (1) are displayed, the expressions

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: “encre pharmaceutique”, “parfum” and “saveur” in the table in French, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: “flavour”, “fragrance” and “pharmaceutical ink” in the table in English.

Subsection.Text: If the composition of the drug varies from one lot to another with respect to its non-medicinal ingredients,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where a bilingual table referred to in subsection (1) is displayed, the table shall include a reference to all non-medicinal ingredient alternatives that may be present in the drug, preceded by the symbol “+/–” or “±” or the expression “or/ou” or “may contain/peut contenir”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where two unilingual tables referred to in subsection (1) are displayed,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the table in French shall list all non-medicinal ingredient alternatives that may be present in the drug, preceded by the symbol “+/–” or “±” or the expression “ou” or “peut contenir”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the table in English shall list all non-medicinal ingredient alternatives that may be present in the drug, preceded by the symbol “+/–” or “±” or the expression “or” or “may contain”.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraphs (3)(a) and (4)(a), the French terms in the expressions may appear first.
Subsections (1) to (5) do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prescription drugs;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: drugs that are permitted to be sold without a prescription but that are to be administered only under the supervision of a practitioner; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: drugs that are represented as being solely for use as a disinfectant on hard non-porous surfaces.

Section.Label: C.01.004.03
Section.Text: In addition to the requirements of section C.01.004, the inner label of a drug to which section C.01.004.02 applies shall display on any panel

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adequate directions for use of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a quantitative list of the drug’s medicinal ingredients by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in subsection C.01.004.01(1).

Subsection.Text: No person shall import a drug in dosage form into Canada for the purpose of sale unless they have in Canada a person who is responsible for the sale of the drug.

No person who imports a drug in dosage form into Canada shall sell any lot or batch of the drug unless the name of the person who imports it, and the address of the principal place of business in Canada of the person responsible for its sale, appears on the inner and outer labels of the drug.

The principal display panel of both the inner label and outer label of a drug in dosage form shall show the drug identification number assigned for that drug, preceded by the expression “Drug Identification Number” or “Drogue : identification numérique”, or both, or the abbreviation “DIN”.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug in dosage form that is compounded by a pharmacist under a prescription or by a practitioner; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug in dosage form that is sold under a prescription if the following information appears on the drug’s label:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug’s proper name, common name or brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug’s potency, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the drug’s manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: In this section and in sections C.01.005.1 and C.01.014, drug in dosage form means a drug in a form in which it is ready for use by the consumer without requiring any further manufacturing.
No pharmacist or practitioner shall sell a Class A opioid — including one that is compounded by a pharmacist under a prescription or by a practitioner — unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s package has applied to it a warning sticker that meets the specifications set out in the source document; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is accompanied by a patient information handout that meets the specifications set out in the source document.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of the sale of a Class A opioid by a pharmacist or practitioner if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the opioid will be, or is, administered under the supervision of a practitioner; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sale is to a pharmacist or practitioner.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: Class A opioid means a drug in dosage form set out in Part A of the List of Opioids, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (opioïde de catégorie A)
source document means the document entitled Information for Patients Concerning Opioids, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (document source)

Section.Label: C.01.006
Section.Text: Where a package of a drug has only one label, that label shall contain all the information required by these Regulations to be shown on both the inner and the outer labels.

Section.Label: C.01.007
Section.Text: No reference, direct or indirect, to the Act or to these Regulations shall be made upon any label of or in any advertisement for a drug unless such reference is a specific requirement of the Act or these Regulations.

Section.Label: C.01.009
Section.Text: If any Act of Parliament or any of its regulations prescribes a standard or grade for a drug and that standard or grade is given a name or designation in the Act or regulation, no person shall, on a label of or in any advertisement for that drug, use that name or designation unless the drug conforms with the standard or grade.

Section.Label: C.01.010
Section.Text: If it is necessary to provide adequate directions for the safe use of a parenteral drug or prescription drug that is used in the treatment or prevention of any disease, disorder or abnormal physical state mentioned in Schedule A.1 to the Act, the disease, disorder or abnormal physical state may be mentioned on the drug’s labels, including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the drug, and, in that respect, the drug is exempt from subsections 3(1) and (2) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: A drug referred to in subsection 10(2) of the Act shall be exempt from the standard for any drug contained in any publication mentioned in Schedule B to the Act to the extent that such drug differs from that standard with respect to colour, flavour, shape and size, if such difference does not interfere with any method of assay prescribed in any such publication.

Where a manufacturer’s standard is used for a drug, the manufacturer shall make available to the Minister, on request, details of that standard and of a method of analysis for the drug acceptable to the Minister.
No person shall use a manufacturer’s standard for a drug that provides

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a lesser degree of purity than the highest degree of purity, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a greater variation in potency than the least variation in potency,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: provided for that drug in any publication mentioned in Schedule B to the Act.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (4) does not apply in respect of new drugs, other than those listed in Schedule C to the Act.

Section.Label: C.01.012
Section.Text: A manufacturer who makes representations on a label of a drug in oral dosage form, or in any advertisement, with respect to the site, rate or extent of release to the body of a medicinal ingredient of the drug, or the availability to the body of a medicinal ingredient of the drug, shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before making the representations, conduct such investigations, using an acceptable method, as may be necessary to demonstrate that the site, rate or extent of release to the body of the medicinal ingredient of the drug and the availability to the body of the medicinal ingredient of the drug, correspond to the representations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on request submit the record of such investigations to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: Where the manufacturer of a drug is requested in writing by the Minister to submit on or before a specified day evidence with respect to a drug, the manufacturer shall make no further sales of that drug after that day unless he has submitted the evidence requested.
If the Minister determines that the evidence submitted by a manufacturer under subsection (1) is not sufficient, he or she shall so notify the manufacturer in writing.

Where, pursuant to subsection (2), a manufacturer is notified that the evidence with respect to a drug is not sufficient, he shall make no further sales of that drug unless he submits further evidence and is notified in writing by the Minister that that further evidence is sufficient.

A reference in this section to evidence with respect to a drug means evidence to establish the safety of the drug under the conditions of use recommended and the effectiveness of the drug for the purposes recommended.

Section.Label: C.01.013.1
Section.Text: Section C.01.013 does not apply in respect of a veterinary health product.

Heading.TitleText: Assignment and Cancellation of Drug Identification Numbers

Subsection.Text: No manufacturer shall sell a drug in dosage form unless a drug identification number has been assigned for that drug and the assignment of the number has not been cancelled under section C.01.014.6.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a veterinary health product, a study drug as defined in section C.03.301 or a medicated feed as defined in subsection 1(1) of the Feeds Regulations, 2024.
A manufacturer of a drug may make an application for a drug identification number for that drug.
An application under subsection (1) shall be made to the Minister in writing and shall include the following information and material:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer of the drug as it will appear on the label;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmaceutical form in which the drug is to be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any drug other than a drug described in paragraph (d), the recommended route of administration;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug for disinfection in premises, the types of premises for which its use is recommended;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a quantitative list of the medicinal ingredients contained in the drug by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name under which the drug is to be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the drug is for human use or veterinary use;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of each colouring ingredient that is not a medicinal ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the use or purpose for which the drug is recommended;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended dosage of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the manufacturer referred to in paragraph (a) and, where the address is outside the country, the name and address of the importer of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of any individual, firm, partnership or corporation, other than the names and addresses referred to in paragraphs (a) and (k), that will appear on the label of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug for veterinary use, the written text of every label to be used in connection with the drug, including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (m.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug for human use, mock-ups of every label to be used in connection with the drug — including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the drug — and mock-ups of the drug’s packages;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the application and the date of signature; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug for human use, an assessment as to whether there is a likelihood that the drug will be mistaken for another drug for which a drug identification number has been assigned due to a resemblance between the brand name that is proposed to be used in respect of the drug and the brand name, common name or proper name of the other drug.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a new drug, a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission filed under section C.08.002, C.08.002.01 or C.08.002.1 shall be regarded as an application for a drug identification number.

Subject to subsection (2), if a manufacturer has provided all the information and material described in subsection C.01.014.1(2) or section C.08.002, C.08.002.01 or C.08.002.1, as the case may be, in respect of a drug, the Minister shall issue to the manufacturer a document that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number assigned for the drug, preceded by the abbreviation “DIN”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if there are two or more brand names for the drug, the drug identification numbers assigned by the Minister for the drug, each of which pertains to one of the brand names and is preceded by the abbreviation “DIN”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains the information referred to in paragraphs C.01.014.1(2)(a) to (f).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may refuse to issue the document referred to in subsection (1) if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that the product in respect of which an application referred to in section C.01.014.1 has been made

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is not a drug, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is a drug but its sale would cause injury to the health of the purchaser or consumer or would be a contravention of the Act or these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister refuses to issue the document under subsection (2), the manufacturer may submit additional information or material and request the Minister to reconsider his or her decision.
On the basis of the additional information or material submitted under subsection (3), the Minister shall reconsider the grounds on which the refusal to issue the document was made.
The Minister may, at any time, impose terms and conditions on a drug identification number assigned for a Class B opioid or amend those terms and conditions.
The Minister may, at any time, impose terms and conditions on a drug identification number assigned for a public health emergency drug or amend such terms and conditions if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of compliance was issued under section C.08.004 in respect of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a new drug submission that was filed for the public health emergency drug under section C.08.002 and contains the statement referred to in paragraph C.08.002(2.1)(a), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a supplement to any new drug submission that was filed for the public health emergency drug under section C.08.003 and contains the statement referred to in paragraph C.08.003(5)(a); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of compliance was issued under section C.08.004 in respect of one of the following submissions or supplements that was filed in respect of the public health emergency drug on the basis of a direct or indirect comparison to another public health emergency drug referred to in paragraph (a):

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a new drug submission under section C.08.002,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an abbreviated new drug submission under section C.08.002.1, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a supplement to a new drug submission or abbreviated new drug submission under section C.08.003.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall notify, in writing, the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number of any terms and conditions imposed on the drug identification number and of any amendment to those terms and conditions.
The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: Class B opioid means a drug set out in Part B of the List of Opioids, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (opioïde de catégorie B)
public health emergency drug has the same meaning as in section C.08.001.1. (drogue pour urgence de santé publique)

Section.Label: C.01.014.3
Section.Text: The manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for a drug shall, within 30 days after the day on which the drug is first sold following the issuance by the Minister of the document, date and sign the document and return it to the Minister with a statement set out on it that the information it contains is correct and with an indication of the date of that first sale.

Section.Label: C.01.014.4
Section.Text: If the information referred to in subsection C.01.014.1(2) in respect of a drug is no longer correct owing to a change in the subject matter of the information,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a change in the subject matter of any of the information referred to in paragraphs C.01.014.1(2)(a) to (f)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that occurs prior to the sale of the drug, a new application shall be made, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that occurs after the sale of the drug, no further sale of the drug shall be made until a new application for a drug identification number in respect of that drug is made and a number is assigned; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a change in the subject matter of any of the information referred to in paragraphs C.01.014.1(2)(g) to (k)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that occurs prior to the sale of the drug, the particulars of the change shall be submitted with the return of the document referred to in section C.01.014.3, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that occurs after the sale of the drug, the person to whom the drug identification number in respect of that drug was issued shall, within 30 days of the change, inform the Minister of the change.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for a drug shall, annually before the first day of October and in a form established by the Minister, provide the Minister with a notification that is signed by them and that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: indicates whether any of the following circumstances apply in respect of the drug:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: as of the day on which the notification is sent,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the manufacturer sells the drug in Canada, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the manufacturer has discontinued the sale of the drug in Canada, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the manufacturer has not sold the drug in Canada for a period that is greater than 12 months and a portion of that period is covered by the notification; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2), confirms that the information that the manufacturer previously submitted with respect to the drug under subsection C.01.014.1(2), paragraph C.01.014.4(b) or section C.08.002, C.08.002.01, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, is correct as of the day on which the notification is sent.

Subsection.Text: If any of the information that the manufacturer submitted under a provision referred to in paragraph (1)(b) is not correct as of the day on which the notification is sent, the manufacturer shall update that information in the notification.
The Minister shall cancel the assignment of a drug identification number for a drug if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number advises under section C.01.014.7 that they discontinued the sale of the drug; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister determines that the product for which the drug identification number has been assigned is not a drug.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may cancel the assignment of a drug identification number for a drug if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number contravenes section C.01.014.5;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number has been notified under section C.01.013 that the evidence that they submitted with respect to the drug is not sufficient; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is a new drug in respect of which the notice of compliance has been suspended under section C.08.006.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may cancel the assignment of a drug identification number for a drug if, after he or she has, under section 21.31 of the Act, ordered the holder of a therapeutic product authorization referred to in subparagraph C.01.052(1)(a)(i) or (iii) to conduct an assessment of the drug in order to provide evidence establishing that the benefits associated with the drug outweigh the risks of injury to health,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder fails to comply with the order; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder complies with the order but the Minister determines that the results of the assessment are not sufficient to establish that the benefits associated with the drug outweigh the risks of injury to health.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, the Minister’s power to cancel the assignment of a drug identification number

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: under paragraph (2)(b) is not affected by his or her power to cancel the assignment of such a number under subsection (3); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under subsection (3) is not affected by his or her power to cancel the assignment of such a number under paragraph (2)(b).

Heading.TitleText: Shortages of Drugs and Interruption and Discontinuation of Sale of Drugs

Section.Label: C.01.014.7
Section.Text: The manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for a drug shall, within 30 days after the day on which they discontinue the sale of the drug, submit the following information to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the drug identification number assigned for the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the manufacturer discontinued the sale of the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the latest expiration date of the drug that the manufacturer sold and the lot number of that drug.

Section.Label: C.01.014.71
Section.Text: If a period of 12 months has elapsed since the day on which the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for a drug as defined in section C.01.014.8 last sold the drug, the manufacturer shall so notify the Minister in writing within 30 days after the day on which that period ends.

Section.Label: C.01.014.72
Section.Text: If the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for a drug resumes the sale of the drug after a period of 12 months has elapsed since the day on which they last sold the drug, the manufacturer shall so notify the Minister in writing within 30 days after the day on which they resume the sale of the drug.

Section.Label: C.01.014.8
Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and in sections C.01.014.9 to C.01.014.14.

Definition.Text: drug means any of the following drugs for human use for which a drug identification number has been assigned:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: drugs included in Schedule I, II, III, IV or V to the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prescription drugs;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: drugs that are listed in Schedule C or D to the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: drugs that are permitted to be sold without a prescription but that are to be administered only under the supervision of a practitioner. (drogue)

Definition.Text: shortage, in respect of a drug, means a situation in which the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for the drug is unable to meet the demand for the drug in Canada. (pénurie)

Subsection.Text: If a shortage of a drug exists or is likely to occur, the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for the drug shall post the following information in English and French on a website that is operated by a party for that purpose with whom Her Majesty in right of Canada has entered into a contract to make that information available to the public:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s name and their telephone number, email address, website address, postal address or any other information that enables communication with them;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the drug identification number assigned for the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s brand name and proper name or, if it does not have a proper name, its common name;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the proper names of the drug’s medicinal ingredients or, if they do not have proper names, their common names;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s therapeutic classification according to the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical classification system (ATC), established by the World Health Organization Collaborating Centre for Drug Statistics Methodology — namely the level 3 description of, and level 4 code for, the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s strength;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s dosage form;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the drug contained in its package;
