Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s route of administration;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the date when the shortage began or is anticipated to begin;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the anticipated date when the manufacturer will be able to meet the demand for the drug, if they can anticipate that date; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the actual or anticipated reason for the shortage.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer shall post the information

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if they anticipate that a shortage will begin in more than six months, at least six months before the day on which they anticipate it to begin;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if they anticipate that a shortage will begin in six months or less, within five days after the day on which they anticipate it; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if they did not anticipate the shortage, within five days after the day on which they become aware of it.

Subsection.Text: If any of the information that was posted by the manufacturer changes, they shall update that information on the website within two days after the day on which they make or become aware of the change.
Within two days after the day on which the manufacturer is able to meet the demand for the drug, they shall post information on the website to that effect.
This section does not apply in respect of a shortage of a drug that results from a decision by the manufacturer to discontinue its sale.

If the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for a drug decides to discontinue the sale of the drug, they shall post the following information in English and French on the website referred to in subsection C.01.014.9(1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s name and their telephone number, email address, website address, postal address or any other information that enables communication with them;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the drug identification number assigned for the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s brand name and proper name or, if it does not have a proper name, its common name;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the proper names of the drug’s medicinal ingredients or, if they do not have proper names, their common names;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s therapeutic classification according to the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical classification system (ATC), established by the World Health Organization Collaborating Centre for Drug Statistics Methodology — namely the level 3 description of, and level 4 code for, the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s strength;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s dosage form;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the drug contained in its package;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s route of administration;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the manufacturer will discontinue the sale of the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the reason for the discontinuation of sale.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer shall post the information

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if they decide to discontinue the sale of the drug in more than six months, at least six months before the day on which they will discontinue its sale; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if they decide to discontinue the sale of the drug in six months or less, within five days after the day on which that decision is made.

Subsection.Text: If any of the information that was posted by the manufacturer changes, they shall update that information on the website within two days after the day on which they make or become aware of the change.

Section.Label: C.01.014.11
Section.Text: The Minister shall ensure that a hyperlink to the website referred to in subsection C.01.014.9(1) is on the Government of Canada website.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may request that the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for a drug — or any person who holds an establishment licence in respect of a drug — provide the Minister with information that is in their control if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there is a shortage or risk of shortage of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information is necessary to establish or assess

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the existence of a shortage or risk of shortage of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the reason for a shortage or risk of shortage of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the effects or potential effects on human health of a shortage of the drug, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: measures that could be taken to prevent or alleviate a shortage of the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer or licensee will not provide the information without a legal obligation to do so.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer or licensee shall provide the requested information electronically in a format specified by or acceptable to the Minister within the time limit specified by the Minister.

Section.Label: C.01.014.13
Section.Text: No person who holds an establishment licence shall distribute a drug for consumption or use outside Canada unless the licensee has reasonable grounds to believe that the distribution will not cause or exacerbate a shortage of the drug.

Subsection.Text: If a person who holds an establishment licence distributes a drug for consumption or use outside Canada, the licensee shall immediately create a detailed record of the information that they relied on to determine that the distribution of the drug is not prohibited by section C.01.014.13.
The licensee shall retain the record for at least one year after the latest expiration date of the drug that they distributed.

Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell for human use a drug in the form of a tablet that is intended to be swallowed whole unless, when tested by the official method DO-25, Determination of the Disintegration Time of Tablets, dated July 5, 1989,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an uncoated tablet, the tablet disintegrates in not more than 45 minutes;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a plain coated tablet, the tablet disintegrates in not more than 60 minutes; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the label of the drug indicates that the tablet carries an enteric coating or a coating designed to serve a purpose similar to that of an enteric coating, the tablet does not disintegrate when exposed for 60 minutes to simulated gastric fluid, but when it is subsequently exposed for a continuous period to simulated intestinal fluid, the tablet disintegrates in not more than 60 minutes.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a drug in the form of a tablet where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of compliance in respect of the drug in the form of a tablet has been issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a dissolution or disintegration test for the drug in the form of a tablet is prescribed in Division 6 of this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is labelled as complying with a standard contained in a publication referred to in Schedule B to the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the drug has been demonstrated by an acceptable method to be available to the body; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: representations regarding the drug are made on its label, or in any advertisement, with respect to the site, rate or extent of release to the body of a medicinal ingredient of that drug, or the availability to the body of a medicinal ingredient of that drug.

Section.Label: C.01.016
Section.Text: No manufacturer shall sell a drug unless the manufacturer complies with the conditions set out in sections C.01.017 to C.01.019.

Heading.TitleText: Serious Adverse Drug Reaction Reporting — Manufacturers

Section.Label: C.01.017
Section.Text: The manufacturer shall submit to the Minister a report of all information relating to the following serious adverse drug reactions within 15 days after receiving or becoming aware of the information, whichever occurs first:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any serious adverse drug reaction that has occurred in Canada with respect to the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any serious unexpected adverse drug reaction that has occurred outside Canada with respect to the drug.

Heading.TitleText: Annual Summary Report and Case Reports

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer shall prepare an annual summary report of all information relating to adverse drug reactions and serious adverse drug reactions to the drug that it received or became aware of during the previous 12 months.
The annual summary report shall contain a concise, critical analysis of the adverse drug reactions and serious adverse drug reactions to the drug.

In preparing the annual summary report, the manufacturer shall determine, on the basis of the analysis referred to in subsection (2), whether there has been a significant change in what is known about the risks and benefits of the drug during the period covered by the report and shall include its conclusions in this regard in the summary report.

If, in preparing the annual summary report, the manufacturer concludes that there has been a significant change, it shall notify the Minister without delay, in writing, unless this has already been done.
The Minister may, for the purposes of assessing the safety and effectiveness of the drug, request in writing that the manufacturer submit to the Minister one or both of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the annual summary reports;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the case reports relating to the adverse drug reactions and serious adverse drug reactions to the drug that are known to the manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall, after giving the manufacturer an opportunity to be heard, specify a period for the submission of the annual summary reports or case reports, or both, that is reasonable in the circumstances, and the manufacturer shall submit the reports within that period.

Section.Label: C.01.018.1
Section.Text: Section C.01.018 does not apply in respect of a veterinary health product.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, for the purposes of assessing the safety and effectiveness of the drug, request in writing that the manufacturer submit to the Minister an issue-related summary report.

The report shall contain a concise, critical analysis of the adverse drug reactions and serious adverse drug reactions to the drug, as well as case reports of all or specified adverse drug reactions and serious adverse drug reactions to the drug that are known to the manufacturer in respect of the issue that the Minister directs the manufacturer to analyze in the report.

The Minister shall, after giving the manufacturer an opportunity to be heard, specify a period for the submission of the report that is reasonable in the circumstances. The Minister may only specify a period that is less than 30 days if the Minister needs the information in the report to determine whether the drug poses a serious and imminent risk to human health.
The manufacturer shall submit the report within the specified period.

Section.Label: C.01.019.1
Section.Text: Section C.01.019 does not apply in respect of a veterinary health product.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer shall maintain records of the reports and case reports referred to in sections C.01.017 to C.01.019.
The manufacturer shall retain the records for 25 years after the day on which they were created.

Heading.TitleText: Provision of Information Under Section 21.8 of Act

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of section 21.8 of the Act, hospitals are the prescribed health care institutions that shall provide information that is in their control to the Minister about a serious adverse drug reaction.

The following prescribed information about a serious adverse drug reaction that is in a hospital’s control shall be provided to the Minister in writing within 30 days after the day on which the serious adverse drug reaction is first documented within the hospital:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the hospital and the contact information of a representative of that hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s brand name, proper name or common name;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug imported under subsection C.10.001(2) or section C.10.006, the identifying code or number of the drug, if any, assigned in the country in which the drug was authorized for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug whose sale has been authorized under subsection C.11.003(1), its identifying name, code, number or mark;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the drug identification number assigned for the drug, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the patient’s age and sex;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the serious adverse drug reaction;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the serious adverse drug reaction was first documented;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the patient first used the drug and, if applicable, the date on which the patient stopped using the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the serious adverse drug reaction first occurred and, if applicable, the date on which the patient’s health was restored to its state prior to the reaction;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: any medical condition of the patient that directly relates to the serious adverse drug reaction;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: any concomitant therapeutic products used by the patient; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the effect of the serious adverse drug reaction on the patient’s health.

Subsection.Text: A hospital is exempt from section 21.8 of the Act in respect of the reporting of information referred to in subsection (2) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the hospital does not have in its control all of the information referred to in paragraphs (2)(b), (c), (e) and (f) in respect of the serious adverse drug reaction; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the serious adverse drug reaction relates only to any of the following drugs:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a vaccine that was administered under a routine immunization program of a province,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a drug that is authorized for sale under Division 5 of this Part, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a drug that was sold under subsection C.08.011(1).

Subsection.Text: In this section, hospital means a facility

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is licensed, approved or designated as a hospital by a province in accordance with the laws of the province to provide care or treatment to persons suffering from any form of disease or illness; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is operated by the Government of Canada and that provides health services to in-patients.

Section.Label: C.01.021
Section.Text: Except as provided in these Regulations, no person shall sell a drug for human use listed in the following table unless both the inner and the outer labels other than the inner label of a single dose container carry a statement of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the quantitative content of the drug,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended single and daily adult dose designated as such, except for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: preparations solely for external use, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: preparations solely for children’s use; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: adequate directions for use when the drug is recommended for children which shall be either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the statement “CHILDREN: As directed by the physician”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a suitable reduced maximum single and daily dose which shall not exceed the following:

table.title: Table of Limits of Drug Dosage for Adults

row.entry: Maximum Dosage Unless otherwise stated, doses are in milligrams
Amylocaine, its salts and derivatives when sold or recommended for opthalmic use
Amylocaine Hydrochloride, except when sold or recommended for ophthalmic use
Belladonna and its preparations, on the basis of belladonna alkaloids
Butacaine, its salts and derivatives when sold or recommended for ophthalmic use
Butacaine Sulphate, except when sold or recommended for opthalmic use
Cantharides, cantharidin, and their preparations, on the basis of cantharidin, except blisters
Chlorbutol (not more often than every 4 hours)
Colchicum and its preparations, on the basis of colchicine
Cyproheptadine and its salts — when sold or recommended for the promotion of weight gain
Gelseminine (Gelsemine) and its salts (not to be repeated within 4 hours)
Gelsemium and its preparations, on the basis of the crude drug
Hydrocyanic (Prussic) Acid as 2 per cent solution
Hyoscyamus and its preparations, on the basis of hyoscyamus alkaloids
Lobelia and its preparations, on the basis of the crude drug
Phenylpropanolamine when sold or recommended as an appetite depressent
Proxymetacaine, its salts and derivatives when sold or recommended for ophthalmic use
Squill and its preparations, on the basis of crude drug
Stramonium and its preparations, on the basis of stramonium alkaloids
Tetracaine, its salts and derivatives when sold or recommended for ophthalmic use

Provision.Text: Where drugs having similar physiological actions occur in combination, the dosage of each shall be proportionately reduced.

Accurate dosagesmay be expressed in either metric units or imperial units. If the dosage is expressed in both systems, then an approximation may be used for one expression, but such approximation must precede or follow the accurate statement by which the product will be judged and must be in brackets.

Section.Label: C.01.022
Section.Text: Notwithstanding paragraph C.01.021(b), the recommended single and daily dosage of a drug

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: intended to be burned and the smoke inhaled may be increased to 10 times the oral dose, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: intended for use as suppositories may be increased to 33 1/3 per cent in excess of the oral dose.

Subsection.Text: Sections C.01.021 and C.01.022 do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug sold to a drug manufacturer; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug sold on prescription.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph C.01.021(c) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: acetaminophen;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: acetylsalicylic acid;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: magnesium salicylate;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: sodium salicylate; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: choline salicylate.

Subsection.Text: Where a drug mentioned in any of paragraphs (2)(a) to (d) is recommended for children, no person shall sell the drug for human use unless both the inner and the outer labels carry a statement that it is recommended

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that the drug be used as directed by a physician; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that the maximum doses of the drug not exceed the amounts set out in the following table and that single doses not be administered more frequently than every four hours.

table.title: Maximum Dose

row.entry: Maximum Children’s Dose (80 mg units) Acetaminophen Drops
Maximum Children’s Dose (160 mg units) Acetaminophen
1.5 or as directed by a physician
1 or as directed by a physician
0.5 or as directed by a physician

Subsection.Text: Where choline salicylate is recommended for children, no person shall sell the drug for human use unless both the inner and the outer labels carry a statement that it is recommended

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that the drug be used as directed by physician; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that the maximum doses of the drug not exceed the amounts set out in the following table and that single doses not be administered more frequently than every four hours.

Section.Label: C.01.025
Section.Text: Both the inner and the outer labels of a drug that carry a recommended single or daily dosage or a statement of concentration in excess of the limits provided by section C.01.021 shall carry a caution that the product is to be used only on the advice of a physician.

Section.Label: C.01.026
Section.Text: The provisions of section C.01.025 do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug sold on prescription, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the inner label of a single-dose container.

Subsection.Text: Where a person advertises to the general public a drug for human use, the person shall not make any representation other than with respect to the brand name, proper name, common name, price and quantity of the drug if it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contains a drug set out in the table to section C.01.021; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: carries on its label

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the recommended single or daily adult dosage that results in a single or daily adult dosage of the drug referred to in paragraph (a) in excess of the maximum dosage set out in the table to section C.01.021 for that drug, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement that shows a concentration of the drug referred to in paragraph (a) in excess of the maximum limit set out in the table to section C.01.021 for that drug.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to products containing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: acetaminophen;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: acetylsalicylic acid;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: choline salicylate;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: magnesium salicylate; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: sodium salicylate.

Subsection.Text: Where a person advertises to the general public a drug for human use that contains acetylsalicylic acid, the person shall not make any representation with respect to its administration to or use by children or teenagers.

Heading.TitleText: Cautionary Statements and Child Resistant Packages

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the inner and outer labels of a drug that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: acetylsalicylic acid or any of its salts or derivatives, salicylic acid or a salt thereof, or salicylamide, where the drug is recommended for children, shall carry a cautionary statement to the effect that the drug should not be administered to a child under two years of age except on the advice of a physician;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: boric acid or sodium borate as a medicinal ingredient shall carry a cautionary statement to the effect that the drug should not be administered to a child under three years of age;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: hyoscine (scopolamine) or a salt thereof shall carry a cautionary statement to the effect that the drug should not be used by persons suffering from glaucoma or where it causes blurring of the vision or pressure pain within the eye;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: phenacetin, either singly or in combination with other drugs, shall carry the following cautionary statement:

Provision.Text: “CAUTION: May be injurious if taken in large doses or for a long time. Do not exceed the recommended dose without consulting a physician.”; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: acetylsalicylic acid for internal use shall carry a cautionary statement to the effect that the drug should not be administered to or used by children or teenagers who have chicken pox or manifest flu symptoms before a physician or pharmacist is consulted about Reye’s syndrome, which statement shall also refer to the fact that Reye’s syndrome is a rare and serious illness.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a drug that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: intended for parenteral use only;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: dispensed pursuant to a prescription; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a prescription drug or a drug that is required to be sold under a prescription by Part G, the Benzodiazepines and Other Targeted Substances Regulations or the Narcotic Control Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections C.01.031.2(1) and (2), the inner and outer labels of a drug

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: salicylic acid, a salt thereof or salicylamide,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: acetylsalicylic acid, or any of its salts or derivatives,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: acetaminophen, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: more than five per cent alkyl salicylates,

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: that contains nicotine or any of its salts and is a vaping product as defined in section 2 of the Tobacco and Vaping Products Act but that is not referred to in paragraph 2(b) or (c) or section 3 of the Regulations Excluding Certain Vaping Products Regulated Under the Food and Drugs Act from the Application of the Tobacco and Vaping Products Act, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is in a package that contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: more than the equivalent of 250 mg of elemental iron, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: more than the equivalent of 120 mg of fluoride ion, unless the drug is intended solely for use in dentists’ offices,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: shall carry a cautionary statement to the effect that the drug should be kept out of the reach of children.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections C.01.031.2(1) and (2), the inner label and outer label of a drug that is in a package shall carry a cautionary statement, to the effect that there is enough drug in the package to seriously harm a child, if the package contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: more than 1.5 g of salicylic acid or the equivalent quantity of any of its salts or salicylamide,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: more than 2 g of acetylsalicylic acid or the equivalent quantity of any of its salts or derivatives,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: more than 3.2 g of acetaminophen,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: more than the equivalent of 250 mg of elemental iron,

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: more than the equivalent of 120 mg of fluoride ion, unless the drug is intended solely for use in dentists’ offices, or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the drug is a vaping product as defined in section 2 of the Tobacco and Vaping Products Act but is not referred to in paragraph 2(b) or (c) or section 3 of the Regulations Excluding Certain Vaping Products Regulated Under the Food and Drugs Act from the Application of the Tobacco and Vaping Products Act, 0.1 mg/ml or more of nicotine or the equivalent quantity of any of its salts.

Subsection.Text: The cautionary statements required under subsections (1) and (2) shall be preceded by a prominently displayed symbol that is octagonal in shape, conspicuous in colour and on a background of a contrasting colour.
Subject to section C.01.031.2,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no person shall sell a drug described in subsection C.01.029(1) unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: where the drug is recommended solely for children, it is packaged in a child resistant package,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where the drug is not recommended solely for children, other than a drug referred to in subparagraph (iii), at least one of the sizes of packages available for sale is packaged in a child resistant package, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: where the drug is a vaping product referred to in paragraph C.01.029(1)(a.1), it is packaged in a child resistant package; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where a drug described in subsection C.01.029(1) is packaged in a package that is not a child resistant package, the outer label shall carry a statement that the drug is available in a child resistant package.

Subsection.Text: Subsection C.01.031.2(2) and paragraph C.01.031.2(3)(a) do not apply to a drug referred to in paragraph C.01.029(1)(a.1).
Sections C.01.029 to C.01.031 do not apply to a drug that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a prescription drug or a drug that is required to be sold under a prescription by Part G, the Benzodiazepines and Other Targeted Substances Regulations or the Narcotic Control Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: intended for parenteral use only;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in effervescent or powder form;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in suppository form;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: intended for topical use, unless it is a liquid preparation containing more than five per cent alkyl salicylates;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: packaged in a non-reclosable package containing not more than two adult standard dosage units per package; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in toothpaste form.

Subsection.Text: Sections C.01.029 to C.01.031 do not apply to a drug that is repackaged by a pharmacist or practitioner at the time of sale.
Section C.01.031 does not apply to a drug that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sold only in containers that have roll-on or spray applicators or permanently installed wick applicators;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sold for exclusive use in animals other than household pets; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: intended solely for use in dentists’ offices, or packaged for hospital use only.

Section.Label: C.01.032
Section.Text: No person shall sell a corticosteroid drug for ophthalmic use unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the outer label or the package insert carries, as part of the directions for use, the following statements:

Provision.Text: Viral diseases of the cornea and conjunctiva;
Tuberculosis of the eye;
Fungal diseases of the eye;
Acute purulent untreated infections of the eye, which, like other diseases caused by micro-organisms, may be masked or enhanced by the presence of the steroid.

Extended ophthalmic use of corticosteroid drugs may cause increased intraocular pressure in certain individuals and in those diseases causing thinning of the cornea, perforation has been known to occur.”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the inner label carries the statements required by paragraph (a) or instructions to see the outer label or package insert for information about contraindications and side effects.

Section.Label: C.01.033
Section.Text: Section C.01.032 does not apply to a corticosteroid drug that is sold by a pharmacist under a prescription.

Section.Label: C.01.034
Section.Text: No person shall disseminate to a practitioner promotional literature about corticosteroid drugs for ophthalmic use unless the statements required by paragraph C.01.032(a) are included in that literature.

Section.Label: C.01.035
Section.Text: Sections C.01.032 and C.01.034 do not apply to a drug sold solely for veterinary use.

Subsection.Text: No manufacturer or importer shall sell

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug that contains phenacetin in combination with any salt or derivative of salicylic acid;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug for human use that contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: oxyphenisatin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: oxyphenisatin acetate, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: phenisatin; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a drug for human use that contains mercury or a salt or derivative thereof, unless the drug is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a drug described in Schedule C or D to the Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one of the following drugs, namely,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an ophthalmic drug or other drug to be used in the area of the eye,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a drug for nasal administration,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: a drug for otic administration, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: a drug for parenteral administration that is packaged in a multi-dose container,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: in which the mercury or the salt or derivative thereof is present as a preservative and the manufacturer or importer has submitted evidence to the Minister demonstrating that the only satisfactory way to maintain the sterility or stability of the drug is to use that preservative.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of clause (1)(c)(ii)(A), area of the eye means the area bounded by the supraorbital and infraorbital ridges and includes the eyebrows, the skin underlying the eyebrows, the eyelids, the eyelashes, the conjunctival sac of the eye, the eyeball and the soft tissue that lies below the eye and within the infraorbital ridge.

Section.Label: C.01.036.1
Section.Text: No person shall sell, or advertise for sale, nitrous oxide to the general public.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell to the general public a drug that is recommended solely for children if the package in which the drug is sold contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: more than 1.92 g of salicylamide or salicylic acid or the equivalent quantity of a salt of salicylic acid;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: more than 1.92 g of acetylsalicylic acid or the equivalent quantity of a salt or derivative thereof;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: more than 3.2 g of acetaminophen in 160 mg dosage units; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: more than 1.92 g of acetaminophen in 80 mg dosage units.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a drug dispensed pursuant to a prescription.

Section.Label: C.01.038
Section.Text: A drug for human use is adulterated if it contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Strychnine or any of its salts;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: extracts or tinctures of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Strychnos nux vomica,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Strychnos Ignatii, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a Strychnos species containing strychnine, other than those species mentioned in subparagraphs (i) and (ii);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: Methapyrilene or any of its salts;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: Echimidine or any of its salts; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any of the following plant species or extracts or tinctures thereof:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Symphytum asperum,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Symphytum x uplandicum, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other plant species containing echimidine.

Section.Label: C.01.039
Section.Text: In vitro diagnostic products that are or contain drugs other than drugs listed in Schedule E to the Act, and drugs listed in Schedule D to the Act that are labelled for veterinary use only, are exempt from the application of this Part.

Section.Label: C.01.040
Section.Text: No manufacturer or importer shall sell a drug for human use that contains as an ingredient

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: chloroform; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: arsenic or any of its salts or derivatives, other than arsenic trioxide.

Section.Label: C.01.040.1
Section.Text: No manufacturer shall use methyl salicylate as a medicinal ingredient in a drug for internal use in humans.

Subsection.Text: No manufacturer shall use a colouring agent in a drug other than a colouring agent listed in subsections (3) and (4).
No person shall import for sale a drug that contains a colouring agent other than a colouring agent listed in subsections (3) and (4).
The following definitions apply in subsections (3) to (4.1):

Definition.Text: C.I. (indication of the number) means the designation used to identify a colouring agent in the Colour Index published by The Society of Dyers and Colourists, as amended from time to time; (C.I. (indication du numéro))

D & C (indication of the colour and the number) means the designation used to identify, in accordance with the Code of Federal Regulations of the United States, a colouring agent that can be used in the United States in drugs and cosmetics; (D&C (indication de la couleur et du numéro))

FD & C (indication of the colour and the number) means the designation used to identify, in accordance with the Code of Federal Regulations of the United States, a colouring agent that can be used in the United States in food, drugs and cosmetics. (FD&C (indication de la couleur et du numéro))

Subsection.Text: The following colouring agents are permitted in drugs for internal and external use, namely,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ACID FUCHSIN D (D & C Red No. 33; C.I. No. 17200),

Provision.Text: ALIZARIN CYANINE GREEN F (D & C Green No. 5; C.I. No. 61570),
ALLURA RED AC (FD & C Red No. 40; C.I. No. 16035),
AMARANTH (Delisted FD & C Red No. 2; C.I. No. 16185),
ANTHOCYANIN DERIVED FROM JUICE EXPRESSED FROM FRESH EDIBLE FRUITS OR VEGETABLES,
ß-APO-81-CAROTENAL (C.I. No. 40820),
BRILLIANT BLUE FCF SODIUM SALT (FD & C Blue No. 1; C.I. No. 42090),
BRILLIANT BLUE FCF AMMONIUM SALT (D & C Blue No. 4; C.I. No. 42090),
CANTHAXANTHIN (C.I. No. 40850),
CARAMEL,
CARBON BLACK (C.I. No. 77266),
CARMINE (C.I. No. 75470),
CARMOISINE (Delisted Ext. D & C Red No. 10; C.I. No. 14720),
ß-CAROTENE (C.I. No. 40800),
CHLOROPHYLL (C.I. No. 75810),
EOSIN YS ACID FORM (D & C Red No. 21; C.I. No. 45380:2),
EOSIN YS SODIUM SALT (D & C Red No. 22; C.I. No. 45380),
ERYTHROSINE (FD & C Red No. 3; C.I. No. 45430),
FAST GREEN FCF (FD & C Green No. 3; C.I. No. 42053),
FLAMING RED (D & C Red No. 36; C.I. No. 12085),
HELINDONE PINK CN (D & C Red No. 30; C.I. No. 73360),
INDIGO (D & C Blue No. 6; C.I. No. 73000),
INDIGOTINE (FD & C Blue No. 2; C.I. No. 73015),
LITHOL RUBIN B SODIUM SALT (D & C Red No. 6; C.I. No. 15850),
LITHOL RUBIN B CALCIUM SALT (D & C Red No. 7; C.I. No. 15850:1),
PHLOXINE B ACID FORM (D & C Red No. 27; C.I. No. 45410:1),
PHLOXINE B SODIUM SALT (D & C Red No. 28; C.I. No. 45410),
PONCEAU 4R (C.I. No. 16255),
PONCEAU SX (FD & C Red No. 4; C.I. No. 14700),
QUINOLINE YELLOW WS (D & C Yellow No. 10; C.I. No. 47005),
RIBOFLAVIN,
SUNSET YELLOW FCF (FD & C Yellow No. 6; C.I. No. 15985),
TARTRAZINE (FD & C Yellow No. 5; C.I. No. 19140),
TITANIUM DIOXIDE (C.I. No. 77891);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: preparations made by extending any of the colouring agents listed in paragraph (a) on a substratum of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: alumina,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: blanc fixe,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: gloss white,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: clay,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: zinc oxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: talc,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: rosin,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: aluminum benzoate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium carbonate, or

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: any combination of the substances listed in subparagraphs (i) to (ix); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: preparations made by extending any sodium, potassium, aluminum, barium, calcium, strontium or zirconium salt of any of the colouring agents listed in paragraph (a) on a substratum of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: alumina,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: blanc fixe,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: gloss white,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: clay,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: zinc oxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: talc,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: rosin,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: aluminum benzoate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium carbonate, or

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: any combination of the substances listed in subparagraphs (i) to (ix).

Subsection.Text: The following colouring agents are permitted in drugs for external use, namely,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ACID VIOLET 43 (Ext. D & C Violet No. 2; C.I. No. 60730),

Provision.Text: ALIZUROL PURPLE SS (D&C Violet No. 2; C.I. No. 60725),
ANNATTO (C.I. No. 75120),
BISMUTH OXYCHLORIDE (C.I. No. 77163),
CHROMIUM HYDROXIDE GREEN (PIGMENT GREEN 18 (C.I. No. 77289)),
DEEP MAROON (D&C Red No. 34; C.I. No. 15880:1),
DIBROMOFLUORESCEIN (SOLVENT RED 72 (C.I. No. 45370:1); ORANGE No. 5 (D & C Orange No. 5)),
FERRIC FERROCYANIDE (C.I. No. 77510),
GUANINE (C.I. No. 75170),
MANGANESE VIOLET (C.I. No. 77742),
MICA (C.I. No. 77019),
ORANGE II (D&C Orange No. 4; C.I. No. 15510),
PYRANINE CONCENTRATED (D&C Green No. 8; C.I. No. 59040),
QUINIZARIN GREEN SS (D&C Green No. 6; C.I. No. 61565),
TONEY RED (D&C Red No. 17; C.I. No. 26100),
URANINE ACID FORM (D&C Yellow No. 7; C.I. No. 45350:1),
URANINE SODIUM SALT (D&C Yellow No. 8; C.I. No. 45350);
ZINC OXIDE (C.I. No. 77947);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: preparations made by extending any of the colouring agents listed in paragraph (a) on a substratum of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: alumina,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: blanc fixe,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: gloss white,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: clay,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: zinc oxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: talc,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: rosin,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: aluminum benzoate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium carbonate, or

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: any combination of the substances listed in subparagraphs (i) to (ix); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: preparations made by extending any sodium, potassium, aluminum, barium, calcium, strontium or zirconium salt of any of the colouring agents listed in paragraph (a) on a substratum of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: alumina,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: blanc fixe,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: gloss white,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: clay,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: zinc oxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: talc,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: rosin,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: aluminum benzoate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium carbonate, or

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: any combination of the substances listed in subparagraphs (i) to (ix).

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), no manufacturer shall use a preparation made by extending any of the following substances on a substratum of mica in a drug unless the requirements in subsection (4.3) are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: titanium dioxide (C.I. No. 77891);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a mixed oxide made from substances referred to in both paragraphs (a) and (b).

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), no person shall import for sale a drug that contains a preparation made by extending any of the substances referred to in paragraphs (4.1)(a) to (c) on a substratum of mica unless the requirements in subsection (4.3) are met.
The requirements referred to in subsections (4.1) and (4.2) are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the drug shall be in a solid dosage form intended for oral administration or in a liquid dosage form intended for oral administration or it shall be a drug intended for external use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the drug is in a solid dosage form intended for oral administration, the drug shall not contain more than 3% of the preparation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the preparation was made using iron oxides, the preparation shall not contain more than 55% iron oxides.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1), (2), (4.1) and (4.2) do not apply in respect of a drug that is represented as being solely for use in the disinfection, for disease prevention, of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: medical devices;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: health care facilities; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: premises in which food is manufactured, prepared or kept.

Section.Label: C.01.040.3
Section.Text: In deciding whether to amend the Prescription Drug List in respect of a drug, including by adding the drug to it or removing the drug from it, the Minister shall consider whether any of the following criteria apply with respect to the drug:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: supervision by a practitioner is necessary

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the diagnosis, treatment, mitigation or prevention of a disease, disorder or abnormal physical state, or its symptoms, in respect of which the drug is recommended for use, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to monitor a disease, disorder or abnormal physical state, or its symptoms, in respect of which the drug is recommended for use, or to monitor the use of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the level of uncertainty respecting the drug, its use or its effects justifies supervision by a practitioner; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: use of the drug can cause harm to human or animal health or a risk to public health and the harm or the risk can be mitigated by a practitioner’s supervision.

Section.Label: C.01.040.4
Section.Text: The Minister shall consult the general public on any proposal by the Minister to remove a drug from the Prescription Drug List.

Section.Label: C.01.040.5
Section.Text: Sections C.01.040.3 and C.01.040.4 apply, with any modifications that the circumstances require, in respect of classes of drugs.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell a prescription drug unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they are entitled under the laws of a province to dispense a prescription drug and they sell it in that province under a verbal or written prescription that they received; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they sell it under section C.01.043.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a verbal prescription, the person referred to in paragraph (1)(a) or a pharmacy technician shall create a written record of the prescription that includes the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the prescription was received and, if applicable, the number of the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person to whom the prescription was issued;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the proper name, common name or brand name of the drug and its quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the person’s name and the name of the practitioner who issued the prescription; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use provided with the prescription, whether or not the practitioner authorized it to be refilled and, if refills are authorized, the number of authorized refills.

Subsection.Text: The person referred to in paragraph (1)(a) shall retain the written prescription referred to in subsection (1) or the record referred to in subsection (2) for at least two years after the day on which the prescription is filled.

Section.Label: C.01.041.1
Section.Text: Subject to paragraph C.01.041.3(2)(b), a pharmacist or pharmacy technician may transfer to another pharmacist or pharmacy technician a prescription for a prescription drug.

Subsection.Text: Before a pharmacist sells a drug under a prescription that was transferred under section C.01.041.1, the pharmacist or a pharmacy technician shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: create a written record of the name and address of the pharmacist or pharmacy technician who transferred the prescription and, if applicable, the number of authorized refills remaining and the date of the last refill; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: obtain a copy of the written prescription or of the written record that was created under subsection C.01.041(2), as the case may be, or, in the case of a verbal transfer, create a written record that includes the information referred to in that subsection.

Subsection.Text: The pharmacist shall retain the documents referred to in subsection (1) for at least two years after the day on which the prescription was filled.

A pharmacist or a pharmacy technician who transfers a prescription under section C.01.041.1 shall indicate the date of transfer on the original of the written prescription or of the written record created under subsection C.01.041(2) or in a record kept under the name of the patient in question, as the case may be.
When the pharmacist or pharmacy technician has transferred the prescription,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist shall not make any additional sales under the prescription; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist or pharmacy technician shall not transfer the prescription to another pharmacist or pharmacy technician.

Section.Label: C.01.042
Section.Text: A person referred to in paragraph C.01.041(1)(a) shall not refill a prescription for a prescription drug unless authorized by the practitioner and, in the case of such an authorization, they shall not refill a prescription more than the number of times specified by the practitioner.

Section.Label: C.01.042.1
Section.Text: A person referred to in paragraph C.01.041(1)(a) shall indicate on the original of or on the copy of the written prescription or the written record created under subsection C.01.041(2) or in a record kept under the name of the patient in question, as the case may be,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the prescription was filled;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of each refill, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of drug sold when the prescription was filled and, if applicable, for each refill; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person who sold the drug.

Subsection.Text: A person may sell a prescription drug to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a wholesale druggist;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Government of Canada or the government of a province, for the use of a department or agency of that government, on receipt of a written order signed by the minister responsible for the department or by the person in charge of the agency, or by their duly authorized representative.

Subsection.Text: If a person sells a prescription drug under paragraph (1)(e), they shall retain the written order for the drug for a period of at least two years after the day on which the drug is sold.

Section.Label: C.01.044
Section.Text: If a person advertises a prescription drug to the general public, the person shall not make any representation other than with respect to the brand name, the proper name, the common name and the price and quantity of the drug.

Section.Label: C.01.045
Section.Text: No person, other than one of the following, shall import a prescription drug:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a wholesale druggist;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a resident of a foreign country while a visitor in Canada.

Subsection.Text: If a practitioner or pharmacist has signed an order specifying the proper name or common name, the brand name and the quantity of a drug, other than the following, the person who receives the order may distribute or cause to be distributed the drug, in dosage form, as a sample to that practitioner or pharmacist if the drug meets the requirements of these Regulations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a narcotic as defined in the Narcotic Control Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a controlled drug as defined in section G.01.001; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a prescription drug as defined in subsection 1(2) of the Cannabis Regulations.

Subsection.Text: A person may distribute or cause to be distributed a prescription drug as a sample under subsection (1) only to a practitioner or pharmacist who is entitled, under the laws of the province in which they are practising, to prescribe or dispense that drug, as the case may be.
An order referred to in subsection (1) may provide that the order be repeated at specified intervals during any period not exceeding six months.

Despite subsection (1), a person may distribute or cause to be distributed a drug, in dosage form, as a sample to a practitioner or pharmacist without a signed order if that drug is not a prescription drug and is part of a class of drugs that is set out in column 1 of List D, and if all of the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the drug contains, as its only medicinal ingredients, one or more of those set out in column 2, each of which corresponds to that class, in the corresponding quantity set out in column 3, and the drug is consistent with the descriptive information set out in columns 4 to 6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the drug falls on a day that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at least 30 days after the day on which it is distributed, if the expiration date consists of a day, month and year, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a month that follows the month in which it is distributed, if the expiration date consists only of a month and year;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the drug meets the requirements of these Regulations.

Section.Label: C.01.049
Section.Text: A person who, under subsection C.01.048(1), receives an order for and distributes or causes to be distributed a drug as a sample shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maintain records showing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and description of each person to whom the drug is distributed,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name, quantity and form of the drug distributed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date upon which each such distribution was made; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: keep those records and all orders received for drugs in accordance with section C.01.048 for a period of not less than two years from the date upon which the distribution referred to in the records was made.

Section.Label: C.01.049.1
Section.Text: A person may distribute or cause to be distributed a drug, in dosage form, as a sample to any consumer that is 18 years of age or older if that drug is not a prescription drug and is part of a class of drugs that is set out in column 1 of List D, and if all of the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the drug contains, as its only medicinal ingredients, one or more of those set out in column 2, each of which corresponds to that class, in the corresponding quantity set out in column 3, and the drug is consistent with the descriptive information set out in columns 4 to 6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the drug falls on a day that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at least 30 days after the day on which it is distributed, if the expiration date consists of a day, month and year, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a month that follows the month in which it is distributed, if the expiration date consists only of a month and year;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the drug meets the requirements of these Regulations.

Heading.TitleText: Information — Serious Risk of Injury to Human Health

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a holder of one or more of the following therapeutic product authorizations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug identification number that has been assigned under subsection C.01.014.2(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of compliance that has been issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a therapeutic product authorization in respect of a drug that is part of a class of drugs set out in subsection (4) shall provide the Minister with information in respect of any serious risk of injury to human health that the holder receives or becomes aware of and that is relevant to the safety of the drug, regarding

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: risks that have been communicated by any foreign regulatory authority that is set out in Part A of the List of Foreign Regulatory Authorities for the Purposes of Section C.01.050 of the Food and Drug Regulations, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time, or by any person who is authorized to manufacture or sell a drug within the jurisdiction of such an authority, and the manner of the communication;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: changes that have been made to the labelling of any drug and that have been communicated to or requested by any foreign regulatory authority that is set out in Part B of the list referred to in paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: recalls, reassessments and suspensions or revocations of authorizations, including licences, in respect of any drug, that have taken place within the jurisdiction of any foreign regulatory authority that is set out in Part C of the list referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The information shall be provided to the Minister within 72 hours after the holder receives or becomes aware of it, whichever occurs first.
The classes of drugs are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prescription drugs;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: drugs that are required to be sold under a prescription by Part G, the Benzodiazepines and Other Targeted Substances Regulations or the Narcotic Control Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: drugs that are permitted to be sold without a prescription but that are to be administered only under the supervision of a practitioner.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), a holder of a therapeutic product authorization who provided information in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph (2)(a) is not required to provide the same information again under that paragraph in the case where the holder receives or becomes aware of that information in respect of a foreign regulatory authority or person referred to in that paragraph; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph (2)(b) or (c) is not required to provide the same information again under that paragraph in the case where the holder receives or becomes aware of that information in respect of a foreign regulatory authority referred to in that paragraph.

Subsection.Text: In this section, foreign regulatory authority means a government agency or other entity outside Canada that has a legal right to control the manufacturing, use or sale of drugs within its jurisdiction and that may take enforcement action to ensure that drugs marketed within its jurisdiction comply with the applicable legal requirements.

If a manufacturer who sells a drug in dosage form or an active ingredient or a person who imports into and sells a drug in dosage form or an active ingredient in Canada decides to recall any of those drugs without being ordered to do so by the Minister, the manufacturer or importer shall, within 24 hours after making the decision, provide the Minister with the following information in writing:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s proper name or the common name, if there is no proper name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an indication as to whether the drug is a drug in dosage form or an active ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug in dosage form,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number assigned under subsection C.01.014.2(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the dosage form,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of the persons in Canada, other than consumers that purchased the drug at the retail level, to whom the drug was sold by the manufacturer or importer and the quantity sold to each of the named persons, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an assessment of the effect that the recall may have on the manufacturer’s or importer’s ability to meet demand for the drug in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the lot numbers of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the dates of fabrication of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration dates of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the drug that was fabricated in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the drug that was imported;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the drug that the manufacturer or importer sold to persons in Canada and the period during which it was sold;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the drug that the manufacturer or importer exported, as well as the quantity exported, by country;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the drug in Canada that is in the possession or control of the manufacturer or importer;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: an assessment of the risk of injury to human health posed by the drug, including because of a failure of its effectiveness;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the names and civic addresses of the manufacturer and fabricator of the drug and of any importers of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: the name and contact information of the individual who is responsible for the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: the expected dates for the start and completion of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: the reasons for the recall and the date on which and manner in which the situation that prompted the recall was discovered.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer or importer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before starting the recall, provide the Minister with a copy of any communications that the manufacturer or importer intends to use in connection with the start of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after starting the recall, provide the Minister, on request and within the time specified by the Minister, with a copy of any additional communications that the manufacturer or importer uses, or intends to use, in connection with the recall.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer or importer shall, within 72 hours after making the decision to recall the drug, provide the Minister with the following information in writing:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the strategy for conducting the recall, including the time and manner in which the Minister will be informed of the progress of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measures that are intended to be taken to prevent a recurrence of the situation that prompted the recall.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer or importer shall, within 30 days after completing the recall, provide the Minister with the following information in writing:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the results of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measures that have been or will be taken to prevent a recurrence of the situation that prompted the recall.

Subsection.Text: In this section and in section C.01.051.1, active ingredient and fabricate have the same meaning as in subsection C.01A.001(1).

A person who is ordered by the Minister under section 21.3 of the Act to recall a drug in dosage form, or an active ingredient, shall provide the Minister with the following information in the time and manner specified by the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the drug that has been sold by the person at the retail level to consumers in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the person has sold the drug to persons in Canada other than consumers referred to in paragraph (a),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of those persons and the quantity that has been sold to each of them, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the period during which the drug was sold to those persons;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the drug that the person has exported from Canada, as well as the quantity exported by country;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the drug in Canada that is in the possession or control of the person;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title and contact information of an individual from whom the Minister may obtain additional information concerning the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the strategy for conducting the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe is necessary to mitigate the risk of injury to human health; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is in a position to prevent a recurrence of the situation that prompted the recall, a description of the measures that they intend to take to prevent a recurrence.

Subsection.Text: The person shall notify the Minister without delay of any change to the information referred to in paragraph (1)(e).
The person shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before starting the recall, provide the Minister with a copy of any communications that the person intends to use in connection with the start of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after starting the recall, provide the Minister with, on request and within the time specified by the Minister, a copy of any additional communications that the person uses, or intends to use, in connection with the recall.

Subsection.Text: The person shall notify the Minister in writing, within 24 hours, of the start and completion of the recall.
The person shall, within 30 days after completing the recall, provide the Minister with the following information in writing:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the results of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is in a position to prevent a recurrence of the situation that prompted the recall, a description of the measures that they have taken or will take to prevent a recurrence.

Heading.TitleText: Assessments Ordered Under Section 21.31 of the Act

Subsection.Text: The Minister’s power to make an order under section 21.31 of the Act in respect of a drug is subject to the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person to whom the order is made shall be the holder of one or more of the following therapeutic product authorizations in respect of the drug:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a drug identification number that has been assigned under subsection C.01.014.2(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an establishment licence that has been issued under subsection C.01A.008(1), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a notice of compliance that has been issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister shall have reasonable grounds to believe that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a holder of a therapeutic product authorization referred to in subparagraph (a)(i) or (iii), the benefits or risks of injury to health associated with the drug are significantly different than they were when the authorization was issued,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a holder of a therapeutic product authorization referred to in subparagraph (a)(ii) who is an importer, the manner in which one or more of the following activities is conducted may present a risk of injury to health associated with the drug:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: importation, as defined in subsection C.01A.001(1), of the drug,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: fabrication or packaging/labelling, as defined in subsection C.01A.001(1), of the drug outside Canada, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: testing of the drug outside Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a holder of a therapeutic product authorization referred to in subparagraph (a)(ii) who is not an importer, the manner in which an activity that is authorized under the authorization is conducted may present a risk of injury to health associated with the drug.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall, after examining the results of an assessment that was ordered under section 21.31 of the Act in respect of a drug,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the holder of the therapeutic product authorization with the results of the examination; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that a summary of the results of the examination, together with a description of any steps that the Minister has taken or may take as a consequence of the examination, is published on the Government of Canada website.

Heading.TitleText: Activities Ordered Under Section 21.32 of the Act

Section.Label: C.01.053
Section.Text: The Minister’s power to make an order under section 21.32 of the Act in respect of a drug is subject to the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person to whom the order is made shall be the holder of one or more of the following therapeutic product authorizations in respect of the drug:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a drug identification number that has been assigned under subsection C.01.014.2(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an establishment licence that has been issued under subsection C.01A.008(1), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a notice of compliance that has been issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister shall have reasonable grounds to believe that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a holder of a therapeutic product authorization referred to in subparagraph (a)(i) or (iii), there are significant uncertainties relating to the benefits or harms associated with the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a holder of a therapeutic product authorization referred to in subparagraph (a)(ii) who is an importer, the manner in which one or more of the following activities is conducted has introduced significant uncertainties relating to the benefits or harms associated with the drug:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: importation, as defined in subsection C.01A.001(1), of the drug,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: fabrication or packaging/labelling, as defined in subsection C.01A.001(1), of the drug outside Canada, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: testing of the drug outside Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a holder of a therapeutic product authorization referred to in subparagraph (a)(ii) who is not an importer, the manner in which an activity that is authorized under the authorization is conducted has introduced significant uncertainties relating to the benefits or harms associated with the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder of the therapeutic product authorization is unable to provide the Minister with information that is sufficient to manage those uncertainties, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the applicable requirements of these Regulations, together with any terms and conditions that have been imposed on the authorization, do not allow for sufficient information to be obtained to manage those uncertainties; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister shall take into account the following matters:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the activities that the holder of the therapeutic product authorization will be ordered to undertake are feasible, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether there are less burdensome ways of obtaining additional information about the drug’s effects on health or safety.

Subsection.Text: Where the net amount of a drug in a package is not expressed on the label in terms of number of dosage units, any 10 packages of the drug selected as provided by official method DO-31, Determination of Net Contents, dated December 7, 1988, shall contain an amount of the drug such that, when determined by that official method, the average of the net amounts of the drug in the 10 packages is not less than the net amount of the drug shown on the label.

Where the net amount of a drug in a package is expressed on the label in terms of the number of dosage units, any 10 packages of the drug selected as provided by official method DO-31, Determination of Net Contents, dated December 7, 1988, shall contain a number of units such that, when determined by that official method,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the average number of dosage units in the 10 packages is not less than the number of dosage units shown on the label;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no package contains less than the number of dosage units shown on the label except as provided in the table; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where the drug is a controlled drug as defined in section G.01.001 or a narcotic as defined in the Narcotic Control Regulations, no package contains more than the number of dosage units shown on the label except as provided in the table to this section.

row.entry: Labelled Number of Dosage Units Per Package
Permitted Variation from the Labelled Number
the greater of one unit or 0.75% of the labelled number, rounded up to the next whole number

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) to (5), no manufacturer shall sell a drug in dosage form where the amount of any medicinal ingredient therein, determined using an acceptable method, is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: less than 90.0 per cent of the amount of the medicinal ingredient shown on the label; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: more than 110.0 per cent of the amount of the medicinal ingredient shown on the label.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (5), where a drug in dosage form contains a medicinal ingredient that is a volatile substance of botanical origin or its synthetic equivalent, the amount of that ingredient, determined using an acceptable method, shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 85.0 per cent of the amount of the medicinal ingredient shown on the label; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 120.0 per cent of the amount of the medicinal ingredient shown on the label.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (5), where a drug in capsule form contains a medicinal ingredient that is a vitamin in a fish-liver oil, no variation from the amount of the medicinal ingredient as shown on the label, determined using an acceptable method, is permitted other than that which is in accordance with the variation for that fish-liver oil as stated in any publication whose name is referred to in Schedule B to the Act.

Subject to subsection (5), where a drug in dosage form contains a medicinal ingredient that is a vitamin, no variation from the amount of the medicinal ingredient shown on the label, determined using an acceptable method, is permitted other than the variation set out in column III or IV of an item of the table to this section opposite the vitamin set out in column I of that item for the amount of vitamin set out in column II of that item.
Subsections (1) to (4) do not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug for which a notice of compliance has been issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a drug for which a standard is contained in any publication whose name is referred to in Schedule B to the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a drug described in Schedule C or D to the Act or Division 6 of Part C of these Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a drug for which a drug identification number has been assigned under subsection C.01.014.2(1) and in respect of which

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the conditions of pharmaceutical production and quality control are suitable for controlling the identity, quality, purity, stability, safety, strength and potency of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all labels to be used in connection with the drug, including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the drug, make proper claims in respect of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug can, without undue foreseeable risk to humans, be used for the purposes and under the conditions of use recommended by the manufacturer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug is effective for the purposes and under the conditions of use recommended by the manufacturer.

row.entry: Limits of variation when the recommended daily dose shown on label is equal to or less then amount set out in column II
Limits of variation when the recommended daily dose shown on label is greater than amount set out in column II

Section.Label: C.01.064
Section.Text: Where a drug is prepared for ophthalmic or parenteral use and contains a preservative ingredient, that ingredient

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be present only in an amount necessary to obtain the intended action and that does not pose undue risk to humans or animals; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall not interfere with the therapeutic properties of the drug.

Section.Label: C.01.065
Section.Text: No person shall sell a drug that is prepared for ophthalmic or parenteral use unless a representative sample of each lot of the drug in its immediate container

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is tested by an acceptable method for identity, and the drug is found to be true to its proper name, or to its common name if there is no proper name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is tested by an acceptable method for sterility, except

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for living vaccines, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where the manufacturer has submitted evidence, satisfactory to the Minister to prove that processing controls ensure the sterility of the drug in its immediate container,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: and the drug is found to be sterile; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is subjected to such further tests satisfactory to the Minister to ensure that the drug is safe to use according to directions.

Section.Label: C.01.066
