Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the pharmacological aspects of the drug, including its metabolites in all animal species tested,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the pharmacokinetics of the drug and the drug metabolism, including the biological transformation of the drug in all animal species tested,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any toxicological effects in any animal species tested under a single dose study, a repeated dose study or a special study in respect of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any results of carcinogenicity studies in any animal species tested in respect of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: any results of clinical pharmacokinetic studies of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: any information regarding drug safety, pharmacodynamics, efficacy and dose responses of the drug that were obtained from previous clinical trials in humans, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the drug is a radiopharmaceutical as defined in section C.03.201, information regarding directions for preparing the radiopharmaceutical, the radiation dosimetry in respect of the prepared radiopharmaceutical and a statement of the storage requirements for the prepared radiopharmaceutical;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the drug contains a human-sourced excipient, including any used in the placebo,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: information that indicates the human-sourced excipient has been assigned a drug identification number under subsection C.01.014.2(1) or, in the case of a new drug, issued a notice of compliance under subsection C.08.004(1), as the case may be, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, sufficient information to support the identity, purity, potency, stability and safety of the human-sourced excipient;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the drug has not been assigned a drug identification number under subsection C.01.014.2(1) or, in the case of a new drug, a notice of compliance has not been issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01, the chemistry and manufacturing information in respect of the drug, including its site of manufacture; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed date for the commencement of the clinical trial at each clinical trial site, if known at the time of submitting the application.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), a sponsor may sell or import a drug, other than a drug described in subsection (2), for the purposes of a clinical trial if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has submitted to the Minister an application in accordance with section C.05.005;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister does not, within 30 days after the date of receipt of the application, send to the sponsor a notice in respect of the drug indicating that the sponsor may not sell or import the drug for any of the following reasons:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that the information and documents in respect of the application

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: were not provided in accordance with these Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: are insufficient to enable the Minister to assess the safety and risks of the drug or the clinical trial, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that based on an assessment of the application, an assessment of any information submitted under section C.05.009 or a review of any other information, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the use of the drug for the purposes of the clinical trial endangers the health of a clinical trial subject or other person,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the clinical trial is contrary to the best interests of a clinical trial subject, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the objectives of the clinical trial will not be achieved;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, the sponsor has obtained the approval of the research ethics board in respect of the protocol referred to in paragraph C.05.005(a) and in respect of an informed consent form that contains the statement referred to in paragraph C.05.005(b); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: before the sale or importation of the drug at a clinical trial site, the sponsor submits to the Minister the information referred to in subparagraphs C.05.005(c)(ix) and (x) and paragraphs C.05.005(d) and (h), if it was not submitted in respect of that clinical trial site at the time of submitting the application.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), a sponsor may sell or import a drug for the purposes of a clinical trial in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a new drug that has been issued a notice of compliance under subsection C.08.004(1), if the clinical trial is in respect of a purpose or condition of use for which the notice of compliance was issued; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug, other than a new drug, that has been assigned a drug identification number under subsection C.01.014.2(1), if the clinical trial is in respect of a use or purpose for which the drug identification number was assigned.

Subsection.Text: A sponsor may not sell or import a drug for the purposes of a clinical trial

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the period of any suspension made under section C.05.016 or C.05.017; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after a cancellation made under section C.05.016 or C.05.017.

Section.Label: C.05.007
Section.Text: If the sale or importation of a drug is authorized under this Division, the sponsor may make one or more of the following changes if the sponsor notifies the Minister in writing within 15 days after the date of the change:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the chemistry and manufacturing information that does not affect the quality or safety of the drug, other than a change for which an amendment is required by section C.05.008; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the protocol that does not alter the risk to the health of a clinical trial subject, other than a change for which an amendment is required by section C.05.008.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (4) and (5), when the sale or importation of a drug is authorized under this Division and the sponsor proposes to make an amendment referred to in subsection (2), the sponsor may sell or import the drug for the purposes of the clinical trial in accordance with the amended authorization, if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has submitted to the Minister an application for amendment in accordance with subsection (3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister does not, within 30 days after the date of receipt of the application for amendment, send to the sponsor a notice in respect of the drug indicating that the sponsor may not sell or import the drug in accordance with the amendment for any of the following reasons, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that the information and documents in respect of the application for amendment

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: were not provided in accordance with these Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: are insufficient to enable the Minister to assess the safety and risks of the drug or the clinical trial, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that based on an assessment of the application for amendment, an assessment of any information submitted under section C.05.009 or a review of any other information, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the use of the drug for the purposes of the clinical trial endangers the health of a clinical trial subject or other person,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the clinical trial is contrary to the best interests of a clinical trial subject, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the objectives of the clinical trial will not be achieved;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: before the sale or importation of the drug, the sponsor submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of the research ethics board that approved any amended protocol submitted under paragraph (3)(a) or approved any amended statement submitted under paragraph (3)(c), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of any research ethics board that has previously refused to approve any amendment to the protocol, its reasons for doing so and the date on which the refusal was given;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: before the sale or importation of the drug, the sponsor maintains records concerning

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraph C.05.005(h), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information referred to in subparagraph C.05.005(c)(ix), if any of that information has changed since it was submitted;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: before the sale or importation of the drug in accordance with the amended authorization, the sponsor ceases to sell or import the drug in accordance with the existing authorization; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor conducts the clinical trial in accordance with the amended authorization.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), amendments are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: amendments to the protocol that affect the selection, monitoring or dismissal of a clinical trial subject;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: amendments to the protocol that affect the evaluation of the clinical efficacy of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: amendments to the protocol that alter the risk to the health of a clinical trial subject;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: amendments to the protocol that affect the safety evaluation of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: amendments to the protocol that extend the duration of the clinical trial; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: amendments to the chemistry and manufacturing information that may affect the safety or quality of the drug.

Subsection.Text: The application for amendment referred to in subsection (1) shall contain a reference to the application submitted under section C.05.005 and shall contain the following documents and information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is in respect of an amendment referred to in any of paragraphs (2)(a) to (e), a copy of the amended protocol that indicates the amendment, a copy of the protocol submitted under paragraph C.05.005(a), and the rationale for the amendment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is in respect of an amendment referred to in paragraph (2)(e), a copy of the amended investigator’s brochure or an addendum to the investigator’s brochure that indicates the new information, including supporting toxicological studies and clinical trial safety data;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is in respect of an amendment referred to in any of paragraphs (2)(a) to (f) and, as a result of that amendment, it is necessary to amend the statement referred to in paragraph C.05.005(b), a copy of the amended statement that indicates the amendment; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is in respect of an amendment referred to in paragraph (2)(f), a copy of the amended chemistry and manufacturing information that indicates the amendment, and the rationale for that amendment.

Subsection.Text: If the sponsor is required to immediately make one or more of the amendments referred to in subsection (2) because the clinical trial or the use of the drug for the purposes of the clinical trial endangers the health of a clinical trial subject or other person, the sponsor may immediately make the amendment and shall provide the Minister with the information referred to in subsection (3) within 15 days after the date of the amendment.
A sponsor may not sell or import a drug for the purposes of a clinical trial

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the period of any suspension made under section C.05.016 or C.05.017; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after a cancellation made under section C.05.016 or C.05.017.

Section.Label: C.05.009
Section.Text: If the information and documents submitted in respect of an application under section C.05.005 or an application for amendment under section C.05.008 are insufficient to enable the Minister to determine whether any of the reasons referred to in paragraph C.05.006(1)(b) or C.05.008(1)(b) exist, the Minister may require the sponsor to submit, within two days after receipt of the request, samples of the drug or additional information relevant to the drug or the clinical trial that are necessary to make the determination.

Section.Label: C.05.010
Section.Text: Every sponsor shall ensure that a clinical trial is conducted in accordance with good clinical practices and, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the clinical trial is scientifically sound and clearly described in a protocol;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the clinical trial is conducted, and the drug is used, in accordance with the protocol and this Division;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: systems and procedures that assure the quality of every aspect of the clinical trial are implemented;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, the approval of a research ethics board is obtained before the clinical trial begins at the site;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: at each clinical trial site, there is no more than one qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: at each clinical trial site, medical care and medical decisions, in respect of the clinical trial, are under the supervision of the qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: each individual involved in the conduct of the clinical trial is qualified by education, training and experience to perform his or her respective tasks;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: written informed consent, given in accordance with the applicable laws governing consent, is obtained from every person before that person participates in the clinical trial but only after that person has been informed of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the risks and anticipated benefits to his or her health arising from participation in the clinical trial, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all other aspects of the clinical trial that are necessary for that person to make the decision to participate in the clinical trial;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements respecting information and records set out in section C.05.012 are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is manufactured, handled and stored in accordance with the applicable good manufacturing practices referred to in Divisions 2 to 4 except sections C.02.019, C.02.025 and C.02.026.

Section.Label: C.05.011
Section.Text: Despite any other provision of these Regulations respecting labelling, the sponsor shall ensure that the drug bears a label that sets out the following information in both official languages:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement indicating that the drug is an investigational drug to be used only by a qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, number or identifying mark of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended storage conditions for the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the sponsor;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the protocol code or identification; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the drug is a radiopharmaceutical as defined in section C.03.201, the information required by subparagraph C.03.202(1)(b)(vi).

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall record, handle and store all information in respect of a clinical trial in a way that allows its complete and accurate reporting as well as its interpretation and verification.
The sponsor shall maintain complete and accurate records to establish that the clinical trial is conducted in accordance with good clinical practices and these Regulations.
The sponsor shall maintain complete and accurate records in respect of the use of a drug in a clinical trial, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of all versions of the investigator’s brochure for the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting each change made to the investigator’s brochure, including the rationale for each change and documentation that supports each change;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting all adverse events in respect of the drug that have occurred inside or outside Canada, including information that specifies the indication for use and the dosage form of the drug at the time of the adverse event;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting the enrolment of clinical trial subjects, including information sufficient to enable all clinical trial subjects to be identified and contacted in the event that the sale of the drug may endanger the health of the clinical trial subjects or other persons;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting the shipment, receipt, disposition, return and destruction of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, an undertaking from the qualified investigator that is signed and dated by the qualified investigator prior to the commencement of his or her responsibilities in respect of the clinical trial, that states that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the qualified investigator will conduct the clinical trial in accordance with good clinical practices, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the qualified investigator will immediately, on discontinuance of the clinical trial by the sponsor, in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, inform both the clinical trial subjects and the research ethics board of the discontinuance, provide them with the reasons for the discontinuance and advise them in writing of any potential risks to the health of clinical trial subjects or other persons;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, a copy of the protocol, informed consent form and any amendment to the protocol or informed consent form that have been approved by the research ethics board for that clinical trial site; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, an attestation, signed and dated by the research ethics board for that clinical trial site, stating that it has reviewed and approved the protocol and informed consent form and that the board carries out its functions in a manner consistent with good clinical practices.

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall maintain all records referred to in this Division for a period of 15 years.

The Minister shall require a sponsor to submit, within two days after receipt of the request, information concerning the drug or the clinical trial, or samples of the drug, if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the use of the drug for the purposes of the clinical trial endangers the health of a clinical trial subject or other person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the clinical trial is contrary to the best interests of a clinical trial subject;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the objectives of the clinical trial will not be achieved;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a qualified investigator is not respecting the undertaking referred to in paragraph C.05.012(3)(f); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information submitted in respect of the drug or the clinical trial is false or misleading.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may require the sponsor to submit, within seven days after receipt of the request, any information or records kept under section C.05.012, or samples of the drug, in order to assess the safety of the drug or the health of clinical trial subjects or other persons.

Heading.TitleText: Serious Unexpected Adverse Drug Reaction Reporting

Subsection.Text: During the course of a clinical trial, the sponsor shall inform the Minister of any serious unexpected adverse drug reaction in respect of the drug that has occurred inside or outside Canada as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it is neither fatal nor life threatening, within 15 days after becoming aware of the information; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is fatal or life threatening, within seven days after becoming aware of the information.

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall, within eight days after having informed the Minister under paragraph (1)(b), submit to the Minister a complete report in respect of that information that includes an assessment of the importance and implication of any findings made.
Sections C.01.016 to C.01.020 do not apply to drugs used for the purposes of a clinical trial.
If a clinical trial is discontinued by the sponsor in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, the sponsor shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: inform the Minister no later than 15 days after the date of the discontinuance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the Minister with the reason for the discontinuance and its impact on the proposed or ongoing clinical trials in respect of the drug conducted in Canada by the sponsor;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as possible, inform all qualified investigators of the discontinuance and of the reasons for the discontinuance, and advise them in writing of any potential risks to the health of clinical trial subjects or other persons; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of each discontinued clinical trial site, stop the sale or importation of the drug as of the date of the discontinuance and take all reasonable measures to ensure the recovery of all unused quantities of the drug that have been sold.

Subsection.Text: If the sponsor has discontinued the clinical trial in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, the sponsor may resume selling or importing the drug for the purposes of a clinical trial in its entirety or at a clinical trial site if, in respect of each clinical trial site where the sale or importation is to be resumed, the sponsor submits to the Minister the information referred to in subparagraphs C.05.005(c)(ix) and (x) and paragraphs C.05.005(d) and (h).

Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall suspend the authorization to sell or import a drug for the purposes of a clinical trial, in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has contravened these Regulations or any provisions of the Act relating to the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any information submitted in respect of the drug or clinical trial is false or misleading;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has failed to comply with good clinical practices; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has failed to provide

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: information or samples of the drug as required under section C.05.009 or C.05.013, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: information or a report under section C.05.014.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section C.05.017, the Minister shall not suspend an authorization referred to in subsection (1) unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has sent to the sponsor a written notice of the intention to suspend the authorization that indicates whether the authorization is to be suspended in its entirety or at a clinical trial site and the reason for the intended suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has not, within 30 days after receipt of the notice referred to in paragraph (a), provided the Minister with information or documents that demonstrate that the authorization should not be suspended on the grounds that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the situation giving rise to the intended suspension did not exist, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the situation giving rise to the intended suspension has been corrected; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has provided the sponsor with the opportunity to be heard in paragraph (b).

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall suspend the authorization by sending to the sponsor a written notice of suspension of the authorization that indicates the effective date of the suspension, whether the authorization is suspended in its entirety or at a clinical trial site and the reason for the suspension.
If the Minister has suspended an authorization under subsection (1), the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: reinstate the authorization in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, as the case may be, if within 30 days after the effective date of the suspension the sponsor provides the Minister with information or documents that demonstrate that the situation giving rise to the suspension has been corrected; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cancel the authorization in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, as the case may be, if within 30 days after the effective date of the suspension the sponsor has not provided the Minister with the information or documents referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall suspend an authorization to sell or import a drug for the purposes of a clinical trial, in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, before giving the sponsor an opportunity to be heard if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to prevent injury to the health of a clinical trial subject or other person.

The Minister shall suspend the authorization by sending to the sponsor a written notice of suspension of the authorization that indicates the effective date of the suspension, whether the authorization is suspended in its entirety or at a clinical trial site and the reason for the suspension.
If the Minister has suspended an authorization under subsection (1), the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: reinstate the authorization in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, as the case may be, if within 60 days after the effective date of the suspension the sponsor provides the Minister with information or documents that demonstrate that the situation giving rise to the suspension did not exist or that it has been corrected; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cancel the authorization in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, as the case may be, if within 60 days after the effective date of the suspension the sponsor has not provided the Minister with the information or documents referred to in paragraph (a).

Section.Label: C.06.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: solubility and specific gravity shall be determined at 25°C;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: tests for identity, quantitative tests for arsenic, lead, copper, zinc, fluorine, and sulphur dioxide, and limit tests shall be made by the official methods; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: determination of physical and chemical constants shall be carried out by acceptable methods.

Section.Label: C.06.002
Section.Text: [S]. Conjugated estrogens shall be the drug conjugated estrogens described in The Pharmacopeia of the United States of America, XVIII (1970), except that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dilute assay preparation A, assay preparations A and B and equilin reagent described therein shall be prepared by official method DO-29, Conjugated Estrogens, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the identification test described therein shall be performed by official method DO-29, Conjugated Estrogens, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: C.06.003
Section.Text: [S]. Conjugated estrogens for injection shall be the drug conjugated estrogens for injection described in The Pharmacopeia of the United States of America, XVIII (1970), except that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dilute assay preparation A, assay preparations A and B and equilin reagent described therein shall be prepared by official method DO-29, Conjugated Estrogens, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the identification test described therein shall be performed by official method DO-29, Conjugated Estrogens, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: C.06.004
Section.Text: [S]. Conjugated estrogens tablets shall be the drug conjugated estrogens tablets described in The Pharmacopeia of the United States of America, XVIII (1970), except that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dilute assay preparation A, assay preparations A and B and equilin reagent described therein shall be prepared by official method DO-29, Conjugated Estrogens, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the identification test described therein shall be performed by official method DO-29, Conjugated Estrogens, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: C.06.120
Section.Text: [S]. Digitoxin shall be the drug digitoxin described in the Pharmacopeia of the United States of America.

Section.Label: C.06.121
Section.Text: [S]. Digitoxin tablets shall be the drug digitoxin tablets described in the Pharmacopeia of the United States of America.

Section.Label: C.06.130
Section.Text: [S]. Digoxin shall be the drug digoxin described in the Pharmacopeia of the United States of America.

Section.Label: C.06.131
Section.Text: [S]. Digoxin Elixir shall be the drug digoxin elixir described in the Pharmacopeia of the United States of America.

Section.Label: C.06.132
Section.Text: [S]. Digoxin injection shall be the drug digoxin injection described in the Pharmacopeia of the United States of America.

Section.Label: C.06.133
Section.Text: [S]. Digoxin tablets shall be the drug digoxin tablets described in the Pharmacopeia of the United States of America.

Section.Label: C.06.161
Section.Text: [S]. Esterified estrogens shall be the drug esterified estrogens described in the Pharmacopeia of the United States of America.

Section.Label: C.06.162
Section.Text: [S]. Esterified estrogens tablets shall be the drug esterified estrogens tablets described in the Pharmacopeia of the United States of America.

Section.Label: C.06.170
Section.Text: Gelatin shall be the drug gelatin described in the Pharmacopeia of the United States or the British Pharmacopeia.

Section.Label: C.06.250
Section.Text: Thyroid shall be the cleaned, dried, powdered thyroid glands of domestic animals used for food, and shall contain not less than 0.17 per cent, and not more than 0.23 per cent iodine and no added iodine in either inorganic or organic form, and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its characters are

Provision.Text: Description, —

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: General, — thyroid occurs as a cream-coloured, amorphous powder; the odour and taste are faint and meat-like, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Microscopical, — when suitably mounted and examined under the microscope, thyroid shows the following: numerous smooth to striated hyaline fragments of colloids, of angular to irregular shape, that are colourless to pale yellow in water mounts, brown in Mallory’s stain and pink in solution of eosin, some of these fragments containing granules, minute vacuoles, crystalloidal bodies and cells; numerous irregular fragments of follicular epithelium staining brown with Mallory’s stain, the individual cells more or less polygonal to rounded-angular or irregularly cuboidal, often with prominent nuclei staining dark blue, their cytoplasm purplish with Delafield’s solution of haematoxylin; slender glistening segments of capillaries of closely undulate outline; numerous slender segments of neuraxons; numerous aggregates of particles of intercellular substance and slender, mostly straight connective tissue fibres staining blue to greenish blue with a mixture of Mallory’s stain and solution of phosphotungstic acid, the bundles of fibres often appearing reddish in Mallory’s stain; few glistening fragments of blood vessels with serrated or crenated ends as viewed in water mounts; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the tests for its purity are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Inorganic iodine, — add to one gram of thyroid 10 millilitres of a saturated solution of zinc sulphate in water, shake, allow to stand five minutes, and filter through a fritted glass filter; add to five millilitres of the filtrate 0.5 millilitre of mucilage of starch and four drops each of a 10 per cent w/v solution of sodium nitrite in water and dilute sulphuric acid, shaking after each addition: no blue colour is produced, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Moisture, — thyroid loses not more than six per cent moisture.

Section.Label: C.06.251
Section.Text: Thyroid shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: assayed by official method DO-26, Thyroid, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: stored in a cool place and in a tightly-closed container.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 7
Heading.TitleText: Sale of Drugs for the Purposes of Implementing the General Council Decision

Section.Label: C.07.001
Section.Text: The definitions in this section apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: Commissioner of Patents means the Commissioner of Patents appointed under subsection 4(1) of the Patent Act. (commissaire aux brevets)
General Council Decision has the meaning assigned by subsection 30(6) of the Act. (décision du Conseil général)

Section.Label: C.07.002
Section.Text: This Division applies to the sale of drugs for the purposes of implementing the General Council Decision.

Section.Label: C.07.003
Section.Text: An application by a manufacturer for authorization to sell a drug under this Division shall be submitted to the Minister and shall contain the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the manufacturer intends to file an application with the Commissioner of Patents under section 21.04 of the Patent Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a new drug, the submission number and date of filing of the new drug submission or abbreviated new drug submission filed under section C.08.002 or C.08.002.1, respectively, and of any supplement filed under section C.08.003 in respect of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a drug that is not a new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the application number and date of filing of the application that has been filed under section C.01.014.1 in respect of the drug, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number, if one has been assigned in respect of the drug pursuant to section C.01.014.2;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for a drug in a solid dosage form, the manner in which the drug is marked in accordance with paragraph C.07.008(a) and evidence that such manner does not alter the safety and efficacy of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for a drug in a dosage form that is not solid, the manner in which the immediate container is marked in accordance with paragraph C.07.008(a); and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a sample of the label for the drug that includes the information required by paragraph C.07.008(c).

Section.Label: C.07.004
Section.Text: The Minister shall notify the manufacturer and the Commissioner of Patents for the purposes of paragraph 21.04(3)(b) of the Patent Act that the manufacturer’s drug meets the requirements of the Act and these Regulations if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer has submitted to the Minister an application in accordance with section C.07.003 and a copy of the application filed by the manufacturer with the Commissioner of Patents under section 21.04 of the Patent Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a new drug, an examination of the new drug submission or abbreviated new drug submission or supplement to either submission by the Minister demonstrates that the submission or supplement complies with section C.08.002, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, and section C.08.005.1;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a drug that is not a new drug, a drug identification number has been assigned pursuant to section C.01.014.2; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister is satisfied that the manufacturer and the drug comply with the Act and these Regulations.

Section.Label: C.07.005
Section.Text: Despite sections C.01.014, C.08.002 and C.08.003, a manufacturer may sell a drug under this Division if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has notified the Commissioner of Patents for the purposes of paragraph 21.04(3)(b) of the Patent Act that the drug meets the requirements of the Act and these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer has received authorization under section 21.04 of the Patent Act.

Section.Label: C.07.006
Section.Text: Sections C.01.005 and C.01.014.1 to C.01.014.4 do not apply to new drugs sold under this Division.

Section.Label: C.07.007
Section.Text: The Minister shall notify the manufacturer and the Commissioner of Patents for the purposes of paragraph 21.13(b) of the Patent Act in the event that the Minister is of the opinion that the manufacturer’s drug authorized to be sold under this Division has ceased to meet the requirements of the Act and these Regulations.

Section.Label: C.07.008
Section.Text: No person shall sell a drug under this Division unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the drug itself permanently bears the mark “XCL”, in the case of a drug in a solid dosage form, or the immediate container permanently bears the mark “XCL”, in the case of a drug in a dosage form that is not solid;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the colour of the drug itself is significantly different from the colour of the version of the drug sold in Canada, in the case of a drug in a solid dosage form; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the label of the drug permanently bears the mark “XCL”, followed by the export tracking number assigned by the Minister under section C.07.009 and the words “FOR EXPORT UNDER THE GENERAL COUNCIL DECISION. NOT FOR SALE IN CANADA.” or “POUR EXPORTATION AUX TERMES DE LA DÉCISION DU CONSEIL GÉNÉRAL. VENTE INTERDITE AU CANADA.”

Section.Label: C.07.009
Section.Text: The Minister shall assign an export tracking number to each drug in respect of which the Minister has notified the Commissioner of Patents under section C.07.004.

Section.Label: C.07.010
Section.Text: The manufacturer shall, with respect to a drug authorized to be sold under this Division,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: establish and maintain records, in a manner that enables an audit to be made, respecting the information referred to in subsection C.08.007(1), and retain those records for at least seven years from the day on which they were established; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide to the Minister the summaries referred to in section C.08.008.

Section.Label: C.07.011
Section.Text: The manufacturer shall notify the Minister in writing not less than 15 days before commencing the manufacture of the first lot of a drug authorized to be sold under this Division and not less than 15 days before the exportation of each subsequent lot of the drug.

Section.Label: C.08.001
Section.Text: For the purposes of the Act and this Division, new drug means a drug, other than a veterinary health product,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains or consists of a substance, whether as an active or inactive ingredient, carrier, coating, excipient, menstruum or other component, that has not been sold as a drug in Canada for sufficient time and in sufficient quantity to establish in Canada the safety and effectiveness of that substance for use as a drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is a combination of two or more drugs, with or without other ingredients, and that has not been sold in that combination or in the proportion in which those drugs are combined in that drug, for sufficient time and in sufficient quantity to establish in Canada the safety and effectiveness of that combination and proportion for use as a drug; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to which the manufacturer prescribes, recommends, proposes or claims a use as a drug, or a condition of use as a drug, including dosage, route of administration or duration of action, and that has not been sold for that use or condition of use in Canada for sufficient time and in sufficient quantity to establish in Canada the safety and effectiveness of that use or condition of use of that drug.

Section.Label: C.08.001.1
Section.Text: For the purposes of this Division,

Definition.Text: Canadian reference product means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug in respect of which a notice of compliance is issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01 and which is marketed in Canada by the innovator of the drug,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug, acceptable to the Minister, that can be used for the purpose of demonstrating bioequivalence on the basis of pharmaceutical and, where applicable, bioavailability characteristics, where a drug in respect of which a notice of compliance has been issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01 cannot be used for that purpose because it is no longer marketed in Canada, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a drug, acceptable to the Minister, that can be used for the purpose of demonstrating bioequivalence on the basis of pharmaceutical and, where applicable, bioavailability characteristics, in comparison to a drug referred to in paragraph (a); (produit de référence canadien)

Definition.Text: List of Conditions that Threaten Public Health means the List of Conditions that Threaten Public Health in Canada, published on the Government of Canada’s website, as amended from time to time; (Liste d’affections qui menacent la santé publique)

pharmaceutical equivalent means a new drug that, in comparison with another drug, contains identical amounts of the identical medicinal ingredients, in comparable dosage forms, but that does not necessarily contain the same non-medicinal ingredients; (équivalent pharmaceutique)

public health emergency drug means a new drug for which the purpose and conditions of use recommended by the manufacturer relate to a condition that is described in the List of Conditions that Threaten Public Health; (drogue pour urgence de santé publique)
specifications means a detailed description of a new drug and of its ingredients and includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of all properties and qualities of the ingredients that are relevant to the manufacture and use of the new drug, including the identity, potency and purity of the ingredients,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the methods used for testing and examining the ingredients, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the tolerances associated with the properties and qualities of the ingredients. (spécifications)

Subsection.Text: The Minister may add a condition to the List of Conditions that Threaten Public Health only if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the condition presents, or is the result of, a significant risk to public health in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: immediate action is required to deal with the risk.

Subsection.Text: However, the Minister may add COVID-19 to the List of Conditions that Threaten Public Health, even if the criteria set out in subsection (1) are not met with respect to COVID-19 at the time of the addition, as long as the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the addition is necessary to protect public health or safety.

Section.Label: C.08.001.3
Section.Text: If a condition that is on the List of Conditions that Threaten Public Health is removed from the list, a public health emergency drug that relates to that condition continues to be considered a public health emergency drug for the purposes of this Division if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the public health emergency drug, a new drug submission has been filed under section C.08.002 or a supplement to a new drug submission has been filed under section C.08.003;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the condition is removed from the List after the submission or supplement is filed; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has not issued, in respect of the submission or supplement, a notice of compliance under section C.08.004 or a notice under paragraph C.08.004(3)(b).

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise a new drug unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer of the new drug has filed with the Minister a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission relating to the new drug that is satisfactory to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has issued, under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01, a notice of compliance to the manufacturer of the new drug in respect of the submission; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the notice of compliance in respect of the submission has not been suspended under section C.08.006.

Subsection.Text: A new drug submission shall contain sufficient information and material to enable the Minister to assess the safety and effectiveness of the new drug, including the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the new drug and a statement of its proper name or its common name if there is no proper name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the brand name of the new drug or the identifying name or code proposed for the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the ingredients of the new drug, stated quantitatively, and the specifications for each of those ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the plant and equipment to be used in the manufacture, preparation and packaging of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: details of the method of manufacture and the controls to be used in the manufacture, preparation and packaging of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: details of the tests to be applied to control the potency, purity, stability and safety of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: detailed reports of the tests made to establish the safety of the new drug for the purpose and under the conditions of use recommended;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: substantial evidence of the clinical effectiveness of the new drug for the purpose and under the conditions of use recommended;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the names and qualifications of all the investigators to whom the new drug has been sold;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a new drug for veterinary use, a draft of every label to be used in connection with the new drug, including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (j.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a new drug for human use, mock-ups of every label to be used in connection with the new drug — including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the new drug — and mock-ups of the new drug’s packages;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of all the representations to be made for the promotion of the new drug respecting

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the recommended route of administration of the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the proposed dosage of the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the claims to be made for the new drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the contra-indications and side effects of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the dosage form in which it is proposed that the new drug be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: evidence that all test batches of the new drug used in any studies conducted in connection with the submission were manufactured and controlled in a manner that is representative of market production;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a new drug intended for administration to food-producing animals, the withdrawal period of the new drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a new drug for human use other than a public health emergency drug, an assessment as to whether there is a likelihood that the new drug will be mistaken for another drug for which a drug identification number has been assigned due to a resemblance between the brand name that is proposed to be used in respect of the new drug and the brand name, common name or proper name of the other drug.

Subsection.Text: If clinical trial data that is included in a new drug submission under paragraph (2)(g) or (h) or (2.1)(b) is broken down by population subgroup in an application made to the European Medicines Agency or the United States Food and Drug Administration to authorize the sale of the new drug, the data must be broken down in the same manner in the new drug submission.
A manufacturer may file, for a public health emergency drug, a new drug submission that does not meet the requirements set out in paragraphs (2)(g) and (h) if the submission contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the submission contains evidence to establish that the requirement set out in paragraph (b) is met; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the benefits associated with the public health emergency drug outweigh the risks associated with it for the purpose and under the conditions of use recommended, with consideration given to the uncertainties relating to those benefits and risks as well as the public health need related to the applicable condition described in the List of Conditions that Threaten Public Health.

Subsection.Text: A manufacturer may file, for a public health emergency drug for human use, a new drug submission that does not meet the requirements set out in paragraph (2)(j.1) if the submission contains a draft of every label to be used in connection with the drug, including any package insert and any document provided on request that sets out supplementary information on the use of the drug.

If, at the time a new drug submission is filed for a public health emergency drug, the manufacturer is unable to provide the Minister with information or material that is referred to in any of paragraphs (2)(e) to (k), (m) and (n) and (2.1)(b) and subsection (2.2) — and, as applicable, the corresponding material referred to in paragraphs C.08.005.1(1)(b) to (d) — or any of that information or material is incomplete, the manufacturer must provide the Minister, at that time, with a plan that specifies how and when they will provide the Minister with the missing information or material.
Subsections (2.1) to (2.3) apply only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the new drug submission contains a statement that the submission is for a public health emergency drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the purpose and conditions of use specified in the submission relate only to a condition described in the List of Conditions that Threaten Public Health and the submission contains a statement to that effect.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (2.1) to (2.3) do not apply if a notice of compliance is being sought on the basis of a direct or indirect comparison between the new drug and another drug.

The manufacturer of a new drug shall, at the request of the Minister, provide the Minister, where for the purposes of a new drug submission the Minister considers it necessary to assess the safety and effectiveness of the new drug, with the following information and material:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the names and addresses of the manufacturers of each of the ingredients of the new drug and the names and addresses of the manufacturers of the new drug in the dosage form in which it is proposed that the new drug be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: samples of the ingredients of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: samples of the new drug in the dosage form in which it is proposed that the new drug be sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any additional information or material respecting the safety and effectiveness of the new drug.

Subsection.Text: A manufacturer of a new drug may file an extraordinary use new drug submission for the new drug if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the new drug is intended for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: emergency use in situations where persons have been exposed to a chemical, biological, radiological or nuclear substance and action is required to treat, mitigate or prevent a life-threatening or other serious disease, disorder or abnormal physical state, or its symptoms, that results, or is likely to result, from that exposure, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: preventative use in persons who are at risk of exposure to a chemical, biological, radiological or nuclear substance that is potentially lethal or permanently disabling; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements set out in paragraphs C.08.002(2)(g) and (h) cannot be met because

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: exposing human volunteers to the substance referred to in paragraph (a) would be potentially lethal or permanently disabling, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the circumstances in which exposure to the substance occurs are sporadic and infrequent.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (3) and (5), an extraordinary use new drug submission shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an attestation, signed and dated by the senior executive officer in Canada of the manufacturer filing the submission and by the manufacturer’s senior medical or scientific officer, certifying that the conditions referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) are met, together with sufficient supporting information to enable the Minister to determine that those conditions are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sufficient information and material to enable the Minister to assess the safety and effectiveness of the new drug, including the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information and material described in paragraphs C.08.002(2)(a) to (f), (i) to (m) and (o),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting the pathophysiological mechanism for the toxicity of the chemical, biological, radiological or nuclear substance and describing the new drug’s ability to treat, mitigate or prevent that mechanism,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: detailed reports of in vitro studies respecting the toxicity and activity of the new drug in relation to the recommended purpose,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: detailed reports of studies, in an animal species that is expected to react with a response that is predictive for humans, establishing the safety of the new drug, and providing substantial evidence of its effect, when used for the purpose and under the conditions of use recommended,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: information confirming that the end point of animal studies is clearly related to the desired benefit in humans,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: information demonstrating that there is a sufficient understanding of the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of the new drug in animals and in humans to enable inferences to be drawn in respect of humans so as to allow for the selection of an effective dose in humans,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting the safety of the new drug in humans, including detailed reports of clinical trials, if any, establishing the safety of the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: information, if any, respecting the effectiveness of the new drug in humans for the purpose or under the conditions of use recommended,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: a plan for monitoring and establishing the safety and effectiveness of the new drug under the conditions of use recommended that includes procedures for gathering and analyzing data, and

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: any available assessment reports regarding the new drug prepared by regulatory authorities in countries other than Canada.

Subsection.Text: Reports referred to in subparagraph (2)(b)(iii) or information referred to in subparagraph (2)(b)(vi) may be omitted if the extraordinary use new drug submission includes a detailed scientific explanation as to why the reports are or the information is not available.

Any information or material that is necessary to enable the Minister to assess the safety and effectiveness of the new drug shall, at the request of the Minister, be added to the extraordinary use new drug submission, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the names and addresses of the manufacturers of each of the ingredients of the new drug and the names and addresses of the manufacturers of the new drug in the dosage form in which it is proposed to be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: samples of the ingredients of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: samples of the new drug in the dosage form in which it is proposed to be sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any information omitted by virtue of subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: If an extraordinary use new drug submission is in respect of a new purpose for a new drug for which a notice of compliance has been issued under section C.08.004, the information and material referred to in subparagraph (2)(b)(i) may be omitted unless any of it is different from that which was originally submitted.

Section.Label: C.08.002.02
Section.Text: Despite sections C.08.002 and C.08.003, no manufacturer or importer shall sell a new drug for extraordinary use in respect of which a notice of compliance has been issued under section C.08.004.01 except to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Government of Canada or the government of a province for the use of a department or agency of that government, on receipt of a written order signed by the minister responsible for the department or by the person in charge of the agency, or by their duly authorized representative; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a municipal government, or an institution of such a government, on receipt of a written order signed by a senior official of the government or institution or by his or her duly authorized representative.

Subsection.Text: A manufacturer of a new drug may file an abbreviated new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission for the new drug where, in comparison with a Canadian reference product,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the new drug is the pharmaceutical equivalent of the Canadian reference product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the new drug is bioequivalent with the Canadian reference product, based on the pharmaceutical and, where the Minister considers it necessary, bioavailability characteristics;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the route of administration of the new drug is the same as that of the Canadian reference product; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the conditions of use for the new drug fall within the conditions of use for the Canadian reference product.

Subsection.Text: An abbreviated new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission shall contain sufficient information and material to enable the Minister to assess the safety and effectiveness of the new drug, including the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information and material described in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: paragraphs C.08.002(2)(a) to (f), (j) to (l) and (o), in the case of an abbreviated new drug submission, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: paragraphs C.08.002(2)(a) to (f), (j) to (l) and (o), and subparagraphs C.08.002.01(2)(b)(ix) and (x), in the case of an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information identifying the Canadian reference product used in any comparative studies conducted in connection with the submission;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: evidence from the comparative studies conducted in connection with the submission that the new drug is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the pharmaceutical equivalent of the Canadian reference product, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where the Minister considers it necessary on the basis of the pharmaceutical and, where applicable, bioavailability characteristics of the new drug, bioequivalent with the Canadian reference product as demonstrated using bioavailability studies, pharmacodynamic studies or clinical studies;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: evidence that all test batches of the new drug used in any studies conducted in connection with the submission were manufactured and controlled in a manner that is representative of market production; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for a drug intended for administration to food-producing animals, sufficient information to confirm that the withdrawal period is identical to that of the Canadian reference product.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer of a new drug shall, at the request of the Minister, provide the Minister, where for the purposes of an abbreviated new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission the Minister considers it necessary to assess the safety and effectiveness of the new drug, with the following information and material:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the names and addresses of the manufacturers of each of the ingredients of the new drug and the names and addresses of the manufacturers of the new drug in the dosage form in which it is proposed that the new drug be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: samples of the ingredients of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: samples of the new drug in the dosage form in which it is proposed that the new drug be sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any additional information or material respecting the safety and effectiveness of the new drug.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, in the case of an abbreviated new drug submission, a new drug for extraordinary use in respect of which a notice of compliance has been issued under section C.08.004.01 is not a Canadian reference product.

Despite section C.08.002, no person shall sell a new drug in respect of which a notice of compliance has been issued to the manufacturer of that new drug and has not been suspended under section C.08.006, if any of the matters specified in subsection (2) are significantly different from the information or material contained in the new drug submission, extraordinary use new drug submission, abbreviated new drug submission or abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission, unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer of the new drug has filed with the Minister a supplement to that submission;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has issued a notice of compliance to the manufacturer of the new drug in respect of the supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the notice of compliance in respect of the supplement has not been suspended under section C.08.006.

Subsection.Text: The matters specified for the purposes of subsection (1), in relation to the new drug, are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the description of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the new drug or the identifying name or code proposed for the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the specifications of the ingredients of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the plant and equipment used in manufacturing, preparation and packaging the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the method of manufacture and the controls used in manufacturing, preparation and packaging the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the tests applied to control the potency, purity, stability and safety of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the labels used in connection with the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (g.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a new drug for human use, its packages;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the representations made with regard to the new drug respecting

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the recommended route of administration of the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the dosage of the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the claims made for the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the contra-indications and side effects of the new drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the withdrawal period of the new drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the dosage form in which it is proposed that the new drug be sold.

Subsection.Text: A supplement to a submission referred to in subsection (1), with respect to the matters that are significantly different from those contained in the submission, shall contain sufficient information and material to enable the Minister to assess the safety and effectiveness of the new drug in relation to those matters.

If clinical trial data that is included in a supplement to a new drug submission is broken down by population subgroup in an application made to the European Medicines Agency or the United States Food and Drug Administration to authorize the sale of the new drug, the data must be broken down in the same manner in the supplement.
A supplement to a submission referred to in subsection (1) shall contain, as the case may be,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if, due to a matter specified in subsection (2) — other than the brand name of a new drug for human use — that the supplement concerns, it is necessary to modify a new drug’s labels:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a new drug for veterinary use, a draft of every label to be used in connection with the new drug, including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the new drug, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a new drug for human use, mock-ups of every label to be used in connection with the new drug — including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the new drug — and mock-ups of the new drug’s packages; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the supplement concerns the brand name of a new drug for human use:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an assessment as to whether there is a likelihood that the new drug will be mistaken for another drug for which a drug identification number has been assigned due to a resemblance between the brand name that is proposed to be used in respect of the new drug and the brand name, common name or proper name of the other drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: mock-ups of every label to be used in connection with the new drug — including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the new drug — and mock-ups of the new drug’s packages.

Subsection.Text: If a supplement to an extraordinary use new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission concerns a matter specified in subparagraph (2)(h)(iii), the supplement shall contain the attestation and supporting information referred to in paragraph C.08.002.01(2)(a).

The manufacturer may file, for a public health emergency drug, a supplement to the new drug submission referred to in subsection (1) that does not contain all of the information and material that is required under subsection (3) if the supplement contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the supplement contains evidence to establish that the requirement set out in paragraph (b) is met; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the matters that are significantly different from those contained in the submission, sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the benefits associated with the public health emergency drug outweigh the risks associated with it for the purpose and under the conditions of use recommended, with consideration given to the uncertainties relating to those benefits and risks as well as the public health need related to the applicable condition described in the List of Conditions that Threaten Public Health.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer may file, for a public health emergency drug for human use, a supplement to the new drug submission referred to in subsection (1) that does not meet the requirements set out in subparagraph (3.1)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii) if the supplement contains a draft of every label to be used in connection with the drug, including any package insert and any document provided on request that sets out supplementary information on the use of the drug.

If, at the time the manufacturer files, for a public health emergency drug, a supplement to the new drug submission referred to in subsection (1), the manufacturer is unable to provide the Minister with information or material that relates to any of the matters referred to in paragraphs (2)(d) to (h) and (5)(b) and subsection (6) — and, as applicable, the corresponding material referred to in paragraphs C.08.005.1(1)(b) to (d) — or if any of that information or material is incomplete, the manufacturer shall provide the Minister, at that time, with a plan that specifies how and when they will provide the Minister with the missing information or material.
Subsections (5) to (7) apply only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the supplement contains a statement that the supplement is for a public health emergency drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the purpose and conditions of use specified in the supplement relate only to a condition described in the List of Conditions that Threaten Public Health and the supplement contains a statement to that effect.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (5) to (7) do not apply if a notice of compliance in respect of the supplement is being sought on the basis of a direct or indirect comparison between the new drug and another drug.
The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: submission means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a new drug submission that is filed under section C.08.002;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an extraordinary use new drug submission that is filed under section C.08.002.01;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an abbreviated new drug submission that is filed under section C.08.002.1; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission that is filed under section C.08.002.1. (présentation)

Definition.Text: supplement means a supplement to a submission that is filed under section C.08.003. (supplément)

Subsection.Text: Despite sections C.08.002, C.08.002.01, C.08.002.1 and C.08.003 and subject to subsection (3), the manufacturer of a new drug is not permitted to file a submission or supplement for the new drug on the basis of a direct or indirect comparison to any new drug in respect of which an authorization was issued under the ISAD Interim Order.

Subsection (2) does not prevent the manufacturer of a new drug from filing a submission or supplement for the new drug on the basis of a direct or indirect comparison to another new drug in respect of which an authorization was issued under the ISAD Interim Order if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of compliance is issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01 in respect of a submission or supplement for that other new drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the comparison is in respect of the matters that were approved by the notice of compliance.

Section.Label: C.08.003.1
Section.Text: In examining a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to any of those submissions, the Minister may, for the purpose of assessing the safety and effectiveness of the new drug for which the submission or supplement was filed, examine

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information or material provided by any person under the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information or material obtained from sites at which the new drug or any active ingredient, as defined in subsection C.01A.001(1), of the new drug is or is proposed to be fabricated or packaged/labelled within the meaning of those terms in that subsection, or tested; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: information or material obtained directly or indirectly from a foreign regulatory authority, as defined in subsection C.10.001(1).

Subsection.Text: Subject to section C.08.004.1, the Minister shall, after completing an examination of a new drug submission or abbreviated new drug submission or a supplement to either submission,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if that submission or supplement complies with section C.08.002, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, and section C.08.005.1, issue a notice of compliance; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if that submission or supplement does not comply with section C.08.002, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, or section C.08.005.1, issue a notice to the manufacturer to that effect.

Subsection.Text: If a new drug submission or an abbreviated new drug submission or a supplement to either submission does not comply with section C.08.002, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, or section C.08.005.1, the manufacturer who filed the submission or supplement may amend the submission or supplement by filing additional information or material within 90 days after the day on which the Minister issues a notice to the manufacturer under paragraph C.08.004(1)(b) or within any longer period specified by the Minister.

Subject to section C.08.004.1, the Minister shall, after completing an examination of any additional information or material filed in respect of a new drug submission or an abbreviated new drug submission or a supplement to either submission,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if that submission or supplement complies with section C.08.002, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, and section C.08.005.1, issue a notice of compliance; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if that submission or supplement does not comply with section C.08.002, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, or section C.08.005.1, issue a notice to the manufacturer to that effect.

Subsection.Text: A notice of compliance issued in respect of a new drug on the basis of information and material contained in a submission filed pursuant to section C.08.002.1 shall state the name of the Canadian reference product referred to in the submission and shall constitute a declaration of equivalence for that new drug.

Subject to section C.08.004.1, the Minister shall, after completing an examination of an extraordinary use new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to either submission,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if that submission or supplement complies with section C.08.002.01, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, and section C.08.005.1, issue a notice of compliance; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if that submission or supplement does not comply with section C.08.002.01, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, or section C.08.005.1, issue a notice to the manufacturer to that effect.

Subsection.Text: If an extraordinary use new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to either submission does not comply with section C.08.002.01, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, or section C.08.005.1, the manufacturer who filed the submission or supplement may amend the submission or supplement by filing additional information or material within 90 days after the day on which the Minister issues a notice to the manufacturer under paragraph C.08.004.01(1)(b) or within any longer period specified by the Minister.

Subject to section C.08.004.1, the Minister shall, after completing an examination of any additional information or material filed in respect of an extraordinary use new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to either submission,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if that submission or supplement complies with section C.08.002.01, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, and section C.08.005.1, issue a notice of compliance; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if that submission or supplement does not comply with section C.08.002.01, C.08.002.1 or C.08.003, as the case may be, or section C.08.005.1, issue a notice to the manufacturer to that effect.

Subsection.Text: A notice of compliance issued in respect of a new drug for extraordinary use on the basis of information and material contained in a submission filed pursuant to section C.08.002.1 shall state the name of the Canadian reference product referred to in the submission and shall constitute a declaration of equivalence for that new drug.
The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: abbreviated new drug submission includes an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission. (présentation abrégée de drogue nouvelle)

innovative drug means a drug that contains a medicinal ingredient not previously approved in a drug by the Minister and that is not a variation of a previously approved medicinal ingredient such as a salt, ester, enantiomer, solvate or polymorph. (drogue innovante)
new drug submission includes an extraordinary use new drug submission. (présentation de drogue nouvelle)
