pediatric populations means the following groups: premature babies born before the 37th week of gestation; full-term babies from 0 to 27 days of age; and all children from 28 days to 2 years of age, 2 years plus 1 day to 11 years of age and 11 years plus 1 day to 18 years of age. (population pédiatrique)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the definition innovative drug in subsection (1), a medicinal ingredient is not considered to be approved in a drug by reason of the Minister having issued or amended an authorization under the ISAD Interim Order in respect of a COVID-19 drug that contains the medicinal ingredient.

The purpose of this section is to implement Articles 20.48 and 20.49 of the Agreement between Canada, the United States of America and the United Mexican States, as defined in the definition Agreement in section 2 of the Canada–United States–Mexico Agreement Implementation Act, and paragraph 3 of Article 39 of the Agreement on Trade-related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights set out in Annex 1C to the Agreement Establishing the World Trade Organization, as defined in the definition Agreement in subsection 2(1) of the World Trade Organization Agreement Implementation Act.
If a manufacturer seeks a notice of compliance for a new drug on the basis of a direct or indirect comparison between the new drug and an innovative drug,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer may not file a new drug submission, a supplement to a new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission or a supplement to an abbreviated new drug submission in respect of the new drug before the end of a period of six years after the day on which the first notice of compliance was issued to the innovator in respect of the innovative drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister shall not approve that submission or supplement and shall not issue a notice of compliance in respect of the new drug before the end of a period of eight years after the day on which the first notice of compliance was issued to the innovator in respect of the innovative drug.

Subsection.Text: The period specified in paragraph (3)(b) is lengthened to eight years and six months if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the innovator provides the Minister with the description and results of clinical trials relating to the use of the innovative drug in relevant pediatric populations in its first new drug submission for the innovative drug or in any supplement to that submission that is filed within five years after the issuance of the first notice of compliance for that innovative drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: before the end of a period of six years after the day on which the first notice of compliance was issued to the innovator in respect of the innovative drug, the Minister determines that the clinical trials were designed and conducted for the purpose of increasing knowledge of the use of the innovative drug in those pediatric populations and this knowledge would there-by provide a health benefit to members of those populations.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (3) does not apply if the innovative drug is not being marketed in Canada.

Paragraph (3)(a) does not apply to a manufacturer if the innovator consents to the filing of a new drug submission, a supplement to a new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission or a supplement to an abbreviated new drug submission by the manufacturer before the end of the period of six years specified in that paragraph.
Paragraph (3)(a) does not apply to a manufacturer if the manufacturer files an application for authorization to sell its new drug under section C.07.003.

Paragraph (3)(b) does not apply to a manufacturer if the innovator consents to the issuance of a notice of compliance to the manufacturer before the end of the period of eight years specified in that paragraph or of eight years and six months specified in subsection (4).
The Minister shall maintain a register of innovative drugs that includes information relating to the matters specified in subsections (3) and (4).

Subject to subsection (1.1) and notwithstanding sections C.08.002 and C.08.003, a manufacturer of a new drug may sell it to a qualified investigator to be used solely for the purpose of clinical testing to obtain evidence with respect to the safety, dosage and effectiveness of that new drug, when the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before the sale, the manufacturer has filed with the Minister, in compliance with section C.08.005.1, a preclinical submission containing information and material respecting

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the new drug or the identifying name or code proposed for the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the chemical structure or other specific identification of the composition of the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the source of the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a detailed protocol of the clinical testing,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the results of investigations made to support the clinical use of the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the contra-indications and precautions known in respect of the new drug and the suggested treatment of overdosage of the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: all ingredients of the new drug, stated quantitatively,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the methods, equipment, plant and controls used in the manufacture, processing and packaging of the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the tests applied to control the potency, purity and safety of the new drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: the names and qualifications of all investigators to whom the drug is to be sold and the names of all institutions in which the clinical testing is to be carried out;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has not, within 60 days after the date of receipt of the preclinical submission, sent by registered mail to the manufacturer a notice in respect of that new drug indicating that the preclinical submission is not satisfactory;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: all inner labels and outer labels used in conjunction with the sale of the new drug to qualified investigators carry the statements

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: “Investigational Drug” or “Drogue de recherche”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: “To Be Used By Qualified Investigators Only” or “Réservée uniquement à l’usage de chercheurs compétents”;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: before the sale, the manufacturer ascertains that every qualified investigator to whom the new drug is to be sold

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has the facilities for the clinical testing to be conducted by the investigator, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has received the information and material referred to in subparagraphs (a)(i) to (vi); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: every qualified investigator to whom the new drug is to be sold has agreed in writing with the manufacturer that the investigator will

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not use the new drug or permit it to be used other than for clinical testing,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not permit the new drug to be used by any person other than the investigator except under the investigator’s direction,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: report immediately to that manufacturer and, if so required by the Minister, report to the Minister all serious adverse reactions encountered during the clinical testing, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: account to the manufacturer for all quantities of the new drug received, where so requested by the manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: This section applies only in respect of a new drug for veterinary use.

Notwithstanding subsection (1), no manufacturer shall sell a new drug to a qualified investigator unless that manufacturer has, in respect of all previous sales of that new drug to any qualified investigator,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: kept accurate records of the distribution of that new drug and of the results of the clinical testing and has made those records available to the Minister for inspection on the request of the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: immediately reported to the Minister all information he has obtained with respect to serious adverse reactions.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may notify the manufacturer of a new drug that sales of that new drug to qualified investigators are prohibited if, in the opinion of the Minister, it is in the interest of public health to do so.
Notwithstanding subsection (1), no manufacturer shall sell a new drug to a qualified investigator if the Minister has notified the manufacturer of that drug that such sales are prohibited.
Paragraph (1)(c) does not apply to a radiopharmaceutical as defined in section C.03.201 or to a component or kit as defined in section C.03.205.

Every manufacturer who files a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission, a supplement to any of those submissions or a submission for the clinical testing of a new drug for veterinary use shall, in addition to any information and material that is required under section C.08.002, C.08.002.01, C.08.002.1, C.08.003 or C.08.005, include in the submission or supplement

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a sectional report in respect of each human, animal and in vitro study included in the submission or supplement;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a comprehensive summary of each human, animal and in vitro study referred to or included in the submission or supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a submission certificate in respect of all information and material contained in the submission or supplement and any additional information or material filed to amend the submission or supplement.

Subsection.Text: A sectional report referred to in paragraph (1)(b) shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of each study included in the submission or supplement;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of any additional information or material filed to amend the submission or supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where raw data is available to the manufacturer in respect of a study,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a summary of the data,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a cross-referencing of the data to the relevant portions of the sectional report,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the conditions under which the experiments from which the data were obtained were conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the details of the data treatment process, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the results and conclusions of the study.

Subsection.Text: The comprehensive summary referred to in paragraph (1)(c) shall include a summary of the methods used, results obtained and conclusions arrived at in respect of all studies referred to or included in the submission or supplement and shall be cross-referenced to the relevant portions of the sectional reports.
The submission certificate referred to in paragraph (1)(d) shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: certify that all information and material included in the submission or supplement and any additional information or material filed to amend the submission or supplement are accurate and complete, and that the sectional reports and the comprehensive summary correctly represent the information and material referred to or included in the submission or supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the senior executive officer in Canada of the manufacturer filing the submission or supplement, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the senior medical or scientific officer of the manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer who has filed a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission, a supplement to any of those submissions or a submission for the clinical testing of a new drug for veterinary use and who has any relating clinical case reports or raw data that were not included in the submission or supplement shall keep those reports or data and shall, within 30 days after receiving a written request from the Minister, submit them to the Minister.

For the purposes of subsection (2), evidence or new information obtained by the Minister includes any information or material filed by any person under Division 5 or section C.08.002, C.08.002.01, C.08.002.1, C.08.003, C.08.005 or C.08.005.1.

The Minister may, by notice to a manufacturer, suspend, for a definite or indefinite period, a notice of compliance issued to that manufacturer in respect of a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to any of those submissions if the Minister considers

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that the drug is not safe for the use represented in the submission or supplement, as shown by evidence obtained from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: clinical or other experience not reported in the submission or supplement or not available to the Minister at the time the notice of compliance was issued, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: tests by new methods or tests by methods not reasonably applicable at the time the notice of compliance was issued;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that, upon the basis of new information obtained after the issuance of the notice of compliance, there is lack of substantial evidence that the drug will have the effect it is represented to have under the conditions of use prescribed, recommended or proposed by the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that the submission or supplement contained an untrue statement of material fact;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: that the manufacturer has failed to establish a system for maintaining required records or has repeatedly or deliberately failed to maintain such records;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: that, on the basis of new information obtained after the issuance of the notice of compliance, the methods, equipment, plant and controls used in the manufacturing, processing and packaging of the drug are inadequate to assure and preserve the identity, strength, quality or purity of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: that, on the basis of new information obtained after the issuance of the notice of compliance, the labelling of the drug is false or misleading or incomplete in any particular and that this defect was not corrected by the manufacturer upon receipt of a written notice from the Minister specifying the respect in which the labelling is false or misleading or incomplete; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: that, in the case of a new drug for extraordinary use, the manufacturer has not adhered to the plan referred to in subparagraph C.08.002.01(2)(b)(ix).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, by notice to a manufacturer, suspend for a definite or indefinite period a notice of compliance issued to that manufacturer in respect of a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to any of those submissions if, after the Minister has, under section 21.31 of the Act, ordered the holder of a therapeutic product authorization referred to in subparagraph C.01.052(1)(a)(iii) to conduct an assessment of the new drug in order to provide evidence establishing that the benefits associated with the drug outweigh the risks of injury to health,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder fails to comply with the order; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder complies with the order but the Minister determines that the results of the assessment are not sufficient to establish that the benefits associated with the drug outweigh the risks of injury to health.

Subsection.Text: Where a manufacturer has received a notice of compliance issued in respect of a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to any of those submissions, the manufacturer shall establish and maintain records, in a manner that enables an audit to be made, respecting

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: animal or clinical experience, studies, investigations and tests conducted by the manufacturer or reported to him by any person concerning that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: reports from the scientific literature or the bibliography therefrom that are available to him concerning that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: experience, investigations, studies and tests involving the chemical or physical properties or any other properties of that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any substitution of another substance for that new drug or any mixing of another substance with that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any error in the labelling of that new drug or in the use of the labels designed for that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any bacteriological or any significant chemical or physical or other change or deterioration in any lot of that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any failure of one or more distributed lots of the new drug to meet the specifications established for that new drug in the submission or supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any unusual failure in efficacy of that new drug.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer shall retain the records respecting the information referred to in subsection (1) for at least seven years from the day on which they were established.

A manufacturer or importer who sells a new drug for extraordinary use in accordance with section C.08.002.02 shall retain the written order for at least 15 years from the day on which the order was filled.

Section.Label: C.08.008
Section.Text: No manufacturer shall sell a new drug unless the manufacturer has, with respect to all the manufacturer’s previous sales of that new drug, furnished to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of a record respecting any information referred to in paragraphs C.08.007(1)(a) to (c), on receipt of a request from the Minister for the summary;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of a record respecting any information referred to in paragraph C.08.007(1)(d) to (f), immediately on the manufacturer establishing the record; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of a record respecting any information referred to in paragraph C.08.007(1)(g) or (h), within 15 days after the day on which the manufacturer established the record.

Section.Label: C.08.008.1
Section.Text: Where a manufacturer has received a notice of compliance issued in respect of an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to either of those submissions, the manufacturer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall adhere to the plan referred to in subparagraph C.08.002.01(2)(b)(ix); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall, before the first day of October in each year and whenever requested to do so by the Minister for the purposes of assessing the safety and effectiveness of the drug to which the notice of compliance relates, provide a report on the use of the drug, including a critical analysis of any available updated information respecting the drug’s safety and effectiveness.

Subsection.Text: Where the Minister has decided

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to notify the manufacturer of a new drug for veterinary use that the sale of that drug to qualified investigators is prohibited, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to suspend a notice of compliance issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: the manufacturer, if dissatisfied with that decision, may require the Minister to provide him with the reasons for the decision.

Subsection.Text: Where the manufacturer has received the reasons for a decision of the Minister pursuant to subsection (1), he may require the Minister to refer that decision to a New Drug Committee and thereupon shall provide the Minister with a statement of the reasons for his dissatisfaction and any information and material upon which he relies in support of those reasons.

Where the Minister has been required to refer a decision to a New Drug Committee pursuant to subsection (2), he shall appoint a member of the New Drug Committee, the dissatisfied manufacturer shall appoint a member of the New Drug Committee and the two members so appointed shall appoint a third member of the New Drug Committee who shall be chairman, or, if they are unable to do so within a reasonable time, the Minister shall appoint a third member of the New Drug Committee who shall be chairman.
Any person who is in the full-time employment of the Department or in the full-time employment of the dissatisfied manufacturer shall not be appointed a member of a New Drug Committee.
A member of a New Drug Committee shall, on appointment, sign an undertaking not to disclose or use any information, material, data, evidence or representations considered pursuant to subsection (6).

The Minister shall pay the reasonable fees and costs incurred by the member of the New Drug Committee appointed by the Minister, and the dissatisfied manufacturer shall pay the reasonable fees and costs incurred by the member appointed by the dissatisfied manufacturer, and the Minister and the dissatisfied manufacturer shall each pay half of the reasonable fees and costs incurred by the chairman.

The New Drug Committee formed pursuant to subsection (3) shall consider the reasons for the decision of the Minister, the reasons for the dissatisfaction of the dissatisfied manufacturer and any information or material in support of the reasons of the Minister or the dissatisfied manufacturer and may consider other evidence, material, information or representations.
The New Drug Committee formed pursuant to subsection (3) shall report its findings and recommendations to the Minister.
No member of a New Drug Committee shall disclose or use any information, material, data, evidence or representations considered pursuant to subsection (6).
Where the Minister has received the findings and recommendations of a New Drug Committee, he may reconsider the decision to which those findings and recommendations relate.

Heading.TitleText: Pre-positioning of Public Health Emergency Drugs

Section.Label: C.08.009.01
Section.Text: The following definitions apply in sections C.08.009.03 to C.08.009.05.

Definition.Text: Chief Public Health Officer means the Chief Public Health Officer appointed under subsection 6(1) of the Public Health Agency of Canada Act. (administrateur en chef de la santé publique)
dosage form class has the same meaning as in subsection C.01A.001(1). (classe de forme posologique)
fabricate has the same meaning as in subsection C.01A.001(1). (manufacturer)

foreign regulatory authority means a government agency or other entity outside Canada that has a legal right to control the manufacturing, use or sale of drugs within its jurisdiction and that may take enforcement action to ensure that drugs marketed within its jurisdiction comply with the applicable legal requirements. (autorité réglementaire étrangère)
package/label has the same meaning as in subsection C.01A.001(1). (emballer-étiqueter)

Section.Label: C.08.009.02
Section.Text: Sections C.08.009.03 to C.08.009.05 apply in respect of a public health emergency drug if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of compliance has not been issued in respect of the drug under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: His Majesty in right of Canada has entered into a contract for the procurement of the drug.

Subsection.Text: The holder of an establishment licence may import a public health emergency drug if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Public Health Officer provides the Minister with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and contact information of the holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and contact information of the public health emergency drug’s manufacturer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the public health emergency drug and a description of it,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: information indicating that the public health emergency drug is the subject of a new drug submission, a supplement to a new drug submission or an application made to a foreign regulatory authority to authorize its sale,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: information specifying the quantity of the public health emergency drug to be imported, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the civic address of the place where the public health emergency drug will be stored after it is imported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder provides the Minister with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and contact information of each fabricator, packager/labeller and tester of the public health emergency drug and the civic address of each building at which the drug will be fabricated, packaged/labelled or tested, specifying for each building

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the activities referred to in Table I to section C.01A.008 that apply to the public health emergency drug,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the categories referred to in Table II to that section that apply to the public health emergency drug, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: for each of those categories, the dosage form classes, if any, and, in the case of a public health emergency drug that will be sterile, an indication to that effect, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a certificate from an inspector indicating that the buildings, equipment, practices and procedures of each fabricator, packager/labeller and tester meet the applicable requirements set out in Divisions 2 to 4 or, alternatively, other evidence establishing that those requirements are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the public health emergency drug belongs to a category of drugs that are authorized to be imported under the establishment licence.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(b) does not apply to the holder of an establishment licence in respect of a building referred to in subparagraph (1)(b)(i) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the building is listed in the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in clauses (1)(b)(i)(A) to (C) that the holder submitted in respect of the building in their application for the licence under section C.01A.005 or in an application to amend the licence under section C.01A.006, has not changed.

Subsection.Text: If the conditions set out in subsection (1) are met, the Minister shall send a letter to the Chief Public Health Officer to that effect.

Section.Label: C.08.009.04
Section.Text: Sections A.01.040, C.01.004.1 and C.01A.006 and Divisions 2 to 4 of this Part, other than the following provisions, do not apply in respect of the importation of a public health emergency drug under section C.08.009.03 by the holder of an establishment licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.02.003.1, C.02.004 and C.02.006, as they apply to the storage of the public health emergency drug by the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.012(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.012.1, as it applies to the storage of the public health emergency drug by the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.02.013 and C.02.014;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.015, as it applies to the storage and transportation of the public health emergency drug by the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.021(1), as it applies to the storage of the public health emergency drug by the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.022(1);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.023;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.024(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: section C.03.013.

Section.Label: C.08.009.05
Section.Text: Despite anything in these Regulations, the holder of an establishment licence may distribute a public health emergency drug that they have imported under section C.08.009.03 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Public Health Officer provides the Minister with the name of the public health emergency drug and the civic address of the place where it will be stored after distribution; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the public health emergency drug is distributed to a person who will store it at that place.

Heading.TitleText: Disclosure of Information in Respect of Clinical Trials

Subsection.Text: In sections C.08.009.2 and C.08.009.3, information in respect of a clinical trial means information in respect of a clinical trial, within the meaning of section C.05.001, that is contained in a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission for a new drug for human use filed under section C.08.002, C.08.002.01 or C.08.002.1 or in a supplement to any of those submissions filed under section C.08.003.

For greater certainty, the definition information in respect of a clinical trial includes information that is contained in a submission or supplement referred to in that definition and that is in respect of clinical testing involving human subjects in regards to which an application was filed under this Division before September 1, 2001.

Information in respect of a clinical trial that is confidential business information ceases to be confidential business information when one of the following circumstances occurs with respect to the submission or supplement:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister issues a notice of compliance under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the Minister issues a notice to the manufacturer under paragraph C.08.004(1)(b) or C.08.004.01(1)(b) and the manufacturer does not amend the submission or supplement under subsection C.08.004(2) or C.08.004.01(2), the applicable period referred to in the relevant subsection expires;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister issues a notice to the manufacturer under paragraph C.08.004(3)(b) or C.08.004.01(3)(b).

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to information in respect of a clinical trial that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was not used by the manufacturer in the submission or supplement to support the proposed conditions of use for the new drug or the purpose for which the new drug is recommended; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: describes tests, methods or assays that are used exclusively by the manufacturer.

Section.Label: C.08.009.3
Section.Text: The Minister may disclose, without notifying the person to whose business or affairs the information relates or obtaining their consent, any information in respect of a clinical trial that has ceased to be confidential business information.

Heading.TitleText: Sale of New Drug for Emergency Treatment

Subsection.Text: The Minister may issue a letter of authorization to a manufacturer of a new drug authorizing the sale of a specified quantity of the new drug for human or veterinary use to a practitioner, for use in the emergency treatment of an animal or a person under the care of that practitioner, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner provides the following information to the Minister:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the new drug and details concerning the medical emergency for which the new drug is required,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the new drug that is required,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsection (2), the information in the possession of the practitioner in respect of the use, safety and efficacy of the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and the civic address of the person to whom the new drug is to be shipped, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any other information the Minister may request to enable the Minister to determine whether to issue the letter of authorization;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner agrees to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: provide a report to the manufacturer of the new drug and to the Minister describing the results obtained following the use of the new drug to address the medical emergency, including information respecting any adverse drug reactions observed by the practitioner, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: account to the Minister, on request, for all quantities of the new drug received;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a new drug for human use, the person referred to in subparagraph (a)(iv) is a practitioner or a pharmacist; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a new drug for veterinary use, the person referred to in subparagraph (a)(iv) is a practitioner, a pharmacist or a person who may sell a medicated feed pursuant to section C.08.012.

Subsection.Text: Subparagraph (1)(a)(iii) does not apply if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sale of the new drug has been authorized under subsection (1) to address the same medical emergency on at least one previous occasion;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the European Medicines Agency or the United States Food and Drug Administration has authorized the sale of the new drug without terms or conditions, for the same use in its jurisdiction; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has not cancelled the assignment of a drug identification number for the new drug under paragraph C.01.014.6(2)(b) or (c) or subsection C.01.014.6(3).

Subsection.Text: The letter of authorization must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the practitioner to whom the new drug may be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and the civic address of the person to whom the new drug may be shipped;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the new drug and the medical emergency in respect of which it may be sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the new drug that may be sold to the practitioner to address the medical emergency.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, the practitioner is not required to know the identity of the animal or the person under the care of that practitioner at the time the letter of authorization is issued.
Despite section C.08.002, the manufacturer may sell a new drug in accordance with a letter of authorization issued under subsection C.08.010(1).

In the case of the sale under subsection (1) of a new drug for veterinary use that contains an active pharmaceutical ingredient set out in List A and that was not imported under section C.08.011.2, an annual report identifying the total quantity of the new drug that was sold, including an estimate of the quantity sold in respect of each animal species for which the drug is intended, must be submitted to the Minister by the manufacturer, if the new drug was present in Canada at the time of sale, otherwise by the practitioner.
The sale of a new drug made in accordance with subsection (1) is exempt from the provisions of the Act and these Regulations other than this section.

The annual report described in subsection (2) is for a period of one calendar year and must be submitted on or before March 31 of the year following the calendar year covered by the report, beginning with the first full calendar year during which the drug is first sold.

The Minister may issue a letter of authorization to the manufacturer of a new drug authorizing the holder of an establishment licence to import a specified quantity of the new drug for human or veterinary use, if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer provides the following information to the Minister:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the new drug and details concerning the medical emergency for which the new drug will be imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the new drug to be imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the holder of an establishment licence who will import the new drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the civic address of the facility where the new drug is to be stored in Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any other information the Minister may request to enable the Minister to determine whether to issue the letter of authorization;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the establishment licence authorizes the importation of a new drug in the same category as the one to be imported; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity that is to be imported does not exceed the amount that the Minister determines is likely to be required to address the medical emergency.

Subsection.Text: The letter of authorization must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the new drug and the medical emergency in respect of which the letter is issued;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the new drug that may be imported to address the medical emergency;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the holder of an establishment licence who is authorized to import the new drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the civic address of the facility where the new drug is to be stored in Canada.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection C.01A.004(1), the holder of an establishment licence may import a new drug in accordance with a letter issued under subsection C.08.011.1(1).
Section C.01A.006 and Divisions 2 to 4, except for the following provisions, do not apply to the importation of a new drug referred to in the letter of authorization:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.02.003.1 and C.02.004, as they apply to the storage of the new drug by the holder of an establishment licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.006, as it applies to the storage of the new drug by the holder of an establishment licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.012(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.012.1, as it applies to the storage of the new drug by the holder of an establishment licence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.02.013 and C.02.014;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.015, as it applies to the storage and transportation of the new drug by the holder of an establishment licence;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.021(1), as it applies to the storage of the new drug by the holder of an establishment licence;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.022(1);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.023;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.024(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: section C.03.013.

Subsection.Text: Despite section C.08.002, the holder of an establishment licence who imports a new drug under section C.08.011.2 may distribute a new drug in accordance with a letter of authorization issued under subsection C.08.010(1).

The holder of an establishment licence who distributes to a practitioner, in accordance with subsection (1), a new drug for veterinary use that contains an active pharmaceutical ingredient set out in List A must submit to the Minister an annual report identifying the total quantity of the new drug that was distributed, including an estimate of the quantity distributed in respect of each animal species for which the drug is intended.
The distribution of a new drug made in accordance with subsection (1) is exempt from the provisions of the Act and these Regulations other than this section.

The annual report described in subsection (2) is for a period of one calendar year and must be submitted on or before March 31 of the year following the calendar year covered by the report, beginning with the first full calendar year during which the drug is first distributed.
Notwithstanding anything in this Division, a person may sell, pursuant to a written prescription of a veterinary practitioner, a medicated feed if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as regards the drug or drugs used as the medicating ingredient of the medicated feed,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has assigned a drug identification number pursuant to section C.01.014.2, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the sale is permitted by section C.08.005, C.08.011 or C.08.013;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the medicated feed is for the treatment of animals under the direct care of the veterinary practitioner who signed the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the medicated feed is for therapeutic purposes only; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the written prescription contains the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person named on the prescription as the person for whom the medicated feed is to be mixed,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the species, production type and age or weight of the animals to be treated with the medicated feed,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of medicated feed to be mixed,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name, or the common name if there is no proper name, of the drug or each of the drugs, as the case may be, to be used as medicating ingredients in the preparation of the medicated feed, and the dosage levels of those medicating ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any special mixing instructions, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: labelling instructions including

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: feeding instructions,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a warning statement respecting the withdrawal period to be observed following the use of the medicated feed, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: where applicable, cautions with respect to animal health or to the handling or storage of the medicated feed.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, medicated feed has the same meaning as in the Feeds Regulations, 2024.

Notwithstanding anything in this Division, a person may sell a new drug proposed for use in animals to an experimental studies investigator in a quantity specified by the Minister for the purpose of conducting an experimental study in animals if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the experimental studies investigator has been issued an experimental studies certificate pursuant to subsection C.08.015(1) and the certificate has not been suspended or cancelled pursuant to section C.08.018; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is labelled in accordance with subsection C.08.016(1).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section and sections C.08.014 to C.08.018,

Definition.Text: experimental studies certificate means a certificate issued pursuant to subsection C.08.015(1); (certificat d’études expérimentales)
experimental studies investigator means a person named as the investigator in an experimental studies certificate; (expert en études expérimentales)
experimental study means a limited test of a new drug in animals carried out by an experimental studies investigator. (étude expérimentale)

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of obtaining an experimental studies certificate, an applicant shall submit to the Minister, in writing, the following information and material:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the new drug or the identifying name or code proposed for the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the objectives and an outline of the proposed experimental study of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the species, number and production type of animals in respect of which the new drug is to be administered;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the premises in which the experimental study is to be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the facilities to be used to conduct the experimental study;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and qualifications of the proposed experimental studies investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the chemical structure, if known, and the relevant compositional characteristics of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed quantity of the new drug to be used for the experimental study;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the results of any toxicological or pharmacological studies that may have been conducted with the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the written agreement referred to in subsection (2); and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: such other information and material as the Minister may require.

Subsection.Text: Where a food-producing animal is involved in an experimental study, the applicant referred to in subsection (1) shall, for the purposes of obtaining an experimental studies certificate, obtain from the owner of the animals, or from a person authorized by the owner, a written agreement not to sell the animal or any products from it without prior authorization from the experimental studies investigator.

The Minister may request the manufacturer of a new drug to submit to him samples of the new drug or of any ingredient of the drug and, in satisfactory form and manner, any other information that the Minister requests and where such samples or information are not submitted, the Minister may refuse to issue an experimental studies certificate.
Where, on receipt of the information and material submitted pursuant to section C.08.014, the Minister has determined that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is qualified as an experimental studies investigator for the purposes of the proposed experimental study,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the facilities for the conduct of the experimental study are adequate for the purposes of the proposed experimental study, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed experimental study can be conducted without undue foreseeable risk to humans or animals,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: the Minister shall issue an experimental studies certificate for the purposes of the proposed experimental study and shall specify therein the quantity of the new drug that may be sold to the experimental studies investigator.

Subsection.Text: If, on receipt of the information and material submitted under section C.08.014, the Minister determines that the requirements of paragraphs (1)(a), (b) and (c) have not been met, the Minister shall refuse to issue an experimental studies certificate.
The label of a new drug that is sold pursuant to section C.08.013 shall show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the new drug or the identifying name or code proposed for the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a warning statement to the effect that the drug is for use only in an experimental study in animals;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer of the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person to whom the drug has been supplied.

Subsection.Text: Sections C.01.004, C.01.005 and C.01.014 do not apply to a drug that is sold pursuant to section C.08.013 and labelled in accordance with subsection (1).

Section.Label: C.08.017
Section.Text: An experimental studies investigator shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: use the new drug only in accordance with the outline of the experimental study;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: report immediately to the Minister all serious adverse drug reactions associated with the use of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: report promptly to the Minister, on request, the results of the experimental study;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: return to the manufacturer, on request, all quantities of the new drug not used in the experimental study;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: maintain all records of the experimental study for a period of at least two years after the conclusion of the study and, on request, make such records available to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: report promptly to the Minister any known disposition of animals involved in the study or of any products from the animals that is contrary to the terms of the agreement referred to in subsection C.08.014(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: account to the Minister, on request, for all quantities of the new drug received by him.

Heading.TitleText: Suspension or Cancellation of Experimental Studies Certificate

Subsection.Text: If the Minister determines that it is necessary in order to safeguard animal health or public health or to promote public safety, he or she may suspend for a definite or indefinite period or cancel an experimental studies certificate.
Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the Minister may suspend or cancel an experimental studies certificate if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information and material submitted pursuant to section C.08.014 contains an untrue statement or contains any omission concerning the properties of the drug that were known or ought reasonably to have been known to the manufacturer or the experimental studies investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the labelling of the new drug is, at any time, false, misleading, deceptive or incomplete;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the qualifications of the experimental studies investigator prove to be inadequate;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: there is evidence that the experimental studies investigator has not complied with the conditions referred to in section C.08.017; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an action of the manufacturer in respect of the new drug has resulted in his conviction for a violation of section C.08.002.

Section.Label: C.09.001
Section.Text: This Division does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug that is required by these Regulations or the Narcotic Control Regulations to be sold only on prescription; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug for use exclusively in animals.

Section.Label: C.09.010
Section.Text: No manufacturer or importer shall, after June 30, 1986, sell a drug for analgesia that contains a combination of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a salt or derivative of salicylic acid with another salt or derivative of salicylic acid or with salicylamide; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: acetaminophen with a salt or derivative of salicylic acid or with salicylamide.

Section.Label: C.09.011
Section.Text: Each label of a drug that is intended for internal use and contains acetaminophen, salicylic acid or a salt or derivative thereof shall, after June 30, 1986, carry a caution

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to consult a physician if the underlying condition requires continued use for more than five days; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that it is hazardous to exceed the maximum recommended dose unless advised by a physician.

Section.Label: C.09.012
Section.Text: Each label of a drug that is intended for internal use and contains salicylic acid or a salt or derivative thereof shall after June 30, 1986, carry a warning statement to consult a physician before taking the drug during the last three months of pregnancy or when nursing.

Subsection.Text: The adult standard dosage unit of acetaminophen shall be 325 mg.
The children’s standard dosage units of acetaminophen shall be 80 mg or 160 mg.
In this Division, acetaminophen product means a drug that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: acetaminophen as a single medicinal ingredient; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: acetaminophen in combination with caffeine.

Subsection.Text: No manufacturer or importer shall sell an acetaminophen product unless it meets the requirements of this Division.

Subject to subsections (2) to (4), an acetaminophen product sold in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration shall contain one adult standard dosage unit of acetaminophen per individual dosage form.

An acetaminophen product in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration may contain 500 mg of acetaminophen per individual dosage form if it has a label that states that it is not a standard dosage unit product.

An acetaminophen product sold in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form that is intended for oral administration may contain 325 mg of acetaminophen for immediate release and another 325 mg for subsequent release, if it has a label that states that it is not a standard dosage unit product.

An acetaminophen product sold in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form that is intended for oral administration and that is specially recommended for children shall contain one children’s standard dosage unit of acetaminophen per individual dosage form.

An acetaminophen product in the form of a liquid that is intended to be taken as drops and that is specially recommended for children shall contain one children’s standard dosage unit of acetaminophen per millilitre of the product.
A package of an acetaminophen product described in subsection (5) shall be accompanied by a measuring device capable of accurately delivering 0.5 mL of the product.

An acetaminophen product in the form of a liquid that is not intended to be taken as drops and that is specially recommended for children shall contain one children’s standard dosage unit per teaspoon of the product.
An acetaminophen product in the form of a liquid shall contain one adult standard dosage unit of acetaminophen per teaspoon of the product.
The adult standard dosage unit of a salicylate shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of acetylsalicylic acid, sodium salicylate and magnesium salicylate, 325 mg; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of choline salicylate, 435 mg.

Subsection.Text: The children’s standard dosage unit of a salicylate shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of acetylsalicylic acid, sodium salicylate and magnesium salicylate, 80 mg; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of choline salicylate, 110 mg.

Subsection.Text: In this Division, salicylate product means a drug that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a salt or derivative of salicylic acid as a single medicinal ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a salt or derivative of salicylic acid in combination with caffeine;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a salt or derivative of salicylic acid in combination with one or more buffering agents or antacids; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a salt or derivative of salicylic acid in combination with caffeine and one or more buffering agents or antacids.

Subsection.Text: No manufacturer or importer shall sell a salicylate product after June 30, 1986 unless it meets the requirements of this Division.

No manufacturer or importer shall, until June 30, 1986, sell a salicylate product in a dosage unit other than one mentioned in this Division, unless the salicylate product was legally available for sale in Canada on February 1, 1984.

Subject to subsections (2) and (3) and section C.09.035, a salicylate product in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration shall contain one adult standard dosage unit of a salicylate per individual dosage form.
A salicylate product in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 500 mg of acetylsalicylic acid, sodium salicylate or magnesium salicylate, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 670 mg of choline salicylate

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: per individual dosage form if it has a label that states that it is not a standard dosage unit product.

Subsection.Text: A salicylate product in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: two adult standard dosage units of a salicylate per individual dosage form if the label of the salicylate product states that each individual dosage form contains two adult standard dosage units; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: three adult standard dosage units of a salicylate per individual dosage form if the label of the salicylate product states that each individual dosage form contains three adult standard dosage units.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a salicylate product in the form of a liquid shall contain one adult standard dosage unit of a salicylate per teaspoon.
A salicylate product in the form of a liquid may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: two adult standard dosage units of a salicylate per teaspoon if the label of the salicylate product states that each teaspoon of the product contains two adult standard dosage units; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: three adult standard dosage units of a salicylate per teaspoon if the label of the salicylate product states that each teaspoon of the product contains three adult standard dosage units.

Section.Label: C.09.034
Section.Text: A salicylate product that is claimed to be buffered shall provide at least 1.9 milliequivalents of acid neutralizing capacity per adult standard dosage unit of a salicylate.

Section.Label: C.09.035
Section.Text: A salicylate product in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration and that is specially recommended for children shall contain one children’s standard dosage unit of a salicylate per individual dosage form.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 10
Heading.TitleText: Access to Drugs in Exceptional Circumstances

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and in section C.10.002.

Definition.Text: foreign regulatory authority means a government agency or other entity outside Canada that has a legal right to control the manufacturing, use or sale of drugs within its jurisdiction. (autorité réglementaire étrangère)
public health official means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Public Health Officer appointed under subsection 6(1) of the Public Health Agency of Canada Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Medical Officer of Health, or equivalent, of a province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Surgeon General of the Canadian Armed Forces; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Medical Officer of Public Health for the Department of Indigenous Services. (responsable de la santé publique)

Subsection.Text: Despite sections A.01.040 and C.01.004.1, any person who holds an establishment licence that authorizes the importation of a drug may import a drug for which a notice of compliance has not been issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01, or for which a drug identification number has not been assigned under subsection C.01.014.2(1), if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a public health official has, within the past year, notified the Minister in writing of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an urgent public health need for the immediate use of the drug within their jurisdiction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the intended use or purpose of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is authorized by a foreign regulatory authority in the United States, Switzerland or the European Union to be sold for the same use or purpose as that described under subparagraph (a)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is in the same category as the category for which the licence was issued;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is imported directly from the country in which it is authorized to be sold by the foreign regulatory authority; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is one for which the following information is set out in the List of Drugs for an Urgent Public Health Need that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: medicinal ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: dosage form,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: strength,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: route of administration, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: identifying code or number, if any, assigned in the country in which the drug was authorized for sale.

Subsection.Text: Sections C.01A.006 and C.01A.007 do not apply in respect of the importation of a drug under subsection (2).
For greater certainty, a licensee may, despite subsection C.01A.004(1), import a drug under subsection (2) without having their licence amended under section C.01A.006.
Divisions 2 to 4, other than the following provisions, do not apply to the importation of a drug under subsection (2):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.02.003.1 and C.02.004 as they apply to the storage of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.006;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.012(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.012.1 as it applies to the storage of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.02.013 and C.02.014;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.015 as it applies to the storage and transportation of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.021(1) as it applies to the storage of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.022(1);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.023;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: subsections C.02.024(1) and C.02.025(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: section C.03.013.

Subsection.Text: A sale of a drug that is imported under subsection C.10.001(2) is exempt from the provisions of these Regulations only if the drug is sold to a person within the jurisdiction of a public health official who has notified the Minister as described in paragraph C.10.001(2)(a), for use in respect of the same urgent public health need for which it was imported.

Any person who wholesales such a drug must hold an establishment licence to wholesale a drug in the same category and despite subsection (1), the following provisions apply in respect of the wholesale:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.02.003.1 and C.02.004 as they apply to the storage of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.006 as it applies to the storage of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.012(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.012.1 as it applies to the storage of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.013;

Paragraph.Label: (d.1)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.014;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.015 as it applies to the storage and transportation of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (e.1)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.021(1) as it applies to storage;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.022(1);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.023; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.024(1).

Section.Label: C.10.003
Section.Text: Every licensee who imports a drug under subsection C.10.001(2) must notify the Minister within 15 days after the day on which it is imported by providing the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title and contact information of the person who imported the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the medicinal ingredients, strength, dosage form and route of administration of the drug and any identifying code or number assigned to it in the country in which it was authorized for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the country from which the drug was imported; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the total quantity of the drug imported.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and in sections C.10.005 to C.10.011.

Definition.Text: designated drug means a drug that is set out in the List of Drugs for Exceptional Importation and Sale. (drogue désignée)
drug means any of the following drugs for human use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: drugs included in Schedule I, II, III, IV or V to the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prescription drugs;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: drugs that are listed in Schedule C or D to the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: drugs that are permitted to be sold without a prescription but that are to be administered only under the supervision of a practitioner. (drogue)

Definition.Text: foreign regulatory authority has the same meaning as in subsection C.10.001(1). (autorité réglementaire étrangère)

List of Drugs for Exceptional Importation and Sale means the List of Drugs for Exceptional Importation and Sale that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (Liste des drogues destinées aux importations et aux ventes exceptionnelles)

Subsection.Text: In sections C.10.006 and C.10.009, batch certificate, fabricate, MRA country, package/label and recognized building have the same meanings as in subsection C.01A.001(1).
The Minister may add a drug to the List of Drugs for Exceptional Importation and Sale only if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there is a shortage or risk of shortage of another drug for which a notice of compliance has been issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01 or for which a drug identification number has been assigned under subsection C.01.014.2(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the drug to be added to that list can be substituted for the drug referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: In subsection (1), shortage has the same meaning as in section C.01.014.8.
A person who holds an establishment licence that authorizes the importation of a drug may import a designated drug if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee provides the Minister, electronically in a format specified by or acceptable to the Minister and not later than the third business day before the day on which the designated drug is imported, with a notification that contains the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the licensee’s name and contact information,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and contact information of each fabricator, packager/labeller and tester of the designated drug and the address of each building in which it is fabricated, packaged/labelled or tested,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of the designated drug,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: its brand name,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: its medicinal ingredients,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: its dosage form,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: its strength,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: its route of administration,

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: its identifying code or number, if any, assigned in the country in which it is authorized for sale, and

Clause.Label: (G)
Clause.Text: a detailed description of its conditions of use,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the intended port of entry into Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the estimated date of arrival of the shipment of the designated drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the total quantity of the designated drug that is intended to be imported on the date referred to in subparagraph (v);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the designated drug is authorized to be sold by a foreign regulatory authority within its jurisdiction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the designated drug is in the same category as the category for which the establishment licence was issued;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the following information is set out in the List of Drugs for Exceptional Importation and Sale in respect of the designated drug:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the licensee’s name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information referred to in clauses (a)(iii)(A) to (F),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the foreign regulatory authority referred to in paragraph (b), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date after which it may no longer be imported;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number of the designated drug is set out in the list referred to in paragraph (d), if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the total quantity of the designated drug that the licensee imports does not exceed the maximum limit specified in the list referred to in paragraph (d) in respect of the drug, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the designated drug is imported on or before the date referred to in subparagraph (d)(iv); and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee has prepared a plan that specifies the measures to be taken in order for the licensee to comply with section C.10.011.

Subsection.Text: In subsection (1), business day means a day other than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a Saturday; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a Sunday or other holiday.

Section.Label: C.10.007
Section.Text: Sections A.01.040, A.01.044 and C.01.004.1 do not apply in respect of the importation, under section C.10.006, of a designated drug by a person who holds an establishment licence.

Subsection.Text: Subject to sections C.10.009 and C.10.010, a sale of a designated drug that is imported under section C.10.006 is exempt from the following provisions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sections A.01.015, A.01.017 and A.01.051; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the provisions of Part C other than

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the provisions of Divisions 1A and 2, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: this section and sections C.10.009 to C.10.011.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, for the purposes of section C.01.016, the manufacturer of a designated drug is required to comply only with the requirements set out in sections C.01.017 and C.01.019 in respect of the drug.
Subsections (1) and (2) cease to apply in respect of the sale of a designated drug on its expiration date.
Section C.02.019 does not apply to a person who holds an establishment licence in respect of a designated drug that they import under section C.10.006.
The licensee shall perform the finished product testing on a sample of the designated drug that is taken either

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: after receipt of each lot or batch of the designated drug on their premises in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: before receipt of each lot or batch of the designated drug on their premises in Canada if the following conditions are met:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the licensee has evidence satisfactory to the Minister to demonstrate that lots or batches of the designated drug sold to them by the vendor of the lot or batch are consistently manufactured in accordance with and consistently comply with the specifications for that drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the designated drug has not been transported or stored under conditions that may affect its compliance with the specifications for that drug.

Subsection.Text: In subsection (2), a reference to specifications is a reference to the specifications with which the designated drug is required to comply within the jurisdiction of the foreign regulatory authority referred to in paragraph C.10.006(1)(b).

If the licensee receives on their premises in Canada a lot or batch of a designated drug whose useful life is more than 30 days, they shall visually inspect the lot or batch to confirm the identity of the product.

Subsections (2) and (4) do not apply to the licensee if the designated drug is fabricated, packaged/labelled and tested in an MRA country at a recognized building and the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the building is set out in their establishment licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they retain a copy of the batch certificate for each lot or batch of the designated drug that they receive for at least one year after the expiration date of the lot or batch.

Subsection.Text: In this section, specifications has the same meaning as in section C.02.002.

A person who holds an establishment license and who imports a designated drug under section C.10.006 is required to comply with paragraphs C.02.020(1)(a), (b) and (d) in respect of the drug but is not required to maintain the records referred to in those paragraphs on their premises in Canada.
The Minister may request that the licensee provide to the Minister any of the records referred to in paragraphs C.02.020(1)(a), (b) or (d) in respect of the designated drug.
The licensee shall provide the requested records electronically in a format specified by or acceptable to the Minister within the time limit specified by the Minister.

A person who holds an establishment licence shall not sell a designated drug that they imported under section C.10.006 unless they ensure that the information referred to in clause C.10.006(1)(a)(iii)(G) is available in English and French and in a manner that permits the safe use of the drug.

The licensee shall ensure that the information is available in accordance with subsection (1) until at least the end of the day on the latest expiration date of the designated drug that they imported.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 11
Heading.TitleText: Public or Canadian Armed Forces Health Emergencies — Drugs for Immediate Use or Stockpiling

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: foreign regulatory authority has the same meaning as in subsection C.10.001(1). (autorité réglementaire étrangère)
initial public health official means the public health official named in an authorization issued under subsection C.11.003(1). (responsable de la santé publique initial)
public health official means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Public Health Officer appointed under subsection 6(1) of the Public Health Agency of Canada Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Medical Officer of Health, or equivalent, of a province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Medical Officer of Health, or equivalent, of a municipality;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Surgeon General of the Canadian Armed Forces; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Medical Officer of Public Health for the Department of Indigenous Services. (responsable de la santé publique)

Definition.Text: subsequent public health official means any public health official, other than the initial public health official, who obtains the quantity of a drug, or a portion of the quantity, that is specified in an authorization issued under subsection C.11.003(1). (responsable de la santé publique subséquent)

Subsection.Text: This Division applies to a drug for human use in dosage form for which a drug identification number has not been assigned under subsection C.01.014.2(1) or for which a notice of compliance has not been issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01, including drugs that have ceased to be considered to be natural health products by virtue of subsection 103.15(2) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.

In order to address an actual, imminent or potential emergency, event or incident affecting public health or the health of members of the Canadian Armed Forces, a public health official may, on application to the Minister, obtain an authorization that permits a drug manufacturer to sell a specified quantity of a drug to the public health official, for immediate use or stockpiling or both.
The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: set out the name of the public health official and include information setting out how they may be contacted at any time;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: set out the name of the manufacturer and include information setting out how they may be contacted at any time;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: describe the emergency, event or incident;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: state whether the drug is for immediate use or stockpiling or both;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: describe the use of the drug that is intended to address the emergency, event or incident;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: set out the civic address of the place to which the drug is to be shipped by the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: set out the following information about the drug:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its brand name, if any, and either its proper name, common name and chemical name or its identifying name, code, number or mark,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its medicinal ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its strength,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: its dosage form,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the recommended dosage for the use described under paragraph (e),

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended route of administration,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the indications that have been approved by any foreign regulatory authority, if applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: its contraindications,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: a summary of its safety profile, and
