Paragraph.Text: dispense, sell or provide a controlled drug, other than a preparation, to, or pursuant to a prescription or order given by, a practitioner named in a notice given by the Minister under section G.04.004.2; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: dispense, sell or provide a preparation to a practitioner or pursuant to a prescription or order given by a practitioner named in a notice given by the Minister under section G.04.004.2.

Section.Label: G.03.002.2
Section.Text: Section G.03.002.1 does not apply to a pharmacist to whom the Minister has issued a notice of retraction of the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: under section G.03.017.3, in respect of a pharmacist named in a notice issued by the Minister under section G.03.017.2; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under section G.04.004.3, in respect of a practitioner named in a notice issued by the Minister under section G.04.004.2.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may sell or provide a controlled drug to a practitioner for use in their practice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: upon a written order, signed and dated by that practitioner, that has been verified if the signature of the practitioner is unknown to the pharmacist; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: upon a verbal order specifying the name and quantity of the drug if the pharmacist has taken reasonable precautions to satisfy themself that the person making the order is a practitioner.

Section.Label: G.03.004
Section.Text: A pharmacist shall, in respect of controlled drugs sold or provided to a practitioner under section G.03.003, keep in a special prescription file a record showing the date, the name and address of the practitioner, and the quantity and kind of controlled drug sold or provided.

Section.Label: G.03.005
Section.Text: A pharmacist may provide a controlled drug to a hospital employee or to a practitioner in a hospital on receipt of a written order signed and dated by the pharmacist in charge of the hospital’s pharmacy or by a practitioner authorized by the person in charge of the hospital to sign the order, if the signature of that pharmacist or practitioner is known to the pharmacist or, if unknown, has been verified by the pharmacist.

Section.Label: G.03.006
Section.Text: A pharmacist shall not refill a prescription for a controlled drug unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner, at the time that he issued the prescription, directed in writing, in the case of a controlled drug listed in Part I of the schedule to this Part, or directed in writing or orally, in the case of a controlled drug listed in Part II or III of the schedule to this Part, that the prescription be refilled, the number of times that it may be refilled and the dates for or the intervals between refills; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist keeps a record of each refilling of a prescription.

Section.Label: G.03.007
Section.Text: If, in accordance with a written order or prescription, a pharmacist dispenses a controlled drug listed in Part I of the schedule to this Part, other than a preparation, the pharmacist must immediately enter in a book, register or similar record maintained for such purposes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name or initials;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, initials and municipal address of the practitioner who issued the order or prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the person named in the order or prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of the controlled drug dispensed;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the controlled drug was dispensed; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the order or prescription.

Section.Label: G.03.008
Section.Text: A pharmacist must, before dispensing a controlled drug in accordance with a verbal order or prescription, make a written record of it that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name or initials;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, initials and municipal address of the practitioner who issued the order or prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the person named in the order or prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of the controlled drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use given with the order or prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the controlled drug was dispensed; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the order or prescription.

Section.Label: G.03.009
Section.Text: A pharmacist must maintain a special prescription file in which are filed, in sequence as to date and number, all written orders and prescriptions for controlled drugs that they have dispensed and the written record of all controlled drugs that they have dispensed in accordance with a verbal order or prescription.

Section.Label: G.03.010
Section.Text: A pharmacist shall retain in his possession for a period of at least two years, any records which he is required to keep by this Part.

Section.Label: G.03.011
Section.Text: A pharmacist shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: furnish such information respecting the dealings of the pharmacist in any controlled drug in such form and at such times as the Minister may require;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: make available and produce to an inspector upon request his special prescription file together with any books, records or documents which he is required to keep;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to make copies of or to take extracts from such files, books, records or documents; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to check all stocks of controlled drugs on his premises.

Section.Label: G.03.012
Section.Text: A pharmacist shall take all reasonable steps that are necessary to protect controlled drugs on his premises or under his control against loss or theft.

Section.Label: G.03.013
Section.Text: A pharmacist shall report to the Minister any loss or theft of a controlled drug within 10 days of his discovery thereof.

Section.Label: G.03.014
Section.Text: A pharmacist may, upon receiving a written order for a controlled drug signed and dated by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer who sold or provided that drug to them, return that drug to that licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: another pharmacist, sell or provide any quantity of that drug to that other pharmacist that is specified in the order as being required for emergency purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister, sell or provide to the Minister any quantity of that drug, specified in the order, that is required by the Minister in connection with his or her duties; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to that controlled drug, sell or provide to that person any quantity of that drug that is specified in the order.

Section.Label: G.03.015
Section.Text: A pharmacist shall immediately after receiving, selling or providing a controlled drug under paragraph G.03.014(b) or (c) or subsection G.05.003(4) enter the details of the transaction in a book, register or other record maintained for the purpose of recording such transactions.

Section.Label: G.03.016
Section.Text: A pharmacist shall forthwith after removing, transporting or transferring a controlled drug from his place of business to any other place of business operated by him notify the Minister, setting out the details.

Heading.TitleText: Communication of Information by Minister to Licensing Authority

Section.Label: G.03.017
Section.Text: The Minister must provide in writing any factual information about a pharmacist that has been obtained under the Act or this Part to the provincial professional licensing authority that is responsible for the authorization of the person to practise their profession

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the province in which the pharmacist is or was entitled to practise if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the authority submits to the Minister a written request that sets out the pharmacist’s name and address, a description of the information being requested and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting a lawful investigation by the authority, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist has

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: contravened a rule of conduct established by the authority,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: been convicted of a designated substance offence, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: contravened this Part; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a province in which the pharmacist is not entitled to practise, if the authority submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request that sets out the pharmacist’s name and address and a description of the information being requested, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that shows that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the pharmacist has applied to that authority to practise in that province, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the authority has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist is practising in that province without being authorized to do so.

Section.Label: G.03.017.1
Section.Text: A pharmacist may make a written request to the Minister to send to the persons and authorities specified in subsection G.03.017.2(3) a notice, issued under section G.03.017.2, advising them that recipients of the notice must not sell or provide a controlled drug other than a preparation, a preparation, or both, to that pharmacist.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances described in subsection (2), the Minister must send a notice to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3) advising them that pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies and licensed dealers must not sell or provide to the pharmacist named in the notice a controlled drug other than a preparation or a preparation.
The notice must be sent if the pharmacist named in the notice has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made a request to the Minister in accordance with section G.03.017.1 to send the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contravened a rule of conduct established by the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist is practising and the authority has requested the Minister in writing to send the notice; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: been convicted of a designated substance offence or of a contravention of this Part.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be sent to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all licensed dealers;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies within the province in which the pharmacist named in the notice is entitled to practice and is practising;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist named in the notice is entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies in an adjacent province in which an order from the pharmacist named in the notice may be filled; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any provincial professional licensing authority in another province that has requested the Minister in writing to send the notice.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may send the notice described in subsection (1) to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3) if the Minister has taken the measures specified in subsection (5) and has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist named in the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has contravened a provision of the Act or this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a controlled drug, other than a preparation, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical practice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a preparation, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical practice;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, provided or administered a controlled drug, other than a preparation, to a person who is a spouse, common-law partner, parent or child of the pharmacist, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical practice;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, provided or administered a preparation to a person who is a spouse, common-law partner, parent or child of the pharmacist, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical practice; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is unable to account for the quantity of controlled drug for which the pharmacist was responsible under this Part.

Subsection.Text: The measures that must be taken before sending the notice are that the Minister has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consulted with the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist to whom the notice relates is entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: given that pharmacist an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: considered

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the compliance history of the pharmacist in respect of the Act and its regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the actions of the pharmacist pose a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of the controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Label: G.03.017.3
Section.Text: The Minister must provide the licensed dealers, pharmacies and provincial professional licensing authorities who were sent a notice under subsection G.03.017.2(1) with a notice of retraction of that notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstance described in paragraph G.03.017.2(2)(a), the requirements set out in subparagraphs (b)(i) and (ii) have been met and one year has elapsed since the notice was sent by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a circumstance described in any of paragraphs G.03.017.2(2)(b) and (c) and (4)(a) to (f), the pharmacist named in the notice has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: requested in writing that a retraction of the notice be sent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provided a letter from the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist is entitled to practise, in which the authority consents to the retraction of the notice.

Heading.TitleText: Administration of Designated Drugs and Other Controlled Drugs

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3) and to an exemption granted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the administration of the controlled drug specified in the exemption, a practitioner must not administer a controlled drug to any person or animal.
A practitioner may administer a controlled drug, other than a designated drug, to a person or to an animal, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that person or animal is under their professional treatment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the controlled drug is required for the condition for which that person or animal is receiving treatment.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of medicine, dentistry or veterinary medicine or a nurse practitioner may administer a designated drug to a person or animal who is under their professional treatment if the designated drug is for the treatment of any of the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of persons,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: narcolepsy,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: hyperkinetic disorders in children,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: epilepsy,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: parkinsonism, or

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: hypotensive states associated with anesthesia; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of animals, depression of cardiac and respiratory centres.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: administer includes to prescribe, sell or provide a drug. (administrer)
designated drug means any of the following controlled drugs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: amphetamine and its salts;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: benzphetamine and its salts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: methamphetamine and its salts;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: phenmetrazine and its salts; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: phendimetrazine and its salts. (drogue désignée)

Section.MarginalNote: Record of controlled drugs sold or provided
Section.Label: G.04.002

Subsection.Text: A practitioner who sells or provides a controlled drug to a person for self-administration or for administration to an animal shall, whether or not the practitioner charges for the drug, keep a record showing the name and quantity of the controlled drug sold or provided, the name and address of the person to whom it was sold or provided and the date on which it was sold or provided if the quantity of the controlled drug exceeds

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: three times the maximum daily dosage recommended by the manufacturer or assembler of the controlled drug; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: three times the generally recognized maximum daily therapeutic dosage for that controlled drug if the manufacturer or assembler has not recommended a maximum daily dosage.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner who is required by this section to keep a record shall keep the record in a place, form and manner that will permit an inspector readily to examine and obtain information from it.

Section.Label: G.04.002A
Section.Text: A practitioner shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: furnish to the Minister on request such information respecting

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the use by the practitioner of controlled drugs received — including the administering, selling or providing of the drugs to a person — , and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the prescriptions for controlled drugs issued by the practitioner,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: produce to an inspector on request any records that these Regulations require the practitioner to keep;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to make copies of such records or to take extracts therefrom;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to check all stocks of controlled drugs on the practitioner’s premises;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: retain in his possession for at least two years any record that these Regulations require him to keep;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: take adequate steps to protect controlled drugs in his possession from loss or theft; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: report to the Minister any loss or theft of a controlled drug within 10 days of the practitioner’s discovery of the loss or theft.

Heading.TitleText: Communication of Information by Minister to Licensing Authority

Section.Label: G.04.004
Section.Text: The Minister must provide in writing any factual information about a practitioner that has been obtained under the Act or this Part to the provincial professional licensing authority responsible for the registration and authorization of the person to practise their profession

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the province in which the practitioner is or was registered and entitled to practise if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the authority submits to the Minister a written request that sets out the practitioner’s name and address, a description of the information being requested and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting a lawful investigation by the authority, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the practitioner has

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: contravened a rule of conduct established by the authority,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: been convicted of a designated substance offence, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: contravened this Part; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a province in which the practitioner is not registered and entitled to practise, if the authority submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request that sets out the practitioner’s name and address and a description of the information being requested, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that shows that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the practitioner has applied to that authority to practise in that province, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the authority has reasonable grounds to believe that the practitioner is practising in that province without being authorized to do so.

Section.Label: G.04.004.1
Section.Text: A practitioner may make a written request to the Minister to send to licensed dealers and pharmacies a notice, issued under section G.04.004.2, advising them of one or more of the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: recipients of the notice must not sell or provide a controlled drug, other than a preparation, to that practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: recipients of the notice must not sell or provide a preparation to that practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not fill a prescription or order for a controlled drug, other than a preparation, from that practitioner; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not fill a prescription or order for a preparation from that practitioner.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances described in subsection (2), the Minister must send a notice to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3) advising them that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies and licensed dealers must not sell or provide to the practitioner named in the notice a controlled drug other than a preparation or a preparation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not fill a prescription or order from the practitioner named in the notice for a controlled drug other than a preparation or a preparation; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the prohibitions in both paragraphs (a) and (b) apply with respect to the practitioner named in the notice.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be sent if the practitioner named in the notice has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made a request to the Minister in accordance with section G.04.004.1 to send the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contravened a rule of conduct established by the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the practitioner is practising and the authority has requested the Minister in writing to issue the notice; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: been convicted of a designated substance offence or of a contravention of this Part.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be sent to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all licensed dealers;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies within the province in which the practitioner named in the notice is registeredand entitled to practice and is practising;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the practitioner named in the notice is registered and entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies in an adjacent province in which a prescription or order from the practitioner named in the notice may be filled; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any provincial professional licensing authority in another province that has requested the Minister in writing to send the notice; and

Subsection.Text: The Minister may send the notice described in subsection (1) to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3) if the Minister has taken the measures specified in subsection (5) and has reasonable grounds to believe that the practitioner named in the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has contravened a provision of the Act or this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a controlled drug, other than a preparation, under a self-directed prescription or order or, in the absence of a prescription or order, contrary to accepted professional practice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a preparation, under a self-directed prescription or order or, in the absence of a prescription or order, contrary to accepted professional practice;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, prescribed, provided or administered a controlled drug, other than a preparation, to a person who is a spouse, common-law partner, parent or child of the practitioner, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted professional practice;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, prescribed, provided or administered a preparation to a person who is a spouse, common-law partner, parent or child of the practitioner, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted professional; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is unable to account for the quantity of controlled drug for which the practitioner was responsible under this Part.

Subsection.Text: The measures that must be taken before sending the notice are that the Minister has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consulted with the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the practitioner to whom the notice relates is registered and entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: given that practitioner an opportunity to be heard

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: considered

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the compliance history of the practitioner in respect of the Act and its regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the actions of the practitioner pose a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of the controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Label: G.04.004.3
Section.Text: The Minister must provide the licensed dealers, pharmacies and provincial professional licensing authorities who were sent a notice under subsection G.04.004.2(1) with a notice of retraction of that notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstance described in paragraph G.04.004.2(2)(a), the requirements set out in subparagraphs (b)(i) and (ii) have been met and one year has elapsed since the notice was sent by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a circumstance described in any of paragraphs G.04.004.2(2)(b) and (c) and (4)(a) to (f), the practitioner named in the notice has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: requested in writing that a retraction of the notice be sent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provided a letter from the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the practitioner is registered and entitled to practise, in which the authority consents to the retraction of the notice.

Subsection.Text: A person who is in charge of a hospital shall keep or cause to be kept a record of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of any controlled drug received for the hospital by a hospital employee or a practitioner in the hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person from whom any controlled drug was received and the date on which it was received;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of any controlled drug used in the making or assembling of a product or compound containing that controlled drug, the name and quantity of the product or compound made or assembled and the date on which the product or compound was placed in stock;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of any controlled drug produced and the date on which it was placed in stock;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the patient for whom a controlled drug was dispensed;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the practitioner ordering or prescribing a controlled drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which a controlled drug was ordered or prescribed and the form and quantity thereof.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), the record of information referred to in subsection (1) shall be kept

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a manner that permits an audit to be made;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a book, register or similar record maintained exclusively for controlled drugs; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for a period of at least two years.

Subsection.Text: The information referred to in paragraphs (1)(d) to (f) may, with respect to a preparation, be kept in a form other than that specified in paragraph (2)(b).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — Part II or III of schedule
Subsection.Text: The information referred to in subsection (1) may, with respect to a controlled drug listed in Part II or III of the schedule to this Part, be kept in a form other than that specified in paragraph (2)(b).

Section.Label: G.05.002
Section.Text: A person who is in charge of a hospital shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: furnish such information respecting the use of controlled drugs therein, in such form and at such times as the Minister may require;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: produce to an inspector any books, records or documents required by these Regulations to be kept;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to make copies thereof or take extracts from such books, records and documents; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to check all stocks of controlled drugs in the hospital.

Section.MarginalNote: Selling, providing or administering controlled drug
Section.Label: G.05.003

Subsection.Text: No person in charge of a hospital shall permit a controlled drug to be sold, provided or administered except in accordance with this section.

On receipt of a prescription or a written order signed and dated by a practitioner, the person in charge of a hospital may permit a controlled drug to be administered to a person or an animal under treatment as an in-patient or out-patient of the hospital, or to be sold or provided to the person or to the person in charge of the animal.

Subject to subsection (6), the person in charge of a hospital may permit a controlled drug to be provided, for emergency purposes, to a hospital employee or a practitioner in another hospital on receipt of a written order signed and dated by a pharmacist in the other hospital or a practitioner authorized by the person in charge of the other hospital to sign the order.

Subject to subsection (6), the person in charge of a hospital may permit a controlled drug to be sold or provided, for emergency purposes, to a pharmacist on receipt of a written order signed and dated by the pharmacist.
The person in charge of a hospital may permit a controlled drug to be provided to a person employed in a research laboratory in that hospital for the purpose of research.

No person in charge of a hospital shall permit a controlled drug to be sold or provided under subsection (3) or (4) unless the signature of the pharmacist in the other hospital or of the practitioner authorized by the person in charge of the other hospital to sign an order is known to the person who sells or provides the controlled drug or has been verified.

Section.Label: G.05.004
Section.Text: A person who is in charge of a hospital shall take all steps necessary to protect controlled drugs in the hospital against loss or theft and shall report to the Minister any loss or theft of a controlled drug within 10 days of his discovery thereof.

Section.MarginalNote: Labelling — drug dispensed in accordance with prescription
Section.Label: G.06.001
Section.Text: In the case of a controlled drug that is dispensed by a pharmacist in accordance with a prescription, section C.01.004 does not apply but the label of the package in which the controlled drug is contained must include the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the pharmacy or pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date and number of the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person for whom the controlled drug is dispensed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: directions for use; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that the prescription requires be shown on the label.

Section.Label: G.06.002
Section.Text: Section C.01.004 does not apply to a test kit that contains a controlled drug and that has a registration number.

Section.MarginalNote: Identification or analysis of controlled drug
Section.Label: G.06.003

Subsection.Text: Despite anything in this Part, a person may, for the purpose of identification or analysis of a controlled drug, provide or deliver the drug to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner of medicine; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an agent or mandatary of a practitioner of medicine, if the agent or mandatary is exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that drug for that purpose.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Agent or mandatary of practitioner of medicine
Subsection.Text: An agent or mandatary of a practitioner of medicine who receives the controlled drug must immediately provide or deliver it to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of medicine who receives the controlled drug must immediately provide or deliver it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of its identification or analysis, to a person exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that drug for that purpose; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to the Minister.

Section.Label: G.06.004
Section.Text: It is prohibited to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: advertise a controlled drug to the general public; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: publish any written advertisement respecting a controlled drug unless that advertisement displays the following symbol in a clear and conspicuous colour and size in the upper left quarter of its first page:The symbol consists of a diamond shape outline in which an uppercase letter C is centred.

Section.Label: G.06.005
Section.Text: Every person who is exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession or administration of a controlled drug and every practitioner of medicine who has received a controlled drug under subsection G.06.003(1) or (2) and every agent or mandatary of a practitioner of medicine who has received a controlled drug under subsection G.06.003(1) must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: keep a record of the following information for a two-year period beginning on the day on which the record is made:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and quantity of any controlled drug purchased or received by them and the date on which it was purchased or received,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person from whom the controlled drug was purchased or received, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: details of the use of the controlled drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide any information respecting those controlled drugs that the Minister may require; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: permit access to the records required to be kept by this Part.

Section.MarginalNote: Communication of information by Minister to nursing statutory body
Section.Label: G.06.006

Subsection.Text: The Minister may provide to a nursing statutory body any information concerning any member of that body that has been obtained under this Part, the Act or the Food and Drugs Act.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a nurse practitioner.
The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: member means any person who is authorized by a nursing statutory body to practice nursing. (membre)

nursing statutory body means any provincial professional licensing authority that, in accordance with the laws of that province, authorizes a person to practise nursing. (organisme régissant la profession d’infirmier)

Section.MarginalNote: Notification of application for order of restoration
Section.Label: G.06.007

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 24(1) of the Act, notification of an application for an order of restoration must be given in writing to the Attorney General by registered mail and be mailed not less than 15 days before the date on which the application is to be made to a justice.
The notification must specify

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the justice to whom the application is to be made;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the time and place at which the application is to be heard;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: details concerning the controlled drug or other thing in respect of which the application is to be made; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence on which the applicant intends to rely to establish that they are entitled to possession of the controlled drug or other thing referred to in paragraph (c).

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE
ScheduleFormHeading.OriginatingRef: (Sections G.01.001 and G.01.002, subsections G.01.005(1) and G.02.058(1), section G.02.073, subsection G.03.001(3), paragraph G.03.006(a), section G.03.007 and subsection G.05.001(4))

Item.Text: Amphetamines, their salts, derivatives, isomers and analogues and salts of derivatives, isomers and analogues, excluding those substances set out in item 1 of Part I of the schedule to Part J but including:
Methylphenidate (methyl 2-phenyl-2-(piperidin-2-yl)acetate), its salts, derivatives, isomers and analogues and salts of derivatives, isomers and analogues, including:
Aminorex (5-phenyl-4,5-dihydro-1,3-oxazol-2-amine), its salts, derivatives, isomers and analogues and salts of derivatives, isomers and analogues, including
Lefetamine ((-)-N,N-dimethyl-α-phenylbenzeneethanamine), its salts, derivatives and isomers and salts of derivatives and isomers
Mesocarb (3-(α-methylphenethyl)-N-(phenylcarbamoyl)sydnone imine) and any salt thereof
Amineptine (7-[(10,11-dihydro-5H-dibenzo[a,d]cyclohepten-5-yl)amino]heptanoic acid) and any salt thereof

Barbiturates, their salts and derivatives, excluding the substances set out in items 6 and 7 of Part I of this schedule, as well as barbituric acid (2,4,6(1H,3H,5H)-pyrimidinetrione) and its salts and 1,3-dimethylbarbituric acid (1,3-dimethyl-2,4,6(1H,3H,5H)-pyrimidinetrione) and its salts, but including
Thiobarbiturates, their salts and derivatives, including:
Anabolic steroids and their derivatives, including:

Section.Label: J.01.001
Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: Act means the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act. (Loi)

competent authority means a public authority of a foreign country that is authorized under the laws of the country to approve the importation or exportation of restricted drugs into or from the country. (autorité compétente)
compound includes a preparation. (composé)
designated criminal offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving the financing of terrorism against any of sections 83.02 to 83.04 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving fraud against any of sections 380 to 382 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the offence of laundering proceeds of crime against section 462.31 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving a criminal organization against any of sections 467.11 to 467.13 of the Criminal Code; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (d). (infraction désignée en matière criminelle)

Definition.Text: destroy, in respect of a restricted drug, means to alter or denature it to such an extent that its consumption is rendered impossible or improbable. (destruction)
hospital means a facility that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: licensed, approved or designated by a province in accordance with the laws of the province to provide care or treatment to persons or animals suffering from any form of disease or illness; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: owned or operated by the Government of Canada or the government of a province and that provides health services. (hôpital)

Definition.Text: institution means any institution engaged in research on drugs and includes a hospital, a university in Canada or a department or agency of the Government of Canada or of a government of a province or any part of them. (établissement)

international obligation means an obligation in respect of a restricted drug set out in a convention, treaty or other multilateral or bilateral instrument that Canada has ratified or to which Canada adheres. (obligation internationale)
label has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act. (étiquette)
licensed dealer means the holder of a licence issued under section J.01.015. (distributeur autorisé)
package includes anything in which a restricted drug is wholly or partly contained, placed or packed. (emballage)
proper name, in respect of a restricted drug, means the name in English or French that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is assigned to the drug in section C.01.002;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: appears in bold face type for the drug in these Regulations and, if the drug is dispensed in a form other than that described in Part C, the name of the dispensing form; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is assigned in any of the publications mentioned in Schedule B to the Food and Drugs Act in the case of a drug not included in paragraph (a) or (b). (nom propre)

Definition.Text: qualified investigator means, in respect of a restricted drug, a person whose use and possession of that drug are authorized by the Minister under subsection J.01.059(4) and who is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: employed by or connected with an institution; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: engaged in clinical testing or laboratory research in an institution in respect of that drug. (chercheur compétent)

Definition.Text: qualified person in charge means the individual designated under subsection J.01.012(1). (responsable qualifié)
restricted drug means a controlled substance that is set out in the schedule to this Part. (drogue d’usage restreint)

Security Directive means the Directive on Physical Security Requirements for Controlled Substances and Drugs Containing Cannabis, as amended from time to time and published by the Government of Canada on its website. (Directive en matière de sécurité)
senior person in charge means the individual designated under section J.01.011. (responsable principal)
test kit means a kit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains a restricted drug and a reagent system or buffering agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is used during the course of a chemical or analytical procedure to test for the presence or quantity of a restricted drug for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of which are not intended or likely to be consumed by, or administered to, a person or an animal. (nécessaire d’essai)

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, by order, add to column 1 of Part III of the schedule to this Part any item or portion of an item listed in Schedule V to the Act for a period referred to in column 2 that is the same as that listed in Schedule V for that item.
The Minister may, by order, delete any item or portion of an item from column 1 of Part III of the schedule to this Part.
An item or portion of an item listed in Part III of the schedule to this Part is deemed to be deleted on the day on which it is no longer listed in Schedule V to the Act.

Section.Label: J.01.003
Section.Text: A member of a police force or a person acting under their direction and control who, in respect of the conduct of the member or person, is exempt from the application of subsection 4(2) or section 5, 6 or 7 of the Act by virtue of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act (Police Enforcement) Regulations is, in respect of that conduct, exempt from the application of this Part.

Subsection.Text: The following persons are authorized to possess a restricted drug listed in Part I of the schedule to this Part:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a qualified investigator who possesses the drug for the purpose of conducting clinical testing or laboratory research in an institution;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector, member of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, police constable, peace officer, member of the technical or scientific staff of the Government of Canada, the government of a province or a university in Canada who possesses the drug in connection with their employment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A person is authorized to possess a restricted drug listed in Part I of the schedule to this Part if they are acting as the agent or mandatary of a person referred to in paragraph (1)(a), (b), (d) or (e).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Agent or mandatary — person referred to in paragraph (1)(c)
Subsection.Text: A person is authorized to possess a restricted drug listed in Part I of the schedule to this Part if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: are acting as the agent or mandatary of a person who they have reasonable grounds to believe is a person referred to in paragraph (1)(c); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: possess the restricted drug for the purpose of assisting that person in the administration or enforcement of an Act or regulation.

Section.Label: J.01.005
Section.Text: A person may sell, possess or otherwise deal in a test kit if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a registration number has been issued for the test kit under section J.01.007 and has not been cancelled under section J.01.008;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit bears, on its external surface,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the trade name or trademark, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit will be used for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer of a test kit may obtain a registration number for it by submitting to the Minister an application containing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the design and construction of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the restricted drug and other substances, if any, contained in the test kit, including the qualitative and quantitative composition of each component; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the proposed use of the test kit.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the person authorized by the applicant for that purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that all of the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The applicant must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Label: J.01.007
Section.Text: On completion of the review of the application for a registration number, the Minister must issue a registration number for the test kit, preceded by the letters “TK”, if the Minister determines that the test kit will only be used for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose and that it contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a restricted drug and an adulterating or denaturing agent that are combined in such a manner and in such a quantity, proportion or concentration that the preparation or mixture has no significant drug abuse potential; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: such small quantities or concentrations of any restricted drug as to have no significant drug abuse potential.

Section.Label: J.01.008
Section.Text: The Minister must cancel the registration number for a test kit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is removed from the market by the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the test kit is used or is likely to be used for any purpose other than a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the cancellation is necessary to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer may produce, assemble, sell, provide, transport, send, deliver, import or export a restricted drug if they comply with this Part and the terms and conditions of their dealer’s licence and any permit issued under this Part.
A licensed dealer may conduct an activity in relation to a restricted drug at their site only if the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge is present at the site.
A licensed dealer must obtain a permit to import or export a restricted drug.
A licensed dealer may possess a restricted drug for the purpose of exporting it if they have obtained it in accordance with this Part.

Section.Label: J.01.010
Section.Text: The following persons may apply for a dealer’s licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who ordinarily resides in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation that has its head office in Canada or operates a branch office in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a position that includes responsibility for restricted drugs on behalf of the Government of Canada or of a government of a province, a police force, a hospital or a university in Canada.

Section.Label: J.01.011
Section.Text: An applicant for a dealer’s licence must designate only one individual as the senior person in charge, who has overall responsibility for management of the activities with respect to restricted drugs that are specified in the licence application. The applicant may designate themself if the applicant is an individual.

Subsection.Text: An applicant for a dealer’s licence must designate only one individual as the qualified person in charge, who is responsible for supervising the activities with respect to restricted drugs that are specified in the licence application and for ensuring that those activities comply with this Part. The applicant may designate themself if the applicant is an individual.

An applicant for a dealer’s licence may designate an individual as an alternate qualified person in charge, who is authorized to replace the qualified person in charge when that person is absent. The applicant may designate themself if the applicant is an individual.
Only an individual who meets the following requirements may be designated as a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they work at the site specified in the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: are a person entitled or, if applicable, registered and entitled by a provincial professional licensing authority or a professional association in Canada and entitled to practise a profession that is relevant to their duties, such as pharmacist, practitioner, pharmacy technician or laboratory technician,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: hold a diploma, certificate or credential awarded by a post-secondary educational institution in Canada in a field or occupation that is relevant to their duties, such as pharmacy, medicine, dentistry, veterinary medicine, pharmacology, chemistry, biology, pharmacy technician, laboratory technician, pharmaceutical regulatory affairs or supply chain management or security, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: hold a diploma, certificate or credential that is awarded by a foreign educational institution in a field or occupation referred to in subparagraph (ii) and hold

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment as defined in subsection 73(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment issued by an organization or institution that is responsible for issuing equivalency assessments and is recognized by a province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: they have sufficient knowledge of and experience with the use and handling of the restricted drugs specified in the dealer’s licence to properly carry out their duties; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: they have sufficient knowledge of the provisions of the Act and this Part that are applicable to the activities specified in the dealer’s licence to properly carry out their duties.

Subsection.Text: An applicant for a dealer’s licence may designate an individual who does not meet any of the requirements of paragraph (3)(b) as a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no other individual working at the site meets those requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: those requirements are not necessary for the activities specified in the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the individual has sufficient knowledge — acquired from a combination of education, training or work experience — to properly carry out their duties.

Section.Label: J.01.013
Section.Text: An individual is not eligible to be a senior person in charge, a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge if, during the 10 years before the day on which the dealer’s licence application is submitted,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a designated substance offence or a designated criminal offence or a designated offence as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Cannabis Act, the individual

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: was convicted as an adult, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: was a young person who received an adult sentence, as those terms are defined in subsection 2(1) of the Youth Criminal Justice Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an offence committed outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted a designated substance offence or a designated criminal offence or a designated offence as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Cannabis Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the individual was convicted as an adult, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they committed the offence when they were at least 14 years old but less than 18 years old, the individual received a sentence that was longer than the maximum youth sentence, as that term is defined in subsection 2(1) of the Youth Criminal Justice Act, that could have been imposed under that Act for such an offence.

Subsection.Text: A person who intends to conduct an activity referred to in section J.01.009 must obtain a dealer’s licence for each site at which they intend to conduct activities by submitting an application to the Minister that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual, the individual’s name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a corporation, its corporate name and any other name registered with a province under which it intends to conduct the activities specified in its dealer’s licence or by which it intends to identify itself, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder of a position mentioned in paragraph J.01.010(c), the applicant’s name and the title of the position;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address, telephone number and, if applicable, the email address of the proposed site and, if different from the municipal address, its mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, date of birth, telephone number and email address of the proposed senior person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to each of the proposed qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name, date of birth, telephone number and email address,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the title of their position at the site,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and title of the position of their immediate supervisor at the site,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the profession they practise that is relevant to their duties, the name of the province that authorizes them to practise it and their authorization number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: their education, training and work experience that are relevant to their duties;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the activities that are to be conducted and the restricted drugs in respect of which each of the activities is to be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested to manufacture or assemble a product or compound that contains a restricted drug, other than a test kit, a list that includes, for each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product or the name of the compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the restricted drug in the product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the restricted drug in it, the number of units per package and the number of packages,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is to be manufactured or assembled by or for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, municipal address and dealer’s licence number of the other licensed dealer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: if the applicant’s name appears on the label of the product or compound, a copy of the inner label;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested in order to produce a restricted drug other than a product or compound that contains a restricted drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the restricted drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity that the applicant expects to produce under their licence and the period during which that quantity would be produced, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is to be produced for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, municipal address and licence number of the other licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested for an activity that is not described in paragraph (f) or (g), the name of the restricted drug for which the activity is to be conducted and the purpose of the activity;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the security measures in place at the site, determined in accordance with the Security Directive; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the method for recording information that the applicant proposes to use for the purpose of section J.01.075.

Subsection.Text: An application for a dealer’s licence must be accompanied by the following documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is a corporation, a copy of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the certificate of incorporation or other constituting instrument, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any document filed with the province in which its site is located that states its corporate name and any other name registered with the province under which the applicant intends to conduct the activities specified in its dealer’s licence or by which it intends to identify itself;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: individual declarations signed and dated by each of the proposed senior person in charge, and qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge, attesting that the person is not ineligible for a reason specified in section J.01.013;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a document issued by a Canadian police force in relation to each person referred to in paragraph (b), indicating whether, during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, the person was convicted as specified in subparagraph J.01.013(a)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph J.01.013(a)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if any of the persons referred to in paragraph (b) has ordinarily resided in a country other than Canada during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, a document issued by a police force of that country indicating whether in that period that person was convicted as specified in subparagraph J.01.013(b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph J.01.013(b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: declaration, signed and dated by the proposed senior person in charge, attesting that the proposed qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge have the knowledge and experience required under paragraphs J.01.012(3)(c) and (d); and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the proposed qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge does not meet the requirement of subparagraph J.01.012(3)(b)(i), either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the person’s diploma, certificate or credential referred to in subparagraph J.01.012(3)(b)(ii) or (iii), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a detailed description of the education, training and work experience that is required under paragraph J.01.012(4)(c), together with supporting evidence, such as a copy of a course transcript or an attestation by the person who provided the training.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the proposed senior person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the applicant.

Subsection.Text: The applicant must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Label: J.01.015
Section.Text: Subject to section J.01.017, on completion of the review of the licence application, the Minister must issue a dealer’s licence, with or without terms and conditions, that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the licensed dealer, their corporate name or the title of the position they hold;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the activities that are authorized and the names of the restricted drugs in respect of which each activity may be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the site at which the dealer may conduct the authorized activities;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the security level at the site, determined in accordance with the Security Directive;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the licence, which must be not later than three years after its effective date;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level that is referred to in paragraph (e), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensed dealer produces a restricted drug, the quantity that they may produce and the authorized production period.

Section.Label: J.01.016
Section.Text: A dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section J.01.035 or J.01.036.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant may not apply for a licence under section J.01.010;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the licence application is submitted, the applicant has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the applicant under any regulations made under the Act or issued to the applicant under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the licence application is submitted the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph J.01.013(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph J.01.013(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the licence is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the licence is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph J.01.014(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required under section J.01.075;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has not complied with the requirements of subsection J.01.014(4) or the information and documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the licence application;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the licence application;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant has been involved in the diversion of a restricted drug to an illicit market or use or has been involved in an activity that contravened an international obligation; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to issue a licence under paragraph (1)(b) or (h) if the applicant meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue a licence, the Minister must send the applicant a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the applicant an opportunity to be heard.
To apply to renew a dealer’s licence, a licensed dealer must submit to the Minister an application that contains the information and documents referred to in subsections J.01.014(1) and (2).
The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the senior person in charge of the site specified in the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section J.01.021, on completion of the review of the renewal application, the Minister must issue a renewed dealer’s licence that contains the information specified in section J.01.015.
When renewing a dealer’s licence, the Minister may, if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to it or modify or delete one in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence or the new level required as a result of the licence renewal; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Label: J.01.020
Section.Text: A renewed dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section J.01.035 or J.01.036.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to renew a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer may no longer apply for a licence under section J.01.010;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the renewal application is submitted, the licensed dealer has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their Regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the dealer under a regulation made under the Act or issued to the dealer under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the renewal application is submitted, the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph J.01.013(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph J.01.013(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the renewal is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the renewal is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph J.01.014(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required under section J.01.075;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection J.01.018(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the renewal application;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the renewal application;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a restricted drug to an illicit market or use or has been involved in an activity that contravened an international obligation; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the renewal of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to renew a licence under paragraph (1)(b) or (h) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to renew a licence, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Before making a change affecting any information referred to in section J.01.015 that is contained in their dealer’s licence, a licensed dealer must submit to the Minister an application to amend the licence that contains a description of the proposed amendment, as well as the information and documents referred to in section J.01.014 that are relevant to the proposed amendment.
The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the senior person in charge of the site specified in the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section J.01.025, on completion of the review of the amendment application, the Minister must amend the dealer’s licence.
When amending a dealer’s licence, the Minister may, if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to it or modify or delete one in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence or the new level required as a result of the amendment; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Label: J.01.024
Section.Text: An amended dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section J.01.035 or J.01.036.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to amend a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the licence amendment is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the licence amendment is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph J.01.014(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required by section J.01.075;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection J.01.022(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the amendment application;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the amendment application; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the amendment of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.
