Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to amend a licence under paragraph (1)(e) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to amend a licence, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Heading.TitleText: Changes Requiring Prior Approval by Minister

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must obtain the Minister’s approval before making any of the following changes by submitting a written application to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change affecting the security measures in place at the site specified in the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement of the senior person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement of the qualified person in charge; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement or addition of an alternate qualified person in charge.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must provide the Minister with the following with respect to a change referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a change affecting the security measures in place at the site specified in the dealer’s licence, details of the change;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the senior person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph J.01.014(1)(c), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the declaration specified in paragraph J.01.014(2)(b) and the documents specified in paragraphs J.01.014(2)(c) and (d); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph J.01.014(1)(d), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the declarations specified in paragraphs J.01.014(2)(b) and (e) and the documents specified in paragraphs J.01.014(2)(c), (d) and (f).

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section J.01.028, on completion of the review of the application for approval of the change, the Minister must approve the change.
When approving a change, the Minister may, if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to the licence or modify or delete one in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to approve the change if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the application for approval of the change is submitted, the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subpa/ragraph J.01.013(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph J.01.0013(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection J.01.026(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the application for approval of the change;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the application for approval of the change; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the change would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to approve a change under paragraph (1)(c) if the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
Before refusing to approve a change, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard in respect of them.
A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: making or assembling a product or compound that is not set out in the most recent version of the list referred to in paragraph J.01.014(1)(f) that has been submitted to the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: making a change to a product or compound that is set out in the list, if the change affects any of the information that has previously been submitted.

Subsection.Text: The notice must contain the information referred to in paragraph J.01.014(1)(f) that is necessary to update the list and be accompanied by the revised version of the list.

Section.Label: J.01.030
Section.Text: A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing within five days after a person ceases to act as the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing within 10 days after one of the following changes occurs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person ceases to act as the senior person in charge; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer ceases to manufacture or assemble a product or compound that is set out in the most recent version of the list referred to in paragraph J.01.014(1)(f) that has been submitted to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A notice submitted under paragraph (1)(b) must specify which information referred to in paragraph J.01.014(1)(f) is being changed and be accompanied by the revised version of the list.

A licensed dealer that intends to cease conducting activities at their site — whether on or before the expiry of their licence — must notify the Minister in writing to that effect at least 30 days before ceasing those activities.
The notice must be signed and dated by the senior person in charge and contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expected date of the cessation of activities at the site;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the manner in which any remaining restricted drugs on the site as of that date will be disposed of by the licensed dealer, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be sold or provided to another licensed dealer that will be conducting activities at the same site, the name of that dealer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be sold or provided to another licensed dealer that will not be conducting activities at the same site, the name of that dealer and the municipal address of their site, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be destroyed, the date on which and the municipal address of the location at which the destruction is to take place;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the location at which the licensed dealer’s documents will be kept after activities have ceased; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, municipal address, telephone number and, if applicable, the email address of a person who the Minister may contact for further information after activities have ceased.

Subsection.Text: After having ceased to conduct the activities, the licensed dealer must submit to the Minister a detailed update of the information referred to in subsection (2) if it differs from what was set out in the notice. The update must be signed and dated by the senior person in charge.

Heading.TitleText: Changes to Terms and Conditions of Licence

Section.MarginalNote: Addition of or modification to term or condition
Section.Label: J.01.033

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, at any time other than at the issuance, renewal or amendment of a dealer’s licence, add a term or condition to it or modify one if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before adding a term or condition to a licence or modifying one, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Despite subsection (2), the Minister may add a term or condition to a licence or modify one without prior notice if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
The addition or modification of a term or condition that is made under subsection (3) takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the addition or modification;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may delete a term or condition of a dealer’s licence that the Minister determines is no longer necessary.
The deletion takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice to that effect.

The Minister must suspend a dealer’s licence without prior notice if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
The suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the licence if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must revoke a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer may no longer apply for a licence under section J.01.010;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the licence or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer ceases to conduct activities at their site before the expiry of their licence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not take the corrective measures specified in an undertaking or notice;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the dealer under a regulation made under the Act or issued to the dealer under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the licence is revoked, the senior person in charge, the qualified person in charge or any alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph J.01.013(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph J.01.013(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of an application relating to the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a restricted drug to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not revoke a dealer’s licence for a ground set out in paragraph (1)(e) or (g) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before revoking a licence, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Label: J.01.037
Section.Text: The licensed dealer must return the original of the licence to the Minister within 15 days after the effective date of the revocation.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must submit to the Minister, before each importation of a restricted drug, an application for an import permit that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, municipal address and dealer’s licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the restricted drug to be imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, as specified in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity and its anhydrous content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the restricted drug is contained in a product to be imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the restricted drug in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address, in the country of export, of the exporter from whom the restricted drug is being obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office where the importation is anticipated; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed mode of transportation and any proposed country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that all of the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Label: J.01.039
Section.Text: Subject to section J.01.042, on completion of the review of the import permit application, the Minister must issue to the licensed dealer an import permit that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in subsection J.01.038(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the permit, being the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a date specified by the Minister that is not more than 180 days after its effective date, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the dealer’s licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Label: J.01.040
Section.Text: An import permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the permit under section J.01.045 or J.01.046,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the dealer’s licence under section J.01.035 or J.01.036, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the export permit that applies to the restricted drug to be imported and that is issued by the competent authority in the country of export.

Section.Label: J.01.041
Section.Text: If an import permit expires, the licensed dealer must return the original of the permit to the Minister within 15 days after its expiry.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue an import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is not authorized by their dealer’s licence to import the relevant restricted drug or their licence will expire before the date of importation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the importation would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of the importation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection J.01.038(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has been notified that their application to renew or amend their licence will be refused;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the importation would contravene the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the permit would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue the import permit, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Label: J.01.043
Section.Text: The holder of an import permit must provide a copy of the permit to the customs office at the time of importation.

Section.Label: J.01.044
Section.Text: The holder of an import permit must provide the Minister, within 15 days after the day of release of the restricted drug specified in the permit in accordance with the Customs Act, with a declaration that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and the numbers of their dealer’s licence and the import permit that applies to the restricted drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the restricted drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, as set out in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the restricted drug is contained in a product that they have imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the restricted drug in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office from which the restricted drug was released and the date of the release.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must suspend an import permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence is suspended;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the importation would contravene the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: The suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the import permit if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must revoke an import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the permit or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not carry out the corrective measures specified by the Minister under paragraph J.01.045(2)(c) by the specified date;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has contravened a term or condition of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the application for the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a restricted drug to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence has been revoked.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not revoke an import permit for a ground set out in paragraph (1)(d) or J.01.036(1)(e) or (g) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before revoking an import permit, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Label: J.01.047
Section.Text: If an import permit is revoked, the licensed dealer must return the original of the permit to the Minister within 15 days after the effective date of the revocation.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must submit to the Minister, before each exportation of a restricted drug, an application for an export permit that contains the following information and document:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, municipal address and dealer’s licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the restricted drug to be exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, as specified in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity and its anhydrous content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the restricted drug is contained in a product to be exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the restricted drug in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the importer in the country of final destination;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office where the exportation is anticipated;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed mode of transportation and any proposed country of transit or transhipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the import permit issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination that sets out the name of the importer and the municipal address of their site in that country.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that, to the best of their knowledge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the exportation does not contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Label: J.01.049
Section.Text: Subject to section J.01.052, on completion of the review of the export permit application, the Minister must issue to the licensed dealer an export permit that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in paragraphs J.01.048(1)(a) to (f);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the permit, being the earliest of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a date specified by the Minister that is not more than 180 days after its effective date,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the dealer’s licence, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the import permit issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Label: J.01.050
Section.Text: An export permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the permit under section J.01.055 or J.01.056,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the dealer’s licence under section J.01.035 or J.01.036, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the expiry, suspension or revocation of the import permit that applies to the restricted drug to be exported and that is issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination.

Section.Label: J.01.051
Section.Text: If an export permit expires, the licensed dealer must return the original of the permit to the Minister within 15 days after its expiry.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue an export permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is not authorized by their dealer’s licence to export the relevant restricted drug or their dealer’s licence will expire before the date of export;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the exportation would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection J.01.048(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has been notified that their application to renew or amend their licence will be refused;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the exportation would not be in conformity with the import permit issued by the competent authority of the country of final destination;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the exportation would contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the permit would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue the export permit, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Label: J.01.053
Section.Text: The holder of an export permit must provide a copy of the permit to the customs office at the time of exportation.

Section.Label: J.01.054
Section.Text: The holder of an export permit must provide the Minister, within 15 days after the day of export of the restricted drug specified in the permit, with a declaration that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and the numbers of their dealer’s licence and the export permit that applies to the restricted drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the restricted drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, as specified in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the restricted drug is contained in a product that they have exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the restricted drug in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office from which the restricted drug was exported and the date of export.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must suspend an export permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence is suspended;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the exportation would contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: The suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the export permit if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must revoke an export permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the permit or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not carry out the corrective measures specified by the Minister under paragraph J.01.055(2)(c) by the specified date;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has contravened a term or condition of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the application for the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a restricted drug to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence has been revoked.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not revoke an export permit for a ground set out in paragraph (1)(d) or J.01.036(1)(e) or (g) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a restricted drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before revoking an export permit, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Label: J.01.057
Section.Text: If an export permit is revoked, the licensed dealer must return the original of the permit to the Minister within 15 days after the effective date of the revocation.

Section.Label: J.01.058
Section.Text: A licensed dealer must include their name, as set out in their dealer’s licence, on all the means by which they identify themself in regard to their activities in relation to restricted drugs, including labels, orders, shipping documents, invoices and advertising.

Subsection.Text: Despite section C.08.002 and subject to subsections (3) and (4), a licensed dealer may sell a restricted drug to an institution for one of the following purposes if the institution submits to the dealer or the Minister an application to purchase the drug and the Minister issues a prior written authorization for the sale:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: clinical testing in the institution by qualified investigators for the purpose of determining the hazards and efficacy of the drug; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: laboratory research in the institution by qualified investigators.

Subsection.Text: The application must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and the municipal address of the institution;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the names and qualifications of the qualified investigators;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form, quantity and strength per unit of the restricted drug being requested;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: details of the proposed use of the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the licensed dealer from whom the institution proposes to purchase the drug.

Subsection.Text: If the institution submits the application to the licensed dealer, the dealer must provide a copy of it to the Minister.

After reviewing the application received from the institution or the copy of it received from the licensed dealer, the Minister may, subject to any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary, authorize in writing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sale by the licensed dealer to the institution of the restricted drug applied for in the form, quantity and strength per unit specified by the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the possession of the restricted drug by qualified investigators for clinical testing of the drug in the institution for the purpose of determining its hazards and efficacy or to conduct laboratory research with the drug in the institution.

Subsection.Text: The institution must use the restricted drug only in accordance with the written authorization.

Section.Label: J.01.060
Section.Text: A licensed dealer may sell or provide a restricted drug to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: Despite anything in this Part, a person may, for the purpose of identification or analysis of a restricted drug, provide or deliver it to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner of medicine; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an agent or mandatary of a practitioner of medicine, if the agent or mandatary has been exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that restricted drug for that purpose.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Agent or mandatary of practitioner of medicine
Subsection.Text: An agent or mandatary of a practitioner of medicine who receives the restricted drug must immediately provide or deliver it to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of medicine who receives the restricted drug must immediately provide or deliver it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of its identification or analysis, to a person exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that restricted drug for that purpose; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer that sells or provides a restricted drug must securely package it in its immediate container, which must be sealed in such a manner that the container cannot be opened without breaking the seal.
A licensed dealer that transports or exports a restricted drug must ensure that its package is sealed in such a manner that the package cannot be opened without breaking the seal.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a test kit that contains a restricted drug and that has a registration number.
A licensed dealer that sells or provides a restricted drug must ensure that its package is labelled so that its inner and outer labels show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the proper name or, if there is no proper name, the name of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the net contents of the package;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the unit strength of the drug and the number of units per package, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the expression “Restricted Drug”; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the manufacturer or assembler of the drug.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a test kit that contains a restricted drug and that has a registration number.
The labelling requirements set out in section C.01.004 do not apply to a restricted drug.

Section.Label: J.01.064
Section.Text: A licensed dealer must, in taking delivery of a restricted drug that they have imported or in making delivery of a restricted drug,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take any measures that are necessary to ensure the security of the drug while it is being transported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: use a method of transportation that permits an accurate record to be kept of all handling of the drug as well as of the signatures of every person handling it until it is delivered to the consignee;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an imported drug, transport it directly to the site specified in their licence after it is released under the Customs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug to be exported, transport it directly from the site specified in their licence to the customs office where it will be exported.

Section.Label: J.01.065
Section.Text: A licensed dealer must take any measures that are necessary to ensure the security of any licence or permit in their possession.

Section.Label: J.01.066
Section.Text: The following persons must take any measures that are necessary to ensure the security of any restricted drugs in their possession:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an institution;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a qualified investigator who possesses the restricted drug for the purpose of clinical testing or laboratory research in an institution; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of the restricted drug.

Section.MarginalNote: Theft or loss — licences and permits
Section.Label: J.01.067
Section.Text: A licensed dealer that becomes aware of a theft or loss of their licence or permit must provide a written report to the Minister within 72 hours after becoming aware of it.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), any person referred to in section J.01.066 who becomes aware of a theft or loss of a restricted drug must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide a written report to a member of a police force within 24 hours after becoming aware of the theft or loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide a written report to the Minister within 72 hours after becoming aware of the theft or loss and include a confirmation that the report required under paragraph (a) has been provided.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a licensed dealer that becomes aware of a loss of a restricted drug that can be explained on the basis of normally accepted business activities.

A licensed dealer must provide a written report containing the following information to the Minister within 72 hours after becoming aware of a transaction occurring in the course of their activities that they have reasonable grounds to suspect may be related to the diversion of a restricted drug to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, municipal address, telephone number and, if the licensed dealer is a corporation, the position held by the individual making the report;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the other party to the transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: details of the transaction, including its date and time, its type, the name and quantity of the restricted drug and, in the case of a product or compound, the quantity of every restricted drug that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product that contains the restricted drug, other than a test kit, the drug identification number that is assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the reasons for those suspicions.

Subsection.Text: No civil proceedings lie against a licensed dealer for having provided the report in good faith.

A licensed dealer must not disclose that they have provided the report or disclose details of it, with the intent to prejudice a criminal investigation, whether or not a criminal investigation has begun.

Section.Label: J.01.070
Section.Text: A report made under any of sections J.01.067 to J.01.069, or any evidence derived from it, is not to be used or received to incriminate the licensed dealer in any criminal proceeding against them other than a prosecution under section 132, 136 or 137 of the Criminal Code.

Section.Label: J.01.071
Section.Text: A licensed dealer that intends to destroy a restricted drug at the site specified in their licence must ensure that the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer obtains the prior approval of the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction occurs in the presence of two of the following persons, at least one of whom must be a person referred to in subparagraph (i):

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the senior person in charge, the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person who works for or provides services to the licensed dealer and holds a senior position;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out in accordance with a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as the destruction is completed, the person who carried out the destruction and each of the two persons referred to in paragraph (b) who were present at the destruction sign and date a joint declaration attesting that the restricted drug was completely destroyed, to which each signatory must add their name in printed letters.

Section.Label: J.01.072
Section.Text: A licensed dealer that intends to destroy a restricted drug elsewhere than at the site specified in their licence must ensure that the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer obtains the prior approval of the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer takes any measures that are necessary to ensure the security of the restricted drug while it is being transported in order to prevent its diversion to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out by a person working for a business that specializes in the destruction of dangerous goods and in the presence of another person working for that business;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out in accordance with a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as the destruction is completed, the person who carried out the destruction provides the licensed dealer with a dated declaration attesting that the restricted drug was completely destroyed and containing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and quantity of the restricted drug and, if applicable, the brand name and quantity of the product containing it or the name and quantity of the compound containing it,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the method of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the names in printed letters and signatures of that person and the other person who was present at the destruction.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must submit to the Minister an application that contains the following information in order to obtain the Minister’s prior approval to destroy a restricted drug:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, municipal address and dealer’s licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed date of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a brief description of the method of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the destruction is to be carried out at the site specified in the dealer’s licence, the names of the persons proposed for the purpose of paragraph J.01.071(b) and information establishing that they meet the conditions of that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the restricted drug and, if applicable, the brand name of the product containing it or the name of the compound containing it; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the form and quantity of the restricted drug or the product or compound containing it and if applicable, the strength per unit of the restricted drug in the product or compound, the number of units per package and the number of packages.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proposed method of destruction complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of the signatory’s knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Label: J.01.074
Section.Text: On completion of the review of the application for approval, the Minister must approve the destruction of the restricted drug unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a destruction that is to be carried out at the site specified in the dealer’s licence, the persons proposed for the purpose of paragraph J.01.071(b) do not meet the conditions of that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the restricted drug would not be destroyed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the approval application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the restricted drug or a portion of it is required for the purposes of a criminal or administrative investigation or a preliminary inquiry, trial or other proceeding under any Act or its regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the approval would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of the restricted drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Label: J.01.075
Section.Text: A licensed dealer must record any information that they are required to record under this Part using a method that permits an audit of it to be made at any time.

Section.Label: J.01.076
Section.Text: A licensed dealer must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of any restricted drug that the dealer orders, the name of the person who placed the order on the dealer’s behalf and the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of any restricted drug that the dealer receives, the name and municipal address of the person who sold or provided it and the date on which it was received;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a restricted drug that the dealer sells or provides,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product or the name of the compound containing the restricted drug and the name of the restricted drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the form and quantity of the restricted drug and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the restricted drug in the product or compound, the number of units per package and the number of packages,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the person to whom it was sold or provided, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which it was sold or provided;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of any restricted drug that the dealer manufactures or assembles and the date on which it was placed in stock and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the restricted drug in the product or compound, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of any restricted drug that the dealer uses in the manufacturing or assembling of a product or compound, as well as the brand name and quantity of the product or the name and quantity of the compound, and the date on which the product or compound was placed in stock;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of any restricted drug in stock at the end of each month;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of any restricted drug that the dealer delivers, transports or sends, the name and municipal address of the consignee and the date on which it was delivered, transported or sent;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of any restricted drug imported, the date on which it was that the dealer imports, the name and municipal address of the exporter, the country of exportation and any country of transit or transhipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of any restricted drug that the dealer exports, the date on which it was exported, the name and municipal address of the importer, the country of final destination and any country of transit or transhipment.

Section.Label: J.01.077
Section.Text: A licensed dealer that becomes aware of a loss of a restricted drug that can be explained on the basis of normally accepted business activities must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the lost restricted drug and, if applicable, the brand name of the product or the name of the compound containing it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the form and quantity of the restricted drug and, if applicable, the form of the product or compound containing it, the strength per unit of the restricted drug in the product or compound, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the dealer became aware of the loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the explanation for the loss.

Section.Label: J.01.078
Section.Text: A licensed dealer must record the following information concerning any restricted drug that they destroy at the site specified in their licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of the restricted drug and, if applicable, the brand name and quantity of the product containing the drug or the name and quantity of the compound containing the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the method of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of destruction.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a licensed dealer must provide to the Minister, within three months after the end of each calendar year, an annual report that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and total quantity of each restricted drug that they receive, produce, sell, provide, import, export or destroy during the calendar year, as well as the name and total quantity of each restricted drug that they use to manufacture or assemble a product or compound;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of each restricted drug in physical inventory taken at the site specified in their licence at the end of the calendar year; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, form and quantity of any restricted drug that has been lost in the course of conducting activities during the calendar year.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Non-renewal or revocation within first three months
Subsection.Text: If a licensed dealer’s licence expires without being renewed or is revoked during the first three months of a calendar year, the dealer must provide to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within three months after the end of the preceding calendar year, the annual report in respect of that year; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: within three months after the expiry or revocation, a report in respect of the portion of the current calendar year during which the licence was valid that contains the information referred to in subsection (1), in which the quantity in physical inventory is to be calculated as of the date of expiry or revocation.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Non-renewal or revocation after third month
Subsection.Text: If a licensed dealer’s licence expires without being renewed or is revoked after the first three months of a calendar year, the dealer must provide to the Minister, within three months after the expiry or revocation, a report in respect of the portion of the calendar year during which the licence was valid that contains the information referred to in subsection (1) for that period, in which the quantity in physical inventory is to be calculated as of the date of expiry or revocation.

Section.Label: J.01.080
Section.Text: An institution must record any information that it is required to record under this Part using a method that permits an audit of the information to be made at any time.

Section.Label: J.01.081
Section.Text: An institution must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of any restricted drug that the institution orders, the name of the person who placed the order on the institution’s behalf and the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of any restricted drug that the institution receives as well as the name and municipal address of the licensed dealer that sold or provided it and the date on which it was received;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: details of the use of restricted drugs in the institution;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the names and qualifications of every person who makes use of a restricted drug in the institution; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: all clinical data with respect to the use of every restricted drug received by the institution.

Heading.TitleText: Drug Received for Identification and Analysis

Section.Label: J.01.082
Section.Text: A person who records information in accordance with section J.01.083 must do so using a method that permits an audit of the information to be made at any time.

Section.Label: J.01.083
Section.Text: A person who receives a restricted drug in accordance with section J.01.061 must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the restricted drug, as well as the name and municipal address of the person who provided it to them and the date on which it was received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: details regarding the identification or analysis of the restricted drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the names of the persons who handled the restricted drug during the process of identifying or analyzing it.

Section.Label: J.01.084
Section.Text: A licensed dealer, a former licensed dealer, an institution and a person referred to in section J.01.083 must keep any document containing the information that they are required to record under this Part, including every declaration and a copy of every report, for a period of two years following the day on which the last record is recorded in the document and in a manner that permits an audit of the document to be made at any time.

Section.Label: J.01.085
Section.Text: The documents must be kept

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licensed dealer, at the site specified in their licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an institution, at the institution;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person referred to in section J.01.083, at a location in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a former licensed dealer, at a location in Canada.

Section.Label: J.01.086
Section.Text: The documents must be complete and readily retrievable and the information in them must be legible and indelible.

Heading.TitleText: Notification of Application for Order of Restoration

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 24(1) of the Act, notification of an application for an order of restoration must be given in writing to the Attorney General by registered mail and be mailed at least 15 days before the date on which the application is to be made to a justice.
The notification must specify

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the justice to whom the application is to be made;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the time and place at which the application is to be heard;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: details concerning the restricted drug or other thing in respect of which the application is to be made; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence on which the applicant intends to rely to establish that they are entitled to possession of the restricted drug or other thing referred to in paragraph (c).

Item.Text: The following amphetamines, their salts, derivatives, isomers and analogues and salts of derivatives, isomers and analogues:
Lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD) (N,N-diethyllysergamide) and any salt thereof
N-Methyl-3-piperidyl benzilate (LBJ) (3-[(hydroxydiphenylacetyl)oxy]-1-methylpiperidine) and any salt thereof
Mescaline (3,4,5-trimethoxybenzeneethanamine) and any salt thereof, but not peyote (lophophora)
Rolicyclidine (1-(1-phenylcyclohexyl) pyrrolidine) and any salt thereof
Benzylpiperazine [BZP], namely 1-benzylpiperazine and its salts, isomers and salts of isomers
Trifluoromethylphenylpiperazine [TFMPP], namely 1-(3-trifluoromethylphenyl)piperazine and its salts, isomers and salts of isomers
Methylenedioxypyrovalerone (MDPV), its salts, derivatives, isomers and analogues and salts of derivatives, isomers and analogues
2C-phenethylamines and their salts, derivatives, isomers and salts of derivatives and isomers that correspond to the following chemical description:

any substance that has a 1-amino-2-phenylethane structure substituted at the 2’ and 5’ or 2’ and 6’ positions of the benzene ring by an alkoxy or haloalkoxy group, or substituted at two adjacent carbon atoms of the benzene ring which results in the formation of a furan, dihydrofuran, pyran, dihydropyran or methylenedioxy group — whether or not further substituted on the benzene ring to any extent, whether or not substituted at the amino group by one or two, or a combination of, methyl, ethyl, propyl, isopropyl, hydroxyl, benzyl (or benzyl substituted to any extent) or benzylene (or benzylene substituted to any extent) groups and whether or not substituted at the 2-ethyl (beta carbon) position by a hydroxyl, oxo or alkoxy group — and its salts and derivatives and salts of derivatives, including
AH-7921 (1-(3,4-dichlorobenzamidomethyl)cyclohexyldimethylamine), its salts, isomers and salts of isomers
MT-45 (1-cyclohexyl-4-(1,2-diphenylethyl)piperazine), its salts, derivatives, isomers and analogues and salts of derivatives, isomers and analogues, including
Lefetamine ((-)-N,N-dimethyl-α-phenylbenzeneethanamine), its salts, derivatives and isomers and salts of derivatives and isomers
W-18 (4-chloro-N-[1-[2-(4-nitrophenyl)ethyl]-2-piperidinylidene]benzenesulfonamide), its salts, derivatives, isomers and analogues and salts of derivatives, isomers and analogues
U-47700 (3,4-dichloro-N-(2-(dimethylamino)cyclohexyl)-N-methylbenzamide), its salts, derivatives, isomers and analogues, and salts of derivatives, isomers and analogues, including
Salvia divinorum (S. divinorum), its preparations and derivatives, including
Catha edulis Forsk, its preparations, derivatives, alkaloids and salts, including

Fruit Juices (other than lemon juice and lime juice)
Instant Breakfast, Ready Breakfast (ready to serve)

Provision.Text: The undersigned exporter hereby certifies that the (description of article)

row.entry: and marked in distinct overprinting with the word “Export”

Provision.Text: is manufactured or prepared in Canada,
is not manufactured or sold for consumption or use in Canada, and
the packages and the contents of those packages do not contravene any known requirement of the law of (name of country or countries) to which it is or is about to be consigned.

row.entry: Canada : In the matter of an Export Certificate under the Food and Drugs Act,

Provision.Text: I,
that I am the “Exporter” issuing the certificate above set out and have a knowledge of the matters and facts herein declared to by me,
or

row.entry: the “Exporter” issuing the certificate above set out and have a knowledge of the matters and facts herein declared to by me (describe position of declarant as the agent of the “Exporter” in case of a Corporation issuing the certificate),

Provision.Text: that the information set out in the said certificate is true,
that all information relevant to the purpose of the said certificate is set out herein and no information relevant thereto has knowingly been withheld.

row.entry: And I make this solemn declaration conscientiously believing it to be true, and knowing that it is of the same force and effect as if made under oath, and by virtue of The Canada Evidence Act.

Provision.Text: Declared before me at this
day of 20 .
A Commissioner for Taking Oaths

ImageGroup.Caption: 1(EH)
ImageGroup.AlternateText: This figure shows a nutrition symbol for the principal display panel that indicates that a prepackaged product is high in saturated fat, sugars and sodium. This symbol is in English only. There is a white rectangular box outlined by a thin black line. At the top of the box is the heading “High in” in black, bold, lower case letters, except that the first letter of the first word is in upper case. Under the heading is a left-justified black magnifying glass with three bars stacked to its right. There is a small amount of white space between the magnifying glass and the left side of the three bars. This left side forms a concave curve that follows the curvature of the magnifying glass. There is a small amount of white space between each bar, as well as between the right side of the bars and the thin black line that outlines the box. The first bar is black and contains the words “Sat fat” in white, bold, lower case letters, except that the first letter of the first word is in upper case. The second bar is black and contains the word “Sugars” in white, bold, lower case letters, except that the first letter is in upper case. The third bar is black and contains the word “Sodium” in white, bold, lower case letters, except that the first letter is in upper case. Centred at the bottom of the box are the words “Health Canada” in black, lower case letters, except that the first letter of each word is in upper case.

The first bar is black and contains the words “Gras sat.” in white, bold, lower case letters, except that the first letter of the first word is in upper case. The second bar is black and contains the word “Sucres” in white, bold, lower case letters, except that the first letter is in upper case. Section.Text: Packages of drugs that are labelled in accordance with Part C of the Food and Drug Regulations, as those Regulations read on December 31, 1996, are not required to comply with the labelling requirements in these Regulations until January 1, 1999.
For the purposes of sections 11 to 13, Director has the same meaning as in section A.01.010 of the Food and Drugs Regulations.

Despite sections 1 and 7 to 9, if a numbered certificate of registration has been issued in respect of a drug but a drug identification number has not been assigned under section C.01.014.2 of the Food and Drug Regulations, as amended by section 4 of these Regulations, or under section 12 of these Regulations, then section C.01.001A, paragraphs C.01.015(2)(b) and C.01.062(5)(b) and Division 10 and the schedule and the table to Division 10 of Part C of the Food and Drug Regulations, as they read immediately before the coming into force of these Regulations, remain in force in respect of that drug until October 1, 1998, except to the extent that they require information that is not required by those provisions as amended by these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Despite these Regulations and subject to subsection (3), if the conditions set out in subsection (2) are satisfied, the Director shall, until October 1, 1998, provide to a manufacturer or importer referred to in paragraph (2)( c),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the information referred to in section C.01.014.3 of the Food and Drug Regulations as amended by section 5 of these Regulations has not been submitted in respect of the drug, the document referred to in subsection C.01.014.2(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations, as amended by section 4 of these Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a drug identification number for the drug preceded by the letters “DIN”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where there are two or more brand names for the drug, the drug identification numbers assigned by the Director for the drug, each of which pertains to one of the brand names and is preceded by the letters “DIN”.

Subsection.Text: The conditions referred to in subsection (1) are:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a numbered certificate of registration has been issued for the drug under subsection C.10.004(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations as it read before the coming into force of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the numbered certificate of registration has not been cancelled under section C.10.008 of the Food and Drug Regulations as it read immediately before the coming into force of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prior to September 1, 1998, the manufacturer or importer has submitted to the Director

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the drug for which a drug identification number is to be issued, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information referred to in subsection C.01.014.1(2) of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Subsection.Text: If more than one numbered certificate of registration has been issued for a drug on the sole basis of a difference in colour, flavour or fragrance, a single drug identification number shall be assigned in respect of the drug.

Section.Text: Despite section 4 of these Regulations and subject to section C.10.005 of the Food and Drug Regulations as that section read immediately before the coming into force of these Regulations, the Director may, until September 30, 1998, issue a numbered certificate of registration, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer expressly requests that a numbered certificate of registration be issued for the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its application was accepted by the Director for review before the coming into force of these Regulations.

Section.Text: Despite section 2, a manufacturer may, until September 30, 2000, label a drug with the label that was in use on September 30, 1998.

An application concerning the sale of a drug for human use for the purposes of a clinical trial that is received under Division 8 of the Food and Drug Regulations before September 1, 2001 is subject to those Regulations and any procedures established under those Regulations as they read at the time the application was received.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: former Regulations means the Food and Drug Regulations as they read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force. (règlement antérieur)
manufacturer has the same meaning as in section A.01.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations. (fabricant)
prepackaged product has the same meaning as in section B.01.001 of the Food and Drug Regulations. (produit préemballé)

Subsection.Text: Despite sections 1 to 37 and subject to subsection (3), the former Regulations continue to apply to a prepackaged product that is labelled in accordance with the former Regulations until the day that is three years after the day on which these Regulations come into force, unless the label of the product, or any advertisement for the product that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 4 of any of items 15, 16 and 22 to 26 of the table following section B.01.513 of the Food and Drug Regulations, as enacted by section 20 of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 1 of the table following section B.01.603 of the Food and Drug Regulations, as enacted by section 20 of these Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expression “nutrition facts”, “valeur nutritive” or “valeurs nutritives”.

Subsection.Text: In applying subsection (2) to a prepackaged product that is sold by a manufacturer who had gross revenues from sales in Canada of food of less than $1,000,000 for the 12-month period immediately prior to the day on which these Regulations come into force, the reference to “three years” in that subsection shall be read as a reference to “five years”.

Section.Text: Section C.08.004.1 of the Food and Drug Regulations, as it read immediately before the coming into force of these Regulations, applies to a drug in respect of which a notice of compliance was issued before June 17, 2006.
Sections 1 to 6 and 11 of these Regulations do not apply to cheese that is made before these Regulations come into force.

Subsection.Text: Every person who, on the day on which these Regulations come into force, fabricates, packages/labels, tests or imports an active pharmaceutical ingredient may continue to do so without an establishment licence if they submit an application for a licence under section C.01A.005 of the Food and Drug Regulations within three months after that day.
Subsection (1) applies until the determination of the licence application under section C.01A.008 or C.01A.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Heading.TitleText: — SOR/2013-74, s. 18, as amended by SOR/2013-178, s. 125

Section.Text: The Food and Drug Regulations, as they read immediately before the coming into force of these Regulations, continue to apply in respect of whole blood and blood components until the day before the day on which subsection 3(2) of the Blood Regulations comes into force.

If, on the day on which these Regulations come into force, the Director has not yet issued a letter of authorization under subsection C.08.010(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations in response to a request that was made by a practitioner before that day, subsection C.08.010(1.1) of those Regulations, as enacted by section 11, applies in respect of the request.
For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
The following definitions apply in sections 15 to 32:

Definition.Text: submission means any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a new drug submission that is filed under section C.08.002 of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an extraordinary use new drug submission that is filed under section C.08.002.01 of those Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
